verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं नरो॒ दीधि॑तिभिर॒रण्यो॒र्हस्त॑च्युती जनयन्त प्रश॒स्तम् दू॒रे॒दृशं॑ गृ॒हप॑तिमथ॒र्युम्
verses.transliteration: agníṃ náro dī́dhitibhir aráṇyor  hástacyutī janayanta praśastám  dūredŕ̥śaṃ gr̥hápatim atharyúm

translation.text: THE men from fire-sticks, with their hands' swift movement, have, in deep thought, engendered glorious Agni, Far-seen, with pointed flame, Lord of the homestead.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तम॒ग्निमस्ते॒ वस॑वो॒ न्यृ॑ण्वन्त्सुप्रति॒चक्ष॒मव॑से॒ कुत॑श्चित् द॒क्षाय्यो॒ यो दम॒ आस॒ नित्यः॑
verses.transliteration: tám agním áste vásavo ny r̥̀ṇvan  supraticákṣam ávase kútaś cit  dakṣā́yyo yó dáma ā́sa nítyaḥ

translation.text: The Vasus set that Agni in the dwelling, fair to behold, for help from every quarter: Who, in the home for ever, must be honoured.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रेद्धो॑ अग्ने दीदिहि पु॒रो नोऽज॑स्रया सू॒र्म्या॑ यविष्ठ त्वां शश्व॑न्त॒ उप॑ यन्ति॒ वाजाः॑
verses.transliteration: préddho agne dīdihi puró naḥ-  -ájasrayā sūrmyā̀ yaviṣṭha  tvā́ṃ śáśvanta úpa yanti vā́jāḥ

translation.text: Shine thou before us, Agni, well-enkindled, with flame, Most Youthful God, that never fadeth. To thee come all our sacrificial viands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ते अ॒ग्नयो॒ऽग्निभ्यो॒ वरं॒ निः सु॒वीरा॑सः शोशुचन्त द्यु॒मन्तः॑ यत्रा॒ नरः॑ स॒मास॑ते सुजा॒ताः
verses.transliteration: prá te agnáyo 'gníbhyo váraṃ níḥ  suvī́rāsaḥ śośucanta dyumántaḥ  yátrā náraḥ samā́sate sujātā́ḥ

translation.text: Among all fires these fires have shone most brightly, splendid with light, begirt by noble heroes, Where men of lofty birth sit down together.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दा नो॑ अग्ने धि॒या र॒यिं सु॒वीरं॑ स्वप॒त्यं स॑हस्य प्रश॒स्तम् न यं यावा॒ तर॑ति यातु॒मावा॑न्
verses.transliteration: dā́ no agne dhiyā́ rayíṃ suvī́raṃ  svapatyáṃ sahasya praśastám  ná yáṃ yā́vā tárati yātumā́vān

translation.text: Victorious Agni, grant us wealth with wisdom, wealth with brave sons, famous and independent, Which not a foe who deals in magic conquers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॒ यमेति॑ युव॒तिः सु॒दक्षं॑ दो॒षा वस्तो॑र्ह॒विष्म॑ती घृ॒ताची॑ उप॒ स्वैन॑म॒रम॑तिर्वसू॒युः
verses.transliteration: úpa yám éti yuvatíḥ sudákṣaṃ  doṣā́ vástor havíṣmatī ghr̥tā́cī  úpa svaínam arámatir vasūyúḥ

translation.text: To whom, the Strong, at morn and eve comes, maid-like, the ladle dropping oil, with its oblation. Wealth-seeking comes to him his own devotion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वा॑ अ॒ग्नेऽप॑ द॒हारा॑ती॒र्येभि॒स्तपो॑भि॒रद॑हो॒ जरू॑थम् प्र नि॑स्व॒रं चा॑तय॒स्वामी॑वाम्
verses.transliteration: víśvā agné 'pa dahā́rātīr  yébhis tápobhir ádaho járūtham  prá nisvaráṃ cātayasvā́mīvām

translation.text: Burn up all malice with those flames, O Agni, wherewith of old thou burntest up Jarûtha, And drive away in silence pain and sickness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यस्ते॑ अग्न इध॒ते अनी॑कं॒ वसि॑ष्ठ॒ शुक्र॒ दीदि॑वः॒ पाव॑क उ॒तो न॑ ए॒भिः स्त॒वथै॑रि॒ह स्याः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ yás te agna idhaté ánīkaṃ  vásiṣṭha śúkra dī́divaḥ pā́vaka  utó na ebhí staváthair ihá syāḥ

translation.text: With him who lighteth up thy splendour, Agni, excellent, pure, refulgent, Purifier, Be present, and with us through these our praises.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि ये ते॑ अग्ने भेजि॒रे अनी॑कं॒ मर्ता॒ नरः॒ पित्र्या॑सः पुरु॒त्रा उ॒तो न॑ ए॒भिः सु॒मना॑ इ॒ह स्याः॑
verses.transliteration: ví yé te agne bhejiré ánīkam  mártā náraḥ pítryāsaḥ purutrā́  utó na ebhíḥ sumánā ihá syāḥ

translation.text: Agni, the patriarchal men, the mortals who have in many places spread thy lustre,– Be gracious to us here for their sake also.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे नरो॑ वृत्र॒हत्ये॑षु॒ शूरा॒ विश्वा॒ अदे॑वीर॒भि स॑न्तु मा॒याः ये मे॒ धियं॑ प॒नय॑न्त प्रश॒स्ताम्
verses.transliteration: imé náro vr̥trahátyeṣu śū́rāḥ-  víśvā ádevīr abhí santu māyā́ḥ  yé me dhíyam panáyanta praśastā́m

translation.text: Let these men, heroes in the fight with foemen, prevail against all godless arts of 4magic,– These who ipprove the noble song I sing thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा शूने॑ अग्ने॒ नि ष॑दाम नृ॒णां माशेष॑सो॒ऽवीर॑ता॒ परि॑ त्वा प्र॒जाव॑तीषु॒ दुर्या॑सु दुर्य
verses.transliteration: mā́ śū́ne agne ní ṣadāma nr̥ṇā́m  mā́śéṣaso 'vī́ratā pári tvā  prajā́vatīṣu dúryāsu durya

translation.text: Let us not sit in want of men, O Agni, without descendants, heroleu, about thee: But, O House-Friend, in houses full of children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यम॒श्वी नित्य॑मुप॒याति॑ य॒ज्ञं प्र॒जाव॑न्तं स्वप॒त्यं क्षयं॑ नः स्वज॑न्मना॒ शेष॑सा वावृधा॒नम्
verses.transliteration: yám aśvī́ nítyam upayā́ti yajñám  prajā́vantaṃ svapatyáṃ kṣáyaṃ naḥ  svájanmanā śéṣasā vāvr̥dhānám

translation.text: By sacrifice which the Steeds' Lord ever visits, there make our dwelling rich in seed and offspring, Increasing still with lineal successors.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पा॒हि नो॑ अग्ने र॒क्षसो॒ अजु॑ष्टात्पा॒हि धू॒र्तेरर॑रुषो अघा॒योः त्वा यु॒जा पृ॑तना॒यूँर॒भि ष्या॑म्
verses.transliteration: pāhí no agne rakṣáso ájuṣṭāt  pāhí dhūrtér áraruṣo aghāyóḥ  tvā́ yujā́ pr̥tanāyū́m̐r abhí ṣyām

translation.text: Guard us, O Agni, from the hated demon, guard us from malice of the churlish sinner: Allied with thee may I subdue assailants.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सेद॒ग्निर॒ग्नीँरत्य॑स्त्व॒न्यान्यत्र॑ वा॒जी तन॑यो वी॒ळुपा॑णिः स॒हस्र॑पाथा अ॒क्षरा॑ स॒मेति॑
verses.transliteration: séd agnír agnī́m̐r áty astv anyā́n  yátra vājī́ tánayo vīḷúpāṇiḥ  sahásrapāthā akṣárā saméti

translation.text: May this same fire of mine surpass all others, this fire where offspring, vigorous and firm-handed, Wins, on a thousand paths, what ne'er shall perish.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सेद॒ग्निर्यो व॑नुष्य॒तो नि॒पाति॑ समे॒द्धार॒मंह॑स उरु॒ष्यात् सु॒जा॒तासः॒ परि॑ चरन्ति वी॒राः
verses.transliteration: séd agnír yó vanuṣyató nipā́ti  sameddhā́ram áṃhasa uruṣyā́t  sujātā́saḥ pári caranti vīrā́ḥ

translation.text: This is that Agni, saviour from the foeman, who guards the kindler of the flame from sorrow: Heroes of noble lineage serve and tend him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं सो अ॒ग्निराहु॑तः पुरु॒त्रा यमीशा॑नः॒ समिदि॒न्धे ह॒विष्मा॑न् परि॒ यमेत्य॑ध्व॒रेषु॒ होता॑
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ só agnír ā́hutaḥ purutrā́  yám ī́śānaḥ sám íd indhé havíṣmān  pári yám éty adhvaréṣu hótā

translation.text: This is that Agni, served in many places, whom the rich lord who brings oblation kindles, And round him goes the priest at sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे अ॑ग्न आ॒हव॑नानि॒ भूरी॑शा॒नास॒ आ जु॑हुयाम॒ नित्या॑ उ॒भा कृ॒ण्वन्तो॑ वह॒तू मि॒येधे॑
verses.transliteration: tvé agna āhávanāni bhū́ri-  -īśānā́sa ā́ juhuyāma nítyā  ubhā́ kr̥ṇvánto vahatū́ miyédhe

translation.text: Agni, may we with riches in possession bring thee continual ofierings in abundance, Using both means to draw thee to our worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मो अ॑ग्ने वी॒तत॑मानि ह॒व्याज॑स्रो वक्षि दे॒वता॑ति॒मच्छ॑ प्रति॑ न ईं सुर॒भीणि॑ व्यन्तु
verses.transliteration: imó agne vītátamāni havyā́-  -ájasro vakṣi devátātim ácha  práti na īṃ surabhī́ṇi vyantu

translation.text: Agni, bear thou, Eternal, these most welcome oblations to the Deities' assembly: Let them enjoy our very fragrant presents.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॑ अग्ने॒ऽवीर॑ते॒ परा॑ दा दु॒र्वास॒सेऽम॑तये॒ मा नो॑ अ॒स्यै मा नः॑ क्षु॒धे मा र॒क्षस॑ ऋतावो॒ मा नो॒ दमे॒ मा वन॒ आ जु॑हूर्थाः
verses.transliteration: mā́ no agne 'vī́rate párā dāḥ-  durvā́sasé 'mataye mā́ no asyaí  mā́ naḥ kṣudhé mā́ rakṣása r̥tāvo  mā́ no dáme mā́ vána ā́ juhūrthāḥ

translation.text: Give us not up, Agni, to want of heroes, to wretched clothes, to need, to destitution. Yield us not, Holy One, to fiend or hunger; injure us not at home or in the forest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू मे॒ ब्रह्मा॑ण्यग्न॒ उच्छ॑शाधि॒ त्वं दे॑व म॒घव॑द्भ्यः सुषूदः रा॒तौ स्या॑मो॒भया॑स॒ आ ते॑ यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: nū́ me bráhmāṇy agna úc chaśādhi  tváṃ deva maghávadbhyaḥ suṣūdaḥ  rātaú syāmobháyāsa ā́ te  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Give strength and power to these my prayers, O Agni; O God, pour blessings on our chiefs and nobles. Grant that both we and they may share thy bounty. Ye Gods, protect us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने सु॒हवो॑ र॒ण्वसं॑दृक्सुदी॒ती सू॑नो सहसो दिदीहि मा त्वे सचा॒ तन॑ये॒ नित्य॒ आ ध॒ङ्मा वी॒रो अ॒स्मन्नर्यो॒ वि दा॑सीत्
verses.transliteration: tvám agne suhávo raṇvásaṃdr̥k  sudītī́ sūno sahaso didīhi  mā́ tvé sácā tánaye nítya ā́ dhak-  mā́ vīró asmán náryo ví dāsīt

translation.text: Thou Agni, swift to hear, art fair of aspect: beam forth, O Son of Strength, in full effulgence. Let me not want, with thee, a son for ever: let not a manly hero ever fail us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॑ अग्ने दुर्भृ॒तये॒ सचै॒षु दे॒वेद्धे॑ष्व॒ग्निषु॒ प्र वो॑चः मा ते॑ अ॒स्मान्दु॑र्म॒तयो॑ भृ॒माच्चि॑द्दे॒वस्य॑ सूनो सहसो नशन्त
verses.transliteration: mā́ no agne durbhr̥táye sácaiṣú  devéddheṣv agníṣu prá vocaḥ  mā́ te asmā́n durmatáyo bhr̥mā́c cid  devásya sūno sahaso naśanta

translation.text: Condemn us not to indigence, O Agni, beside these flaming fires which Gods have kindled; Nor, even after fault, let thy displeasure, thine as a God, O Son of Strength, o'ertake us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स मर्तो॑ अग्ने स्वनीक रे॒वानम॑र्त्ये॒ य आ॑जु॒होति॑ ह॒व्यम् स दे॒वता॑ वसु॒वनिं॑ दधाति॒ यं सू॒रिर॒र्थी पृ॒च्छमा॑न॒ एति॑
verses.transliteration: sá márto agne svanīka revā́n  ámartye yá ājuhóti havyám  sá devátā vasuvániṃ dadhāti  yáṃ sūrír arthī́ pr̥chámāna éti

translation.text: O Agni, fair of face, the wealthy mortal who to the Immortal offers his oblation. Hath him who wins him treasure by his Godhead, to whom the prince, in need, goes supplicating.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हो नो॑ अग्ने सुवि॒तस्य॑ वि॒द्वान्र॒यिं सू॒रिभ्य॒ आ व॑हा बृ॒हन्त॑म् येन॑ व॒यं स॑हसाव॒न्मदे॒मावि॑क्षितास॒ आयु॑षा सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: mahó no agne suvitásya vidvā́n  rayíṃ sūríbhya ā́ vahā br̥hántam  yéna vayáṃ sahasāvan mádema-  -ávikṣitāsa ā́yuṣā suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: Knowing our chief felicity, O Agni, bring hither ample riches to our nobles, Wherewith we may enjoy ourselves, O Victor, with undiminished life and hero children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू मे॒ ब्रह्मा॑ण्यग्न॒ उच्छ॑शाधि॒ त्वं दे॑व म॒घव॑द्भ्यः सुषूदः रा॒तौ स्या॑मो॒भया॑स॒ आ ते॑ यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: nū́ me bráhmāṇy agna úc chaśādhi  tváṃ deva maghávadbhyaḥ suṣūdaḥ  rātaú syāmobháyāsa ā́ te  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Give strength and power to these my prayers, O Agni; O God, pour blessings on bur chiefs and nobles. Grant that both we and they may share thy bounty. Ye Gods, protect us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जु॒षस्व॑ नः स॒मिध॑मग्ने अ॒द्य शोचा॑ बृ॒हद्य॑ज॒तं धू॒ममृ॒ण्वन् उप॑ स्पृश दि॒व्यं सानु॒ स्तूपैः॒ सं र॒श्मिभि॑स्ततनः॒ सूर्य॑स्य
verses.transliteration: juṣásva naḥ samídham agne adyá  śócā br̥hád yajatáṃ dhūmám r̥ṇván  úpa spr̥śa divyáṃ sā́nu stū́paiḥ  sáṃ raśmíbhis tatanaḥ sū́ryasya

translation.text: GLADLY accept, this day, our fuel, Agni: send up thy sacred smoke and shine sublimely. Touch the celestial summits with thy columns, and overspread thee with the rays of Sûrya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नरा॒शंस॑स्य महि॒मान॑मेषा॒मुप॑ स्तोषाम यज॒तस्य॑ य॒ज्ञैः ये सु॒क्रत॑वः॒ शुच॑यो धियं॒धाः स्वद॑न्ति दे॒वा उ॒भया॑नि ह॒व्या
verses.transliteration: nárāśáṃsasya mahimā́nam eṣām  úpa stoṣāma yajatásya yajñaíḥ  yé sukrátavaḥ śúcayo dhiyaṃdhā́ḥ  svádanti devā́ ubháyāni havyā́

translation.text: With sacrifice to these we men will honour the majesty of holy Narâṣansa- To these the pure, most wise, the thought. inspirers, Gods who enjoy both sorts of our oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒ळेन्यं॑ वो॒ असु॑रं सु॒दक्ष॑म॒न्तर्दू॒तं रोद॑सी सत्य॒वाच॑म् म॒नु॒ष्वद॒ग्निं मनु॑ना॒ समि॑द्धं॒ सम॑ध्व॒राय॒ सद॒मिन्म॑हेम
verses.transliteration: īḷényaṃ vo ásuraṃ sudákṣam  antár dūtáṃ ródasī satyavā́cam  manuṣvád agním mánunā sámiddhaṃ  sám adhvarā́ya sádam ín mahema

translation.text: We will extol at sacrifice for ever, as men may do, Agni whom Manu kindled, Your very skilful Asura, meet for worship, envoy between both worlds, the truthful speaker.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प॒र्यवो॒ भर॑माणा अभि॒ज्ञु प्र वृ॑ञ्जते॒ नम॑सा ब॒र्हिर॒ग्नौ आ॒जुह्वा॑ना घृ॒तपृ॑ष्ठं॒ पृष॑द्व॒दध्व॑र्यवो ह॒विषा॑ मर्जयध्वम्
verses.transliteration: saparyávo bháramāṇā abhijñú  prá vr̥ñjate námasā barhír agnaú  ājúhvānā ghr̥tápr̥ṣṭham pŕ̥ṣadvad  ádhvaryavo havíṣā marjayadhvam

translation.text: Bearing the sacred grass, the men who serve him strew it with reverence, on their knees, by Agni. Calling him to the spotted grass, oil-sprinkled, adorn him, ye Adhvaryus, with oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वा॒ध्यो॒३॒॑ वि दुरो॑ देव॒यन्तोऽशि॑श्रयू रथ॒युर्दे॒वता॑ता पू॒र्वी शिशुं॒ न मा॒तरा॑ रिहा॒णे सम॒ग्रुवो॒ न सम॑नेष्वञ्जन्
verses.transliteration: svādhyò ví dúro devayántaḥ-  -áśiśrayū rathayúr devátātā  pūrvī́ śíśuṃ ná mātárā rihāṇé  sám agrúvo ná sámaneṣv añjan

translation.text: With holy thoughts the pious have thrown open Doors fain for chariots in the Gods' assembly. Like two full mother cows who lick their youngling, like maidens for the gathering, they adorn them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त योष॑णे दि॒व्ये म॒ही न॑ उ॒षासा॒नक्ता॑ सु॒दुघे॑व धे॒नुः ब॒र्हि॒षदा॑ पुरुहू॒ते म॒घोनी॒ आ य॒ज्ञिये॑ सुवि॒ताय॑ श्रयेताम्
verses.transliteration: utá yóṣaṇe divyé mahī́ naḥ-  -uṣā́sānáktā sudúgheva dhenúḥ  barhiṣádā puruhūté maghónī  ā́ yajñíye suvitā́ya śrayetām

translation.text: And let the two exalted Heavenly Ladies, Morning and Night, like a cow good at milking, Come, much-invoked, and on our grass be seated ' wealthy, deserving worship, for our welfare.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विप्रा॑ य॒ज्ञेषु॒ मानु॑षेषु का॒रू मन्ये॑ वां जा॒तवे॑दसा॒ यज॑ध्यै ऊ॒र्ध्वं नो॑ अध्व॒रं कृ॑तं॒ हवे॑षु॒ ता दे॒वेषु॑ वनथो॒ वार्या॑णि
verses.transliteration: víprā yajñéṣu mā́nuṣeṣu kārū́  mánye vāṃ jātávedasā yájadhyai  ūrdhváṃ no adhvaráṃ kr̥taṃ háveṣu  tā́ devéṣu vanatho vā́ryāṇi

translation.text: You, Bards and Singers at men's sacrifices, both filled with wisdom, I incline to worship. Send up our offerings when we call upon you, and so among the Gods obtain us treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ भार॑ती॒ भार॑तीभिः स॒जोषा॒ इळा॑ दे॒वैर्म॑नु॒ष्ये॑भिर॒ग्निः सर॑स्वती सारस्व॒तेभि॑र॒र्वाक्ति॒स्रो दे॒वीर्ब॒र्हिरेदं स॑दन्तु
verses.transliteration: ā́ bhā́ratī bhā́ratībhiḥ sajóṣāḥ-  íḷā devaír manuṣyèbhir agníḥ  sárasvatī sārasvatébhir arvā́k  tisró devī́r barhír édáṃ sadantu

translation.text: May Bhâratî with all her Sisters, Iḷâ accordant with the Gods, with mortals Agni, Sarasvatî with all her kindred Rivers, come to this grass, Three Goddesses, and seat them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्न॑स्तु॒रीप॒मध॑ पोषयि॒त्नु देव॑ त्वष्ट॒र्वि र॑रा॒णः स्य॑स्व यतो॑ वी॒रः क॑र्म॒ण्यः॑ सु॒दक्षो॑ यु॒क्तग्रा॑वा॒ जाय॑ते दे॒वका॑मः
verses.transliteration: tán nas turī́pam ádha poṣayitnú  déva tvaṣṭar ví rarāṇáḥ syasva  yáto vīráḥ karmaṇyàḥ sudákṣo  yuktágrāvā jā́yate devákāmaḥ

translation.text: Well pleased with us do thou, O God, O Tvashṭar, give ready issue to our procreant vigour, Whence springs the hero, powerful, skilled in action, lover of Gods, adjuster of the press-stones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वन॑स्प॒तेऽव॑ सृ॒जोप॑ दे॒वान॒ग्निर्ह॒विः श॑मि॒ता सू॑दयाति सेदु॒ होता॑ स॒त्यत॑रो यजाति॒ यथा॑ दे॒वानां॒ जनि॑मानि॒ वेद॑
verses.transliteration: vánaspaté 'va sr̥jópa devā́n  agnír havíḥ śamitā́ sūdayāti  séd u hótā satyátaro yajāti  yáthā devā́nāṃ jánimāni véda

translation.text: Send to the Gods the oblation, Lord of Forests, and let the Immolator, Agni, dress it. He as the truer Priest shall offer worship, for the God'sgenerations well he knoweth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ या॑ह्यग्ने समिधा॒नो अ॒र्वाङिन्द्रे॑ण दे॒वैः स॒रथं॑ तु॒रेभिः॑ ब॒र्हिर्न॑ आस्ता॒मदि॑तिः सुपु॒त्रा स्वाहा॑ दे॒वा अ॒मृता॑ मादयन्ताम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ yāhy agne samidhānó arvā́ṅ  índreṇa devaíḥ saráthaṃ turébhiḥ  barhír na āstām áditiḥ suputrā́  svā́hā devā́ amŕ̥tā mādayantām

translation.text: Come thou to us, O Agni, duly kindled, together with the potent Gods and Indra. On this our grass sit Aditi, happy Mother, and let our Hail! delight the Gods Immortal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं वो॑ दे॒वम॒ग्निभिः॑ स॒जोषा॒ यजि॑ष्ठं दू॒तम॑ध्व॒रे कृ॑णुध्वम् यो मर्त्ये॑षु॒ निध्रु॑विर्ऋ॒तावा॒ तपु॑र्मूर्धा घृ॒तान्नः॑ पाव॒कः
verses.transliteration: agníṃ vo devám agníbhiḥ sajóṣāḥ-  yájiṣṭhaṃ dūtám adhvaré kr̥ṇudhvam  yó mártyeṣu nídhruvir r̥tā́vā  tápurmūrdhā ghr̥tā́nnaḥ pāvakáḥ

translation.text: ASSOCIATE with fires, make your God Agni envoy at sacrifice, best skilled in worship, Established firm among mankind, the Holy, flame-crowned and fed with oil, the Purifier.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रोथ॒दश्वो॒ न यव॑सेऽवि॒ष्यन्य॒दा म॒हः सं॒वर॑णा॒द्व्यस्था॑त् आद॑स्य॒ वातो॒ अनु॑ वाति शो॒चिरध॑ स्म ते॒ व्रज॑नं कृ॒ष्णम॑स्ति
verses.transliteration: próthad áśvo ná yávase 'viṣyán  yadā́ maháḥ saṃváraṇād vy ásthāt  ā́d asya vā́to ánu vāti śocír  ádha sma te vrájanaṃ kr̥ṣṇám asti

translation.text: Like a steed neighing eager for the pasture, when he hath stepped forth from the great enclosure: Then the wind following blows upon his splendour, and, straight, the path is black which thou hast travelled.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद्यस्य॑ ते॒ नव॑जातस्य॒ वृष्णोऽग्ने॒ चर॑न्त्य॒जरा॑ इधा॒नाः अच्छा॒ द्याम॑रु॒षो धू॒म ए॑ति॒ सं दू॒तो अ॑ग्न॒ ईय॑से॒ हि दे॒वान्
verses.transliteration: úd yásya te návajātasya vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ-  -ágne cáranty ajárā idhānā́ḥ  áchā dyā́m aruṣó dhūmá eti  sáṃ dūtó agna ī́yase hí devā́n

translation.text: From thee a Bull but newly born, O Agni, the kindled everlasting flames rise upward. Aloft to heaven thy ruddy smoke ascendeth: Agni, thou speedest to the Gods as envoy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि यस्य॑ ते पृथि॒व्यां पाजो॒ अश्रे॑त्तृ॒षु यदन्ना॑ स॒मवृ॑क्त॒ जम्भैः॑ सेने॑व सृ॒ष्टा प्रसि॑तिष्ट एति॒ यवं॒ न द॑स्म जु॒ह्वा॑ विवेक्षि
verses.transliteration: ví yásya te pr̥thivyā́m pā́jo áśret  tr̥ṣú yád ánnā samávr̥kta jámbhaiḥ  séneva sr̥ṣṭā́ prásitiṣ ṭa eti  yávaṃ ná dasma juhvā̀ vivekṣi

translation.text: Thou whose fresh lustre o'er the earth advanceth when greedily with thy jaws thy food thou eatest. Like a host hurried onward comes thy lasso: fierce, with thy tongue thou piercest, as 'twere barley.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमिद्दो॒षा तमु॒षसि॒ यवि॑ष्ठम॒ग्निमत्यं॒ न म॑र्जयन्त॒ नरः॑ नि॒शिशा॑ना॒ अति॑थिमस्य॒ योनौ॑ दी॒दाय॑ शो॒चिराहु॑तस्य॒ वृष्णः॑
verses.transliteration: tám íd doṣā́ tám uṣási yáviṣṭham  agním átyaṃ ná marjayanta náraḥ  niśíśānā átithim asya yónau  dīdā́ya śocír ā́hutasya vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ

translation.text: The men have decked him both at eve and morning, Most Youthful Agni, as they tend a courser. They kindle him, a guest within his dwelling: bright shines the splendour of the worshipped Hero.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒सं॒दृक्ते॑ स्वनीक॒ प्रती॑कं॒ वि यद्रु॒क्मो न रोच॑स उपा॒के दि॒वो न ते॑ तन्य॒तुरे॑ति॒ शुष्म॑श्चि॒त्रो न सूरः॒ प्रति॑ चक्षि भा॒नुम्
verses.transliteration: susaṃdŕ̥k te svanīka prátīkaṃ  ví yád rukmó ná rócasa upāké  divó ná te tanyatúr eti śúṣmaś  citró ná sū́raḥ práti cakṣi bhānúm

translation.text: O fair of face, beautiful is thine aspect when, very near at hand, like gold thou gleamest, Like Heaven's thundering roar thy might approaches, and like the wondrous Sun thy light thou showest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॑ वः॒ स्वाहा॒ग्नये॒ दाशे॑म॒ परीळा॑भिर्घृ॒तव॑द्भिश्च ह॒व्यैः तेभि॑र्नो अग्ने॒ अमि॑तै॒र्महो॑भिः श॒तं पू॒र्भिराय॑सीभि॒र्नि पा॑हि
verses.transliteration: yáthā vaḥ svā́hāgnáye dā́śema  párī́ḷābhir ghr̥távadbhiś ca havyaíḥ  tébhir no agne ámitair máhobhiḥ  śatám pūrbhír ā́yasībhir ní pāhi

translation.text: That we may worship, with your Hail to Agni! with sacrificial cakes and fat oblations, Guard us, O Agni, with those boundless glories as with a hundred fortresses of iron.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या वा॑ ते॒ सन्ति॑ दा॒शुषे॒ अधृ॑ष्टा॒ गिरो॑ वा॒ याभि॑र्नृ॒वती॑रुरु॒ष्याः ताभि॑र्नः सूनो सहसो॒ नि पा॑हि॒ स्मत्सू॒रीञ्ज॑रि॒तॄञ्जा॑तवेदः
verses.transliteration: yā́ vā te sánti dāśúṣe ádhr̥ṣṭāḥ-  gíro vā yā́bhir nr̥vátīr uruṣyā́ḥ  tā́bhir naḥ sūno sahaso ní pāhi  smát sūrī́ñ jaritr̥̄́ñ jātavedaḥ

translation.text: Thine are resistless songs for him who offers, and hero-giving hymns wherewith thou savest; With these, O Son of Strength, O Jâtavedas, guard us, preserve these princes and the singers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: निर्यत्पू॒तेव॒ स्वधि॑तिः॒ शुचि॒र्गात्स्वया॑ कृ॒पा त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ रोच॑मानः आ यो मा॒त्रोरु॒शेन्यो॒ जनि॑ष्ट देव॒यज्या॑य सु॒क्रतुः॑ पाव॒कः
verses.transliteration: nír yát pūtéva svádhitiḥ śúcir gā́t  sváyā kr̥pā́ tanvā̀ rócamānaḥ  ā́ yó mātrór uśényo jániṣṭa  devayájyāya sukrátuḥ pāvakáḥ

translation.text: When forth he cometh, like an axe new-sharpened, pure in his form, resplendent in his body, Sprung, sought with eager longing, from his Parents, for the Gods' worship, Sage and Purifier:

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ता नो॑ अग्ने॒ सौभ॑गा दिदी॒ह्यपि॒ क्रतुं॑ सु॒चेत॑सं वतेम विश्वा॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॑ गृण॒ते च॑ सन्तु यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: etā́ no agne saúbhagā didīhi-  ápi krátuṃ sucétasaṃ vatema  víśvā stotŕ̥bhyo gr̥ṇaté ca santu  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Shine this felicity on us, O Agni: may we attain to perfect understanding. All happiness be theirs who sing and praise thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वः॑ शु॒क्राय॑ भा॒नवे॑ भरध्वं ह॒व्यं म॒तिं चा॒ग्नये॒ सुपू॑तम् यो दैव्या॑नि॒ मानु॑षा ज॒नूंष्य॒न्तर्विश्वा॑नि वि॒द्मना॒ जिगा॑ति
verses.transliteration: prá vaḥ śukrā́ya bhānáve bharadhvaṃ  havyám matíṃ cāgnáye súpūtam  yó daívyāni mā́nuṣā janū́ṃṣi-  antár víśvāni vidmánā jígāti

translation.text: BRING forth your gifts to his refulgent splendour, your hymn as purest offering to Agni, To him who goes as messenger with knowledge between all songs of men and Gods in heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स गृत्सो॑ अ॒ग्निस्तरु॑णश्चिदस्तु॒ यतो॒ यवि॑ष्ठो॒ अज॑निष्ट मा॒तुः सं यो वना॑ यु॒वते॒ शुचि॑द॒न्भूरि॑ चि॒दन्ना॒ समिद॑त्ति स॒द्यः
verses.transliteration: sá gŕ̥tso agnís táruṇaś cid astu  yáto yáviṣṭho ájaniṣṭa mātúḥ  sáṃ yó vánā yuváte śúcidan  bhū́ri cid ánnā sám íd atti sadyáḥ

translation.text: Wise must this Agni be, though young and tender, since he was born, Most Youthful, of his Mother; He who with bright teeth seizeth fast the forests, and eats his food, though plenteous, in a moment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य दे॒वस्य॑ सं॒सद्यनी॑के॒ यं मर्ता॑सः श्ये॒तं ज॑गृ॒भ्रे नि यो गृभं॒ पौरु॑षेयीमु॒वोच॑ दु॒रोक॑म॒ग्निरा॒यवे॑ शुशोच
verses.transliteration: asyá devásya saṃsády ánīke  yám mártāsaḥ śyetáṃ jagr̥bhré  ní yó gŕ̥bham paúruṣeyīm uvóca  durókam agnír āyáve śuśoca

translation.text: Before his presence must we all assemble, this God's whom men have seized in his white splendour. This Agni who hath brooked that men should seize him hath shone for man with glow insufferable.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं क॒विरक॑विषु॒ प्रचे॑ता॒ मर्ते॑ष्व॒ग्निर॒मृतो॒ नि धा॑यि स मा नो॒ अत्र॑ जुहुरः सहस्वः॒ सदा॒ त्वे सु॒मन॑सः स्याम
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ kavír ákaviṣu prácetāḥ-  márteṣv agnír amŕ̥to ní dhāyi  sá mā́ no átra juhuraḥ sahasvaḥ  sádā tvé sumánasaḥ syāma

translation.text: Far-seeing hath this Agni been established, deathless mid mortals, wise among the foolish. Here, O victorious God, forbear to harm us: may weforever share thy gracious favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यो योनिं॑ दे॒वकृ॑तं स॒साद॒ क्रत्वा॒ ह्य१॒॑ग्निर॒मृताँ॒ अता॑रीत् तमोष॑धीश्च व॒निन॑श्च॒ गर्भं॒ भूमि॑श्च वि॒श्वधा॑यसं बिभर्ति
verses.transliteration: ā́ yó yóniṃ devákr̥taṃ sasā́da  krátvā hy àgnír amŕ̥tām̐ átārīt  tám óṣadhīś ca vanínaś ca gárbham  bhū́miś ca viśvádhāyasam bibharti

translation.text: He who hath occupied his God-made dwelling, Agni, in wisdom hath surpassed Immortals. A Babe unborn, the plants and trees support him, and the earth beareth him the All-sustainer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ईशे॒ ह्य१॒॑ग्निर॒मृत॑स्य॒ भूरे॒रीशे॑ रा॒यः सु॒वीर्य॑स्य॒ दातोः॑ मा त्वा॑ व॒यं स॑हसावन्न॒वीरा॒ माप्स॑वः॒ परि॑ षदाम॒ मादु॑वः
verses.transliteration: ī́śe hy àgnír amŕ̥tasya bhū́rer  ī́śe rāyáḥ suvī́ryasya dā́toḥ  mā́ tvā vayáṃ sahasāvann avī́rāḥ-  mā́psavaḥ pári ṣadāma mā́duvaḥ

translation.text: Agni is Lord of Amrit. in abundance, Lord of the gift of wealth and hero valour, Victorious God, let us not sit about thee like men devoid of strength, beauty, and worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒रि॒षद्यं॒ ह्यर॑णस्य॒ रेक्णो॒ नित्य॑स्य रा॒यः पत॑यः स्याम न शेषो॑ अग्ने अ॒न्यजा॑तम॒स्त्यचे॑तानस्य॒ मा प॒थो वि दु॑क्षः
verses.transliteration: pariṣádyaṃ hy áraṇasya rékṇo  nítyasya rāyáḥ pátayaḥ syāma  ná śéṣo agne anyájātam asti-  ácetānasya mā́ pathó ví dukṣaḥ

translation.text: The foeman's treasure may be won with labour: may we be masters of our own possessions. Agni, no son is he who springs from others: lengthen not out the pathways of the foolish.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒हि ग्रभा॒यार॑णः सु॒शेवो॒ऽन्योद॑र्यो॒ मन॑सा॒ मन्त॒वा उ॑ अधा॑ चि॒दोकः॒ पुन॒रित्स ए॒त्या नो॑ वा॒ज्य॑भी॒षाळे॑तु॒ नव्यः॑
verses.transliteration: nahí grábhāyā́raṇaḥ suśévo  -anyódaryo mánasā mántavā́ u  ádhā cid ókaḥ púnar ít sá eti-  ā́ no vājy àbhīṣā́ḷ etu návyaḥ

translation.text: Unwelcome for adoption is the stranger, one to be thought of as another's offspring, Though grown familiar by continual presence. May our strong hero come, freshly triumphant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने वनुष्य॒तो नि पा॑हि॒ त्वमु॑ नः सहसावन्नव॒द्यात् सं त्वा॑ ध्वस्म॒न्वद॒भ्ये॑तु॒ पाथः॒ सं र॒यिः स्पृ॑ह॒याय्यः॑ सह॒स्री
verses.transliteration: tvám agne vanuṣyató ní pāhi  tvám u naḥ sahasāvann avadyā́t  sáṃ tvā dhvasmanvád abhy ètu pā́thaḥ  sáṃ rayí spr̥hayā́yyaḥ sahasrī́

translation.text: Guard us from him who would assail us, Agni; preserve us O thou Victor, from dishonour. Here let the place of darkening come upon thee: may wealth be ours, desirable, in thousands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ता नो॑ अग्ने॒ सौभ॑गा दिदी॒ह्यपि॒ क्रतुं॑ सु॒चेत॑सं वतेम विश्वा॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॑ गृण॒ते च॑ सन्तु यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: etā́ no agne saúbhagā didīhi-  ápi krátuṃ sucétasaṃ vatema  víśvā stotŕ̥bhyo gr̥ṇaté ca santu  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Shine this felicity on us, O Agni: may we attain to perfect understanding. All happiness be theirs who sing and praise thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्राग्नये॑ त॒वसे॑ भरध्वं॒ गिरं॑ दि॒वो अ॑र॒तये॑ पृथि॒व्याः यो विश्वे॑षाम॒मृता॑नामु॒पस्थे॑ वैश्वान॒रो वा॑वृ॒धे जा॑गृ॒वद्भिः॑
verses.transliteration: prā́gnáye taváse bharadhvaṃ  gíraṃ divó aratáye pr̥thivyā́ḥ  yó víśveṣām amŕ̥tānām upásthe  vaiśvānaró vāvr̥dhé jāgr̥vádbhiḥ

translation.text: BRING forth your song of praise to mighty Agni, the speedy messenger of earth and heaven, Vaiṣvânara, who, with those who wake, hath waxen great in the lap of all the Gods Immortal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पृ॒ष्टो दि॒वि धाय्य॒ग्निः पृ॑थि॒व्यां ने॒ता सिन्धू॑नां वृष॒भः स्तिया॑नाम् स मानु॑षीर॒भि विशो॒ वि भा॑ति वैश्वान॒रो वा॑वृधा॒नो वरे॑ण
verses.transliteration: pr̥ṣṭó diví dhā́yy agníḥ pr̥thivyā́ṃ  netā́ síndhūnāṃ vr̥ṣabhá stíyānām  sá mā́nuṣīr abhí víśo ví bhāti  vaiśvānaró vāvr̥dhānó váreṇa

translation.text: Sought in the heavens, on earth is Agni stablished, leader of rivers, Bull of standing waters. Vaiṣvânara when he hath grown in glory, shines on the tribes of men with light and treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वद्भि॒या विश॑ आय॒न्नसि॑क्नीरसम॒ना जह॑ती॒र्भोज॑नानि वैश्वा॑नर पू॒रवे॒ शोशु॑चानः॒ पुरो॒ यद॑ग्ने द॒रय॒न्नदी॑देः
verses.transliteration: tvád bhiyā́ víśa āyann ásiknīr  asamanā́ jáhatīr bhójanāni  vaíśvānara pūráve śóśucānaḥ  púro yád agne daráyann ádīdeḥ

translation.text: For fear of thee forth fled the dark-hued races, scattered abroad, deserting their possessions, When, glowing, O Vaiṣvânara, for Pûru, thou Agni didst light up and rend their castles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॑ त्रि॒धातु॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौर्वैश्वा॑नर व्र॒तम॑ग्ने सचन्त त्वं भा॒सा रोद॑सी॒ आ त॑त॒न्थाज॑स्रेण शो॒चिषा॒ शोशु॑चानः
verses.transliteration: táva tridhā́tu pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúr  vaíśvānara vratám agne sacanta  tvám bhāsā́ ródasī ā́ tatantha-  -ájasreṇa śocíṣā śóśucānaḥ

translation.text: Agni Vaiṣvânara, both Earth and Heaven submit them to thy threefold jurisdiction. Refulgent in thine undecaying lustre thou hast invested both the worlds with splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वाम॑ग्ने ह॒रितो॑ वावशा॒ना गिरः॑ सचन्ते॒ धुन॑यो घृ॒ताचीः॑ पतिं॑ कृष्टी॒नां र॒थ्यं॑ रयी॒णां वै॑श्वान॒रमु॒षसां॑ के॒तुमह्ना॑म्
verses.transliteration: tvā́m agne haríto vāvaśānā́ḥ-  gíraḥ sacante dhúnayo ghr̥tā́cīḥ  pátiṃ kr̥ṣṭīnā́ṃ rathyàṃ rayīṇā́ṃ  vaiśvānarám uṣásāṃ ketúm áhnām

translation.text: Agni, the tawny horses, loudly neighing our resonant hymns that drop with oil, attend thee; Lord of the tribes, our Charioteer of riches, Ensign of days, Vaiṣvânara of mornings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे अ॑सु॒र्यं१॒॑ वस॑वो॒ न्यृ॑ण्व॒न्क्रतुं॒ हि ते॑ मित्रमहो जु॒षन्त॑ त्वं दस्यूँ॒रोक॑सो अग्न आज उ॒रु ज्योति॑र्ज॒नय॒न्नार्या॑य
verses.transliteration: tvé asuryàṃ vásavo ny r̥̀ṇvan  krátuṃ hí te mitramaho juṣánta  tváṃ dásyūm̐r ókaso agna ājaḥ-  urú jyótir janáyann ā́ryāya

translation.text: In thee, O bright as Mitra, Vasus seated the might of Aduras, for they loved thy spirit. Thou dravest Dasyus from their home, O Agni, and broughtest forth broad light to light the Ârya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स जाय॑मानः पर॒मे व्यो॑मन्वा॒युर्न पाथः॒ परि॑ पासि स॒द्यः त्वं भुव॑ना ज॒नय॑न्न॒भि क्र॒न्नप॑त्याय जातवेदो दश॒स्यन्
verses.transliteration: sá jā́yamānaḥ paramé vyòman  vāyúr ná pā́thaḥ pári pāsi sadyáḥ  tvám bhúvanā janáyann abhí krann  ápatyāya jātavedo daśasyán

translation.text: Born in the loftiest heaven thou in a moment reachest, like wind, the place where Gods inhabit. Thou, favouring thine offspring, roaredst loudly when giving life to creatures, Jâtavedas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ताम॑ग्ने अ॒स्मे इष॒मेर॑यस्व॒ वैश्वा॑नर द्यु॒मतीं॑ जातवेदः यया॒ राधः॒ पिन्व॑सि विश्ववार पृ॒थु श्रवो॑ दा॒शुषे॒ मर्त्या॑य
verses.transliteration: tā́m agne asmé íṣam érayasva  vaíśvānara dyumátīṃ jātavedaḥ  yáyā rā́dhaḥ pínvasi viśvavāra  pr̥thú śrávo dāśúṣe mártyāya

translation.text: Send us that strength, Vaiṣvânara, send it, Agni, that strength, O Jâtavedas, full of splendour, Wherewith, all-bounteous God, thou pourest riches, as fame wide-spreading, on the man who offers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं नो॑ अग्ने म॒घव॑द्भ्यः पुरु॒क्षुं र॒यिं नि वाजं॒ श्रुत्यं॑ युवस्व वैश्वा॑नर॒ महि॑ नः॒ शर्म॑ यच्छ रु॒द्रेभि॑रग्ने॒ वसु॑भिः स॒जोषाः॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ no agne maghávadbhyaḥ purukṣúṃ  rayíṃ ní vā́jaṃ śrútyaṃ yuvasva  vaíśvānara máhi naḥ śárma yacha  rudrébhir agne vásubhiḥ sajóṣāḥ

translation.text: Agni, bestow upon our chiefs and nobles that famous power, that wealth which feedeth many. Accordant with the Vasus and the Rudras, Agni, Vaiṣvânara, give us sure protection.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र स॒म्राजो॒ असु॑रस्य॒ प्रश॑स्तिं पुं॒सः कृ॑ष्टी॒नाम॑नु॒माद्य॑स्य इन्द्र॑स्येव॒ प्र त॒वस॑स्कृ॒तानि॒ वन्दे॑ दा॒रुं वन्द॑मानो विवक्मि
verses.transliteration: prá samrā́jo ásurasya práśastim  puṃsáḥ kr̥ṣṭīnā́m anumā́dyasya  índrasyeva prá tavásas kr̥tā́ni  vánde dārúṃ vándamāno vivakmi

translation.text: PRAISE of the Asura, high imperial Ruler, the Manly One in whom the folk shall triumph I laud his deeds who is as strong as Indra, and lauding celebrate the Fort-destroyer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒विं के॒तुं धा॒सिं भा॒नुमद्रे॑र्हि॒न्वन्ति॒ शं रा॒ज्यं रोद॑स्योः पु॒रं॒द॒रस्य॑ गी॒र्भिरा वि॑वासे॒ऽग्नेर्व्र॒तानि॑ पू॒र्व्या म॒हानि॑
verses.transliteration: kavíṃ ketúṃ dhāsím bhānúm ádrer  hinvánti śáṃ rājyáṃ ródasyoḥ  puraṃdarásya gīrbhír ā́ vivāse  -agnér vratā́ni pūrvyā́ mahā́ni

translation.text: Sage, Sing, Food, Light,– they bring him from the mountain, the blessed Sovran of the earth and heaven. I decorate with songs the mighty actions which Agni, Fort-destroyer, did aforetime.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न्य॑क्र॒तून्ग्र॒थिनो॑ मृ॒ध्रवा॑चः प॒णीँर॑श्र॒द्धाँ अ॑वृ॒धाँ अ॑य॒ज्ञान् प्रप्र॒ तान्दस्यूँ॑र॒ग्निर्वि॑वाय॒ पूर्व॑श्चका॒राप॑राँ॒ अय॑ज्यून्
verses.transliteration: ny àkratū́n grathíno mr̥dhrávācaḥ  paṇī́m̐r aśraddhā́m̐ avr̥dhā́m̐ ayajñā́n  prá-pra tā́n dásyūm̐r agnír vivāya  pū́rvaś cakārā́parām̐ áyajyūn

translation.text: The foolish, faithless, rudely-speaking niggards, without belief or sacrifice or worship,– Far far sway hath Agni chased those Dasytis, and, in the cast, hath turned the godless westward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अ॑पा॒चीने॒ तम॑सि॒ मद॑न्तीः॒ प्राची॑श्च॒कार॒ नृत॑मः॒ शची॑भिः तमीशा॑नं॒ वस्वो॑ अ॒ग्निं गृ॑णी॒षेऽना॑नतं द॒मय॑न्तं पृत॒न्यून्
verses.transliteration: yó apācī́ne támasi mádantīḥ  prā́cīś cakā́ra nŕ̥tamaḥ śácībhiḥ  tám ī́śānaṃ vásvo agníṃ gr̥ṇīṣe-  -ánānataṃ damáyantam pr̥tanyū́n

translation.text: Him who brought eastward, manliest with his prowess, the Maids rejoicing in the western darkness, That Agni I extol, the Lord of riches, unyielding tamer of assailing foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो दे॒ह्यो॒३॒॑ अन॑मयद्वध॒स्नैर्यो अ॒र्यप॑त्नीरु॒षस॑श्च॒कार॑ स नि॒रुध्या॒ नहु॑षो य॒ह्वो अ॒ग्निर्विश॑श्चक्रे बलि॒हृतः॒ सहो॑भिः
verses.transliteration: yó dehyò ánamayad vadhasnaír  yó aryápatnīr uṣásaś cakā́ra  sá nirúdhyā náhuṣo yahvó agnír  víśaś cakre balihŕ̥taḥ sáhobhiḥ

translation.text: Him who brake down the walls with deadly weapons, and gave the Mornings to anoble Husband, Young Agni, who with conquering strength subduing the tribes of Nahus made them bring their tribute.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ शर्म॒न्नुप॒ विश्वे॒ जना॑स॒ एवै॑स्त॒स्थुः सु॑म॒तिं भिक्ष॑माणाः वै॒श्वा॒न॒रो वर॒मा रोद॑स्यो॒राग्निः स॑साद पि॒त्रोरु॒पस्थ॑म्
verses.transliteration: yásya śármann úpa víśve jánāsaḥ-  évais tasthúḥ sumatím bhíkṣamāṇāḥ  vaiśvānaró váram ā́ ródasyor  ā́gníḥ sasāda pitrór upástham

translation.text: In whose protection all men rest by nature, desiring to enjoy his gracious favour- Agni Vaiṣvânara in his Parents, bosom hath found the choicest seat in earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ दे॒वो द॑दे बु॒ध्न्या॒३॒॑ वसू॑नि वैश्वान॒र उदि॑ता॒ सूर्य॑स्य आ स॑मु॒द्रादव॑रा॒दा पर॑स्मा॒दाग्निर्द॑दे दि॒व आ पृ॑थि॒व्याः
verses.transliteration: ā́ devó dade budhnyā̀ vásūni  vaiśvānará úditā sū́ryasya  ā́ samudrā́d ávarād ā́ párasmād  ā́gnír dade divá ā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ

translation.text: Vaiṣvânara the God, at the sun's setting, hath taken to himself deep-hidden treasures: Agni hath taken them from earth and heaven, from the sea under and the sea above us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॑ दे॒वं चि॑त्सहसा॒नम॒ग्निमश्वं॒ न वा॒जिनं॑ हिषे॒ नमो॑भिः भवा॑ नो दू॒तो अ॑ध्व॒रस्य॑ वि॒द्वान्त्मना॑ दे॒वेषु॑ विविदे मि॒तद्रुः॑
verses.transliteration: prá vo deváṃ cit sahasānám agním  áśvaṃ ná vājínaṃ hiṣe námobhiḥ  bhávā no dūtó adhvarásya vidvā́n  tmánā devéṣu vivide mitádruḥ

translation.text: I SEND forth even your God, victorious Agni, like a strong courser, with mine adoration. Herald of sacrifice be he who knoweth he hath reached Gods, himself, with measured motion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ या॑ह्यग्ने प॒थ्या॒३॒॑ अनु॒ स्वा म॒न्द्रो दे॒वानां॑ स॒ख्यं जु॑षा॒णः आ सानु॒ शुष्मै॑र्न॒दय॑न्पृथि॒व्या जम्भे॑भि॒र्विश्व॑मु॒शध॒ग्वना॑नि
verses.transliteration: ā́ yāhy agne pathyā̀ ánu svā́ḥ-  mandró devā́nāṃ sakhyáṃ juṣāṇáḥ  ā́ sā́nu śúṣmair nadáyan pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  jámbhebhir víśvam uśádhag vánāni

translation.text: By paths that are thine own come hither, Agni, joyous, delighting in the Gods' alliance, Making the heights of earth roar with thy fury, burning with eager teeth the woods and forests.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रा॒चीनो॑ य॒ज्ञः सुधि॑तं॒ हि ब॒र्हिः प्री॑णी॒ते अ॒ग्निरी॑ळि॒तो न होता॑ आ मा॒तरा॑ वि॒श्ववा॑रे हुवा॒नो यतो॑ यविष्ठ जज्ञि॒षे सु॒शेवः॑
verses.transliteration: prācī́no yajñáḥ súdhitaṃ hí barhíḥ  prīṇīté agnír īḷitó ná hótā  ā́ mātárā viśvávāre huvānó  yáto yaviṣṭha jajñiṣé suśévaḥ

translation.text: The grass is strewn; the sacrifice advances adored as Priest, Agni is made propitious, Invoking both All-boon-bestowing Mothers of whom, Most Youthful! thou wast born to help us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒द्यो अ॑ध्व॒रे र॑थि॒रं ज॑नन्त॒ मानु॑षासो॒ विचे॑तसो॒ य ए॑षाम् वि॒शाम॑धायि वि॒श्पति॑र्दुरो॒णे॒३॒॑ऽग्निर्म॒न्द्रो मधु॑वचा ऋ॒तावा॑
verses.transliteration: sadyó adhvaré rathiráṃ jananta  mā́nuṣāso vícetaso yá eṣām  viśā́m adhāyi viśpátir duroṇé-  -agnír mandró mádhuvacā r̥tā́vā

translation.text: Forthwith the men, the best of these for wisdom, have made him leader in the solemn worship. As Lord in homes of men is Agni stablished, the Holy One, the joyous, sweetly speaking.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असा॑दि वृ॒तो वह्नि॑राजग॒न्वान॒ग्निर्ब्र॒ह्मा नृ॒षद॑ने विध॒र्ता द्यौश्च॒ यं पृ॑थि॒वी वा॑वृ॒धाते॒ आ यं होता॒ यज॑ति वि॒श्ववा॑रम्
verses.transliteration: ásādi vr̥tó váhnir ājaganvā́n  agnír brahmā́ nr̥ṣádane vidhartā́  dyaúś ca yám pr̥thivī́ vāvr̥dhā́te  ā́ yáṃ hótā yájati viśvávāram

translation.text: He hath come, chosen bearer, and is seated in man's home, Brahman, Agni, the Supporter, He whom both Heaven anct Earth exalt and strengthenwhom, Giver of all boons, the Hotar worships.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ते द्यु॒म्नेभि॒र्विश्व॒माति॑रन्त॒ मन्त्रं॒ ये वारं॒ नर्या॒ अत॑क्षन् प्र ये विश॑स्ति॒रन्त॒ श्रोष॑माणा॒ आ ये मे॑ अ॒स्य दीध॑यन्नृ॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: eté dyumnébhir víśvam ā́tiranta  mántraṃ yé vā́raṃ náryā átakṣan  prá yé víśas tiránta śróṣamāṇāḥ-  ā́ yé me asyá dī́dhayann r̥tásya

translation.text: These have passed all in glory, who, the manly, have wrought with skill the hymn of adoration; Who, listening, have advanced the people's welfare, and set their thoughts on this my holy statute.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू त्वाम॑ग्न ईमहे॒ वसि॑ष्ठा ईशा॒नं सू॑नो सहसो॒ वसू॑नाम् इषं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॑ म॒घव॑द्भ्य आनड्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: nū́ tvā́m agna īmahe vásiṣṭhāḥ-  īśānáṃ sūno sahaso vásūnām  íṣaṃ stotŕ̥bhyo maghávadbhya ānaḍ  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: We, the Vasishṭhas, now implore thee, Agni, O Son of Strength, the Lord of wealth and treasure. Thou hast brought food to singers and to nobles. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒न्धे राजा॒ सम॒र्यो नमो॑भि॒र्यस्य॒ प्रती॑क॒माहु॑तं घृ॒तेन॑ नरो॑ ह॒व्येभि॑रीळते स॒बाध॒ आग्निरग्र॑ उ॒षसा॑मशोचि
verses.transliteration: indhé rā́jā sám aryó námobhir  yásya prátīkam ā́hutaṃ ghr̥téna  náro havyébhir īḷate sabā́dhaḥ-  ā́gnír ágra uṣásām aśoci

translation.text: THE King whose face is decked with oil is kindled with homage offered by his faithful servant. The men, the priests adore him with oblations. Agni hath shone forth when the dawn is breaking.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यमु॒ ष्य सुम॑हाँ अवेदि॒ होता॑ म॒न्द्रो मनु॑षो य॒ह्वो अ॒ग्निः वि भा अ॑कः ससृजा॒नः पृ॑थि॒व्यां कृ॒ष्णप॑वि॒रोष॑धीभिर्ववक्षे
verses.transliteration: ayám u ṣyá súmahām̐ avedi  hótā mandró mánuṣo yahvó agníḥ  ví bhā́ akaḥ sasr̥jānáḥ pr̥thivyā́ṃ  kr̥ṣṇápavir óṣadhībhir vavakṣe

translation.text: Yea, he hath been acknowledged as most mighty, the joyous Priest of men, the youthful Agni. He, spreading o'er the earth, made light around him, and grew among the plants with blackened fellies..

verses.sanskrit_deva: कया॑ नो अग्ने॒ वि व॑सः सुवृ॒क्तिं कामु॑ स्व॒धामृ॑णवः श॒स्यमा॑नः क॒दा भ॑वेम॒ पत॑यः सुदत्र रा॒यो व॒न्तारो॑ दु॒ष्टर॑स्य सा॒धोः
verses.transliteration: káyā no agne ví vasaḥ suvr̥ktíṃ  kā́m u svadhā́m r̥ṇavaḥ śasyámānaḥ  kadā́ bhavema pátayaḥ sudatra  rāyó vantā́ro duṣṭárasya sādhóḥ

translation.text: How dost thou decorate our hymn, O Agni? What power dost thou exert when thou art lauded? When, Bounteous God, may we be lords of riches, winners of precious wealth which none may conquer?

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रप्रा॒यम॒ग्निर्भ॑र॒तस्य॑ शृण्वे॒ वि यत्सूर्यो॒ न रोच॑ते बृ॒हद्भाः अ॒भि यः पू॒रुं पृत॑नासु त॒स्थौ द्यु॑ता॒नो दैव्यो॒ अति॑थिः शुशोच
verses.transliteration: prá-prāyám agnír bharatásya śr̥ṇve  ví yát sū́ryo ná rócate br̥hád bhā́ḥ  abhí yáḥ pūrúm pŕ̥tanāsu tasthaú  dyutānó daívyo átithiḥ śuśoca

translation.text: Far famed is this the Bharata's own Agni he shineth like the Sun with lofty splendour. He who hath vanquished Pûru in the battle, the heavenly guest hath glowed in full refulgence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस॒न्नित्त्वे आ॒हव॑नानि॒ भूरि॒ भुवो॒ विश्वे॑भिः सु॒मना॒ अनी॑कैः स्तु॒तश्चि॑दग्ने शृण्विषे गृणा॒नः स्व॒यं व॑र्धस्व त॒न्वं॑ सुजात
verses.transliteration: ásann ít tvé āhávanāni bhū́ri  bhúvo víśvebhiḥ sumánā ánīkaiḥ  stutáś cid agne śr̥ṇviṣe gr̥ṇānáḥ  svayáṃ vardhasva tanvàṃ sujāta

translation.text: Full many oblations are in thee collected: with all thine aspects thou hast waxen gracious. Thou art already famed as praised and lauded, yet still, O nobly born, increase thy body.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं वचः॑ शत॒साः संस॑हस्र॒मुद॒ग्नये॑ जनिषीष्ट द्वि॒बर्हाः॑ शं यत्स्तो॒तृभ्य॑ आ॒पये॒ भवा॑ति द्यु॒मद॑मीव॒चात॑नं रक्षो॒हा
verses.transliteration: idáṃ vácaḥ śatasā́ḥ sáṃsahasram  úd agnáye janiṣīṣṭa dvibárhāḥ  śáṃ yát stotŕ̥bhya āpáye bhávāti-  dyumád amīvacā́tanaṃ rakṣohā́

translation.text: Be this my song, that winneth countless treasure, engendered with redoubled force for Agni, That, splendid, chasing sickness, slaying demons, it may delight our friend and bless the singers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू त्वाम॑ग्न ईमहे॒ वसि॑ष्ठा ईशा॒नं सू॑नो सहसो॒ वसू॑नाम् इषं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॑ म॒घव॑द्भ्य आनड्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: nū́ tvā́m agna īmahe vásiṣṭhāḥ-  īśānáṃ sūno sahaso vásūnām  íṣaṃ stotŕ̥bhyo maghávadbhya ānaḍ  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: We, the Vasishṭhas, now implore thee, Agni, O Son of Strength, the Lord of wealth and riches. Thou hast brought food to singers and to nobles. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अबो॑धि जा॒र उ॒षसा॑मु॒पस्था॒द्धोता॑ म॒न्द्रः क॒वित॑मः पाव॒कः दधा॑ति के॒तुमु॒भय॑स्य ज॒न्तोर्ह॒व्या दे॒वेषु॒ द्रवि॑णं सु॒कृत्सु॑
verses.transliteration: ábodhi jārá uṣásām upásthād  -hótā mandráḥ kavítamaḥ pāvakáḥ  dádhāti ketúm ubháyasya jantór  havyā́ devéṣu dráviṇaṃ sukŕ̥tsu

translation.text: ROUSED from their bosom is the Dawns' beloved, the joyous Priest, most sapient, Purifier. He gives a signal both to Gods and mortals, to Gods oblations, riches to the pious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स सु॒क्रतु॒र्यो वि दुरः॑ पणी॒नां पु॑ना॒नो अ॒र्कं पु॑रु॒भोज॑सं नः होता॑ म॒न्द्रो वि॒शां दमू॑नास्ति॒रस्तमो॑ ददृशे रा॒म्याणा॑म्
verses.transliteration: sá sukrátur yó ví dúraḥ paṇīnā́m  punānó arkám purubhójasaṃ naḥ  hótā mandró viśā́ṃ dámūnās  tirás támo dadr̥śe rāmyā́ṇām

translation.text: Most wise is he who, forcing doors of Paṇis, brought the bright Sun to us who feedeth many. The cheerful Priest, men's Friend and home-companion, through still night's darkness he is made apparent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अमू॑रः क॒विरदि॑तिर्वि॒वस्वा॑न्त्सुसं॒सन्मि॒त्रो अति॑थिः शि॒वो नः॑ चि॒त्रभा॑नुरु॒षसां॑ भा॒त्यग्रे॒ऽपां गर्भः॑ प्र॒स्व१॒॑ आ वि॑वेश
verses.transliteration: ámūraḥ kavír áditir vivásvān  susaṃsán mitró átithiḥ śivó naḥ  citrábhānur uṣásām bhāty ágre  -apā́ṃ gárbhaḥ prasvà ā́ viveśa

translation.text: Wise, ne.'er deceived, uncircumscribed, refulgent, our gracious guest, a Friend with good attendants, Shines forth with wondrous light before the Mornings; the young plants hath he entered, Child of Waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒ळेन्यो॑ वो॒ मनु॑षो यु॒गेषु॑ समन॒गा अ॑शुचज्जा॒तवे॑दाः सु॒सं॒दृशा॑ भा॒नुना॒ यो वि॒भाति॒ प्रति॒ गावः॑ समिधा॒नं बु॑धन्त
verses.transliteration: īḷényo vo mánuṣo yugéṣu  samanagā́ aśucaj jātávedāḥ  susaṃdŕ̥śā bhānúnā yó vibhā́ti  práti gā́vaḥ samidhānám budhanta

translation.text: Seeking our gatherings, he, your Jâtavedas, hath shone adorable through human ages, Who gleams refulgent with his lovely lustre: the kine have waked to meet him when enkindled.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ या॒हि दू॒त्यं१॒॑ मा रि॑षण्यो दे॒वाँ अच्छा॑ ब्रह्म॒कृता॑ ग॒णेन॑ सर॑स्वतीं म॒रुतो॑ अ॒श्विना॒पो यक्षि॑ दे॒वान्र॑त्न॒धेया॑य॒ विश्वा॑न्
verses.transliteration: ágne yāhí dūtyàm mā́ riṣaṇyo  devā́m̐ áchā brahmakŕ̥tā gaṇéna  sárasvatīm marúto aśvínāpó  yákṣi devā́n ratnadhéyāya víśvān

translation.text: Go on thy message to the Gods, and fail not, O Agni, with their band who pray and worship. Bring all the Gods that they may give us riches, Sarasvatî, the Maruts, Aṣvins, Waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वाम॑ग्ने समिधा॒नो वसि॑ष्ठो॒ जरू॑थं ह॒न्यक्षि॑ रा॒ये पुरं॑धिम् पु॒रु॒णी॒था जा॑तवेदो जरस्व यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: tvā́m agne samidhānó vásiṣṭho  járūthaṃ han yákṣi rāyé púraṃdhim  puruṇīthā́ jātavedo jarasva  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Vasishṭha, when enkindling thee, O Agni, hath slain Jarûtha. Give us wealth in plenty. Sing praise in choral song, O Jâtavedas. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒षो न जा॒रः पृ॒थु पाजो॑ अश्रे॒द्दवि॑द्युत॒द्दीद्य॒च्छोशु॑चानः वृषा॒ हरिः॒ शुचि॒रा भा॑ति भा॒सा धियो॑ हिन्वा॒न उ॑श॒तीर॑जीगः
verses.transliteration: uṣó ná jāráḥ pr̥thú pā́jo aśred  dávidyutad dī́dyac chóśucānaḥ  vŕ̥ṣā háriḥ śúcir ā́ bhāti bhāsā́  dhíyo hinvāná uśatī́r ajīgaḥ

translation.text: HE hath sent forth, bright, radiant, and refulgent, like the Dawn's Lover, his far-spreading lustre. Pure in his splendour shines the golden Hero: our longing thoughts hath he aroused and wakened.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व१॒॑र्ण वस्तो॑रु॒षसा॑मरोचि य॒ज्ञं त॑न्वा॒ना उ॒शिजो॒ न मन्म॑ अ॒ग्निर्जन्मा॑नि दे॒व आ वि वि॒द्वान्द्र॒वद्दू॒तो दे॑व॒यावा॒ वनि॑ष्ठः
verses.transliteration: svàr ṇá vástor uṣásām aroci  yajñáṃ tanvānā́ uśíjo ná mánma  agnír jánmāni devá ā́ ví vidvā́n  dravád dūtó devayā́vā vániṣṭhaḥ

translation.text: He, like the Sun, hath shone while Morn is breaking, and priests who weave the sacrifice sing praises, Agni, the God, who knows their generations and visits Gods, most bounteous, rapid envoy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॒ गिरो॑ म॒तयो॑ देव॒यन्ती॑र॒ग्निं य॑न्ति॒ द्रवि॑णं॒ भिक्ष॑माणाः सु॒सं॒दृशं॑ सु॒प्रती॑कं॒ स्वञ्चं॑ हव्य॒वाह॑मर॒तिं मानु॑षाणाम्
verses.transliteration: áchā gíro matáyo devayántīr  agníṃ yanti dráviṇam bhíkṣamāṇāḥ  susaṃdŕ̥śaṃ suprátīkaṃ sváñcaṃ  havyavā́ham aratím mā́nuṣāṇām

translation.text: Our songs and holy hymns go forth to Agni, seeking the God and asking him for riches, Him fair to see, of goodly aspect, mighty, men's messenger who carries their oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रं॑ नो अग्ने॒ वसु॑भिः स॒जोषा॑ रु॒द्रं रु॒द्रेभि॒रा व॑हा बृ॒हन्त॑म् आ॒दि॒त्येभि॒रदि॑तिं वि॒श्वज॑न्यां॒ बृह॒स्पति॒मृक्व॑भिर्वि॒श्ववा॑रम्
verses.transliteration: índraṃ no agne vásubhiḥ sajóṣāḥ-  rudráṃ rudrébhir ā́ vahā br̥hántam  ādityébhir áditiṃ viśvájanyām  bŕ̥haspátim ŕ̥kvabhir viśvávāram

translation.text: joined with the Vasus, Agni, bring thou Indra bring hither mighty Rudra with the Rudras, Aditi good to all men with Âdityas, Br̥ihaspati All-bounteous, with the Singers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒न्द्रं होता॑रमु॒शिजो॒ यवि॑ष्ठम॒ग्निं विश॑ ईळते अध्व॒रेषु॑ स हि क्षपा॑वाँ॒ अभ॑वद्रयी॒णामत॑न्द्रो दू॒तो य॒जथा॑य दे॒वान्
verses.transliteration: mandráṃ hótāram uśíjo yáviṣṭham  agníṃ víśa īḷate adhvaréṣu  sá hí kṣápāvām̐ ábhavad rayīṇā́m  átandro dūtó yajáthāya devā́n

translation.text: Men eagerly implore at sacrifices Agni, Most Youthful God, the joyous Herald. For he is Lord and Ruler over riches, and for Gods' worship an unwearied envoy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हाँ अ॑स्यध्व॒रस्य॑ प्रके॒तो न ऋ॒ते त्वद॒मृता॑ मादयन्ते आ विश्वे॑भिः स॒रथं॑ याहि दे॒वैर्न्य॑ग्ने॒ होता॑ प्रथ॒मः स॑दे॒ह
verses.transliteration: mahā́m̐ asy adhvarásya praketó  ná r̥té tvád amŕ̥tā mādayante  ā́ víśvebhiḥ saráthaṃ yāhi devaír  ny àgne hótā prathamáḥ sadehá

translation.text: GREAT art thou, Agni, sacrifice's Herald: not without thee are deathless Gods made joyful. Come hither with all Deities about thee here take thy seat, the first, as Priest, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वामी॑ळते अजि॒रं दू॒त्या॑य ह॒विष्म॑न्तः॒ सद॒मिन्मानु॑षासः यस्य॑ दे॒वैरास॑दो ब॒र्हिर॒ग्नेऽहा॑न्यस्मै सु॒दिना॑ भवन्ति
verses.transliteration: tvā́m īḷate ajiráṃ dūtyā̀ya  havíṣmantaḥ sádam ín mā́nuṣāsaḥ  yásya devaír ā́sado barhír agne-  -áhāny asmai sudínā bhavanti

translation.text: Men with oblations evermore entreat thee, the swift, to undertake an envoy's duty. He on whose sacred grass with Gods thou sittest, to him, O Agni, are the days propitious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिश्चि॑द॒क्तोः प्र चि॑कितु॒र्वसू॑नि॒ त्वे अ॒न्तर्दा॒शुषे॒ मर्त्या॑य म॒नु॒ष्वद॑ग्न इ॒ह य॑क्षि दे॒वान्भवा॑ नो दू॒तो अ॑भिशस्ति॒पावा॑
verses.transliteration: tríś cid aktóḥ prá cikitur vásūni  tvé antár dāśúṣe mártyāya  manuṣvád agna ihá yakṣi devā́n  bhávā no dūtó abhiśastipā́vā

translation.text: Three times a day in thee are shown the treasures sent for the mortal who presents oblation. Bring the Gods hither like a man, O Agni: be thou our envoy, guarding us from curses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निरी॑शे बृह॒तो अ॑ध्व॒रस्या॒ग्निर्विश्व॑स्य ह॒विषः॑ कृ॒तस्य॑ क्रतुं॒ ह्य॑स्य॒ वस॑वो जु॒षन्ताथा॑ दे॒वा द॑धिरे हव्य॒वाह॑म्
verses.transliteration: agnír īśe br̥ható adhvarásya-  -agnír víśvasya havíṣaḥ kr̥tásya  krátuṃ hy àsya vásavo juṣánta-  -áthā devā́ dadhire havyavā́ham

translation.text: Lord of the lofty sacrifice is Agni, Agni is Lord of every gift presented. The Vasus were contented with his wisdom, so the Gods made him their oblationbearer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आग्ने॑ वह हवि॒रद्या॑य दे॒वानिन्द्र॑ज्येष्ठास इ॒ह मा॑दयन्ताम् इ॒मं य॒ज्ञं दि॒वि दे॒वेषु॑ धेहि यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: ā́gne vaha havirádyāya devā́n  índrajyeṣṭhāsa ihá mādayantām  imáṃ yajñáṃ diví devéṣu dhehi  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: O Agni, bring the Gods to taste our presents: with Indra leading, here let them be joyful. Convey this sacrifice to Gods in heaven. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग॑न्म म॒हा नम॑सा॒ यवि॑ष्ठं॒ यो दी॒दाय॒ समि॑द्धः॒ स्वे दु॑रो॒णे चि॒त्रभा॑नुं॒ रोद॑सी अ॒न्तरु॒र्वी स्वा॑हुतं वि॒श्वतः॑ प्र॒त्यञ्च॑म्
verses.transliteration: áganma mahā́ námasā yáviṣṭhaṃ  yó dīdā́ya sámiddhaḥ své duroṇé  citrábhānuṃ ródasī antár urvī́  svā̀hutaṃ viśvátaḥ pratyáñcam

translation.text: WE with great reverence have approached The Youngest who hath shone forth well-kindled in his dwelling, With wondrous light between wide earth and heaven, well-worshipped, looking forth in all directions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स म॒ह्ना विश्वा॑ दुरि॒तानि॑ सा॒ह्वान॒ग्निः ष्ट॑वे॒ दम॒ आ जा॒तवे॑दाः स नो॑ रक्षिषद्दुरि॒ताद॑व॒द्याद॒स्मान्गृ॑ण॒त उ॒त नो॑ म॒घोनः॑
verses.transliteration: sá mahnā́ víśvā duritā́ni sāhvā́n  agní ṣṭave dáma ā́ jātávedāḥ  sá no rakṣiṣad duritā́d avadyā́d  asmā́n gr̥ṇatá utá no maghónaḥ

translation.text: Through his great might o'ercoming all misfortunes, praised in the house is Agni Jâtavedas. May he protect us from disgrace and trouble, both us who laud him and our noble patrons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं वरु॑ण उ॒त मि॒त्रो अ॑ग्ने॒ त्वां व॑र्धन्ति म॒तिभि॒र्वसि॑ष्ठाः त्वे वसु॑ सुषण॒नानि॑ सन्तु यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ váruṇa utá mitró agne  tvā́ṃ vardhanti matíbhir vásiṣṭhāḥ  tvé vásu suṣaṇanā́ni santu  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: O Agni, thou art Varuṇa and Mitra: Vasishṭhas with their holy hymns exalt thee. With thee be most abundant gain of treasure. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्राग्नये॑ विश्व॒शुचे॑ धियं॒धे॑ऽसुर॒घ्ने मन्म॑ धी॒तिं भ॑रध्वम् भरे॑ ह॒विर्न ब॒र्हिषि॑ प्रीणा॒नो वै॑श्वान॒राय॒ यत॑ये मती॒नाम्
verses.transliteration: prā́gnáye viśvaśúce dhiyaṃdhé-  -asuraghné mánma dhītím bharadhvam  bháre havír ná barhíṣi prīṇānó  vaiśvānarā́ya yátaye matīnā́m

translation.text: BRING song and hymn to Agni, Asura-slayer, enlightener of all and thought-bestower. Like an oblation on the grass, to please him, I bring this to Vaiṣvânara, hymn-inspirer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने शो॒चिषा॒ शोशु॑चान॒ आ रोद॑सी अपृणा॒ जाय॑मानः त्वं दे॒वाँ अ॒भिश॑स्तेरमुञ्चो॒ वैश्वा॑नर जातवेदो महि॒त्वा
verses.transliteration: tvám agne śocíṣā śóśucānaḥ-  ā́ ródasī apr̥ṇā jā́yamānaḥ-  tváṃ devā́m̐ abhíśaster amuñco  vaíśvānara jātavedo mahitvā́

translation.text: Thou with thy flame, O Agni, brightly glowing, hast at thy birth filled full the earth and heaven. TIOU with thy might, Vaiṣvânara Jâtavedas, settest the Gods free frodi the curse that bound them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जा॒तो यद॑ग्ने॒ भुव॑ना॒ व्यख्यः॑ प॒शून्न गो॒पा इर्यः॒ परि॑ज्मा वैश्वा॑नर॒ ब्रह्म॑णे विन्द गा॒तुं यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: jātó yád agne bhúvanā vy ákhyaḥ  paśū́n ná gopā́ íryaḥ párijmā  vaíśvānara bráhmaṇe vinda gātúṃ  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Agni, when, born thou lookedst on all creatures, like a brisk herdsman moving round his cattle. The path to prayer, Vaiṣvânara, thou foundest. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मिधा॑ जा॒तवे॑दसे दे॒वाय॑ दे॒वहू॑तिभिः ह॒विर्भिः॑ शु॒क्रशो॑चिषे नम॒स्विनो॑ व॒यं दा॑शेमा॒ग्नये॑
verses.transliteration: samídhā jātávedase  devā́ya deváhūtibhiḥ  havírbhiḥ śukráśociṣe namasvíno  vayáṃ dāśemāgnáye

translation.text: WITH reverence and with offered gifts serve we the God whose flame is bright: Let us bring Jâtavedas fuel, and adore Agni when we invoke the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं ते॑ अग्ने स॒मिधा॑ विधेम व॒यं दा॑शेम सुष्टु॒ती य॑जत्र व॒यं घृ॒तेना॑ध्वरस्य होतर्व॒यं दे॑व ह॒विषा॑ भद्रशोचे
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ te agne samídhā vidhema  vayáṃ dāśema suṣṭutī́ yajatra  vayáṃ ghr̥ténādhvarasya hotar  vayáṃ deva havíṣā bhadraśoce

translation.text: Agni, may we perform thy rites with fuel, and honour thee, O Holy one, with praises: Honour thee, Priest of sacrifice! with butter, thee, God of blessed light! with our oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ दे॒वेभि॒रुप॑ दे॒वहू॑ति॒मग्ने॑ या॒हि वष॑ट्कृतिं जुषा॒णः तुभ्यं॑ दे॒वाय॒ दाश॑तः स्याम यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: ā́ no devébhir úpa deváhūtim  ágne yāhí váṣaṭkr̥tiṃ juṣāṇáḥ  túbhyaṃ devā́ya dā́śataḥ syāma  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Come, Agni, with the Gods to our invoking, come, pleased, to offerings sanctified with Vashaṭ. May we be his who pays thee, God, due honour. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒प॒सद्या॑य मी॒ळ्हुष॑ आ॒स्ये॑ जुहुता ह॒विः यो नो॒ नेदि॑ष्ठ॒माप्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: upasádyāya mīḷhúṣe-  āsyè juhutā havíḥ  yó no nédiṣṭham ā́pyam

translation.text: OFFER oblations in his mouth, the bounteous God's whom we must serve. His who is nearest kin to us:

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः पञ्च॑ चर्ष॒णीर॒भि नि॑ष॒साद॒ दमे॑दमे क॒विर्गृ॒हप॑ति॒र्युवा॑
verses.transliteration: yáḥ páñca carṣaṇī́r abhí  niṣasā́da dáme-dame  kavír gr̥hápatir yúvā

translation.text: Who for the Fivefold People's take hath seated him in every home Wise, Youthful, Master of the house.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॒ वेदो॑ अ॒मात्य॑म॒ग्नी र॑क्षतु वि॒श्वतः॑ उ॒तास्मान्पा॒त्वंह॑सः
verses.transliteration: sá no védo amā́tyam  agnī́ rakṣatu viśvátaḥ  utā́smā́n pātv áṃhasaḥ

translation.text: On all sides may that Agni guard our household folk and property; May he deliver us from woe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नवं॒ नु स्तोम॑म॒ग्नये॑ दि॒वः श्ये॒नाय॑ जीजनम् वस्वः॑ कु॒विद्व॒नाति॑ नः
verses.transliteration: návaṃ nú stómam agnáye  diváḥ śyenā́ya jījanam  vásvaḥ kuvíd vanā́ti naḥ

translation.text: I have begotten this new hymn for Agni, Falcon of the sky: Will he not give us of his wealth?

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्पा॒र्हा यस्य॒ श्रियो॑ दृ॒शे र॒यिर्वी॒रव॑तो यथा अग्रे॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॒ शोच॑तः
verses.transliteration: spārhā́ yásya śríyo dr̥śé  rayír vīrávato yathā  ágre yajñásya śócataḥ

translation.text: Whose lories when he glows in front of sacrite are fair to see, Like wealth of one with hero sons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सेमां वे॑तु॒ वष॑ट्कृतिम॒ग्निर्जु॑षत नो॒ गिरः॑ यजि॑ष्ठो हव्य॒वाह॑नः
verses.transliteration: sémā́ṃ vetu váṣaṭkr̥tim  agnír juṣata no gíro  yájiṣṭho havyavā́hanaḥ

translation.text: May he enjoy this hallowed gift, Agni accept our songs, who bears Oblations, best of worshippers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि त्वा॑ नक्ष्य विश्पते द्यु॒मन्तं॑ देव धीमहि सु॒वीर॑मग्न आहुत
verses.transliteration: ní tvā nakṣya viśpate  dyumántaṃ deva dhīmahi  suvī́ram agna āhuta

translation.text: Lord of the house, whom men must seek, we set thee down, O Worshipped Onel Bright, rich in heroes, Agni! God

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्षप॑ उ॒स्रश्च॑ दीदिहि स्व॒ग्नय॒स्त्वया॑ व॒यम् सु॒वीर॒स्त्वम॑स्म॒युः
verses.transliteration: kṣápa usráś ca dīdihi  svagnáyas tváyā vayám  suvī́ras tvám asmayúḥ

translation.text: Shine forth at night and morn: through thee with fires are we provided well. Thou, rich in heroes, art our Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ त्वा सा॒तये॒ नरो॒ विप्रा॑सो यन्ति धी॒तिभिः॑ उपाक्ष॑रा सह॒स्रिणी॑
verses.transliteration: úpa tvā sātáye náro  víprāso yanti dhītíbhiḥ  úpā́kṣarā sahasríṇī

translation.text: The men come near thee for their gain, the singers with their songs of praise: Speech, thousandfold, comes near to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्नी रक्षां॑सि सेधति शु॒क्रशो॑चि॒रम॑र्त्यः शुचिः॑ पाव॒क ईड्यः॑
verses.transliteration: agnī́ rákṣāṃsi sedhati  śukráśocir ámartyaḥ  śúciḥ pāvaká ī́ḍyaḥ

translation.text: Bright, Purifier, meet for praise, Immortal with refulgent glow, Agni drives Raksasas away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॒ राधां॒स्या भ॒रेशा॑नः सहसो यहो भग॑श्च दातु॒ वार्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: sá no rā́dhāṃsy ā́ bhara-  ī́śānaḥ sahaso yaho  bhágaś ca dātu vā́ryam

translation.text: As such, bring us abundant wealth, young Child of Strength, for this thou canst May Bhaga give us what is choice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने वी॒रव॒द्यशो॑ दे॒वश्च॑ सवि॒ता भगः॑ दिति॑श्च दाति॒ वार्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: tvám agne vīrávad yáśo  deváś ca savitā́ bhágaḥ  dítiś ca dāti vā́ryam

translation.text: Thou, Agni, givest hero fame: Bhaga and Savitar the God, And Did give us what is good.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ रक्षा॑ णो॒ अंह॑सः॒ प्रति॑ ष्म देव॒ रीष॑तः तपि॑ष्ठैर॒जरो॑ दह
verses.transliteration: ágne rákṣā ṇo áṃhasaḥ  práti ṣma deva rī́ṣataḥ  tápiṣṭhair ajáro daha

translation.text: Agni, preserve us from distress: consume our enemies, O God, Eternal, with the hottest flames.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॑ म॒ही न॒ आय॒स्यना॑धृष्टो॒ नृपी॑तये पूर्भ॑वा श॒तभु॑जिः
verses.transliteration: ádhā mahī́ na ā́yasī-  ánādhr̥ṣṭo nŕ̥pītaye  pū́r bhavā śatábhujiḥ

translation.text: And, irresistible, be thou a mighty iron fort to us, With hundred walls for man's defence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नः॑ पा॒ह्यंह॑सो॒ दोषा॑वस्तरघाय॒तः दिवा॒ नक्त॑मदाभ्य
verses.transliteration: tváṃ naḥ pāhy áṃhaso  dóṣāvastar aghāyatáḥ  dívā náktam adābhya

translation.text: Do thou preserve us, eve and morn, from sorrow, from the wicked men, Infallible! by day and night.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ना वो॑ अ॒ग्निं नम॑सो॒र्जो नपा॑त॒मा हु॑वे प्रि॒यं चेति॑ष्ठमर॒तिं स्व॑ध्व॒रं विश्व॑स्य दू॒तम॒मृत॑म्
verses.transliteration: enā́ vo agníṃ námasā-  -ūrjó nápātam ā́ huve  priyáṃ cétiṣṭham aratíṃ svadhvaráṃ  víśvasya dūtám amŕ̥tam

translation.text: WITH this my reverent hymn I call Agni for you, the Son of Strength, Dear, wisest envoy, served with noble sacrifice, immortal messenger of all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स यो॑जते अरु॒षा वि॒श्वभो॑जसा॒ स दु॑द्रव॒त्स्वा॑हुतः सु॒ब्रह्मा॑ य॒ज्ञः सु॒शमी॒ वसू॑नां दे॒वं राधो॒ जना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: sá yojate aruṣā́ viśvábhojasā  sá dudravat svā̀hutaḥ  subráhmā yajñáḥ suśámī vásūnāṃ  deváṃ rā́dho jánānām

translation.text: His two red horses, all-supporting, let him yoke: let him, well-worshipped, urge them fast. Then hath the sacrifice good prayers and happy end, and heavenly gift of wealth to men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद॑स्य शो॒चिर॑स्थादा॒जुह्वा॑नस्य मी॒ळ्हुषः॑ उद्धू॒मासो॑ अरु॒षासो॑ दिवि॒स्पृशः॒ सम॒ग्निमि॑न्धते॒ नरः॑
verses.transliteration: úd asya śocír asthād  ājúhvānasya mīḷhúṣaḥ  úd dhūmā́so aruṣā́so divispŕ̥śaḥ  sám agním indhate náraḥ

translation.text: The flame of him the Bountiful, the Much-invoked, hath mounted up, And his red-coloured smoke-clouds reach and touch the sky: the men are kindling Agni well.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॑ दू॒तं कृ॑ण्महे य॒शस्त॑मं दे॒वाँ आ वी॒तये॑ वह विश्वा॑ सूनो सहसो मर्त॒भोज॑ना॒ रास्व॒ तद्यत्त्वेम॑हे
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā dūtáṃ kr̥ṇmahe yaśástamaṃ  devā́m̐ ā́ vītáye vaha  víśvā sūno sahaso martabhójanā  rā́sva tád yát tvémahe

translation.text: Thee, thee Most Glorious One we make our messenger. Bring the Gods hither to the feast. Give us, O Son of Strength, all food that fcedeth man: give that for which we pray to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने गृ॒हप॑ति॒स्त्वं होता॑ नो अध्व॒रे त्वं पोता॑ विश्ववार॒ प्रचे॑ता॒ यक्षि॒ वेषि॑ च॒ वार्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: tvám agne gr̥hápatis  tváṃ hótā no adhvaré  tvám pótā viśvavāra prácetāḥ-  yákṣi véṣi ca vā́ryam

translation.text: Thou, Agni, art the homestead's Lord, our Herald at the sacrifice. Lord of all boons, thou art the Cleanser and a Sage. Pay worship, and enjoy the good.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒धि रत्नं॒ यज॑मानाय सुक्रतो॒ त्वं हि र॑त्न॒धा असि॑ आ न॑ ऋ॒ते शि॑शीहि॒ विश्व॑मृ॒त्विजं॑ सु॒शंसो॒ यश्च॒ दक्ष॑ते
verses.transliteration: kr̥dhí rátnaṃ yájamānāya sukrato  tváṃ hí ratnadhā́ ási  ā́ na r̥té śiśīhi víśvam r̥tvíjaṃ  suśáṃso yáś ca dákṣate

translation.text: Give riches to the sacrificer, O Most Wise, for thou art he who granteth wealth. Inspire with zeal each priest at this our solemn rite; all who are skilled in singing praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे अ॑ग्ने स्वाहुत प्रि॒यासः॑ सन्तु सू॒रयः॑ य॒न्तारो॒ ये म॒घवा॑नो॒ जना॑नामू॒र्वान्दय॑न्त॒ गोना॑म्
verses.transliteration: tvé agne svāhuta  priyā́saḥ santu sūráyaḥ  yantā́ro yé maghávāno jánānām  ūrvā́n dáyanta gónām

translation.text: O Agni who art worshipped well, dear let our princes he to thee, Our wealthy patrons who are governors of men, who part, as gifts, their stalls of kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येषा॒मिळा॑ घृ॒तह॑स्ता दुरो॒ण आँ अपि॑ प्रा॒ता नि॒षीद॑ति ताँस्त्रा॑यस्व सहस्य द्रु॒हो नि॒दो यच्छा॑ नः॒ शर्म॑ दीर्घ॒श्रुत्
verses.transliteration: yéṣām íḷā ghr̥táhastā duroṇá ā́m̐  ápi prātā́ niṣī́dati  tā́ṃs trāyasva sahasya druhó nidó  yáchā naḥ śárma dīrghaśrút

translation.text: They in whose home, her hand bearing the sacred oil, Iḷâ sits down well-satisfied- Guard them, Victorious God, from slander and from harm. give us a refuge famed afar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स म॒न्द्रया॑ च जि॒ह्वया॒ वह्नि॑रा॒सा वि॒दुष्ट॑रः अग्ने॑ र॒यिं म॒घव॑द्भ्यो न॒ आ व॑ह ह॒व्यदा॑तिं च सूदय
verses.transliteration: sá mandráyā ca jihváyā  váhnir āsā́ vidúṣṭaraḥ  ágne rayím maghávadbhyo na ā́ vaha  havyádātiṃ ca sūdaya

translation.text: Do thou, a Priest with pleasant tongue, most wise, and very near to us, Agni, bring riches hither to our liberal chiefs, and speed the oflering of our gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये राधां॑सि॒ दद॒त्यश्व्या॑ म॒घा कामे॑न॒ श्रव॑सो म॒हः ताँ अंह॑सः पिपृहि प॒र्तृभि॒ष्ट्वं श॒तं पू॒र्भिर्य॑विष्ठ्य
verses.transliteration: yé rā́dhāṃsi dádaty áśvyā maghā́  kā́mena śrávaso maháḥ  tā́m̐ áṃhasaḥ pipr̥hi partŕ̥bhiṣ ṭváṃ  śatám pūrbhír yaviṣṭhya

translation.text: They who bestow as bounty plenteous wealth of steeds, moved by desire of great renown- Do thou with saving help preserve them from distress, Most Youthful! with a hundred forts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वो वो॑ द्रविणो॒दाः पू॒र्णां वि॑वष्ट्या॒सिच॑म् उद्वा॑ सि॒ञ्चध्व॒मुप॑ वा पृणध्व॒मादिद्वो॑ दे॒व ओ॑हते
verses.transliteration: devó vo draviṇodā́ḥ  pūrṇā́ṃ vivaṣṭy āsícam  úd vā siñcádhvam úpa vā pr̥ṇadhvam  ā́d íd vo devá ohate

translation.text: The God who gives your wealth demands a full libation poured to him. Pour ye it forth, then fill the vessel full again: then doth the God pay heed to you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं होता॑रमध्व॒रस्य॒ प्रचे॑तसं॒ वह्निं॑ दे॒वा अ॑कृण्वत दधा॑ति॒ रत्नं॑ विध॒ते सु॒वीर्य॑म॒ग्निर्जना॑य दा॒शुषे॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ hótāram adhvarásya prácetasaṃ  váhniṃ devā́ akr̥ṇvata  dádhāti rátnaṃ vidhaté suvī́ryam  agnír jánāya dāśúṣe

translation.text: Him have the Gods appointed Priest of sacrifice, oblation-bearer, passing wise. Agni gives wealth and valour to the worshipper, to folk who offer up their gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ भव॑ सुष॒मिधा॒ समि॑द्ध उ॒त ब॒र्हिरु॑र्वि॒या वि स्तृ॑णीताम्
verses.transliteration: ágne bháva suṣamídhā sámiddhaḥ-  utá barhír urviyā́ ví str̥ṇītām

translation.text: AGNI, be kindled well with proper fuel, and let the grass be scattered wide about thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त द्वार॑ उश॒तीर्वि श्र॑यन्तामु॒त दे॒वाँ उ॑श॒त आ व॑हे॒ह
verses.transliteration: utá dvā́ra uśatī́r ví śrayantām  utá devā́m̐ uśatá ā́ vahehá

translation.text: Let the impatient Portals be thrown open bring thou the Gods impatient to come hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ वी॒हि ह॒विषा॒ यक्षि॑ दे॒वान्त्स्व॑ध्व॒रा कृ॑णुहि जातवेदः
verses.transliteration: ágne vīhí havíṣā yákṣi devā́n  svadhvarā́ kr̥ṇuhi jātavedaḥ

translation.text: Taste, Agni: serve the Gods with our oblation. Offer good sacrifices, Jâtavedas!

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒ध्व॒रा क॑रति जा॒तवे॑दा॒ यक्ष॑द्दे॒वाँ अ॒मृता॑न्पि॒प्रय॑च्च
verses.transliteration: svadhvarā́ karati jātávedāḥ  yákṣad devā́m̐ amŕ̥tān pipráyac ca

translation.text: Let Jâtavedas pay fair sacrifices, worship andgratify the Gods Immortal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वंस्व॒ विश्वा॒ वार्या॑णि प्रचेतः स॒त्या भ॑वन्त्वा॒शिषो॑ नो अ॒द्य
verses.transliteration: váṃsva víśvā vā́ryāṇi pracetaḥ  satyā́ bhavantv āśíṣo no adyá

translation.text: Wise God, win for us things that are all-goodly, and let the prayers, we pray today be fruitful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वामु॒ ते द॑धिरे हव्य॒वाहं॑ दे॒वासो॑ अग्न ऊ॒र्ज आ नपा॑तम्
verses.transliteration: tvā́m u té dadhire havyavā́haṃ  devā́so agna ūrjá ā́ nápātam

translation.text: Thee, even thee, the Son of Strength, O Agni, those Gods have made the bearer of oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते ते॑ दे॒वाय॒ दाश॑तः स्याम म॒हो नो॒ रत्ना॒ वि द॑ध इया॒नः
verses.transliteration: té te devā́ya dā́śataḥ syāma  mahó no rátnā ví dadha iyānáḥ

translation.text: To thee the God may we perform our worship: do thou, besought, grant us abundant riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे ह॒ यत्पि॒तर॑श्चिन्न इन्द्र॒ विश्वा॑ वा॒मा ज॑रि॒तारो॒ अस॑न्वन् त्वे गावः॑ सु॒दुघा॒स्त्वे ह्यश्वा॒स्त्वं वसु॑ देवय॒ते वनि॑ष्ठः
verses.transliteration: tvé ha yát pitáraś cin na indra  víśvā vāmā́ jaritā́ro ásanvan  tvé gā́vaḥ sudúghās tvé hy áśvās  tváṃ vásu devayaté vániṣṭhaḥ

translation.text: ALL is with thee, O Indra, all the treasures which erst our fathers won who sang thy praises. With thee are milch-kine good to milk, and horses: best winner thou of riches for the pious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: राजे॑व॒ हि जनि॑भिः॒ क्षेष्ये॒वाव॒ द्युभि॑र॒भि वि॒दुष्क॒विः सन् पि॒शा गिरो॑ मघव॒न्गोभि॒रश्वै॑स्त्वाय॒तः शि॑शीहि रा॒ये अ॒स्मान्
verses.transliteration: rā́jeva hí jánibhiḥ kṣéṣy evá-  -áva dyúbhir abhí vidúṣ kavíḥ sán  piśā́ gíro maghavan góbhir áśvais  tvāyatáḥ śiśīhi rāyé asmā́n

translation.text: For like a King among his wives thou dwellest: with glories, as a Sage, surround and help us. Make us, thy servants, strong for wealth, and honour our songs wirth kine and steeds and decoration.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा उ॑ त्वा पस्पृधा॒नासो॒ अत्र॑ म॒न्द्रा गिरो॑ देव॒यन्ती॒रुप॑ स्थुः अ॒र्वाची॑ ते प॒थ्या॑ रा॒य ए॑तु॒ स्याम॑ ते सुम॒तावि॑न्द्र॒ शर्म॑न्
verses.transliteration: imā́ u tvā paspr̥dhānā́so átra  mandrā́ gíro devayántīr úpa sthuḥ  arvā́cī te pathyā̀ rāyá etu  syā́ma te sumatā́v indra śárman

translation.text: Here these our holy hymns with joy and gladness in pious emulation have approached thee. Hitherward come thy path that leads to riches: may we find shelter in thy favour, Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धे॒नुं न त्वा॑ सू॒यव॑से॒ दुदु॑क्ष॒न्नुप॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि ससृजे॒ वसि॑ष्ठः त्वामिन्मे॒ गोप॑तिं॒ विश्व॑ आ॒हा न॒ इन्द्रः॑ सुम॒तिं ग॒न्त्वच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: dhenúṃ ná tvā sūyávase dúdukṣann  úpa bráhmāṇi sasr̥je vásiṣṭhaḥ  tvā́m ín me gópatiṃ víśva āha-  -ā́ na índraḥ sumatíṃ gantv ácha

translation.text: Vasishṭha hath poured forth his prayers, desiring to milk thee like a cow in goodly pasture. All these my people call thee Lord of cattle: may Indra. come unto the prayer we offer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्णां॑सि चित्पप्रथा॒ना सु॒दास॒ इन्द्रो॑ गा॒धान्य॑कृणोत्सुपा॒रा शर्ध॑न्तं शि॒म्युमु॒चथ॑स्य॒ नव्यः॒ शापं॒ सिन्धू॑नामकृणो॒दश॑स्तीः
verses.transliteration: árṇāṃsi cit paprathānā́ sudā́se-  índro gādhā́ny akr̥ṇot supārā́  śárdhantaṃ śimyúm ucáthasya návyaḥ  śā́paṃ síndhūnām akr̥ṇod áśastīḥ

translation.text: What though the floods spread widely, Indra made them shallow and easy for Sudâs to traverse. He, worthy of our praises, caused the Simyu, foe of our hymn, to curse the rivers' fury.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रो॒ळा इत्तु॒र्वशो॒ यक्षु॑रासीद्रा॒ये मत्स्या॑सो॒ निशि॑ता॒ अपी॑व श्रु॒ष्टिं च॑क्रु॒र्भृग॑वो द्रु॒ह्यव॑श्च॒ सखा॒ सखा॑यमतर॒द्विषू॑चोः
verses.transliteration: puroḷā́ ít turváśo yákṣur āsīd  rāyé mátsyāso níśitā ápīva  śruṣṭíṃ cakrur bhŕ̥gavo druhyávaś ca  sákhā sákhāyam atarad víṣūcoḥ

translation.text: Eager for spoil was Turvaṣa Puroḍâs, fain to win wealth, like fishes urged by hunger. The Bhr̥igus and the Druhyus quickly listened: friend rescued friend mid the two distant peoples.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ प॒क्थासो॑ भला॒नसो॑ भन॒न्तालि॑नासो विषा॒णिनः॑ शि॒वासः॑ आ योऽन॑यत्सध॒मा आर्य॑स्य ग॒व्या तृत्सु॑भ्यो अजगन्यु॒धा नॄन्
verses.transliteration: ā́ pakthā́so bhalānáso bhananta-  -ā́lināso viṣāṇínaḥ śivā́saḥ  ā́ yó 'nayat sadhamā́ ā́ryasya  gavyā́ tŕ̥tsubhyo ajagan yudhā́ nr̥̄́n

translation.text: Together came the Pakthas, the Bhalânas, the Alinas, the Ṣivas, the Vishâṇins. Yet to the Tr̥itsus came the Ârya's Comrade, through love of spoil and heroes' war, to lead them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दु॒रा॒ध्यो॒३॒॑ अदि॑तिं स्रे॒वय॑न्तोऽचे॒तसो॒ वि ज॑गृभ्रे॒ परु॑ष्णीम् म॒ह्नावि॑व्यक्पृथि॒वीं पत्य॑मानः प॒शुष्क॒विर॑शय॒च्चाय॑मानः
verses.transliteration: durādhyò áditiṃ sreváyanto  -acetáso ví jagr̥bhre páruṣṇīm  mahnā́vivyak pr̥thivī́m pátyamānaḥ  paśúṣ kavír aśayac cā́yamānaḥ

translation.text: Fools, in their folly fain to waste her waters, they parted inexhaustible Parushṇî. Lord of the Earth, he with his might repressed them: still lay the herd and the affrighted herdsman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒युरर्थं॒ न न्य॒र्थं परु॑ष्णीमा॒शुश्च॒नेद॑भिपि॒त्वं ज॑गाम सु॒दास॒ इन्द्रः॑ सु॒तुकाँ॑ अ॒मित्रा॒नर॑न्धय॒न्मानु॑षे॒ वध्रि॑वाचः
verses.transliteration: īyúr árthaṃ ná nyarthám páruṣṇīm  āśúś canéd abhipitváṃ jagāma  sudā́sa índraḥ sutúkām̐ amítrān  árandhayan mā́nuṣe vádhrivācaḥ

translation.text: As to their goal they sped to their destruction: they sought Parushṇî; e'en the swift returned not. Indra abandoned, to Sudâs the manly, the swiftly flying foes, unmanly babblers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒युर्गावो॒ न यव॑सा॒दगो॑पा यथाकृ॒तम॒भि मि॒त्रं चि॒तासः॑ पृश्नि॑गावः॒ पृश्नि॑निप्रेषितासः श्रु॒ष्टिं च॑क्रुर्नि॒युतो॒ रन्त॑यश्च
verses.transliteration: īyúr gā́vo ná yávasād ágopāḥ-  yathākr̥tám abhí mitráṃ citā́saḥ  pŕ̥śnigāvaḥ pŕ̥śninipreṣitāsaḥ  śruṣṭíṃ cakrur niyúto rántayaś ca

translation.text: They went like kine unherded from the pasture, each clinging to a friend as chance directed. They who drive spotted steeds, sent down by Pr̥iṣni, gave ear, the Warriors and the harnessed horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एकं॑ च॒ यो विं॑श॒तिं च॑ श्रव॒स्या वै॑क॒र्णयो॒र्जना॒न्राजा॒ न्यस्तः॑ द॒स्मो न सद्म॒न्नि शि॑शाति ब॒र्हिः शूरः॒ सर्ग॑मकृणो॒दिन्द्र॑ एषाम्
verses.transliteration: ékaṃ ca yó viṃśatíṃ ca śravasyā́  vaikarṇáyor jánān rā́jā ny ástaḥ  dasmó ná sádman ní śiśāti barhíḥ  śū́raḥ sárgam akr̥ṇod índra eṣām

translation.text: The King who scattered one-and-twenty people of both Vaikarṇa tribes through lust of glory- As the skilled priest clips grass within the chamber, so hath the Hero Indra, wrought their downfall.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॑ श्रु॒तं क॒वषं॑ वृ॒द्धम॒प्स्वनु॑ द्रु॒ह्युं नि वृ॑ण॒ग्वज्र॑बाहुः वृ॒णा॒ना अत्र॑ स॒ख्याय॑ स॒ख्यं त्वा॒यन्तो॒ ये अम॑द॒न्ननु॑ त्वा
verses.transliteration: ádha śrutáṃ kaváṣaṃ vr̥ddhám apsú-  ánu druhyúṃ ní vr̥ṇag vájrabāhuḥ  vr̥ṇānā́ átra sakhyā́ya sakhyáṃ  tvāyánto yé ámadann ánu tvā

translation.text: Thou, thunder-armed, o'erwhelmedst in the waters famed ancient Kavasa and then the Druhyu. Others here claiming friendship to their friendship, devoted unto thee, in thee were joyful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि स॒द्यो विश्वा॑ दृंहि॒तान्ये॑षा॒मिन्द्रः॒ पुरः॒ सह॑सा स॒प्त द॑र्दः व्यान॑वस्य॒ तृत्स॑वे॒ गयं॑ भा॒ग्जेष्म॑ पू॒रुं वि॒दथे॑ मृ॒ध्रवा॑चम्
verses.transliteration: ví sadyó víśvā dr̥ṃhitā́ny eṣām  índraḥ púraḥ sáhasā saptá dardaḥ  vy ā́navasya tŕ̥tsave gáyam bhāg  jéṣma pūrúṃ vidáthe mr̥dhrávācam

translation.text: Indra at once with conquering might demolished all their strong places and their seven castles. The goods of Anu's son he gave to Tr̥itsu. May we in sacrifice conquer scorned Pûru.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि ग॒व्यवोऽन॑वो द्रु॒ह्यव॑श्च ष॒ष्टिः श॒ता सु॑षुपुः॒ षट् स॒हस्रा॑ ष॒ष्टिर्वी॒रासो॒ अधि॒ षड्दु॑वो॒यु विश्वेदिन्द्र॑स्य वी॒र्या॑ कृ॒तानि॑
verses.transliteration: ní gavyávó 'navo druhyávaś ca  ṣaṣṭíḥ śatā́ suṣupuḥ ṣáṭ sahásrā  ṣaṣṭír vīrā́so ádhi ṣáḍ duvoyú  víśvéd índrasya vīryā̀ kr̥tā́ni

translation.text: The Anavas and Druhyus, seeking booty, have slept, the sixty hundred, yea, six thousand, And six-and-sixty heroes. For the pious were all these mighty exploits done by Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रे॑णै॒ते तृत्स॑वो॒ वेवि॑षाणा॒ आपो॒ न सृ॒ष्टा अ॑धवन्त॒ नीचीः॑ दु॒र्मि॒त्रासः॑ प्रकल॒विन्मिमा॑ना ज॒हुर्विश्वा॑नि॒ भोज॑ना सु॒दासे॑
verses.transliteration: índreṇaité tŕ̥tsavo véviṣāṇāḥ-  ā́po ná sr̥ṣṭā́ adhavanta nī́cīḥ  durmitrā́saḥ prakalavín mímānāḥ-  jahúr víśvāni bhójanā sudā́se

translation.text: These Tr̥itsus under Indra's careful guidance came speeding like loosed waters rushing downward. The foemen, measuring exceeding closely, abandoned to Sudâs all their provisions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्धं वी॒रस्य॑ शृत॒पाम॑नि॒न्द्रं परा॒ शर्ध॑न्तं नुनुदे अ॒भि क्षाम् इन्द्रो॑ म॒न्युं म॑न्यु॒म्यो॑ मिमाय भे॒जे प॒थो व॑र्त॒निं पत्य॑मानः
verses.transliteration: ardháṃ vīrásya śr̥tapā́m anindrám  párā śárdhantaṃ nunude abhí kṣā́m  índro manyúm manyumyò mimāya  bhejé pathó vartaním pátyamānaḥ

translation.text: The hero's side who drank the dressed oblation, Indra's denier, far o'er earth he scattered. Indra brought down the fierce destroyer's fury. He gave them various roads, the path's Controller.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒ध्रेण॑ चि॒त्तद्वेकं॑ चकार सिं॒ह्यं॑ चि॒त्पेत्वे॑ना जघान अव॑ स्र॒क्तीर्वे॒श्या॑वृश्च॒दिन्द्रः॒ प्राय॑च्छ॒द्विश्वा॒ भोज॑ना सु॒दासे॑
verses.transliteration: ādhréṇa cit tád v ékaṃ cakāra  siṃhyàṃ cit pétvenā jaghāna  áva sraktī́r veśyā̀vr̥ścad índraḥ  prā́yachad víśvā bhójanā sudā́se

translation.text: E'en with the weak he wrought this matchless exploit: e'en with a goat he did to death a lion. He pared the pillar's angles with a needle. Thus to Sudâs Indra gave all provisions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शश्व॑न्तो॒ हि शत्र॑वो रार॒धुष्टे॑ भे॒दस्य॑ चि॒च्छर्ध॑तो विन्द॒ रन्धि॑म् मर्ताँ॒ एनः॑ स्तुव॒तो यः कृ॒णोति॑ ति॒ग्मं तस्मि॒न्नि ज॑हि॒ वज्र॑मिन्द्र
verses.transliteration: śáśvanto hí śátravo rāradhúṣ ṭe  bhedásya cic chárdhato vinda rándhim  mártām̐ éna stuvató yáḥ kr̥ṇóti  tigmáṃ tásmin ní jahi vájram indra

translation.text: To thee have all thine enemies submitted: e'en the fierce Bheda hast thou made thy subject. Cast down thy sharpened thunderbolt, O Indra, on him who harms the men who sing thy praises.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आव॒दिन्द्रं॑ य॒मुना॒ तृत्स॑वश्च॒ प्रात्र॑ भे॒दं स॒र्वता॑ता मुषायत् अ॒जास॑श्च॒ शिग्र॑वो॒ यक्ष॑वश्च ब॒लिं शी॒र्षाणि॑ जभ्रु॒रश्व्या॑नि
verses.transliteration: ā́vad índraṃ yamúnā tŕ̥tsavaś ca  prā́tra bhedáṃ sarvátātā muṣāyat  ajā́saś ca śígravo yákṣavaś ca  balíṃ śīrṣā́ṇi jabhrur áśvyāni

translation.text: Yamunâ and the Tr̥itsus aided Indra. There he stripped Bheda bare of all his treasures. The Ajas and the Ṣigrus and the Yakshus brought in to him as tribute heads of horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न त॑ इन्द्र सुम॒तयो॒ न रायः॑ सं॒चक्षे॒ पूर्वा॑ उ॒षसो॒ न नूत्नाः॑ देव॑कं चिन्मान्यमा॒नं ज॑घ॒न्थाव॒ त्मना॑ बृह॒तः शम्ब॑रं भेत्
verses.transliteration: ná ta indra sumatáyo ná rā́yaḥ  saṃcákṣe pū́rvā uṣáso ná nū́tnāḥ  dévakaṃ cin mānyamānáṃ jaghantha-  -áva tmánā br̥hatáḥ śámbaram bhet

translation.text: Not to be scorned, but like Dawns past and recent, O Indra, are thy favours and thy riches. Devaka, Manyamana's son, thou slewest, and smotest Ṣambara from the lofty mountain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ये गृ॒हादम॑मदुस्त्वा॒या प॑राश॒रः श॒तया॑तु॒र्वसि॑ष्ठः न ते॑ भो॒जस्य॑ स॒ख्यं मृ॑ष॒न्ताधा॑ सू॒रिभ्यः॑ सु॒दिना॒ व्यु॑च्छान्
verses.transliteration: prá yé gr̥hā́d ámamadus tvāyā́  parāśaráḥ śatáyātur vásiṣṭhaḥ  ná te bhojásya sakhyám mr̥ṣanta-  -ádhā sūríbhyaḥ sudínā vy ùchān

translation.text: They who, from home, have gladdened thee, thy servants Parâṣara, Vasishṭha, Ṣatayâtu, Will not forget thy friendship, liberal Giver. So shall the days dawn prosperous for the princes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वे नप्तु॑र्दे॒वव॑तः श॒ते गोर्द्वा रथा॑ व॒धूम॑न्ता सु॒दासः॑ अर्ह॑न्नग्ने पैजव॒नस्य॒ दानं॒ होते॑व॒ सद्म॒ पर्ये॑मि॒ रेभ॑न्
verses.transliteration: dvé náptur devávataḥ śaté gór  dvā́ ráthā vadhū́mantā sudā́saḥ  árhann agne paijavanásya dā́naṃ  hóteva sádma páry emi rébhan

translation.text: Priest-like, with praise, I move around the altar, earning Paijavana's reward, O Agni, Two hundred cows from Devavan's descendant, two chariots from Sudâs with mares to draw them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒त्वारो॑ मा पैजव॒नस्य॒ दानाः॒ स्मद्दि॑ष्टयः कृश॒निनो॑ निरे॒के ऋ॒ज्रासो॑ मा पृथिवि॒ष्ठाः सु॒दास॑स्तो॒कं तो॒काय॒ श्रव॑से वहन्ति
verses.transliteration: catvā́ro mā paijavanásya dā́nāḥ  smáddiṣṭayaḥ kr̥śaníno nireké  r̥jrā́so mā pr̥thiviṣṭhā́ḥ sudā́sas  tokáṃ tokā́ya śrávase vahanti

translation.text: Gift of Paijavana, four horses bear me in foremost place, trained steeds with pearl to deck them. Sudâs's brown steeds, firmly-stepping, carry me and my son for progeny and glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ श्रवो॒ रोद॑सी अ॒न्तरु॒र्वी शी॒र्ष्णेशी॑र्ष्णे विब॒भाजा॑ विभ॒क्ता स॒प्तेदिन्द्रं॒ न स्र॒वतो॑ गृणन्ति॒ नि यु॑ध्याम॒धिम॑शिशाद॒भीके॑
verses.transliteration: yásya śrávo ródasī antár urvī́  śīrṣṇé-śīrṣṇe vibabhā́jā vibhaktā́  saptéd índraṃ ná sraváto gr̥ṇanti  ní yudhyāmadhím aśiśād abhī́ke

translation.text: Him whose fame spreads between wide earth and heaven, who, as dispenser, gives each chief his portion, Seven flowing Rivers glorify like Indra. He slew Yudhyâmadhi in close encounter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं न॑रो मरुतः सश्च॒तानु॒ दिवो॑दासं॒ न पि॒तरं॑ सु॒दासः॑ अ॒वि॒ष्टना॑ पैजव॒नस्य॒ केतं॑ दू॒णाशं॑ क्ष॒त्रम॒जरं॑ दुवो॒यु
verses.transliteration: imáṃ naro marutaḥ saścatā́nu  dívodāsaṃ ná pitáraṃ sudā́saḥ  aviṣṭánā paijavanásya kétaṃ  dūṇā́śaṃ kṣatrám ajáraṃ duvoyú

translation.text: Attend on him O ye heroic Maruts as on Sudâs's father Divodâsa. Further Paijavana's desire with favour. Guard faithfully his lasting firm dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ति॒ग्मशृ॑ङ्गो वृष॒भो न भी॒म एकः॑ कृ॒ष्टीश्च्या॒वय॑ति॒ प्र विश्वाः॑ यः शश्व॑तो॒ अदा॑शुषो॒ गय॑स्य प्रय॒न्तासि॒ सुष्वि॑तराय॒ वेदः॑
verses.transliteration: yás tigmáśr̥ṅgo vr̥ṣabhó ná bhīmáḥ-  ékaḥ kr̥ṣṭī́ś cyāváyati prá víśvāḥ  yáḥ śáśvato ádāśuṣo gáyasya  prayantā́si súṣvitarāya védaḥ

translation.text: HE like a bull with sharpened horns, terrific, singly excites and agitates all the people: Thou givest him who largely pours libations his goods who pours not, for his own possession.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं ह॒ त्यदि॑न्द्र॒ कुत्स॑मावः॒ शुश्रू॑षमाणस्त॒न्वा॑ सम॒र्ये दासं॒ यच्छुष्णं॒ कुय॑वं॒ न्य॑स्मा॒ अर॑न्धय आर्जुने॒याय॒ शिक्ष॑न्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ ha tyád indra kútsam āvaḥ  śúśrūṣamāṇas tanvā̀ samaryé  dā́saṃ yác chúṣṇaṃ kúyavaṃ ny àsmai-  árandhaya ārjuneyā́ya śíkṣan

translation.text: Thou, verily, Indra, gavest help to Kutsa, willingly giving car to him in battle, When, aiding Ârjuneya, thou subduedst to him both Kuyava and the Dâsa Ṣushṇa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं धृ॑ष्णो धृष॒ता वी॒तह॑व्यं॒ प्रावो॒ विश्वा॑भिरू॒तिभिः॑ सु॒दास॑म् प्र पौरु॑कुत्सिं त्र॒सद॑स्युमावः॒ क्षेत्र॑साता वृत्र॒हत्ये॑षु पू॒रुम्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ dhr̥ṣṇo dhr̥ṣatā́ vītáhavyam  prā́vo víśvābhir ūtíbhiḥ sudā́sam  prá paúrukutsiṃ trasádasyum āvaḥ  kṣétrasātā vr̥trahátyeṣu pūrúm

translation.text: O Bold One, thou with all thine aids hast boldly holpen Sudâs whose offerings were accepted, Pûru in winning land and slaying foemen, and Trasadasyu son of Purukutsa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नृभि॑र्नृमणो दे॒ववी॑तौ॒ भूरी॑णि वृ॒त्रा ह॑र्यश्व हंसि त्वं नि दस्युं॒ चुमु॑रिं॒ धुनिं॒ चास्वा॑पयो द॒भीत॑ये सु॒हन्तु॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ nŕ̥bhir nr̥maṇo devávītau  bhū́rīṇi vr̥trā́ haryaśva haṃsi  tváṃ ní dásyuṃ cúmuriṃ dhúniṃ ca-  -ásvāpayo dabhī́taye suhántu

translation.text: At the Gods' banquet, hero-souled! with Heroes, Lord of Bay Steeds, thou slewest many foemen. Thou sentest in swift death to sleep the Dasyu, both Chumuri and Dhuni, for Dabhîti.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॑ च्यौ॒त्नानि॑ वज्रहस्त॒ तानि॒ नव॒ यत्पुरो॑ नव॒तिं च॑ स॒द्यः नि॒वेश॑ने शतत॒मावि॑वेषी॒रह॑ञ्च वृ॒त्रं नमु॑चिमु॒ताह॑न्
