verses.transliteration: táva cyautnā́ni vajrahasta tā́ni  náva yát púro navatíṃ ca sadyáḥ  nivéśane śatatamā́viveṣīr  áhañ ca vr̥tráṃ námucim utā́han

translation.text: These were thy mighty powers that, Thunder-wielder, thou swiftly crushedst nine-and-ninety castles: Thou capturedst the hundredth in thine onslaught; thou slewest Namuci, thou slewest Vr̥itra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सना॒ ता त॑ इन्द्र॒ भोज॑नानि रा॒तह॑व्याय दा॒शुषे॑ सु॒दासे॑ वृष्णे॑ ते॒ हरी॒ वृष॑णा युनज्मि॒ व्यन्तु॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि पुरुशाक॒ वाज॑म्
verses.transliteration: sánā tā́ ta indra bhójanāni  rātáhavyāya dāśúṣe sudā́se  vŕ̥ṣṇe te hárī vŕ̥ṣaṇā yunajmi  vyántu bráhmāṇi puruśāka vā́jam

translation.text: Old are the blessings, Indra, which thou gavest Sudâs the worshipper who brought oblations. For thee, the Strong, I yoke thy strong Bay Horses: may our prayers reach thee and win strength, Most Mighty!

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा ते॑ अ॒स्यां स॑हसाव॒न्परि॑ष्टाव॒घाय॑ भूम हरिवः परा॒दै त्राय॑स्व नोऽवृ॒केभि॒र्वरू॑थै॒स्तव॑ प्रि॒यासः॑ सू॒रिषु॑ स्याम
verses.transliteration: mā́ te asyā́ṃ sahasāvan páriṣṭāv  aghā́ya bhūma harivaḥ parādaí  trā́yasva no 'vr̥kébhir várūthais  táva priyā́saḥ sūríṣu syāma

translation.text: Give us not up, Lord of Bay Horses, Victor, in this thine own assembly, to the wicked. Deliver us with true and faithful succours: dear may we be to thee among the princes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रि॒यास॒ इत्ते॑ मघवन्न॒भिष्टौ॒ नरो॑ मदेम शर॒णे सखा॑यः नि तु॒र्वशं॒ नि याद्वं॑ शिशीह्यतिथि॒ग्वाय॒ शंस्यं॑ करि॒ष्यन्
verses.transliteration: priyā́sa ít te maghavann abhíṣṭau  náro madema śaraṇé sákhāyaḥ  ní turváśaṃ ní yā́dvaṃ śiśīhi-  atithigvā́ya śáṃsyaṃ kariṣyán

translation.text: May we men, Maghavan, the friends thou lovest, near thee be joyful under thy protection. Fain to fulfil the wish of Âtithigva humble. the pride of Turvaṣa and Yadva.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒द्यश्चि॒न्नु ते म॑घवन्न॒भिष्टौ॒ नरः॑ शंसन्त्युक्थ॒शास॑ उ॒क्था ये ते॒ हवे॑भि॒र्वि प॒णीँरदा॑शन्न॒स्मान्वृ॑णीष्व॒ युज्या॑य॒ तस्मै॑
verses.transliteration: sadyáś cin nú te maghavann abhíṣṭau  náraḥ śaṃsanty ukthaśā́sa ukthā́  yé te hávebhir ví paṇī́m̐r ádāśann  asmā́n vr̥ṇīṣva yújyāya tásmai

translation.text: Swiftly, in truth, O Maghavan, about thee men skilled in hymning sing their songs and praises. ' Elect us also into their assembly who by their calls on thee despoiled the niggards.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ते स्तोमा॑ न॒रां नृ॑तम॒ तुभ्य॑मस्म॒द्र्य॑ञ्चो॒ दद॑तो म॒घानि॑ तेषा॑मिन्द्र वृत्र॒हत्ये॑ शि॒वो भूः॒ सखा॑ च॒ शूरो॑ऽवि॒ता च॑ नृ॒णाम्
verses.transliteration: eté stómā narā́ṃ nr̥tama túbhyam  asmadryàñco dádato maghā́ni  téṣām indra vr̥trahátye śivó bhūḥ  sákhā ca śū́ro 'vitā́ ca nr̥ṇā́m

translation.text: Thine are these lauds, O manliest of heroes, lauds which revert to us and give us riches. Favour these, Indra, when they fight with faemen, as Friend and Hero and the heroes' Helper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू इ॑न्द्र शूर॒ स्तव॑मान ऊ॒ती ब्रह्म॑जूतस्त॒न्वा॑ वावृधस्व उप॑ नो॒ वाजा॑न्मिमी॒ह्युप॒ स्तीन्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: nū́ indra śūra stávamāna ūtī́  bráhmajūtas tanvā̀ vāvr̥dhasva  úpa no vā́jān mimīhy úpa stī́n  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Now, lauded for thine aid, Heroic Indra, sped by our prayer, wax mighty in thy body. Apportion to us strength and habitations. Ye Gods, protect us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒ग्रो ज॑ज्ञे वी॒र्या॑य स्व॒धावा॒ञ्चक्रि॒रपो॒ नर्यो॒ यत्क॑रि॒ष्यन् जग्मि॒र्युवा॑ नृ॒षद॑न॒मवो॑भिस्त्रा॒ता न॒ इन्द्र॒ एन॑सो म॒हश्चि॑त्
verses.transliteration: ugró jajñe vīryā̀ya svadhā́vāñ  cákrir ápo náryo yát kariṣyán  jágmir yúvā nr̥ṣádanam ávobhis  trātā́ na índra énaso maháś cit

translation.text: STRONG, Godly-natured, born for hero exploit, man's Friend, hedoth whatever deed he willeth. Saving us e'en from great transgression, Indra, the Youthful, visiteth man's home with favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हन्ता॑ वृ॒त्रमिन्द्रः॒ शूशु॑वानः॒ प्रावी॒न्नु वी॒रो ज॑रि॒तार॑मू॒ती कर्ता॑ सु॒दासे॒ अह॒ वा उ॑ लो॒कं दाता॒ वसु॒ मुहु॒रा दा॒शुषे॑ भूत्
verses.transliteration: hántā vr̥trám índraḥ śū́śuvānaḥ  prā́vīn nú vīró jaritā́ram ūtī́  kártā sudā́se áha vā́ ulokáṃ  dā́tā vásu múhur ā́ dāśúṣe bhūt

translation.text: Waxing greatness Indra slayeth Vr̥itra: the Hero with his aid hath helped the singer. He gave Sudâs wide room and space, and often hath granted wealth to him who brought oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒ध्मो अ॑न॒र्वा ख॑ज॒कृत्स॒मद्वा॒ शूरः॑ सत्रा॒षाड्ज॒नुषे॒मषा॑ळ्हः व्या॑स॒ इन्द्रः॒ पृत॑नाः॒ स्वोजा॒ अधा॒ विश्वं॑ शत्रू॒यन्तं॑ जघान
verses.transliteration: yudhmó anarvā́ khajakŕ̥t samádvā  śū́raḥ satrāṣā́ḍ janúṣem áṣāḷhaḥ  vy ā̀sa índraḥ pŕ̥tanāḥ svójāḥ-  ádhā víśvaṃ śatrūyántaṃ jaghāna

translation.text: Soldier unchecked, war-rousing, battling Hero, unconquered from of old, victorious ever, Indra the very strong hath scattered armies; yea, he hath slain each foe who fought against him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भे चि॑दिन्द्र॒ रोद॑सी महि॒त्वा प॑प्राथ॒ तवि॑षीभिस्तुविष्मः नि वज्र॒मिन्द्रो॒ हरि॑वा॒न्मिमि॑क्ष॒न्त्समन्ध॑सा॒ मदे॑षु॒ वा उ॑वोच
verses.transliteration: ubhé cid indra ródasī mahitvā́  paprātha táviṣībhis tuviṣmaḥ  ní vájram índro hárivān mímikṣan  sám ándhasā mádeṣu vā́ uvoca

translation.text: Thou with thy greatness hast filled full, O Indra, even both the worlds with might, O thou Most Mighty. Lord of Bays, Indra, brandishing his thunder, is gratified with Soma at the banquet.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषा॑ जजान॒ वृष॑णं॒ रणा॑य॒ तमु॑ चि॒न्नारी॒ नर्यं॑ ससूव प्र यः से॑ना॒नीरध॒ नृभ्यो॒ अस्ती॒नः सत्वा॑ ग॒वेष॑णः॒ स धृ॒ष्णुः
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā jajāna vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ ráṇāya  tám u cin nā́rī náryaṃ sasūva  prá yáḥ senānī́r ádha nŕ̥bhyo ásti-  -ináḥ sátvā gavéṣaṇaḥ sá dhr̥ṣṇúḥ

translation.text: A Bull begat the Bull for joy of battle, and a strong Mother brought forth him the manly. He who is Chief of men, their armies' Leader, is strong Hero, bold, and fain for booty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू चि॒त्स भ्रे॑षते॒ जनो॒ न रे॑ष॒न्मनो॒ यो अ॑स्य घो॒रमा॒विवा॑सात् य॒ज्ञैर्य इन्द्रे॒ दध॑ते॒ दुवां॑सि॒ क्षय॒त्स रा॒य ऋ॑त॒पा ऋ॑ते॒जाः
verses.transliteration: nū́ cit sá bhreṣate jáno ná reṣat-  máno yó asya ghorám āvívāsāt  yajñaír yá índre dádhate dúvāṃsi  kṣáyat sá rāyá r̥tapā́ r̥tejā́ḥ

translation.text: The people falter not, nor suffer sorrow, who win themselves this God's terrific spirit. He who with sacrifices worships Indra is lord of wealth, law-born and law's protector.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑न्द्र॒ पूर्वो॒ अप॑राय॒ शिक्ष॒न्नय॒ज्ज्याया॒न्कनी॑यसो दे॒ष्णम् अ॒मृत॒ इत्पर्या॑सीत दू॒रमा चि॑त्र॒ चित्र्यं॑ भरा र॒यिं नः॑
verses.transliteration: yád indra pū́rvo áparāya śíkṣann  áyaj jyā́yān kánīyaso deṣṇám  amŕ̥ta ít páry āsīta dūrám  ā́ citra cítryam bharā rayíṃ naḥ

translation.text: Whene'er the elder fain would help the younger the greater cometh to the lesser's present. Shall the Immortal sit aloof' inactive? O Wondrous Indra, bring us wondrous riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्त॑ इन्द्र प्रि॒यो जनो॒ ददा॑श॒दस॑न्निरे॒के अ॑द्रिवः॒ सखा॑ ते व॒यं ते॑ अ॒स्यां सु॑म॒तौ चनि॑ष्ठाः॒ स्याम॒ वरू॑थे॒ अघ्न॑तो॒ नृपी॑तौ
verses.transliteration: yás ta indra priyó jáno dádāśad  ásan nireké adrivaḥ sákhā te  vayáṃ te asyā́ṃ sumataú cániṣṭhāḥ  syā́ma várūthe ághnato nŕ̥pītau

translation.text: Thy dear folk, Indra, who present oblations, are, in chief place, thy friends, O Thunder-wielder. May we be best content in this thy favour, sheltered by One who slays not, but preserves us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष स्तोमो॑ अचिक्रद॒द्वृषा॑ त उ॒त स्ता॒मुर्म॑घवन्नक्रपिष्ट रा॒यस्कामो॑ जरि॒तारं॑ त॒ आग॒न्त्वम॒ङ्ग श॑क्र॒ वस्व॒ आ श॑को नः
verses.transliteration: eṣá stómo acikradad vŕ̥ṣā te-  utá stāmúr maghavann akrapiṣṭa  rāyás kā́mo jaritā́raṃ ta ā́gan  tvám aṅgá śakra vásva ā́ śako naḥ

translation.text: To thee the mighty hymn hath clamoured loudly, and, Maghavan, the eloquent hath besought thee. Desire of wealth hath come upon thy singer: help us then, gakra, to our share of riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स न॑ इन्द्र॒ त्वय॑ताया इ॒षे धा॒स्त्मना॑ च॒ ये म॒घवा॑नो जु॒नन्ति॑ वस्वी॒ षु ते॑ जरि॒त्रे अ॑स्तु श॒क्तिर्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: sá na indra tváyatāyā iṣé dhās  tmánā ca yé maghávāno junánti  vásvī ṣú te jaritré astu śaktír  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Place us by food which thou hast given, O Indra, us and the wealthy patrons who command us. Let thy great power bring good to him who lauds thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असा॑वि दे॒वं गोऋ॑जीक॒मन्धो॒ न्य॑स्मि॒न्निन्द्रो॑ ज॒नुषे॑मुवोच बोधा॑मसि त्वा हर्यश्व य॒ज्ञैर्बोधा॑ नः॒ स्तोम॒मन्ध॑सो॒ मदे॑षु
verses.transliteration: ásāvi deváṃ gór̥jīkam ándho  ny àsminn índro janúṣem uvoca  bódhāmasi tvā haryaśva yajñaír  bódhā na stómam ándhaso mádeṣu

translation.text: PRESSED is the juice divine with milk commingled: thereto hath Indra ever been accustomed. We wake thee, Lord of Bays, with sacrifices: mark this our laud in the wild joy of Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र य॑न्ति य॒ज्ञं वि॒पय॑न्ति ब॒र्हिः सो॑म॒मादो॑ वि॒दथे॑ दु॒ध्रवा॑चः न्यु॑ भ्रियन्ते य॒शसो॑ गृ॒भादा दू॒रउ॑पब्दो॒ वृष॑णो नृ॒षाचः॑
verses.transliteration: prá yanti yajñáṃ vipáyanti barhíḥ  somamā́do vidáthe dudhrávācaḥ  ny ù bhriyante yaśáso gr̥bhā́d~ā́  dūrá:upabdo vŕ̥ṣaṇo nr̥ṣā́caḥ

translation.text: On to the rite they move, the grass they scatter, these Soma-drinkers eloquent in synod. Hither, for men to grasp, are brought the press-stones, far-thundering, famous, strong, that wait on heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमि॑न्द्र॒ स्रवि॑त॒वा अ॒पस्कः॒ परि॑ष्ठिता॒ अहि॑ना शूर पू॒र्वीः त्वद्वा॑वक्रे र॒थ्यो॒३॒॑ न धेना॒ रेज॑न्ते॒ विश्वा॑ कृ॒त्रिमा॑णि भी॒षा
verses.transliteration: tvám indra srávitavā́ apás kaḥ  páriṣṭhitā áhinā śūra pūrvī́ḥ  tvád vāvakre rathyò ná dhénāḥ-  réjante víśvā kr̥trímāṇi bhīṣā́

translation.text: Indra, thou settest free the many waters that were encompassed, Hero, by the Dragon. Down rolled, as if on chariots borne, the rivers: through fear of thee all things created tremble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भी॒मो वि॑वे॒षायु॑धेभिरेषा॒मपां॑सि॒ विश्वा॒ नर्या॑णि वि॒द्वान् इन्द्रः॒ पुरो॒ जर्हृ॑षाणो॒ वि दू॑धो॒द्वि वज्र॑हस्तो महि॒ना ज॑घान
verses.transliteration: bhīmó viveṣā́yudhebhir eṣām  ápāṃsi víśvā náryāṇi vidvā́n  índraḥ púro járhr̥ṣāṇo ví dūdhod  ví vájrahasto mahinā́ jaghāna

translation.text: Skilled in all manly deeds the God terrific hath with his weapons mastered these opponents. Indra in rapturous joy shook down their castles he slew them in his might, the Thunder-wielder.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न या॒तव॑ इन्द्र जूजुवुर्नो॒ न वन्द॑ना शविष्ठ वे॒द्याभिः॑ स श॑र्धद॒र्यो विषु॑णस्य ज॒न्तोर्मा शि॒श्नदे॑वा॒ अपि॑ गुर्ऋ॒तं नः॑
verses.transliteration: ná yātáva indra jūjuvur no  ná vándanā śaviṣṭha vedyā́bhiḥ  sá śardhad aryó víṣuṇasya jantór  mā́ śiśnádevā ápi gur r̥táṃ naḥ

translation.text: No evil spirits have impelled us, Indra, nor fiends, O Mightiest God, with their devices. Let our true God subdue the hostile rabble: let not the lewd approach our holy worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि क्रत्वे॑न्द्र भू॒रध॒ ज्मन्न ते॑ विव्यङ्महि॒मानं॒ रजां॑सि स्वेना॒ हि वृ॒त्रं शव॑सा ज॒घन्थ॒ न शत्रु॒रन्तं॑ विविदद्यु॒धा ते॑
verses.transliteration: abhí krátvendra bhūr ádha jmán  ná te vivyaṅ mahimā́naṃ rájāṃsi  svénā hí vr̥tráṃ śávasā jaghántha  ná śátrur ántaṃ vividad yudhā́ te

translation.text: Thou in thy strength surpassest Earth and Heaven: the regions comprehend not all thy greatness. With thine own power and might thou slewest Vr̥itra: no foe hath found the end of thee in battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वाश्चि॑त्ते असु॒र्या॑य॒ पूर्वेऽनु॑ क्ष॒त्राय॑ ममिरे॒ सहां॑सि इन्द्रो॑ म॒घानि॑ दयते वि॒षह्येन्द्रं॒ वाज॑स्य जोहुवन्त सा॒तौ
verses.transliteration: devā́ś cit te asuryā̀ya pū́rve-  -ánu kṣatrā́ya mamire sáhāṃsi  índro maghā́ni dayate viṣáhya-  -índraṃ vā́jasya johuvanta sātaú

translation.text: Even the earlier Deities submitted their powers to thy supreme divine dominion. Indra wins wealth and deals it out to other's: men in the strife for booty call on Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: की॒रिश्चि॒द्धि त्वामव॑से जु॒हावेशा॑नमिन्द्र॒ सौभ॑गस्य॒ भूरेः॑ अवो॑ बभूथ शतमूते अ॒स्मे अ॑भिक्ष॒त्तुस्त्वाव॑तो वरू॒ता
verses.transliteration: kīríś cid dhí tvā́m ávase juhā́va-  -ī́śānam indra saúbhagasya bhū́reḥ  ávo babhūtha śatamūte asmé  abhikṣattús tvā́vato varūtā́

translation.text: The humble hath invoked thee for protection, thee, Lord of great felicity, O Indra. Thou with a hundred aids hast been our Helper: one who brings gifts like thee hath his defender.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सखा॑यस्त इन्द्र वि॒श्वह॑ स्याम नमोवृ॒धासो॑ महि॒ना त॑रुत्र व॒न्वन्तु॑ स्मा॒ तेऽव॑सा समी॒के॒३॒॑ऽभी॑तिम॒र्यो व॒नुषां॒ शवां॑सि
verses.transliteration: sákhāyas ta indra viśváha syāma  namovr̥dhā́so mahinā́ tarutra  vanvántu smā té 'vasā samīké-  -abhī̀tim aryó vanúṣāṃ śávāṃsi

translation.text: May we, O Indra, be thy friends for ever, eagerly, Conqueror, yielding greater homage. May, through thy grace, the strength of us who battle quell in the shock the onset of the foeman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स न॑ इन्द्र॒ त्वय॑ताया इ॒षे धा॒स्त्मना॑ च॒ ये म॒घवा॑नो जु॒नन्ति॑ वस्वी॒ षु ते॑ जरि॒त्रे अ॑स्तु श॒क्तिर्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: sá na indra tváyatāyā iṣé dhās  tmánā ca yé maghávāno junánti  vásvī ṣú te jaritré astu śaktír  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Place us by food which thou hast given, O Indra, us and the wealthy patrons who command us. Let thy great power bring good to him who lauds thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पिबा॒ सोम॑मिन्द्र॒ मन्द॑तु त्वा॒ यं ते॑ सु॒षाव॑ हर्य॒श्वाद्रिः॑ सो॒तुर्बा॒हुभ्यां॒ सुय॑तो॒ नार्वा॑
verses.transliteration: píbā sómam indra mándatu tvā  yáṃ te suṣā́va haryaśvā́driḥ  sotúr bāhúbhyāṃ súyato nā́rvā

translation.text: DRINK Soma, Lord of Bays, and let it cheer thee: Indra, the stone, like a well guided courser, Directed by the presser's arms hath pressed it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ते॒ मदो॒ युज्य॒श्चारु॒रस्ति॒ येन॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ हर्यश्व॒ हंसि॑ स त्वामि॑न्द्र प्रभूवसो ममत्तु
verses.transliteration: yás te mádo yújyaś cā́rur ásti  yéna vr̥trā́ṇi haryaśva háṃsi  sá tvā́m indra prabhūvaso mamattu

translation.text: So let the draught of joy, thy dear companion, by which, O Lord of Bays, thou slayest foemen, Delight thee, Indra, Lord of princely treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बोधा॒ सु मे॑ मघव॒न्वाच॒मेमां यां ते॒ वसि॑ष्ठो॒ अर्च॑ति॒ प्रश॑स्तिम् इ॒मा ब्रह्म॑ सध॒मादे॑ जुषस्व
verses.transliteration: bódhā sú me maghavan vā́cam émā́ṃ  yā́ṃ te vásiṣṭho árcati práśastim  imā́ bráhma sadhamā́de juṣasva

translation.text: Mark closely, Maghavan, the words I utter, this eulogy recited by Vasishṭha: Accept the prayers I offer at thy banquet.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रु॒धी हवं॑ विपिपा॒नस्याद्रे॒र्बोधा॒ विप्र॒स्यार्च॑तो मनी॒षाम् कृ॒ष्वा दुवां॒स्यन्त॑मा॒ सचे॒मा
verses.transliteration: śrudhī́ hávaṃ vipipānásyā́drer  bódhā víprasyā́rcato manīṣā́m  kr̥ṣvā́ dúvāṃsy ántamā sácemā́

translation.text: Hear thou the call of the juice-drinking press-stone: hear thou the Brahman's hymn who sings and lauds thee. Take to thine inmost self these adorations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न ते॒ गिरो॒ अपि॑ मृष्ये तु॒रस्य॒ न सु॑ष्टु॒तिम॑सु॒र्य॑स्य वि॒द्वान् सदा॑ ते॒ नाम॑ स्वयशो विवक्मि
verses.transliteration: ná te gíro ápi mr̥ṣye turásya  ná suṣṭutím asuryàsya vidvā́n  sádā te nā́ma svayaśo vivakmi

translation.text: I know and ne'er forget the hymns and praises of thee, the Conqueror, and thy strength immortal. Thy name I ever utter. Self-Refulgent

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूरि॒ हि ते॒ सव॑ना॒ मानु॑षेषु॒ भूरि॑ मनी॒षी ह॑वते॒ त्वामित् मारे अ॒स्मन्म॑घव॒ञ्ज्योक्कः॑
verses.transliteration: bhū́ri hí te sávanā mā́nuṣeṣu  bhū́ri manīṣī́ havate tvā́m ít  mā́ré asmán maghavañ jyók kaḥ

translation.text: Among mankind many are thy libations, and many a time the pious sageinvokes thee. O Maghavan, be not long distant from us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुभ्येदि॒मा सव॑ना शूर॒ विश्वा॒ तुभ्यं॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि॒ वर्ध॑ना कृणोमि त्वं नृभि॒र्हव्यो॑ वि॒श्वधा॑सि
verses.transliteration: túbhyéd imā́ sávanā śūra víśvā  túbhyam bráhmāṇi várdhanā kr̥ṇomi  tváṃ nŕ̥bhir hávyo viśvádhāsi

translation.text: All these libations are for thee, O Hero: to thee I offer these my prayers. that strengthen. Ever, in every place, must men invoke thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू चि॒न्नु ते॒ मन्य॑मानस्य द॒स्मोद॑श्नुवन्ति महि॒मान॑मुग्र न वी॒र्य॑मिन्द्र ते॒ न राधः॑
verses.transliteration: nū́ cin nú te mányamānasya dasma-  -úd aśnuvanti mahimā́nam ugra  ná vīryàm indra te ná rā́dhaḥ

translation.text: Never do men attain, O Wonder-Worker, thy greatness, Mighty One, who must be lauded, Nor, Indra, thine heroic power and bounty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये च॒ पूर्व॒ ऋष॑यो॒ ये च॒ नूत्ना॒ इन्द्र॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि ज॒नय॑न्त॒ विप्राः॑ अ॒स्मे ते॑ सन्तु स॒ख्या शि॒वानि॑ यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: yé ca pū́rva ŕ̥ṣayo yé ca nū́tnāḥ-  índra bráhmāṇi janáyanta víprāḥ  asmé te santu sakhyā́ śivā́ni  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Among all R̥ishis, Indra, old and recent, who have engendered hymns as sacred singers, Even with us be thine auspicious friendships. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒ ब्रह्मा॑ण्यैरत श्रव॒स्येन्द्रं॑ सम॒र्ये म॑हया वसिष्ठ आ यो विश्वा॑नि॒ शव॑सा त॒तानो॑पश्रो॒ता म॒ ईव॑तो॒ वचां॑सि
verses.transliteration: úd u bráhmāṇy airata śravasyā́-  -índraṃ samaryé mahayā vasiṣṭha  ā́ yó víśvāni śávasā tatā́na-  -upaśrotā́ ma ī́vato vácāṃsi

translation.text: PRAYERS have been offered up through love of glory: Vasishṭha, honour Indra in the battle. He who with might extends through all existence hears words which I, his faithful servant, utter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अया॑मि॒ घोष॑ इन्द्र दे॒वजा॑मिरिर॒ज्यन्त॒ यच्छु॒रुधो॒ विवा॑चि न॒हि स्वमायु॑श्चिकि॒ते जने॑षु॒ तानीदंहां॒स्यति॑ पर्ष्य॒स्मान्
verses.transliteration: áyāmi ghóṣa indra devájāmir  irajyánta yác churúdho vívāci  nahí svám ā́yuś cikité jáneṣu  tā́nī́d áṃhāṃsy áti parṣy asmā́n

translation.text: A cry was raised which reached the Gods, O Indra, a cry to them to send us strength in combat. None among men knows his own life's duration: bear us in safety over these our troubles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒जे रथं॑ ग॒वेष॑णं॒ हरि॑भ्या॒मुप॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि जुजुषा॒णम॑स्थुः वि बा॑धिष्ट॒ स्य रोद॑सी महि॒त्वेन्द्रो॑ वृ॒त्राण्य॑प्र॒ती ज॑घ॒न्वान्
verses.transliteration: yujé ráthaṃ gavéṣaṇaṃ háribhyām  úpa bráhmāṇi jujuṣāṇám asthuḥ  ví bādhiṣṭa syá ródasī mahitvā́-  -índro vr̥trā́ṇy apratī́ jaghanvā́n

translation.text: The Bays, the booty-seeking car I harness: my prayers have reached him who accepts them gladly. Indra, when he had slain resistless foemen, forced with his might the two world-halves asunder.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आप॑श्चित्पिप्युः स्त॒र्यो॒३॒॑ न गावो॒ नक्ष॑न्नृ॒तं ज॑रि॒तार॑स्त इन्द्र या॒हि वा॒युर्न नि॒युतो॑ नो॒ अच्छा॒ त्वं हि धी॒भिर्दय॑से॒ वि वाजा॑न्
verses.transliteration: ā́paś cit pipyu staryò ná gā́vo  nákṣann r̥táṃ jaritā́ras ta indra  yāhí vāyúr ná niyúto no áchā  tváṃ hí dhībhír dáyase ví vā́jān

translation.text: Like barren cows, moreover, swelled the waters: the singen sought thy holy rite, O Indra. Come unto us as with his team comes Vâyu: thou, through our solemn hymns bestowest booty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते त्वा॒ मदा॑ इन्द्र मादयन्तु शु॒ष्मिणं॑ तुवि॒राध॑सं जरि॒त्रे एको॑ देव॒त्रा दय॑से॒ हि मर्ता॑न॒स्मिञ्छू॑र॒ सव॑ने मादयस्व
verses.transliteration: té tvā mádā indra mādayantu  śuṣmíṇaṃ tuvirā́dhasaṃ jaritré  éko devatrā́ dáyase hí mártān  -asmíñ chūra sávane mādayasva

translation.text: So may these gladdening draughts rejoice thee, Indra, the Mighty, very bounteous to the singer. Alone among the Gods thou pitiest mortals: O Hero, make thee glad at this libation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वेदिन्द्रं॒ वृष॑णं॒ वज्र॑बाहुं॒ वसि॑ष्ठासो अ॒भ्य॑र्चन्त्य॒र्कैः स नः॑ स्तु॒तो वी॒रव॑द्धातु॒ गोम॑द्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: evéd índraṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ vájrabāhuṃ  vásiṣṭhāso abhy àrcanty arkaíḥ  sá na stutó vīrávad dhātu gómad  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Thus the Vasishṭhas glorify with praises Indra, the Powerful whose arm wields thunder. Praised, may he guard our wealth in kine and heroes. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: योनि॑ष्ट इन्द्र॒ सद॑ने अकारि॒ तमा नृभिः॑ पुरुहूत॒ प्र या॑हि असो॒ यथा॑ नोऽवि॒ता वृ॒धे च॒ ददो॒ वसू॑नि म॒मद॑श्च॒ सोमैः॑
verses.transliteration: yóniṣ ṭa indra sádane akāri  tám ā́ nŕ̥bhiḥ puruhūta prá yāhi  áso yáthā no 'vitā́ vr̥dhé ca  dádo vásūni mamádaś ca sómaiḥ

translation.text: A HOME is made for thee to dwell in, Indra: O Much-invoked, go thitherwith the heroes. That thou, to prosper us, mayst be our Helper, vouchsafe us wealth, rejoice with draughts of Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गृ॒भी॒तं ते॒ मन॑ इन्द्र द्वि॒बर्हाः॑ सु॒तः सोमः॒ परि॑षिक्ता॒ मधू॑नि विसृ॑ष्टधेना भरते सुवृ॒क्तिरि॒यमिन्द्रं॒ जोहु॑वती मनी॒षा
verses.transliteration: gr̥bhītáṃ te mána indra dvibárhāḥ  sutáḥ sómaḥ páriṣiktā mádhūni  vísr̥ṣṭadhenā bharate suvr̥ktír  iyám índraṃ jóhuvatī manīṣā́

translation.text: Indra, thy wish, twice-strong, is comprehended: pressed is the Soma, poured are pleasant juices. This hymn of praise, from loosened tongue, made perfect, draws Indra to itself with loud invoking.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ दि॒व आ पृ॑थि॒व्या ऋ॑जीषिन्नि॒दं ब॒र्हिः सो॑म॒पेया॑य याहि वह॑न्तु त्वा॒ हर॑यो म॒द्र्य॑ञ्चमाङ्गू॒षमच्छा॑ त॒वसं॒ मदा॑य
verses.transliteration: ā́ no divá ā́ pr̥thivyā́ r̥jīṣinn  idám barhíḥ somapéyāya yāhi  váhantu tvā hárayo madryàñcam  āṅgūṣám áchā tavásam mádāya

translation.text: Come, thou Impetuous; God, from earth or heaven; come to our holy grass to drink the Soma. Hither to me let thy Bay Horses bring thee to listen to our hymns and make thee joyful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॒ विश्वा॑भिरू॒तिभिः॑ स॒जोषा॒ ब्रह्म॑ जुषा॒णो ह॑र्यश्व याहि वरी॑वृज॒त्स्थवि॑रेभिः सुशिप्रा॒स्मे दध॒द्वृष॑णं॒ शुष्म॑मिन्द्र
verses.transliteration: ā́ no víśvābhir ūtíbhiḥ sajóṣāḥ-  bráhma juṣāṇó haryaśva yāhi  várīvr̥jat sthávirebhiḥ suśipra-  -asmé dádhad vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ śúṣmam indra

translation.text: Come unto us with all thine aids, accordant, Lord of Bay Steeds, accepting our devotions, Fair-helmeted, o'ercoming with the mighty, and lending us the strength of bulls, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष स्तोमो॑ म॒ह उ॒ग्राय॒ वाहे॑ धु॒री॒३॒॑वात्यो॒ न वा॒जय॑न्नधायि इन्द्र॑ त्वा॒यम॒र्क ई॑ट्टे॒ वसू॑नां दि॒वी॑व॒ द्यामधि॑ नः॒ श्रोम॑तं धाः
verses.transliteration: eṣá stómo mahá ugrā́ya vā́he  dhurī̀vā́tyo ná vājáyann adhāyi  índra tvāyám arká īṭṭe vásūnāṃ  divī̀va dyā́m ádhi naḥ śrómataṃ dhāḥ

translation.text: As to the chariot pole a vigorous courser, this laud is brought to the great strong Upholder. This hymn solicits wealth of thee: in heaven, as 'twere above the sky, set thou our glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा न॑ इन्द्र॒ वार्य॑स्य पूर्धि॒ प्र ते॑ म॒हीं सु॑म॒तिं वे॑विदाम इषं॑ पिन्व म॒घव॑द्भ्यः सु॒वीरां॑ यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: evā́ na indra vā́ryasya pūrdhi  prá te mahī́ṃ sumatíṃ vevidāma  íṣam pinva maghávadbhyaḥ suvī́rāṃ  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: With precious things. O Indra, thus content us: may we attain to thine exalted favour. Send our chiefs plenteous food with hero children. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ते॑ म॒ह इ॑न्द्रो॒त्यु॑ग्र॒ सम॑न्यवो॒ यत्स॒मर॑न्त॒ सेनाः॑ पता॑ति दि॒द्युन्नर्य॑स्य बा॒ह्वोर्मा ते॒ मनो॑ विष्व॒द्र्य१॒॑ग्वि चा॑रीत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ te mahá indroty ùgra  sámanyavo yát samáranta sénāḥ  pátāti didyún náryasya bāhvór  mā́ te máno viṣvadryàg ví cārīt

translation.text: WHEN with thy mighty help, O potent Indra, the armies rush together in their fury. When from the strong man's arm the lightning flieth, let not the mind go forth to side with others.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि दु॒र्ग इ॑न्द्र श्नथिह्य॒मित्राँ॑ अ॒भि ये नो॒ मर्ता॑सो अ॒मन्ति॑ आ॒रे तं शंसं॑ कृणुहि निनि॒त्सोरा नो॑ भर स॒म्भर॑णं॒ वसू॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: ní durgá indra śnathihy amítrām̐  abhí yé no mártāso amánti  āré táṃ śáṃsaṃ kr̥ṇuhi ninitsór  ā́ no bhara sambháraṇaṃ vásūnām

translation.text: O Indra, where the ground is hard to traverse, smite down our foes, the mortals who assail us, Keep far from us the curse of the reviler: bring us accumulated store of treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तं ते॑ शिप्रिन्नू॒तयः॑ सु॒दासे॑ स॒हस्रं॒ शंसा॑ उ॒त रा॒तिर॑स्तु ज॒हि वध॑र्व॒नुषो॒ मर्त्य॑स्या॒स्मे द्यु॒म्नमधि॒ रत्नं॑ च धेहि
verses.transliteration: śatáṃ te śiprinn ūtáyaḥ sudā́se  sahásraṃ śáṃsā utá rātír astu  jahí vádhar vanúṣo mártyasya  -asmé dyumnám ádhi rátnaṃ ca dhehi

translation.text: God of the fair helm, give Sudâs a hundred succours, a thousand blessings, and thy bounty. Strike down the weapon of our mortal foeman: bestow upon us splendid fame and riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वाव॑तो॒ ही॑न्द्र॒ क्रत्वे॒ अस्मि॒ त्वाव॑तोऽवि॒तुः शू॑र रा॒तौ विश्वेदहा॑नि तविषीव उग्रँ॒ ओकः॑ कृणुष्व हरिवो॒ न म॑र्धीः
verses.transliteration: tvā́vato hī̀ndra krátve ásmi  tvā́vato 'vitúḥ śūra rātaú  víśvéd áhāni taviṣīva ugram̐  ókaḥ kr̥ṇuṣva harivo ná mardhīḥ

translation.text: I wait the power of one like thee, O Indra, gifts of a Helper such as thou art, Hero. Strong, Mighty God, dwell with me now and ever: Lord of Bay Horses, do not thou desert us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कुत्सा॑ ए॒ते हर्य॑श्वाय शू॒षमिन्द्रे॒ सहो॑ दे॒वजू॑तमिया॒नाः स॒त्रा कृ॑धि सु॒हना॑ शूर वृ॒त्रा व॒यं तरु॑त्राः सनुयाम॒ वाज॑म्
verses.transliteration: kútsā eté háryaśvāya śūṣám  índre sáho devájūtam iyānā́ḥ  satrā́ kr̥dhi suhánā śūra vr̥trā́  vayáṃ tárutrāḥ sanuyāma vā́jam

translation.text: Here are the Kutsas supplicating Indra for might, the Lord of Bays for God-sent conquest. Make our foes ever easy to be vanquished: may we, victorious, win the spoil, O Hero.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा न॑ इन्द्र॒ वार्य॑स्य पूर्धि॒ प्र ते॑ म॒हीं सु॑म॒तिं वे॑विदाम इषं॑ पिन्व म॒घव॑द्भ्यः सु॒वीरां॑ यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: evā́ na indra vā́ryasya pūrdhi  prá te mahī́ṃ sumatíṃ vevidāma  íṣam pinva maghávadbhyaḥ suvī́rāṃ  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: With precious things, O Indra, thus content us: may we attain to thine exalted favour. Send our chiefs plenteous food with hero children. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न सोम॒ इन्द्र॒मसु॑तो ममाद॒ नाब्र॑ह्माणो म॒घवा॑नं सु॒तासः॑ तस्मा॑ उ॒क्थं ज॑नये॒ यज्जुजो॑षन्नृ॒वन्नवी॑यः शृ॒णव॒द्यथा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: ná sóma índram ásuto mamāda  nā́brahmāṇo maghávānaṃ sutā́saḥ  tásmā uktháṃ janaye yáj jújoṣan  nr̥ván návīyaḥ śr̥ṇávad yáthā naḥ

translation.text: SOMA unpressed ne'er gladdened liberal Indra, no juices pressed without a prayer have pleased him. I generate a laud that shall delight him, new and heroic, so that he may hear us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒क्थउ॑क्थे॒ सोम॒ इन्द्रं॑ ममाद नी॒थेनी॑थे म॒घवा॑नं सु॒तासः॑ यदीं॑ स॒बाधः॑ पि॒तरं॒ न पु॒त्राः स॑मा॒नद॑क्षा॒ अव॑से॒ हव॑न्ते
verses.transliteration: ukthá-ukthe sóma índram mamāda  nīthé-nīthe maghávānaṃ sutā́saḥ  yád īṃ sabā́dhaḥ pitáraṃ ná putrā́ḥ  samānádakṣā ávase hávante

translation.text: At every laud the Soma gladdens Indra: pressed juices please him as each psalm is chanted, What time the priests with one united effort call him to aid, as sons invoke their father.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒कार॒ ता कृ॒णव॑न्नू॒नम॒न्या यानि॑ ब्रु॒वन्ति॑ वे॒धसः॑ सु॒तेषु॑ जनी॑रिव॒ पति॒रेकः॑ समा॒नो नि मा॑मृजे॒ पुर॒ इन्द्रः॒ सु सर्वाः॑
verses.transliteration: cakā́ra tā́ kr̥ṇávan nūnám anyā́  yā́ni bruvánti vedhásaḥ sutéṣu  jánīr iva pátir ékaḥ samānó  ní māmr̥je púra índraḥ sú sárvāḥ

translation.text: These deeds he did; let him achieve new exploits, such as the priests declare at their libations. Indra hath taken and possessed all castles, like as one common husband doth his spouses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा तमा॑हुरु॒त शृ॑ण्व॒ इन्द्र॒ एको॑ विभ॒क्ता त॒रणि॑र्म॒घाना॑म् मि॒थ॒स्तुर॑ ऊ॒तयो॒ यस्य॑ पू॒र्वीर॒स्मे भ॒द्राणि॑ सश्चत प्रि॒याणि॑
verses.transliteration: evā́ tám āhur utá śr̥ṇva índraḥ-  éko vibhaktā́ taráṇir maghā́nām  mithastúra ūtáyo yásya pūrvī́r  asmé bhadrā́ṇi saścata priyā́ṇi

translation.text: Even thus have they declared him. Famed is Indra as Conqueror, sole distributer of treasures; Whose many succours come in close succession. May dear delightful benefits attend us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा वसि॑ष्ठ॒ इन्द्र॑मू॒तये॒ नॄन्कृ॑ष्टी॒नां वृ॑ष॒भं सु॒ते गृ॑णाति स॒ह॒स्रिण॒ उप॑ नो माहि॒ वाजा॑न्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: evā́ vásiṣṭha índram ūtáye nr̥̄́n  kr̥ṣṭīnā́ṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ suté gr̥ṇāti  sahasríṇa úpa no māhi vā́jān  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Thus, to bring help to men, Vasishṭha laudeth Indra, the peoples' Hero, at libation. Bestow upon us strength and wealth in thousands. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रं॒ नरो॑ ने॒मधि॑ता हवन्ते॒ यत्पार्या॑ यु॒नज॑ते॒ धिय॒स्ताः शूरो॒ नृषा॑ता॒ शव॑सश्चका॒न आ गोम॑ति व्र॒जे भ॑जा॒ त्वं नः॑
verses.transliteration: índraṃ náro nemádhitā havante  yát pā́ryā yunájate dhíyas tā́ḥ  śū́ro nŕ̥ṣātā śávasaś cakānáḥ-  ā́ gómati vrajé bhajā tváṃ naḥ

translation.text: MEN call on Indra in the armed encounter that he may make the hymns they sing decisive. Hero, rejoicing in thy might, in combat give us a portion of the stall of cattle,

verses.sanskrit_deva: य इ॑न्द्र॒ शुष्मो॑ मघवन्ते॒ अस्ति॒ शिक्षा॒ सखि॑भ्यः पुरुहूत॒ नृभ्यः॑ त्वं हि दृ॒ळ्हा म॑घव॒न्विचे॑ता॒ अपा॑ वृधि॒ परि॑वृतं॒ न राधः॑
verses.transliteration: yá indra śúṣmo maghavan te ásti  śíkṣā sákhibhyaḥ puruhūta nŕ̥bhyaḥ  tváṃ hí dr̥ḷhā́ maghavan vícetāḥ-  ápā vr̥dhi párivr̥taṃ ná rā́dhaḥ

translation.text: Grant, Indra Maghavan, invoked of many, to these my friends the strength which thou possessest. Thou, Maghavan, hast rent strong places open: unclose for us, Wise God, thy hidden bounty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॒ राजा॒ जग॑तश्चर्षणी॒नामधि॒ क्षमि॒ विषु॑रूपं॒ यदस्ति॑ ततो॑ ददाति दा॒शुषे॒ वसू॑नि॒ चोद॒द्राध॒ उप॑स्तुतश्चिद॒र्वाक्
verses.transliteration: índro rā́jā jágataś carṣaṇīnā́m  ádhi kṣámi víṣurūpaṃ yád ásti  táto dadāti dāśúṣe vásūni  códad rā́dha úpastutaś cid arvā́k

translation.text: King of the living world, of men, is Indra, of all in varied form that earth containeth. Thence to the worshipper he giveth riches: may he enrich us also when we laud him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू चि॑न्न॒ इन्द्रो॑ म॒घवा॒ सहू॑ती दा॒नो वाजं॒ नि य॑मते न ऊ॒ती अनू॑ना॒ यस्य॒ दक्षि॑णा पी॒पाय॑ वा॒मं नृभ्यो॑ अ॒भिवी॑ता॒ सखि॑भ्यः
verses.transliteration: nū́ cin na índro maghávā sáhūtī  dānó vā́jaṃ ní yamate na ūtī́  ánūnā yásya dákṣiṇā pīpā́ya  vāmáṃ nŕ̥bhyo abhívītā sákhibhyaḥ

translation.text: Maghavan Indra, when we all invoke him, bountiful ever sendeth strength to aid us: Whose perfect guerdon, never failing, bringeth wealth to the men, to friends the thing they covet.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू इ॑न्द्र रा॒ये वरि॑वस्कृधी न॒ आ ते॒ मनो॑ ववृत्याम म॒घाय॑ गोम॒दश्वा॑व॒द्रथ॑व॒द्व्यन्तो॑ यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: nū́ indra rāyé várivas kr̥dhī naḥ-  ā́ te máno vavr̥tyāma maghā́ya  gómad áśvāvad ráthavad vyánto  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Quick, Indra, give us room and way to riches, and let us bring thy mind to grant us treasures, That we may win us cars and Steeds and cattle. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्रह्मा॑ ण इ॒न्द्रोप॑ याहि वि॒द्वान॒र्वाञ्च॑स्ते॒ हर॑यः सन्तु यु॒क्ताः विश्वे॑ चि॒द्धि त्वा॑ वि॒हव॑न्त॒ मर्ता॑ अ॒स्माक॒मिच्छृ॑णुहि विश्वमिन्व
verses.transliteration: bráhmā ṇa indrópa yāhi vidvā́n  arvā́ñcas te hárayaḥ santu yuktā́ḥ  víśve cid dhí tvā vihávanta mártāḥ-  asmā́kam íc chr̥ṇuhi viśvaminva

translation.text: COME to our prayers, O Indra, thou who knowest: let thy Bay Steeds be yoked and guided hither. Though mortal men on every side invoke thee, still give thine ear to us, O All-impeller.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हवं॑ त इन्द्र महि॒मा व्या॑न॒ड्ब्रह्म॒ यत्पासि॑ शवसि॒न्नृषी॑णाम् आ यद्वज्रं॑ दधि॒षे हस्त॑ उग्र घो॒रः सन्क्रत्वा॑ जनिष्ठा॒ अषा॑ळ्हः
verses.transliteration: hávaṃ ta indra mahimā́ vy ā̀naḍ  bráhma yát pā́si śavasinn ŕ̥ṣīṇām  ā́ yád vájraṃ dadhiṣé hásta ugra  ghoráḥ sán krátvā janiṣṭhā áṣāḷhaḥ

translation.text: Thy greatness reacheth to our invocation, the sages' prayer which, Potent God, thou guardest. What time thy hand, O Mighty, holds the thunder, awful in strength thou hast become resistless.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॒ प्रणी॑तीन्द्र॒ जोहु॑वाना॒न्त्सं यन्नॄन्न रोद॑सी नि॒नेथ॑ म॒हे क्ष॒त्राय॒ शव॑से॒ हि ज॒ज्ञेऽतू॑तुजिं चि॒त्तूतु॑जिरशिश्नत्
verses.transliteration: táva práṇītīndra jóhuvānān  sáṃ yán nr̥̄́n ná ródasī ninétha  mahé kṣatrā́ya śávase hí jajñé  -átūtujiṃ cit tū́tujir aśiśnat

translation.text: What time thou drewest both world-halves together, like heroes led by thee who call each other- For thou wast born for strength and high dominion-then e'en the active overthrew the sluggish.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒भिर्न॑ इ॒न्द्राह॑भिर्दशस्य दुर्मि॒त्रासो॒ हि क्षि॒तयः॒ पव॑न्ते प्रति॒ यच्चष्टे॒ अनृ॑तमने॒ना अव॑ द्वि॒ता वरु॑णो मा॒यी नः॑ सात्
verses.transliteration: ebhír na indrā́habhir daśasya  durmitrā́so hí kṣitáyaḥ pávante  práti yác cáṣṭe ánr̥tam anenā́ḥ-  áva dvitā́ váruṇo māyī́ naḥ sāt

translation.text: Honour us in these present days, O Indra, for hostile men are making expiation. Our sin that sinless Varuṇa discovered, the Wondrous-Wise hath long ago forgiven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वो॒चेमेदिन्द्रं॑ म॒घवा॑नमेनं म॒हो रा॒यो राध॑सो॒ यद्दद॑न्नः यो अर्च॑तो॒ ब्रह्म॑कृति॒मवि॑ष्ठो यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: vocéméd índram maghávānam enam  mahó rāyó rā́dhaso yád dádan naḥ  yó árcato bráhmakr̥tim áviṣṭho  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: We will address this liberal Lord, this Indra, that he may grant us gifts of ample riches, Best favourer of the singer's prayer and praises. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं सोम॑ इन्द्र॒ तुभ्यं॑ सुन्व॒ आ तु प्र या॑हि हरिव॒स्तदो॑काः पिबा॒ त्व१॒॑स्य सुषु॑तस्य॒ चारो॒र्ददो॑ म॒घानि॑ मघवन्निया॒नः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ sóma indra túbhyaṃ sunve-  ā́ tú prá yāhi harivas tádokāḥ  píbā tv àsyá súṣutasya cā́roḥ  dádo maghā́ni maghavann iyānáḥ

translation.text: THIS Soma hath been pressed for thee, O Indra: come hither, Lord of Bays, for this thou lovest. Drink of this fair, this well-effused libation: Maghavan, give us wealth when we implore thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्रह्म॑न्वीर॒ ब्रह्म॑कृतिं जुषा॒णो॑ऽर्वाची॒नो हरि॑भिर्याहि॒ तूय॑म् अ॒स्मिन्नू॒ षु सव॑ने मादय॒स्वोप॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि शृणव इ॒मा नः॑
verses.transliteration: bráhman vīra bráhmakr̥tiṃ juṣāṇáḥ-  -arvācīnó háribhir yāhi tū́yam  asmínn ū ṣú sávane mādayasva-  úpa bráhmāṇi śr̥ṇava imā́ naḥ-

translation.text: Come to us quickly with thy Bay Steeds, Hero, come to our prayer, accepting our devotion. Enjoy thyself aright at this libation, and listen thou unto the prayers we offer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: का ते॑ अ॒स्त्यरं॑कृतिः सू॒क्तैः क॒दा नू॒नं ते॑ मघवन्दाशेम विश्वा॑ म॒तीरा त॑तने त्वा॒याधा॑ म इन्द्र शृणवो॒ हवे॒मा
verses.transliteration: kā́ te asty áraṃkr̥tiḥ sūktaíḥ  kadā́ nūnáṃ te maghavan dāśema  víśvā matī́r ā́ tatane tvāyā́-  -ádhā ma indra śr̥ṇavo hávemā́

translation.text: What satisfaction do our hymns afford thee? When, Maghavan? Now let us do thee service. Hymns, only hymns, with love for thee, I weave thee: then hear, O Indra, these mine invocations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒तो घा॒ ते पु॑रु॒ष्या॒३॒॑ इदा॑स॒न्येषां॒ पूर्वे॑षा॒मशृ॑णो॒र्ऋषी॑णाम् अधा॒हं त्वा॑ मघवञ्जोहवीमि॒ त्वं न॑ इन्द्रासि॒ प्रम॑तिः पि॒तेव॑
verses.transliteration: utó ghā té puruṣyā̀ íd āsan  yéṣām pū́rveṣām áśr̥ṇor ŕ̥ṣīṇām  ádhāháṃ tvā maghavañ johavīmi  tváṃ na indrāsi prámatiḥ pitéva

translation.text: They, verily, were also human beings whom thou wast wont to hear, those earlier sages. Hence I, O Indra Maghavan, invoke thee: thou art our Providence, even as a Father.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वो॒चेमेदिन्द्रं॑ म॒घवा॑नमेनं म॒हो रा॒यो राध॑सो॒ यद्दद॑न्नः यो अर्च॑तो॒ ब्रह्म॑कृति॒मवि॑ष्ठो यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: vocéméd índram maghávānam enam  mahó rāyó rā́dhaso yád dádan naḥ  yó árcato bráhmakr̥tim áviṣṭho  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: We will address this liberal Lord, this Indra, that he may grant us gifts of ample riches, Best favourer of the singer's prayer and praises. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ देव॒ शव॑सा याहि शुष्मि॒न्भवा॑ वृ॒ध इ॑न्द्र रा॒यो अ॒स्य म॒हे नृ॒म्णाय॑ नृपते सुवज्र॒ महि॑ क्ष॒त्राय॒ पौंस्या॑य शूर
verses.transliteration: ā́ no deva śávasā yāhi śuṣmin  bhávā vr̥dhá indra rāyó asyá  mahé nr̥mṇā́ya nr̥pate suvajra  máhi kṣatrā́ya paúṃsyāya śūra

translation.text: WITH power and strength, O Mighty God, approach us: be the augmenter, Indra, of these riches; Strong Thunderer, Lord of men, for potent valour, for manly exploit and for high dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हव॑न्त उ त्वा॒ हव्यं॒ विवा॑चि त॒नूषु॒ शूराः॒ सूर्य॑स्य सा॒तौ त्वं विश्वे॑षु॒ सेन्यो॒ जने॑षु॒ त्वं वृ॒त्राणि॑ रन्धया सु॒हन्तु॑
verses.transliteration: hávanta u tvā hávyaṃ vívāci  tanū́ṣu śū́rāḥ sū́ryasya sātaú  tváṃ víśveṣu sényo jáneṣu  tváṃ vr̥trā́ṇi randhayā suhántu

translation.text: Thee, worth invoking, in the din of battle, heroes invoke in fray for life and sunlight. Among all people thou art foremost fighter: give up our enemies to easy slaughter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अहा॒ यदि॑न्द्र सु॒दिना॑ व्यु॒च्छान्दधो॒ यत्के॒तुमु॑प॒मं स॒मत्सु॑ न्य१॒॑ग्निः सी॑द॒दसु॑रो॒ न होता॑ हुवा॒नो अत्र॑ सु॒भगा॑य दे॒वान्
verses.transliteration: áhā yád indra sudínā vyuchā́n  dádho yát ketúm upamáṃ samátsu  ny àgníḥ sīdad ásuro ná hótā  huvānó átra subhágāya devā́n

translation.text: When fair bright days shall dawn on us, O Indra, and thou shalt bring thy banner near in battle, Agni the Asura shall sit as Herald, calling Gods hither for our great good fortune.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं ते त॑ इन्द्र॒ ये च॑ देव॒ स्तव॑न्त शूर॒ दद॑तो म॒घानि॑ यच्छा॑ सू॒रिभ्य॑ उप॒मं वरू॑थं स्वा॒भुवो॑ जर॒णाम॑श्नवन्त
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ té ta indra yé ca deva  stávanta śūra dádato maghā́ni  yáchā sūríbhya upamáṃ várūthaṃ  svābhúvo jaraṇā́m aśnavanta

translation.text: Thine are we, Indra, thine, both these who praise thee, and those who give rich gifts, O God and Hero. Grant to our princes excellent protection, may they wax old and still be strong and happy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वो॒चेमेदिन्द्रं॑ म॒घवा॑नमेनं म॒हो रा॒यो राध॑सो॒ यद्दद॑न्नः यो अर्च॑तो॒ ब्रह्म॑कृति॒मवि॑ष्ठो यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: vocéméd índram maghávānam enam  mahó rāyó rā́dhaso yád dádan naḥ  yó árcato bráhmakr̥tim áviṣṭho  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: We will address this liberal Lord, this Indra that he may grant us gifts of ample riches: Best favourer of the singer's prayer and praises. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र व॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ माद॑नं॒ हर्य॑श्वाय गायत सखा॑यः सोम॒पाव्ने॑
verses.transliteration: prá va índrāya mā́danaṃ  háryaśvāya gāyata  sákhāyaḥ somapā́vne

translation.text: SING ye a song, to make him glad, to Indra, Lord of Tawny Steeds, The Soma-drinker, O my friends.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शंसेदु॒क्थं सु॒दान॑व उ॒त द्यु॒क्षं यथा॒ नरः॑ च॒कृ॒मा स॒त्यरा॑धसे
verses.transliteration: śáṃséd uktháṃ sudā́nave-  utá dyukṣáṃ yáthā náraḥ  cakr̥mā́ satyárādhase

translation.text: To him the Bounteous say the laud, and let us glorify, as men May do, the Giver of true gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं न॑ इन्द्र वाज॒युस्त्वं ग॒व्युः श॑तक्रतो त्वं हि॑रण्य॒युर्व॑सो
verses.transliteration: tváṃ na indra vājayús  tváṃ gavyúḥ śatakrato  tváṃ hiraṇyayúr vaso

translation.text: O Indra, Lord of boundless might, for us thou winnest strength and kine, Thou winnest gold for us, Good Lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यमि॑न्द्र त्वा॒यवो॒ऽभि प्र णो॑नुमो वृषन् वि॒द्धी त्व१॒॑स्य नो॑ वसो
verses.transliteration: vayám indra tvāyávo  -abhí prá ṇonumo vr̥ṣan  viddhī́ tv àsyá no vaso

translation.text: Faithful to thee we loudly sing, heroic Indra, songs to thee: Mark, O Good Lord, this act of ours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॑ नि॒दे च॒ वक्त॑वे॒ऽर्यो र॑न्धी॒ररा॑व्णे त्वे अपि॒ क्रतु॒र्मम॑
verses.transliteration: mā́ no nidé ca váktave  -aryó randhīr árāvṇe  tvé ápi krátur máma

translation.text: Give us not up to man's reproach, to foeman's hateful calumny: In thee alone is all my strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं वर्मा॑सि स॒प्रथः॑ पुरोयो॒धश्च॑ वृत्रहन् त्वया॒ प्रति॑ ब्रुवे यु॒जा
verses.transliteration: tváṃ vármāsi sapráthaḥ  puroyodháś ca vr̥trahan  tváyā práti bruve yujā́

translation.text: Thou art mine ample coat of mail, my Champion, Vr̥itra-Slayer, thou: With thee for Friend I brave the foe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हाँ उ॒तासि॒ यस्य॒ तेऽनु॑ स्व॒धाव॑री॒ सहः॑ म॒म्नाते॑ इन्द्र॒ रोद॑सी
verses.transliteration: mahā́m̐ utā́si yásya te-  -ánu svadhā́varī sáhaḥ  mamnā́te indra ródasī

translation.text: Yea, great art thou whose conquering might two independent Powers confess. The Heaven, O India, and the Earth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॑ म॒रुत्व॑ती॒ परि॒ भुव॒द्वाणी॑ स॒याव॑री नक्ष॑माणा स॒ह द्युभिः॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā marútvatī pári  bhúvad vā́ṇī sayā́varī  nákṣamāṇā sahá dyúbhiḥ

translation.text: So let the voice surround thee, which attends the Maruts on their way, Reaching thee with the rays of light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वास॒स्त्वान्विन्द॑वो॒ भुव॑न्द॒स्ममुप॒ द्यवि॑ सं ते॑ नमन्त कृ॒ष्टयः॑
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvā́sas tvā́nv índavo  bhúvan dasmám úpa dyávi  sáṃ te namanta kr̥ṣṭáyaḥ

translation.text: Let the ascending drops attain to thee, the Wondrous God, in heaven: Let all the folk bow down to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॑ म॒हे म॑हि॒वृधे॑ भरध्वं॒ प्रचे॑तसे॒ प्र सु॑म॒तिं कृ॑णुध्वम् विशः॑ पू॒र्वीः प्र च॑रा चर्षणि॒प्राः
verses.transliteration: prá vo mahé mahivŕ̥dhe bharadhvam  prácetase prá sumatíṃ kr̥ṇudhvam  víśaḥ pūrvī́ḥ prá carā carṣaṇiprā́ḥ

translation.text: Bring to the Wise, the Great, who waxeth mighty, your offerings, and make ready your devotion; To many clans he goeth, man's controller.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रु॒व्यच॑से म॒हिने॑ सुवृ॒क्तिमिन्द्रा॑य॒ ब्रह्म॑ जनयन्त॒ विप्राः॑ तस्य॑ व्र॒तानि॒ न मि॑नन्ति॒ धीराः॑
verses.transliteration: uruvyácase mahíne suvr̥ktím  índrāya bráhma janayanta víprāḥ  tásya vratā́ni ná minanti dhī́rāḥ

translation.text: For Indra, the sublime, the far-pervading, have singers generated prayer and praises: The sages never violate his statutes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रं॒ वाणी॒रनु॑त्तमन्युमे॒व स॒त्रा राजा॑नं दधिरे॒ सह॑ध्यै हर्य॑श्वाय बर्हया॒ समा॒पीन्
verses.transliteration: índraṃ vā́ṇīr ánuttamanyum evá  satrā́ rā́jānaṃ dadhire sáhadhyai  háryaśvāya barhayā sám āpī́n

translation.text: The choirs have stablished Indra King for ever, for victory, him whose anger is resistless: And, for the Bays' Lord, strengthened those he loveth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मो षु त्वा॑ वा॒घत॑श्च॒नारे अ॒स्मन्नि री॑रमन् आ॒रात्ता॑च्चित्सध॒मादं॑ न॒ आ ग॑ही॒ह वा॒ सन्नुप॑ श्रुधि
verses.transliteration: mó ṣú tvā vāghátaś caná-  -āré asmán ní rīraman  ārā́ttāc cit sadhamā́daṃ na ā́ gahi-  -ihá vā sánn úpa śrudhi

translation.text: LET none, no, not thy worshippers, delay thee far away from us. Even from far away come thou unto our feast, or listen if already here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे हि ते॑ ब्रह्म॒कृतः॑ सु॒ते सचा॒ मधौ॒ न मक्ष॒ आस॑ते इन्द्रे॒ कामं॑ जरि॒तारो॑ वसू॒यवो॒ रथे॒ न पाद॒मा द॑धुः
verses.transliteration: imé hí te brahmakŕ̥taḥ suté  sácā mádhau ná mákṣa ā́sate  índre kā́maṃ jaritā́ro vasūyávo  ráthe ná pā́dam ā́ dadhuḥ

translation.text: For here, like flies on honey, these who pray to thee sit by the juice that they have poured. Wealth-craving singers have on Indra set their hope, as men set foot upon a car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रा॒यस्का॑मो॒ वज्र॑हस्तं सु॒दक्षि॑णं पु॒त्रो न पि॒तरं॑ हुवे
verses.transliteration: rāyáskāmo vájrahastaṃ sudákṣiṇam  putró ná pitáraṃ huve

translation.text: Longing for wealth I call on him, the Thunderer with the strong right hand, As a son calleth on his sire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒म इन्द्रा॑य सुन्विरे॒ सोमा॑सो॒ दध्या॑शिरः ताँ आ मदा॑य वज्रहस्त पी॒तये॒ हरि॑भ्यां या॒ह्योक॒ आ
verses.transliteration: imá índrāya sunvire  sómāso dádhyāśiraḥ  tā́m̐ ā́ mádāya vajrahasta pītáye  háribhyāṃ yāhy óka ā́

translation.text: These Soma juices, mixed with curd, have been expressed for Indra here. Come with thy Bay Steeds, Thunder-wielder, to our home, to drink them till they make thee glad.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रव॒च्छ्रुत्क॑र्ण ईयते॒ वसू॑नां॒ नू चि॑न्नो मर्धिष॒द्गिरः॑ स॒द्यश्चि॒द्यः स॒हस्रा॑णि श॒ता दद॒न्नकि॒र्दित्स॑न्त॒मा मि॑नत्
verses.transliteration: śrávac chrútkarṇa īyate vásūnāṃ  nū́ cin no mardhiṣad gíraḥ  sadyáś cid yáḥ sahásrāṇi śatā́ dádat-  nákir dítsantam ā́ minat

translation.text: May he whose ear is open hear us. He is asked for wealth: will he despise our prayer? Him who bestows at once a hundred thousand gifts none shall restrain when he would give.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वी॒रो अप्र॑तिष्कुत॒ इन्द्रे॑ण शूशुवे॒ नृभिः॑ यस्ते॑ गभी॒रा सव॑नानि वृत्रहन्त्सु॒नोत्या च॒ धाव॑ति
verses.transliteration: sá vīró ápratiṣkutaḥ-  índreṇa śūśuve nŕ̥bhiḥ  yás te gabhīrā́ sávanāni vr̥trahan  sunóty ā́ ca dhā́vati

translation.text: The hero never checked by men hath gained his strength through Indra, he Who presses out and pours his deep libations forth, O Vr̥itra-slayer, unto thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भवा॒ वरू॑थं मघवन्म॒घोनां॒ यत्स॒मजा॑सि॒ शर्ध॑तः वि त्वाह॑तस्य॒ वेद॑नं भजेम॒ह्या दू॒णाशो॑ भरा॒ गय॑म्
verses.transliteration: bhávā várūtham maghavan maghónāṃ  yát samájāsi śárdhataḥ  ví tvā́hatasya védanam bhajemahi-  ā́ dūṇā́śo bharā gáyam

translation.text: When thou dost drive the fighting men together be, thou Mighty One, the mighty's shield. May we divide the wealth of him whom thou hast slain: bring us, Unreachable, his goods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒नोता॑ सोम॒पाव्ने॒ सोम॒मिन्द्रा॑य व॒ज्रिणे॑ पच॑ता प॒क्तीरव॑से कृणु॒ध्वमित्पृ॒णन्नित्पृ॑ण॒ते मयः॑
verses.transliteration: sunótā somapā́vne  sómam índrāya vajríṇe  pácatā paktī́r ávase kr̥ṇudhvám ít  pr̥ṇánn ít pr̥ṇaté máyaḥ

translation.text: For Indra, Soma-drinker, armed with thunder, press the Soma juice. Make ready your dressed meats: cause him to favour us. The Giver blesses him who gives.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा स्रे॑धत सोमिनो॒ दक्ष॑ता म॒हे कृ॑णु॒ध्वं रा॒य आ॒तुजे॑ त॒रणि॒रिज्ज॑यति॒ क्षेति॒ पुष्य॑ति॒ न दे॒वासः॑ कव॒त्नवे॑
verses.transliteration: mā́ sredhata somino dákṣatā mahé  kr̥ṇudhváṃ rāyá ātúje  taráṇir íj jayati kṣéti púṣyati  ná devā́saḥ kavatnáve

translation.text: Grudge not, ye Soma pourers; stir you, pay the rites, for wealth, to the great Conqueror. Only the active conquers dwells in peace, and thrives: not for the niggard are the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नकिः॑ सु॒दासो॒ रथं॒ पर्या॑स॒ न री॑रमत् इन्द्रो॒ यस्या॑वि॒ता यस्य॑ म॒रुतो॒ गम॒त्स गोम॑ति व्र॒जे
verses.transliteration: nákiḥ sudā́so rátham  páry āsa ná rīramat  índro yásyāvitā́ yásya marúto  gámat sá gómati vrajé

translation.text: No one hath overturned or stayed the car of him who freely gives. The man whom Indra and the Marut host defend comes to a stable full of kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गम॒द्वाजं॑ वा॒जय॑न्निन्द्र॒ मर्त्यो॒ यस्य॒ त्वम॑वि॒ता भुवः॑ अ॒स्माकं॑ बोध्यवि॒ता रथा॑नाम॒स्माकं॑ शूर नृ॒णाम्
verses.transliteration: gámad vā́jaṃ vājáyann indra mártyo  yásya tvám avitā́ bhúvaḥ  asmā́kam bodhy avitā́ ráthānām  asmā́kaṃ śūra nr̥ṇā́m

translation.text: Indra, that man when fighting shall obtain the spoil, whose strong defender thou wilt be. Be thou the gracious helper, Hero I of our cars, be thou the helper of our men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदिन्न्व॑स्य रिच्य॒तेंऽशो॒ धनं॒ न जि॒ग्युषः॑ य इन्द्रो॒ हरि॑वा॒न्न द॑भन्ति॒ तं रिपो॒ दक्षं॑ दधाति सो॒मिनि॑
verses.transliteration: úd ín nv àsya ricyate-  -áṃśo dhánaṃ ná jigyúṣaḥ  yá índro hárivān ná dabhanti táṃ rípo  dákṣaṃ dadhāti somíni

translation.text: His portion is exceeding great like a victorious soldier's spoil. Him who is Indra, Lord of Bays, no foes subdue. He gives the Soma-pourer strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मन्त्र॒मख॑र्वं॒ सुधि॑तं सु॒पेश॑सं॒ दधा॑त य॒ज्ञिये॒ष्वा पू॒र्वीश्च॒न प्रसि॑तयस्तरन्ति॒ तं य इन्द्रे॒ कर्म॑णा॒ भुव॑त्
verses.transliteration: mántram ákharvaṃ súdhitaṃ supéśasaṃ  dádhāta yajñíyeṣv ā́  pūrvī́ś caná prásitayas taranti táṃ  yá índre kármaṇā bhúvat

translation.text: Make for the Holy Gods a hymn that is not mean, but well-arranged and fair of form. Even many snares and bonds subdue not him who dwells with Indra through his sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कस्तमि॑न्द्र॒ त्वाव॑सु॒मा मर्त्यो॑ दधर्षति श्र॒द्धा इत्ते॑ मघव॒न्पार्ये॑ दि॒वि वा॒जी वाजं॑ सिषासति
verses.transliteration: kás tám indra tvā́vasum  ā́ mártyo dadharṣati  śraddhā́ ít te maghavan pā́rye diví  vājī́ vā́jaṃ siṣāsati

translation.text: Indra, what mortal will attack the man who hath his wealth in thee? The strong will win the spoil on the decisive day through faith in thee, O Maghavan.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒घोनः॑ स्म वृत्र॒हत्ये॑षु चोदय॒ ये दद॑ति प्रि॒या वसु॑ तव॒ प्रणी॑ती हर्यश्व सू॒रिभि॒र्विश्वा॑ तरेम दुरि॒ता
verses.transliteration: maghónaḥ sma vr̥trahátyeṣu codaya  yé dádati priyā́ vásu  táva práṇītī haryaśva sūríbhir  víśvā tarema duritā́

translation.text: In battles with the foe urge on our mighty ones who give the treasures dear to thee, And may we with our princes, Lord of Tawny Steeds! pass through all peril, led by thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तवेदि॑न्द्राव॒मं वसु॒ त्वं पु॑ष्यसि मध्य॒मम् स॒त्रा विश्व॑स्य पर॒मस्य॑ राजसि॒ नकि॑ष्ट्वा॒ गोषु॑ वृण्वते
verses.transliteration: távéd indrāvamáṃ vásu  tvám puṣyasi madhyamám  satrā́ víśvasya paramásya rājasi  nákiṣ ṭvā góṣu vr̥ṇvate

translation.text: Thine, Indra, is the lowest wealth, thou cherishest the mid-most wealth, Thou ever rulest all the highest: in the fray for cattle none resisteth thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं विश्व॑स्य धन॒दा अ॑सि श्रु॒तो य ईं॒ भव॑न्त्या॒जयः॑ तवा॒यं विश्वः॑ पुरुहूत॒ पार्थि॑वोऽव॒स्युर्नाम॑ भिक्षते
verses.transliteration: tváṃ víśvasya dhanadā́ asi śrutó  yá īm bhávanty ājáyaḥ  távāyáṃ víśvaḥ puruhūta pā́rthivo  -avasyúr nā́ma bhikṣate

translation.text: Thou art renowned as giving wealth to every one in all the battles that are fought. Craving protection, all these people of the earth, O Much-invoked, implore thy name.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑न्द्र॒ याव॑त॒स्त्वमे॒ताव॑द॒हमीशी॑य स्तो॒तार॒मिद्दि॑धिषेय रदावसो॒ न पा॑प॒त्वाय॑ रासीय
verses.transliteration: yád indra yā́vatas tvám  etā́vad ahám ī́śīya  stotā́ram íd didhiṣeya radāvaso  ná pāpatvā́ya rāsīya

translation.text: If I, O Indra, were the Lord of riches ample as thine own, I should support the singer, God. who givest wealth! and not abandon him to woe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शिक्षे॑य॒मिन्म॑हय॒ते दि॒वेदि॑वे रा॒य आ कु॑हचि॒द्विदे॑ न॒हि त्वद॒न्यन्म॑घवन्न॒ आप्यं॒ वस्यो॒ अस्ति॑ पि॒ता च॒न
verses.transliteration: śíkṣeyam ín mahayaté divé-dive  rāyá ā́ kuhacidvíde  nahí tvád anyán maghavan na ā́pyaṃ  vásyo ásti pitā́ caná

translation.text: Each day would I enrich the man who sang my praise, in whatsoever place he were. No kinship is there better, Maghavan, than thine: a father even is no more.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त॒रणि॒रित्सि॑षासति॒ वाजं॒ पुरं॑ध्या यु॒जा आ व॒ इन्द्रं॑ पुरुहू॒तं न॑मे गि॒रा ने॒मिं तष्टे॑व सु॒द्र्व॑म्
verses.transliteration: taráṇir ít siṣāsati  vā́jam púraṃdhyā yujā́  ā́ va índram puruhūtáṃ name girā́  nemíṃ táṣṭeva sudrvàm

translation.text: With Plenty for his true ally the active man will gain the spoil. Your Indra, Much-invoked, I bend with song, as bends a wright his wheel of solid wood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न दु॑ष्टु॒ती मर्त्यो॑ विन्दते॒ वसु॒ न स्रेध॑न्तं र॒यिर्न॑शत् सु॒शक्ति॒रिन्म॑घव॒न्तुभ्यं॒ माव॑ते दे॒ष्णं यत्पार्ये॑ दि॒वि
verses.transliteration: ná duṣṭutī́ mártyo vindate vásu  ná srédhantaṃ rayír naśat  suśáktir ín maghavan túbhyam mā́vate  deṣṇáṃ yát pā́rye diví

translation.text: A moral wins no riches by unworthy praise: wealth comes not to the niggard churl. Light is the task to give, O Maghavan, to one like me on the decisive day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि त्वा॑ शूर नोनु॒मोऽदु॑ग्धा इव धे॒नवः॑ ईशा॑नम॒स्य जग॑तः स्व॒र्दृश॒मीशा॑नमिन्द्र त॒स्थुषः॑
verses.transliteration: abhí tvā śūra nonumaḥ-  -ádugdhā iva dhenávaḥ  ī́śānam asyá jágataḥ svardŕ̥śam  ī́śānam indra tasthúṣaḥ

translation.text: Like kine unmilked we call aloud, Hero, to thee, and sing thy praise, Looker on heavenly light, Lord of this moving world, Lord, Indra, of what moveth not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न त्वावाँ॑ अ॒न्यो दि॒व्यो न पार्थि॑वो॒ न जा॒तो न ज॑निष्यते अ॒श्वा॒यन्तो॑ मघवन्निन्द्र वा॒जिनो॑ ग॒व्यन्त॑स्त्वा हवामहे
verses.transliteration: ná tvā́vām̐ anyó divyó ná pā́rthivo  ná jātó ná janiṣyate-  aśvāyánto maghavann indra vājíno  gavyántas tvā havāmahe

translation.text: None other like to thee, of earth or of the heavens, hath been or ever will be born. Desiring horses, Indra Maghavan! and kine, as men of might we call on thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भी ष॒तस्तदा भ॒रेन्द्र॒ ज्यायः॒ कनी॑यसः पु॒रू॒वसु॒र्हि म॑घवन्त्स॒नादसि॒ भरे॑भरे च॒ हव्यः॑
verses.transliteration: abhī́ ṣatás tád ā́ bhara-  -índra jyā́yaḥ kánīyasaḥ  purūvásur hí maghavan sanā́d ási  bháre-bhare ca hávyaḥ

translation.text: Bring, Indra, the Victorious Ones; bring, elder thou, the younger host. For, Maghavan, thou art rich in treasures from of old, and must be called in every fight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॑ णुदस्व मघवन्न॒मित्रा॑न्त्सु॒वेदा॑ नो॒ वसू॑ कृधि अ॒स्माकं॑ बोध्यवि॒ता म॑हाध॒ने भवा॑ वृ॒धः सखी॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: párā ṇudasva maghavann amítrān  suvédā no vásū kr̥dhi  asmā́kam bodhy avitā́ mahādhané  bhávā vr̥dháḥ sákhīnām

translation.text: Drive thou away our enemies, O Maghavan: make riches easy to be won. Be thou our good Protector in the strife for spoil: Cherisher of our friends be thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ क्रतुं॑ न॒ आ भ॑र पि॒ता पु॒त्रेभ्यो॒ यथा॑ शिक्षा॑ णो अ॒स्मिन्पु॑रुहूत॒ याम॑नि जी॒वा ज्योति॑रशीमहि
verses.transliteration: índra krátuṃ na ā́ bhara  pitā́ putrébhyo yáthā  śíkṣā ṇo asmín puruhūta yā́mani  jīvā́ jyótir aśīmahi

translation.text: O Indra, give us wisdom as a sire gives wisdom to his sons. Guide us, O Much-invoked, in this our way may we still live and look upon the light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॒ अज्ञा॑ता वृ॒जना॑ दुरा॒ध्यो॒३॒॑ माशि॑वासो॒ अव॑ क्रमुः त्वया॑ व॒यं प्र॒वतः॒ शश्व॑तीर॒पोऽति॑ शूर तरामसि
verses.transliteration: mā́ no ájñātā vr̥jánā durādhyò  mā́śivāso áva kramuḥ  tváyā vayám pravátaḥ śáśvatīr apó  -áti śūra tarāmasi

translation.text: Grant that no mighty foes, unknown, malevolent, unhallowed, tread us to the ground. With thine assistance, Hero, may we ass through all the waters that are rul`ng down.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्वि॒त्यञ्चो॑ मा दक्षिण॒तस्क॑पर्दा धियंजि॒न्वासो॑ अ॒भि हि प्र॑म॒न्दुः उ॒त्तिष्ठ॑न्वोचे॒ परि॑ ब॒र्हिषो॒ नॄन्न मे॑ दू॒रादवि॑तवे॒ वसि॑ष्ठाः
verses.transliteration: śvityáñco mā dakṣiṇatáskapardāḥ-  dhiyaṃjinvā́so abhí hí pramandúḥ  uttíṣṭhan voce pári barhíṣo nr̥̄́n  ná me dūrā́d ávitave vásiṣṭhāḥ

translation.text: THESE who wear hair-knots on the right, the movers of holy thought, white-robed, have won me over. I warned the men, when from the grass I raised me, Not from afar can my Vasishṭhas help you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दू॒रादिन्द्र॑मनय॒न्ना सु॒तेन॑ ति॒रो वै॑श॒न्तमति॒ पान्त॑मु॒ग्रम् पाश॑द्युम्नस्य वाय॒तस्य॒ सोमा॑त्सु॒तादिन्द्रो॑ऽवृणीता॒ वसि॑ष्ठान्
verses.transliteration: dūrā́d índram anayann ā́ suténa  tiró vaiśantám áti pā́ntam ugrám  pā́śadyumnasya vāyatásya sómāt  sutā́d índro 'vr̥ṇītā vásiṣṭhān

translation.text: With soma they brought Indra from a distance, Over Vaiṣanta, from the strong libation. Indra preferred Vasishṭhas to the Soma pressed by the son of Vâyata, Pâṣadyumna.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वेन्नु कं॒ सिन्धु॑मेभिस्ततारे॒वेन्नु कं॑ भे॒दमे॑भिर्जघान ए॒वेन्नु कं॑ दाशरा॒ज्ञे सु॒दासं॒ प्राव॒दिन्द्रो॒ ब्रह्म॑णा वो वसिष्ठाः
verses.transliteration: evén nú kaṃ síndhum ebhis tatāra-  evén nú kam bhedám ebhir jaghāna  evén nú kaṃ dāśarājñé sudā́sam  prā́vad índro bráhmaṇā vo vasiṣṭhāḥ

translation.text: So, verily, with these he crossed the river, in company with these he slaughtered Bheda. So in the fight with the Ten Kings, Vasishṭhas! did Indra help Sudâs through your devotions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जुष्टी॑ नरो॒ ब्रह्म॑णा वः पितॄ॒णामक्ष॑मव्ययं॒ न किला॑ रिषाथ यच्छक्व॑रीषु बृह॒ता रवे॒णेन्द्रे॒ शुष्म॒मद॑धाता वसिष्ठाः
verses.transliteration: júṣṭī naro bráhmaṇā vaḥ pitr̥̄ṇā́m  ákṣam avyayaṃ ná kílā riṣātha  yác chákvarīṣu br̥hatā́ ráveṇa-  -índre śúṣmam ádadhātā vasiṣṭhāḥ

translation.text: I gladly, men I with prayer prayed by our fathers have fixed your axle: ye shall not be injured: Since, when ye sang aloud the Ṣakvarî verses, Vasishṭhas! ye invigorated Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद्द्यामि॒वेत्तृ॒ष्णजो॑ नाथि॒तासोऽदी॑धयुर्दाशरा॒ज्ञे वृ॒तासः॑ वसि॑ष्ठस्य स्तुव॒त इन्द्रो॑ अश्रोदु॒रुं तृत्सु॑भ्यो अकृणोदु लो॒कम्
verses.transliteration: úd dyā́m ivét tr̥ṣṇájo nāthitā́saḥ-  -ádīdhayur dāśarājñé vr̥tā́saḥ  vásiṣṭhasya stuvatá índro aśrod  urúṃ tŕ̥tsubhyo akr̥ṇod ulokám

translation.text: Like thirsty men they looked to heaven, in battle with the Ten Kings, surrounded and imploring. Then Indra heard Vasishṭha as he praised him, and gave the Tr̥itsus ample room and freedom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒ण्डा इ॒वेद्गो॒अज॑नास आस॒न्परि॑च्छिन्ना भर॒ता अ॑र्भ॒कासः॑ अभ॑वच्च पुरए॒ता वसि॑ष्ठ॒ आदित्तृत्सू॑नां॒ विशो॑ अप्रथन्त
verses.transliteration: daṇḍā́ ivéd goájanāsa āsan  párichinnā bharatā́ arbhakā́saḥ  ábhavac ca puraetā́ vásiṣṭhaḥ-  ā́d ít tŕ̥tsūnāṃ víśo aprathanta

translation.text: Like sticks and staves wherewith they drive the cattle, Stripped bare, the Bharatas were found defenceless: Vasishṭha then became their chief and leader: then widely. were the Tr̥itsus' clans extended.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रयः॑ कृण्वन्ति॒ भुव॑नेषु॒ रेत॑स्ति॒स्रः प्र॒जा आर्या॒ ज्योति॑रग्राः त्रयो॑ घ॒र्मास॑ उ॒षसं॑ सचन्ते॒ सर्वाँ॒ इत्ताँ अनु॑ विदु॒र्वसि॑ष्ठाः
verses.transliteration: tráyaḥ kr̥ṇvanti bhúvaneṣu rétas  tisráḥ prajā́ ā́ryā jyótiragrāḥ  tráyo gharmā́sa uṣásaṃ sacante  sárvām̐ ít tā́m̐ ánu vidur vásiṣṭhāḥ

translation.text: Three fertilize the worlds with genial moisture: three noble Creatures cast a light before them. Three that give warmth to all attend the morning. All these have they discovered, these Vasishṭhas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सूर्य॑स्येव व॒क्षथो॒ ज्योति॑रेषां समु॒द्रस्ये॑व महि॒मा ग॑भी॒रः वात॑स्येव प्रज॒वो नान्येन॒ स्तोमो॑ वसिष्ठा॒ अन्वे॑तवे वः
verses.transliteration: sū́ryasyeva vakṣátho jyótir eṣāṃ  samudrásyeva mahimā́ gabhīráḥ  vā́tasyeva prajavó nā́nyéna  stómo vasiṣṭhā ánvetave vaḥ

translation.text: Like the Sun's growing glory is their splendour, and like the sea's is their unflathomed greatness. Their course is like the wind's. Your laud, Vasishṭhas, can never be attained by any other.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त इन्नि॒ण्यं हृद॑यस्य प्रके॒तैः स॒हस्र॑वल्शम॒भि सं च॑रन्ति य॒मेन॑ त॒तं प॑रि॒धिं वय॑न्तोऽप्स॒रस॒ उप॑ सेदु॒र्वसि॑ष्ठाः
verses.transliteration: tá ín niṇyáṃ hŕ̥dayasya praketaíḥ  sahásravalśam abhí sáṃ caranti  yaména tatám paridhíṃ váyanto  -apsarása úpa sedur vásiṣṭhāḥ

translation.text: They with perceptions of the heart in secret resort to that which spreads a thousand branches. The Apsaras brought hither the Vasishṭhas wearing the vesture spun for them by Yama.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒द्युतो॒ ज्योतिः॒ परि॑ सं॒जिहा॑नं मि॒त्रावरु॑णा॒ यदप॑श्यतां त्वा तत्ते॒ जन्मो॒तैकं॑ वसिष्ठा॒गस्त्यो॒ यत्त्वा॑ वि॒श आ॑ज॒भार॑
verses.transliteration: vidyúto jyótiḥ pári saṃjíhānam  mitrā́váruṇā yád ápaśyatāṃ tvā  tát te jánmotaíkaṃ vasiṣṭha-  -agástyo yát tvā viśá ājabhā́ra

translation.text: A form of lustre springing from the lightning wast thou, when Varuṇa and Mitra saw thee. Tliy one and only birth was then, Vasishṭha, when from thy stock Agastya brought thee hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒तासि॑ मैत्रावरु॒णो व॑सिष्ठो॒र्वश्या॑ ब्रह्म॒न्मन॒सोऽधि॑ जा॒तः द्र॒प्सं स्क॒न्नं ब्रह्म॑णा॒ दैव्ये॑न॒ विश्वे॑ दे॒वाः पुष्क॑रे त्वाददन्त
verses.transliteration: utā́si maitrāvaruṇó vasiṣṭha-  -urváśyā brahman mánasó 'dhi jātáḥ  drapsáṃ skannám bráhmaṇā daívyena  víśve devā́ḥ púṣkare tvādadanta

translation.text: Born of their love for Urvaṣî, Vasishṭha thou, priest, art son of Varuṇa and Mitra; And as a fallen drop, in heavenly fervour, all the Gods laid thee on a lotus-blossorn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स प्र॑के॒त उ॒भय॑स्य प्रवि॒द्वान्त्स॒हस्र॑दान उ॒त वा॒ सदा॑नः य॒मेन॑ त॒तं प॑रि॒धिं व॑यि॒ष्यन्न॑प्स॒रसः॒ परि॑ जज्ञे॒ वसि॑ष्ठः
verses.transliteration: sá praketá ubháyasya pravidvā́n  sahásradāna utá vā sádānaḥ  yaména tatám paridhíṃ vayiṣyánn  apsarásaḥ pári jajñe vásiṣṭhaḥ

translation.text: He thinker, knower both of earth and heaven, endowed with many a gift, bestowing thousands, Destined to wear the vesture spun by Yama, sprang from the Apsaras to life, Vasishṭha.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒त्रे ह॑ जा॒तावि॑षि॒ता नमो॑भिः कु॒म्भे रेतः॑ सिषिचतुः समा॒नम् ततो॑ ह॒ मान॒ उदि॑याय॒ मध्या॒त्ततो॑ जा॒तमृषि॑माहु॒र्वसि॑ष्ठम्
verses.transliteration: satré ha jātā́v iṣitā́ námobhiḥ  kumbhé rétaḥ siṣicatuḥ samānám  táto ha mā́na úd iyāya mádhyāt  táto jātám ŕ̥ṣim āhur vásiṣṭham

translation.text: Born at the sacrifice, urged by adorations, both with a common flow bedewed the pitcher. Then from the midst thereof there rose up Mâna, and thence they say was born the sage Vasishṭha.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒क्थ॒भृतं॑ साम॒भृतं॑ बिभर्ति॒ ग्रावा॑णं॒ बिभ्र॒त्प्र व॑दा॒त्यग्रे॑ उपै॑नमाध्वं सुमन॒स्यमा॑ना॒ आ वो॑ गच्छाति प्रतृदो॒ वसि॑ष्ठः
verses.transliteration: ukthabhŕ̥taṃ sāmabhŕ̥tam bibharti  grā́vāṇam bíbhrat prá vadāty ágre  úpainam ādhvaṃ sumanasyámānāḥ-  ā́ vo gachāti pratr̥do vásiṣṭhaḥ

translation.text: He brings the bearer of the laud and Sâman: first shall he speak bringing the stone for pressing. With grateful hearts in reverence approach him: to you, O Pratr̥idas, Vasishṭha cometh.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र शु॒क्रैतु॑ दे॒वी म॑नी॒षा अ॒स्मत्सुत॑ष्टो॒ रथो॒ न वा॒जी
verses.transliteration: prá śukraítu devī́ manīṣā́  asmát sútaṣṭo rátho ná vājī́

translation.text: MAY our divine and brilliant hymn go forth, like a swift chariot wrought and fashioned well.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒दुः पृ॑थि॒व्या दि॒वो ज॒नित्रं॑ शृ॒ण्वन्त्यापो॒ अध॒ क्षर॑न्तीः
verses.transliteration: vidúḥ pr̥thivyā́ divó janítraṃ  śr̥ṇvánty ā́po ádha kṣárantīḥ

translation.text: The waters listen as they flow along: they know the origin of heaven and earth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आप॑श्चिदस्मै॒ पिन्व॑न्त पृ॒थ्वीर्वृ॒त्रेषु॒ शूरा॒ मंस॑न्त उ॒ग्राः
verses.transliteration: ā́paś cid asmai pínvanta pr̥thvī́r  vr̥tréṣu śū́rā máṃsanta ugrā́ḥ

translation.text: Yea, the broad waters swell their flood ior him: of him strong heroes think amid their foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ धू॒र्ष्व॑स्मै॒ दधा॒ताश्वा॒निन्द्रो॒ न व॒ज्री हिर॑ण्यबाहुः
verses.transliteration: ā́ dhūrṣv àsmai dádhātā́śvān  índro ná vajrī́ híraṇyabāhuḥ

translation.text: Set ye for him the coursers to the pole: like Indra Thunderer is the Golden-armed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि प्र स्था॒ताहे॑व य॒ज्ञं याते॑व॒ पत्म॒न्त्मना॑ हिनोत
verses.transliteration: abhí prá sthātā́heva yajñáṃ  yā́teva pátman tmánā hinota

translation.text: Arouse you, like the days, to sacrifice speed gladly like a traveller on the way.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्मना॑ स॒मत्सु॑ हि॒नोत॑ य॒ज्ञं दधा॑त के॒तुं जना॑य वी॒रम्
verses.transliteration: tmánā samátsu hinóta yajñáṃ  dádhāta ketúṃ jánāya vīrám

translation.text: Go swift to battles, to the sacrifice: set up a flag, a hero for the folk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद॑स्य॒ शुष्मा॑द्भा॒नुर्नार्त॒ बिभ॑र्ति भा॒रं पृ॑थि॒वी न भूम॑
verses.transliteration: úd asya śúṣmād bhānúr nā́rta  bíbharti bhārám pr̥thivī́ ná bhū́ma

translation.text: Up from his strength hath risen as 'twere a light: it bears the load as earth bears living things.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ह्वया॑मि दे॒वाँ अया॑तुरग्ने॒ साध॑न्नृ॒तेन॒ धियं॑ दधामि
verses.transliteration: hváyāmi devā́m̐ áyātur agne  sā́dhann r̥téna dhíyaṃ dadhāmi

translation.text: Agni, no demon I invoke the Gods: by law completing it, I form a hymn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि वो॑ दे॒वीं धियं॑ दधिध्वं॒ प्र वो॑ देव॒त्रा वाचं॑ कृणुध्वम्
verses.transliteration: abhí vo devī́ṃ dhíyaṃ dadhidhvam  prá vo devatrā́ vā́caṃ kr̥ṇudhvam

translation.text: Closely albout you lay your heavenly song, and send your voice to where the Gods abide.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ च॑ष्ट आसां॒ पाथो॑ न॒दीनां॒ वरु॑ण उ॒ग्रः स॒हस्र॑चक्षाः
verses.transliteration: ā́ caṣṭa āsām pā́tho nadī́nāṃ  váruṇa ugráḥ sahásracakṣāḥ

translation.text: Varuṇa, Mighty, with a thousand eyes, beholds the paths wherein these rivers run.

verses.sanskrit_deva: राजा॑ रा॒ष्ट्रानां॒ पेशो॑ न॒दीना॒मनु॑त्तमस्मै क्ष॒त्रं वि॒श्वायु॑
verses.transliteration: rā́jā rāṣṭrā́nām péśo nadī́nām  ánuttam asmai kṣatráṃ viśvā́yu

translation.text: He, King of kings, the glory of the floods, o'er all that liveth hath resistless sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अवि॑ष्टो अ॒स्मान्विश्वा॑सु वि॒क्ष्वद्युं॑ कृणोत॒ शंसं॑ निनि॒त्सोः
verses.transliteration: áviṣṭo asmā́n víśvāsu vikṣú-  ádyuṃ kr̥ṇota śáṃsaṃ ninitsóḥ

translation.text: May he assist us among all the tribes, and make the envier's praise devoid of light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्ये॑तु दि॒द्युद्द्वि॒षामशे॑वा यु॒योत॒ विष्व॒ग्रप॑स्त॒नूना॑म्
verses.transliteration: vy ètu didyúd dviṣā́m áśevā  yuyóta víṣvag rápas tanū́nām

translation.text: May the foes' threatening arrow pass us by: may he put far from us our bodies' sin.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अवी॑न्नो अ॒ग्निर्ह॒व्यान्नमो॑भिः॒ प्रेष्ठो॑ अस्मा अधायि॒ स्तोमः॑
verses.transliteration: ávīn no agnír havyā́n námobhiḥ  préṣṭho asmā adhāyi stómaḥ

translation.text: Agni, oblation-cater, through our prayers aid us: to him our dearest laud is brought.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒जूर्दे॒वेभि॑र॒पां नपा॑तं॒ सखा॑यं कृध्वं शि॒वो नो॑ अस्तु
verses.transliteration: sajū́r devébhir apā́ṃ nápātaṃ  sákhāyaṃ kr̥dhvaṃ śivó no astu

translation.text: Accordant with the Gods choose for our Friend the Waters' Child: may he be good to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ब्जामु॒क्थैरहिं॑ गृणीषे बु॒ध्ने न॒दीनां॒ रजः॑सु॒ षीद॑न्
verses.transliteration: abjā́m ukthaír áhiṃ gr̥ṇīṣe  budhné nadī́nāṃ rájassu ṣī́dan

translation.text: With lauds I sing the Dragon born of floods: he sits beneath the streams in middle air.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नोऽहि॑र्बु॒ध्न्यो॑ रि॒षे धा॒न्मा य॒ज्ञो अ॑स्य स्रिधदृता॒योः
verses.transliteration: mā́ nó 'hir budhnyò riṣé dhād  mā́ yajñó asya sridhad r̥tāyóḥ

translation.text: Ne'er may the Dragon of the Deep harm us: ne'er fail this faithful servant's sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त न॑ ए॒षु नृषु॒ श्रवो॑ धुः॒ प्र रा॒ये य॑न्तु॒ शर्ध॑न्तो अ॒र्यः
verses.transliteration: utá na eṣú nŕ̥ṣu śrávo dhuḥ  prá rāyé yantu śárdhanto aryáḥ

translation.text: To these our heroes may they grant renown: may pious men march boldly on to wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तप॑न्ति॒ शत्रुं॒ स्व१॒॑र्ण भूमा॑ म॒हासे॑नासो॒ अमे॑भिरेषाम्
verses.transliteration: tápanti śátruṃ svàr ṇá bhū́mā  mahā́senāso ámebhir eṣām

translation.text: Leading great hosts, with fierce attacks of these, they burn their foes as the Sun burns the earth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यन्नः॒ पत्नी॒र्गम॒न्त्यच्छा॒ त्वष्टा॑ सुपा॒णिर्दधा॑तु वी॒रान्
verses.transliteration: ā́ yán naḥ pátnīr gámanty áchā  tváṣṭā supāṇír dádhātu vīrā́n

translation.text: What time our wives draw near to us, may he, left-handed Tvashṭar, give us hero sons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ नः॒ स्तोमं॒ त्वष्टा॑ जुषेत॒ स्याद॒स्मे अ॒रम॑तिर्वसू॒युः
verses.transliteration: práti na stómaṃ tváṣṭā juṣeta  syā́d asmé arámatir vasūyúḥ

translation.text: May Tvashṭar find our hymn acceptable, and may Aramati, seeking wealth, be ours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता नो॑ रासन्राति॒षाचो॒ वसू॒न्या रोद॑सी वरुणा॒नी शृ॑णोतु वरू॑त्रीभिः सुशर॒णो नो॑ अस्तु॒ त्वष्टा॑ सु॒दत्रो॒ वि द॑धातु॒ रायः॑
verses.transliteration: tā́ no rāsan rātiṣā́co vásūni-  ā́ ródasī varuṇānī́ śr̥ṇotu  várūtrībhiḥ suśaraṇó no astu  tváṣṭā sudátro ví dadhātu rā́yaḥ

translation.text: May they who lavish gifts bestow those treasures: may Rodasî and Varuṇânî listen. May he, with the Varûtrîs, be our refuge, may bountiful Tvashṭar give us store of riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्नो॒ रायः॒ पर्व॑ता॒स्तन्न॒ आप॒स्तद्रा॑ति॒षाच॒ ओष॑धीरु॒त द्यौः वन॒स्पति॑भिः पृथि॒वी स॒जोषा॑ उ॒भे रोद॑सी॒ परि॑ पासतो नः
verses.transliteration: tán no rā́yaḥ párvatās tán na ā́pas  tád rātiṣā́ca óṣadhīr utá dyaúḥ  vánaspátibhiḥ pr̥thivī́ sajóṣāḥ-  ubhé ródasī pári pāsato naḥ

translation.text: So may rich Mountains and the liberal Waters, so may all Herbs that grow on ground, and Heaven, And Earth accordant with the Forest-Sovrans, and both the World-halves round about protect us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॒ तदु॒र्वी रोद॑सी जिहाता॒मनु॑ द्यु॒क्षो वरु॑ण॒ इन्द्र॑सखा अनु॒ विश्वे॑ म॒रुतो॒ ये स॒हासो॑ रा॒यः स्या॑म ध॒रुणं॑ धि॒यध्यै॑
verses.transliteration: ánu tád urvī́ ródasī jihātām  ánu dyukṣó váruṇa índrasakhā  ánu víśve marúto yé sahā́so  rāyáḥ syāma dharúṇaṃ dhiyádhyai

translation.text: To this may both the wide Worlds lend approval, and Varuṇa in heaven, whose Friend is Indra. May all the Maruts give consent, the Victors, that we may hold great wealth in firm possession.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्न॒ इन्द्रो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निराप॒ ओष॑धीर्व॒निनो॑ जुषन्त शर्म॑न्त्स्याम म॒रुता॑मु॒पस्थे॑ यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: tán na índro váruṇo mitró agnír  ā́pa óṣadhīr vaníno juṣanta  śárman syāma marútām upásthe  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: May Indra, Varuṇa, Mitra, and Agni, Waters, Herbs, Trees accept the praise we offer. May we find refuge in the Marut's bosom. Protect us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं न॑ इन्द्रा॒ग्नी भ॑वता॒मवो॑भिः॒ शं न॒ इन्द्रा॒वरु॑णा रा॒तह॑व्या शमिन्द्रा॒सोमा॑ सुवि॒ताय॒ शं योः शं न॒ इन्द्रा॑पू॒षणा॒ वाज॑सातौ
verses.transliteration: śáṃ na indrāgnī́ bhavatām ávobhiḥ  śáṃ na índrāváruṇā rātáhavyā  śám índrāsómā suvitā́ya śáṃ yóḥ  śáṃ na índrāpūṣáṇā vā́jasātau

translation.text: BEFRIEND us with their aids Indra and Agni, Indra and Varuṇa who receive oblations! Indra and Soma give health, strength and comfort, Indra and Pûshan be our help in battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नो॒ भगः॒ शमु॑ नः॒ शंसो॑ अस्तु॒ शं नः॒ पुरं॑धिः॒ शमु॑ सन्तु॒ रायः॑ शं नः॑ स॒त्यस्य॑ सु॒यम॑स्य॒ शंसः॒ शं नो॑ अर्य॒मा पु॑रुजा॒तो अ॑स्तु
verses.transliteration: śáṃ no bhágaḥ śám u naḥ śáṃso astu  śáṃ naḥ púraṃdhiḥ śám u santu rā́yaḥ  śáṃ naḥ satyásya suyámasya śáṃsaḥ  śáṃ no aryamā́ purujātó astu

translation.text: Auspicious Friends to us be Bhaga, Sathsa, auspicious be Purandhi aid all Riches; The blessing of the true and well-conducted, and Aryaman in many forms apparent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नो॑ धा॒ता शमु॑ ध॒र्ता नो॑ अस्तु॒ शं न॑ उरू॒ची भ॑वतु स्व॒धाभिः॑ शं रोद॑सी बृह॒ती शं नो॒ अद्रिः॒ शं नो॑ दे॒वानां॑ सु॒हवा॑नि सन्तु
verses.transliteration: śáṃ no dhātā́ śám u dhartā́ no astu  śáṃ na urūcī́ bhavatu svadhā́bhiḥ  śáṃ ródasī br̥hatī́ śáṃ no ádriḥ  śáṃ no devā́nāṃ suhávāni santu

translation.text: Kind unto us he Maker and Sustainer, and the far-reaching Pair with God-like natures. Auspicious unto us be Earth and Heaven, the Mountain, and the Gods' fair invocations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नो॑ अ॒ग्निर्ज्योति॑रनीको अस्तु॒ शं नो॑ मि॒त्रावरु॑णाव॒श्विना॒ शम् शं नः॑ सु॒कृतां॑ सुकृ॒तानि॑ सन्तु॒ शं न॑ इषि॒रो अ॒भि वा॑तु॒ वातः॑
verses.transliteration: śáṃ no agnír jyótiranīko astu  śáṃ no mitrā́váruṇāv aśvínā śám  śáṃ naḥ sukŕ̥tāṃ sukr̥tā́ni santu  śáṃ na iṣiró abhí vātu vā́taḥ

translation.text: Favour us Agni with his face of splendour, and Varuva and Mitra and the Aṣvins. Favour us noble actions of the pious, impetuous vita blow on us with favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नो॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी पू॒र्वहू॑तौ॒ शम॒न्तरि॑क्षं दृ॒शये॑ नो अस्तु शं न॒ ओष॑धीर्व॒निनो॑ भवन्तु॒ शं नो॒ रज॑स॒स्पति॑रस्तु जि॒ष्णुः
verses.transliteration: śáṃ no dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ pūrváhūtau  śám antárikṣaṃ dr̥śáye no astu  śáṃ na óṣadhīr vaníno bhavantu  śáṃ no rájasas pátir astu jiṣṇúḥ

translation.text: Early invoked, may Heaven and Earth be friendly, and Air's mid-region good for us to look on. To us may Herbs and Forest-Trees be gracious, gracious the Lord Victorious of the region.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं न॒ इन्द्रो॒ वसु॑भिर्दे॒वो अ॑स्तु॒ शमा॑दि॒त्येभि॒र्वरु॑णः सु॒शंसः॑ शं नो॑ रु॒द्रो रु॒द्रेभि॒र्जला॑षः॒ शं न॒स्त्वष्टा॒ ग्नाभि॑रि॒ह शृ॑णोतु
verses.transliteration: śáṃ na índro vásubhir devó astu  śám ādityébhir váruṇaḥ suśáṃsaḥ  śáṃ no rudró rudrébhir jálāṣaḥ  śáṃ nas tváṣṭā gnā́bhir ihá śr̥ṇotu

translation.text: Be the God Indra with the Vasus friendly, and, with Âdityas, Varuṇa who blesseth. Kind, with the Rudras, be the Healer Rudra, and, with the Dames, may Tvashṭar kindly listen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नः॒ सोमो॑ भवतु॒ ब्रह्म॒ शं नः॒ शं नो॒ ग्रावा॑णः॒ शमु॑ सन्तु य॒ज्ञाः शं नः॒ स्वरू॑णां मि॒तयो॑ भवन्तु॒ शं नः॑ प्र॒स्व१॒॑ः शम्व॑स्तु॒ वेदिः॑
verses.transliteration: śáṃ naḥ sómo bhavatu bráhma śáṃ naḥ  śáṃ no grā́vāṇaḥ śám u santu yajñā́ḥ  śáṃ naḥ svárūṇām mitáyo bhavantu  śáṃ naḥ prasvàḥ śám v astu védiḥ

translation.text: Blest unto us be Soma, and devotions, blest be the Sacrifice, the Stones for pressing. Blest be the fixing of the sacred Pillars, blest be the tender Grass and blest the Altar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नः॒ सूर्य॑ उरु॒चक्षा॒ उदे॑तु॒ शं न॒श्चत॑स्रः प्र॒दिशो॑ भवन्तु शं नः॒ पर्व॑ता ध्रु॒वयो॑ भवन्तु॒ शं नः॒ सिन्ध॑वः॒ शमु॑ स॒न्त्वापः॑
verses.transliteration: śáṃ naḥ sū́rya urucákṣā úd etu  śáṃ naś cátasraḥ pradíśo bhavantu  śáṃ naḥ párvatā dhruváyo bhavantu  śáṃ naḥ síndhavaḥ śám u santv ā́paḥ

translation.text: May the far-seeing Sun rise up to bless us: be the four Quarters of the sky auspicious. Auspicious be the firmly-seated Mountains, auspicious be the Rivers and the Waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नो॒ अदि॑तिर्भवतु व्र॒तेभिः॒ शं नो॑ भवन्तु म॒रुतः॑ स्व॒र्काः शं नो॒ विष्णुः॒ शमु॑ पू॒षा नो॑ अस्तु॒ शं नो॑ भ॒वित्रं॒ शम्व॑स्तु वा॒युः
verses.transliteration: śáṃ no áditir bhavatu vratébhiḥ  śáṃ no bhavantu marútaḥ svarkā́ḥ  śáṃ no víṣṇuḥ śám u pūṣā́ no astu  śáṃ no bhavítraṃ śám v astu vāyúḥ

translation.text: May Adid through holy works be gracioas, and may the Maruts, loud in song, be friendly. May Vishṇu give felicity, and Pûshan, the Air that cherisheth our life, and Vâyu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नो॑ दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता त्राय॑माणः॒ शं नो॑ भवन्तू॒षसो॑ विभा॒तीः शं नः॑ प॒र्जन्यो॑ भवतु प्र॒जाभ्यः॒ शं नः॒ क्षेत्र॑स्य॒ पति॑रस्तु श॒म्भुः
verses.transliteration: śáṃ no deváḥ savitā́ trā́yamāṇaḥ  śáṃ no bhavantūṣáso vibhātī́ḥ  śáṃ naḥ parjányo bhavatu prajā́bhyaḥ  śáṃ naḥ kṣétrasya pátir astu śambhúḥ

translation.text: Prosper us Savitar, the God who rescues, and let the radiant Mornings be propitious. Auspicious to all creatures be Parjanya, auspicious be the field's benign Protector.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नो॑ दे॒वा वि॒श्वदे॑वा भवन्तु॒ शं सर॑स्वती स॒ह धी॒भिर॑स्तु शम॑भि॒षाचः॒ शमु॑ राति॒षाचः॒ शं नो॑ दि॒व्याः पार्थि॑वाः॒ शं नो॒ अप्याः॑
verses.transliteration: śáṃ no devā́ viśvádevā bhavantu  śáṃ sárasvatī sahá dhībhír astu  śám abhiṣā́caḥ śám u rātiṣā́caḥ  śáṃ no divyā́ḥ pā́rthivāḥ śáṃ no ápyāḥ

translation.text: May all the fellowship of Gods befriend us, Sarasvatî, with Holy Thoughts, be gracious. Friendly be they, the Liberal Ones who seek us, yea, those who dwell in heaven, on earth, in waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नः॑ स॒त्यस्य॒ पत॑यो भवन्तु॒ शं नो॒ अर्व॑न्तः॒ शमु॑ सन्तु॒ गावः॑ शं न॑ ऋ॒भवः॑ सु॒कृतः॑ सु॒हस्ताः॒ शं नो॑ भवन्तु पि॒तरो॒ हवे॑षु
verses.transliteration: śáṃ naḥ satyásya pátayo bhavantu  śáṃ no árvantaḥ śám u santu gā́vaḥ  śáṃ na r̥bhávaḥ sukŕ̥taḥ suhástāḥ  śáṃ no bhavantu pitáro háveṣu

translation.text: May the great Lords of Truth protect and aid us: blest to us be our horses and our cattle. Kind be the pious skilful-handed R̥ibhus, kind be the Fathers at our invocations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नो॑ अ॒ज एक॑पाद्दे॒वो अ॑स्तु॒ शं नोऽहि॑र्बु॒ध्न्य१॒॑ः शं स॑मु॒द्रः शं नो॑ अ॒पां नपा॑त्पे॒रुर॑स्तु॒ शं नः॒ पृश्नि॑र्भवतु दे॒वगो॑पा
verses.transliteration: śáṃ no ajá ékapād devó astu  śáṃ nó 'hir budhnyàḥ śáṃ samudráḥ  śáṃ no apā́ṃ nápāt perúr astu  śáṃ naḥ pŕ̥śnir bhavatu devágopā

translation.text: May Aja-Ekapad, the God, be gracious, gracious the Dragon of the Deep, and Ocean. Gracious be he the swelling Child of Waters, gracious be Pr̥iṣni who hath Gods to guard her.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒दि॒त्या रु॒द्रा वस॑वो जुषन्ते॒दं ब्रह्म॑ क्रि॒यमा॑णं॒ नवी॑यः शृ॒ण्वन्तु॑ नो दि॒व्याः पार्थि॑वासो॒ गोजा॑ता उ॒त ये य॒ज्ञिया॑सः
verses.transliteration: ādityā́ rudrā́ vásavo juṣanta-  -idám bráhma kriyámāṇaṃ návīyaḥ  śr̥ṇvántu no divyā́ḥ pā́rthivāso  gójātā utá yé yajñíyāsaḥ

translation.text: So may the Rudras, Vasus, and Âdityas accept the new hymn which we now are making. May all the Holy Ones of earth and heaven, and the Cow's offspring hear our invocation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये दे॒वानां॑ य॒ज्ञिया॑ य॒ज्ञिया॑नां॒ मनो॒र्यज॑त्रा अ॒मृता॑ ऋत॒ज्ञाः ते नो॑ रासन्तामुरुगा॒यम॒द्य यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: yé devā́nāṃ yajñíyā yajñíyānām  mánor yájatrā amŕ̥tā r̥tajñā́ḥ  té no rāsantām urugāyám adyá  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: They who of Holy Gods are very holy, Immortal, knowing Law, whom man must worship,– May these to-day give us broad paths to travel. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ब्रह्मै॑तु॒ सद॑नादृ॒तस्य॒ वि र॒श्मिभिः॑ ससृजे॒ सूर्यो॒ गाः वि सानु॑ना पृथि॒वी स॑स्र उ॒र्वी पृ॒थु प्रती॑क॒मध्येधे॑ अ॒ग्निः
verses.transliteration: prá bráhmaitu sádanād r̥tásya  ví raśmíbhiḥ sasr̥je sū́ryo gā́ḥ  ví sā́nunā pr̥thivī́ sasra urvī́  pr̥thú prátīkam ádhy édhe agníḥ

translation.text: LET the prayer issue from the seat of Order, for Sûrya with his beams hath loosed the cattle. With lofty ridges earth is far extended, and Agni's flame hath lit the spacious surface.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मां वां॑ मित्रावरुणा सुवृ॒क्तिमिषं॒ न कृ॑ण्वे असुरा॒ नवी॑यः इ॒नो वा॑म॒न्यः प॑द॒वीरद॑ब्धो॒ जनं॑ च मि॒त्रो य॑तति ब्रुवा॒णः
verses.transliteration: imā́ṃ vām mitrāvaruṇā suvr̥ktím  íṣaṃ ná kr̥ṇve asurā návīyaḥ  inó vām anyáḥ padavī́r ádabdho  jánaṃ ca mitró yatati bruvāṇáḥ

translation.text: O Asuras, O Varuṇa and Mitra, this hymn to you, like food, anew I offer. One of you is a strong unerring Leader, and Mitra, speaking, stirreth men to labour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वात॑स्य॒ ध्रज॑तो रन्त इ॒त्या अपी॑पयन्त धे॒नवो॒ न सूदाः॑ म॒हो दि॒वः सद॑ने॒ जाय॑मा॒नोऽचि॑क्रदद्वृष॒भः सस्मि॒न्नूध॑न्
verses.transliteration: ā́ vā́tasya dhrájato ranta ityā́ḥ-  ápīpayanta dhenávo ná sū́dāḥ  mahó diváḥ sádane jā́yamānaḥ-  -ácikradad vr̥ṣabháḥ sásminn ū́dhan

translation.text: The movements of the gliding wind come hither: like cows, the springs are filled to overflowing. Born in the station e'en of lofty heaven the Bull hath loudly bellowed in this region.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गि॒रा य ए॒ता यु॒नज॒द्धरी॑ त॒ इन्द्र॑ प्रि॒या सु॒रथा॑ शूर धा॒यू प्र यो म॒न्युं रिरि॑क्षतो मि॒नात्या सु॒क्रतु॑मर्य॒मणं॑ ववृत्याम्
verses.transliteration: girā́ yá etā́ yunájad dhárī te-  índra priyā́ suráthā śūra dhāyū́  prá yó manyúṃ rírikṣato minā́ti-  ā́ sukrátum aryamáṇaṃ vavr̥tyām

translation.text: May I bring hither with my song, O Indra, wise Aryaman who yokes thy dear Bay Horses, Voracious, with thy noble car, O Hero, him who defeats the wrath of the malicious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यज॑न्ते अस्य स॒ख्यं वय॑श्च नम॒स्विनः॒ स्व ऋ॒तस्य॒ धाम॑न् वि पृक्षो॑ बाबधे॒ नृभिः॒ स्तवा॑न इ॒दं नमो॑ रु॒द्राय॒ प्रेष्ठ॑म्
verses.transliteration: yájante asya sakhyáṃ váyaś ca  namasvínaḥ svá r̥tásya dhā́man  ví pŕ̥kṣo bābadhe nŕ̥bhi stávānaḥ-  idáṃ námo rudrā́ya préṣṭham

translation.text: In their own place of sacrifice adorers worship to gain long life and win his friendship. He hath poured food on men when they have praised him; be this, the dearest reverence, paid to Rudra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यत्सा॒कं य॒शसो॑ वावशा॒नाः सर॑स्वती स॒प्तथी॒ सिन्धु॑माता याः सु॒ष्वय॑न्त सु॒दुघाः॑ सुधा॒रा अ॒भि स्वेन॒ पय॑सा॒ पीप्या॑नाः
verses.transliteration: ā́ yát sākáṃ yaśáso vāvaśānā́ḥ  sárasvatī saptáthī síndhumātā  yā́ḥ suṣváyanta sudúghāḥ sudhārā́ḥ-  abhí svéna páyasā pī́pyānāḥ

translation.text: Coming together, glorious, loudly roaring – Sarasvatî, Mother of Floods, the seventh- With copious milk, with fair streams, strongly flowing, full swelling with the volume of their water;

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त त्ये नो॑ म॒रुतो॑ मन्दसा॒ना धियं॑ तो॒कं च॑ वा॒जिनो॑ऽवन्तु मा नः॒ परि॑ ख्य॒दक्ष॑रा॒ चर॒न्त्यवी॑वृध॒न्युज्यं॒ ते र॒यिं नः॑
