verses.transliteration: utá tyé no marúto mandasānā́ḥ-  dhíyaṃ tokáṃ ca vājíno 'vantu  mā́ naḥ pári khyad ákṣarā cárantī-  ávīvr̥dhan yújyaṃ té rayíṃ naḥ

translation.text: And may the mighty Maruts, too, rejoicing, aid our devotion and protect our offspring. Let not swift-moving Aksharâ neglect us: they have increased our own appropriate riches,

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॑ म॒हीम॒रम॑तिं कृणुध्वं॒ प्र पू॒षणं॑ विद॒थ्यं१॒॑ न वी॒रम् भगं॑ धि॒यो॑ऽवि॒तारं॑ नो अ॒स्याः सा॒तौ वाजं॑ राति॒षाचं॒ पुरं॑धिम्
verses.transliteration: prá vo mahī́m arámatiṃ kr̥ṇudhvam  prá pūṣáṇaṃ vidathyàṃ ná vīrám  bhágaṃ dhiyò 'vitā́raṃ no asyā́ḥ  sātaú vā́jaṃ rātiṣā́cam púraṃdhim

translation.text: Bring ye the great Aramati before you, and Pûshan as the Hero of the synod, Bhaga who looks upon this hymn with favour, and, as our strength, the bountiful Purandbi.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॒यं वो॑ मरुतः॒ श्लोक॑ ए॒त्वच्छा॒ विष्णुं॑ निषिक्त॒पामवो॑भिः उ॒त प्र॒जायै॑ गृण॒ते वयो॑ धुर्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: áchāyáṃ vo marutaḥ ślóka etu-  áchā víṣṇuṃ niṣiktapā́m ávobhiḥ  utá prajā́yai gr̥ṇaté váyo dhur  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: May this our song of praise reach you, O Maruts, and Vishṇu guardian of the future infant. May they vouchsafe the singer strength for offspring. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वो॒ वाहि॑ष्ठो वहतु स्त॒वध्यै॒ रथो॑ वाजा ऋभुक्षणो॒ अमृ॑क्तः अ॒भि त्रि॑पृ॒ष्ठैः सव॑नेषु॒ सोमै॒र्मदे॑ सुशिप्रा म॒हभिः॑ पृणध्वम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ vo vā́hiṣṭho vahatu stavádhyai  rátho vājā r̥bhukṣaṇo ámr̥ktaḥ  abhí tripr̥ṣṭhaíḥ sávaneṣu sómair  máde suśiprā mahábhiḥ pr̥ṇadhvam

translation.text: LET your best-bearing car that must be lauded, ne'er injured, bring you Vâjas and R̥ibhukshans. Fill you, fair-helmeted! with mighty Soma, thrice-mixed, at our libations to delight you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒यं ह॒ रत्नं॑ म॒घव॑त्सु धत्थ स्व॒र्दृश॑ ऋभुक्षणो॒ अमृ॑क्तम् सं य॒ज्ञेषु॑ स्वधावन्तः पिबध्वं॒ वि नो॒ राधां॑सि म॒तिभि॑र्दयध्वम्
verses.transliteration: yūyáṃ ha rátnam maghávatsu dhattha  svardŕ̥śa r̥bhukṣaṇo ámr̥ktam  sáṃ yajñéṣu svadhāvantaḥ pibadhvaṃ  ví no rā́dhāṃsi matíbhir dayadhvam

translation.text: Ye who behold the light of heaven, R̥ibhukshans, give our rich patrons unmolested riches. Drink, heavenly-natured. at our sacrifices, and give us bounties for the hymns we sing you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒वोचि॑थ॒ हि म॑घवन्दे॒ष्णं म॒हो अर्भ॑स्य॒ वसु॑नो विभा॒गे उ॒भा ते॑ पू॒र्णा वसु॑ना॒ गभ॑स्ती॒ न सू॒नृता॒ नि य॑मते वस॒व्या॑
verses.transliteration: uvócitha hí maghavan deṣṇám  mahó árbhasya vásuno vibhāgé  ubhā́ te pūrṇā́ vásunā gábhastī  ná sūnŕ̥tā ní yamate vasavyā̀

translation.text: For thou, O Bounteous One, art used to giving, at parting treasure whether small or ample. Filled full are both thine arms with great possessions: thy goodness keeps thee not from granting riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमि॑न्द्र॒ स्वय॑शा ऋभु॒क्षा वाजो॒ न सा॒धुरस्त॑मे॒ष्यृक्वा॑ व॒यं नु ते॑ दा॒श्वांसः॑ स्याम॒ ब्रह्म॑ कृ॒ण्वन्तो॑ हरिवो॒ वसि॑ष्ठाः
verses.transliteration: tvám indra sváyaśā r̥bhukṣā́ḥ-  vā́jo ná sādhúr ástam eṣy ŕ̥kvā  vayáṃ nú te dāśvā́ṃsaḥ syāma  bráhma kr̥ṇvánto harivo vásiṣṭhāḥ

translation.text: Indra, high-famed, as Vâja and R̥ibhukshans, thou goest working, singing to the dwelling. Lord of Bay Steeds, this day may we Vasishṭhas offer our prayers to thee and bring oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सनि॑तासि प्र॒वतो॑ दा॒शुषे॑ चि॒द्याभि॒र्विवे॑षो हर्यश्व धी॒भिः व॒व॒न्मा नु ते॒ युज्या॑भिरू॒ती क॒दा न॑ इन्द्र रा॒य आ द॑शस्येः
verses.transliteration: sánitāsi praváto dāśúṣe cid  yā́bhir víveṣo haryaśva dhībhíḥ  vavanmā́ nú te yújyābhir ūtī́  kadā́ na indra rāyá ā́ daśasyeḥ

translation.text: Thou winnest swift advancement for thy servant, through hymns, Lord of Bay Steeds, which thou hast favoured. For thee with friendly succour have we battled, and when, O Indra, wilt thou grant us riches?

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒सय॑सीव वे॒धस॒स्त्वं नः॑ क॒दा न॑ इन्द्र॒ वच॑सो बुबोधः अस्तं॑ ता॒त्या धि॒या र॒यिं सु॒वीरं॑ पृ॒क्षो नो॒ अर्वा॒ न्यु॑हीत वा॒जी
verses.transliteration: vāsáyasīva vedhásas tváṃ naḥ  kadā́ na indra vácaso bubodhaḥ  ástaṃ tātyā́ dhiyā́ rayíṃ suvī́ram  pr̥kṣó no árvā ny ùhīta vājī́

translation.text: To us thy priests a home, as 'twere, thou givest: when, Indra wilt thou recognize our praises? May thy strong Steed, through our ancestral worship, bring food and wealth with heroes to our dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि यं दे॒वी निर्ऋ॑तिश्चि॒दीशे॒ नक्ष॑न्त॒ इन्द्रं॑ श॒रदः॑ सु॒पृक्षः॑ उप॑ त्रिब॒न्धुर्ज॒रद॑ष्टिमे॒त्यस्व॑वेशं॒ यं कृ॒णव॑न्त॒ मर्ताः॑
verses.transliteration: abhí yáṃ devī́ nírr̥tiś cid ī́śe  nákṣanta índraṃ śarádaḥ supŕ̥kṣaḥ  úpa tribandhúr jarádaṣṭim eti-  ásvaveśaṃ yáṃ kr̥ṇávanta mártāḥ

translation.text: Though Nirr̥iti the Goddess reigneth round him, Autumns with food in plenty come to Indra. With three close Friends to length of days he cometh, he whom men let not rest at home in quiet.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॒ राधां॑सि सवितः स्त॒वध्या॒ आ रायो॑ यन्तु॒ पर्व॑तस्य रा॒तौ सदा॑ नो दि॒व्यः पा॒युः सि॑षक्तु यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: ā́ no rā́dhāṃsi savita stavádhyai-  ā́ rā́yo yantu párvatasya rātaú  sádā no divyáḥ pāyúḥ siṣaktu  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Promise us gifts, O Savitar: may riches come unto us in Parvata's full bounty. May the Celestial Guardian still attend us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒ ष्य दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता य॑याम हिर॒ण्ययी॑म॒मतिं॒ यामशि॑श्रेत् नू॒नं भगो॒ हव्यो॒ मानु॑षेभि॒र्वि यो रत्ना॑ पुरू॒वसु॒र्दधा॑ति
verses.transliteration: úd u ṣyá deváḥ savitā́ yayāma  hiraṇyáyīm amátiṃ yā́m áśiśret  nūnám bhágo hávyo mā́nuṣebhir  ví yó rátnā purūvásur dádhāti

translation.text: ON high hath Savitar, this God, extended the golden lustre which he spreads around him. Now, now must Bhaga be invoked by mortals, Lord of great riches who distributes treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॑ तिष्ठ सवितः श्रु॒ध्य१॒॑स्य हिर॑ण्यपाणे॒ प्रभृ॑तावृ॒तस्य॑ व्यु१॒॑र्वीं पृ॒थ्वीम॒मतिं॑ सृजा॒न आ नृभ्यो॑ मर्त॒भोज॑नं सुवा॒नः
verses.transliteration: úd u tiṣṭha savitaḥ śrudhy àsyá  híraṇyapāṇe prábhr̥tāv r̥tásya  vy ùrvī́m pr̥thvī́m amátiṃ sr̥jānáḥ-  ā́ nŕ̥bhyo martabhójanaṃ suvānáḥ

translation.text: Rise up, O Savitar whose hands are golden, and hear this man while sacrifice is offered, Spreading afar thy broad and wide effulgence, and bringing mortal men the food that feeds them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपि॑ ष्टु॒तः स॑वि॒ता दे॒वो अ॑स्तु॒ यमा चि॒द्विश्वे॒ वस॑वो गृ॒णन्ति॑ स नः॒ स्तोमा॑न्नम॒स्य१॒॑श्चनो॑ धा॒द्विश्वे॑भिः पातु पा॒युभि॒र्नि सू॒रीन्
verses.transliteration: ápi ṣṭutáḥ savitā́ devó astu  yám ā́ cid víśve vásavo gr̥ṇánti  sá na stómān namasyàś cáno dhād  víśvebhiḥ pātu pāyúbhir ní sūrī́n

translation.text: Let Savitar the God he hymned with praises, to whom the Vasus, even, all sing glory. Sweet be our lauds to him whose due is worship: may he with all protection guard our princes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि यं दे॒व्यदि॑तिर्गृ॒णाति॑ स॒वं दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुर्जु॑षा॒णा अ॒भि स॒म्राजो॒ वरु॑णो गृणन्त्य॒भि मि॒त्रासो॑ अर्य॒मा स॒जोषाः॑
verses.transliteration: abhí yáṃ devy áditir gr̥ṇā́ti  saváṃ devásya savitúr juṣāṇā́  abhí samrā́jo váruṇo gr̥ṇanti-  abhí mitrā́so aryamā́ sajóṣāḥ

translation.text: Even he whom Aditi the Goddess praises, rejoicing in God Savitar's incitement: Even he who praise the high imperial Rulers, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, sing in concert.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि ये मि॒थो व॒नुषः॒ सप॑न्ते रा॒तिं दि॒वो रा॑ति॒षाचः॑ पृथि॒व्याः अहि॑र्बु॒ध्न्य॑ उ॒त नः॑ शृणोतु॒ वरू॒त्र्येक॑धेनुभि॒र्नि पा॑तु
verses.transliteration: abhí yé mithó vanúṣaḥ sápante  rātíṃ divó rātiṣā́caḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ  áhir budhnyà utá naḥ śr̥ṇotu  várūtry ékadhenubhir ní pātu

translation.text: They who come emulous to our oblation, dispensing bounty, from the earth and heaven. May they and Ahibudhnya hear our calling: guard us Varûtrî with the Ekadhenus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॒ तन्नो॒ जास्पति॑र्मंसीष्ट॒ रत्नं॑ दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुरि॑या॒नः भग॑मु॒ग्रोऽव॑से॒ जोह॑वीति॒ भग॒मनु॑ग्रो॒ अध॑ याति॒ रत्न॑म्
verses.transliteration: ánu tán no jā́spátir maṃsīṣṭa  rátnaṃ devásya savitúr iyānáḥ  bhágam ugró 'vase jóhavīti  bhágam ánugro ádha yāti rátnam

translation.text: This may the Lord of Life, entreated, grant us,– the wealth which Savitar the God possesses. The mighty calls on Bhaga for protection, on Bhaga calls the weak to give him riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नो॑ भवन्तु वा॒जिनो॒ हवे॑षु दे॒वता॑ता मि॒तद्र॑वः स्व॒र्काः ज॒म्भय॒न्तोऽहिं॒ वृकं॒ रक्षां॑सि॒ सने॑म्य॒स्मद्यु॑यव॒न्नमी॑वाः
verses.transliteration: śáṃ no bhavantu vājíno háveṣu  devátātā mitádravaḥ svarkā́ḥ  jambháyantó 'hiṃ vŕ̥kaṃ rákṣāṃsi  sánemy asmád yuyavann ámīvāḥ

translation.text: Bless us the Vajins when we call, while slowly they move, strong Singers, to the Gods' assembly. Crushing the wolf, the serpent, and the demons, may they completely banish all affliction.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वाजे॑वाजेऽवत वाजिनो नो॒ धने॑षु विप्रा अमृता ऋतज्ञाः अ॒स्य मध्वः॑ पिबत मा॒दय॑ध्वं तृ॒प्ता या॑त प॒थिभि॑र्देव॒यानैः॑
verses.transliteration: vā́je-vāje 'vata vājino no  dháneṣu viprā amr̥tā r̥tajñāḥ  asyá mádhvaḥ pibata mādáyadhvaṃ  tr̥ptā́ yāta pathíbhir devayā́naiḥ

translation.text: Deep-skilled in Law eternal, deathless, Singers, O Vajins, help us in each fray for booty. Drink of this meath, he satisfied, be joyful: then go on paths which Gods are wont to travel.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वो अ॒ग्निः सु॑म॒तिं वस्वो॑ अश्रेत्प्रती॒ची जू॒र्णिर्दे॒वता॑तिमेति भे॒जाते॒ अद्री॑ र॒थ्ये॑व॒ पन्था॑मृ॒तं होता॑ न इषि॒तो य॑जाति
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvó agníḥ sumatíṃ vásvo aśret  pratīcī́ jūrṇír devátātim eti  bhejā́te ádrī rathyèva pánthām  r̥táṃ hótā na iṣitó yajāti

translation.text: AGNI, erect, hath shown enriching favour: the flame goes forward to the Gods' assembly. Like car-borne men the stones their path have chosen: let the priest, quickened, celebrate our worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वा॑वृजे सुप्र॒या ब॒र्हिरे॑षा॒मा वि॒श्पती॑व॒ बीरि॑ट इयाते वि॒शाम॒क्तोरु॒षसः॑ पू॒र्वहू॑तौ वा॒युः पू॒षा स्व॒स्तये॑ नि॒युत्वा॑न्
verses.transliteration: prá vāvr̥je suprayā́ barhír eṣām  ā́ viśpátīva bī́riṭa iyāte  viśā́m aktór uṣásaḥ pūrváhūtau  vāyúḥ pūṣā́ svastáye niyútvān

translation.text: Soft to the tread, their sacred grass is scattered: these go like Kings amid the band around them, At the folks early call on Night and Morning,– Vâyu, and Pûshan with his team, to bless us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज्म॒या अत्र॒ वस॑वो रन्त दे॒वा उ॒राव॒न्तरि॑क्षे मर्जयन्त शु॒भ्राः अ॒र्वाक्प॒थ उ॑रुज्रयः कृणुध्वं॒ श्रोता॑ दू॒तस्य॑ ज॒ग्मुषो॑ नो अ॒स्य
verses.transliteration: jmayā́ átra vásavo ranta devā́ḥ-  urā́v antárikṣe marjayanta śubhrā́ḥ  arvā́k pathá urujrayaḥ kr̥ṇudhvaṃ  śrótā dūtásya jagmúṣo no asyá

translation.text: Here on their path the noble Gods proceeded: in the wide firmament the Beauteous decked them. Bend your way hither, ye who travel widely: hear this our envoy who hath gone to meet you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते हि य॒ज्ञेषु॑ य॒ज्ञिया॑स॒ ऊमाः॑ स॒धस्थं॒ विश्वे॑ अ॒भि सन्ति॑ दे॒वाः ताँ अ॑ध्व॒र उ॑श॒तो य॑क्ष्यग्ने श्रु॒ष्टी भगं॒ नास॑त्या॒ पुरं॑धिम्
verses.transliteration: té hí yajñéṣu yajñíyāsa ū́māḥ  sadhásthaṃ víśve abhí sánti devā́ḥ  tā́m̐ adhvará uśató yakṣy agne  śruṣṭī́ bhágaṃ nā́satyā púraṃdhim

translation.text: For they are holy aids at sacrifices: all Gods approach the place of congregation. Bring these, desirous, to our worship, Agni, swift the Nisatyas, Bhaga, and Purandhi.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आग्ने॒ गिरो॑ दि॒व आ पृ॑थि॒व्या मि॒त्रं व॑ह॒ वरु॑ण॒मिन्द्र॑म॒ग्निम् आर्य॒मण॒मदि॑तिं॒ विष्णु॑मेषां॒ सर॑स्वती म॒रुतो॑ मादयन्ताम्
verses.transliteration: ā́gne gíro divá ā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  mitráṃ vaha váruṇam índram agním  ā́ryamáṇam áditiṃ víṣṇum eṣāṃ  sárasvatī marúto mādayantām

translation.text: Agni, to these men's hymns, from earth, from heaven, bring Mitra, Varuṇa, Indra, and Agni, And Aryaman, and Aditi, and Vishṇu. Sarasvatî be joyful, and the Maruts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: र॒रे ह॒व्यं म॒तिभि॑र्य॒ज्ञिया॑नां॒ नक्ष॒त्कामं॒ मर्त्या॑ना॒मसि॑न्वन् धाता॑ र॒यिम॑विद॒स्यं स॑दा॒सां स॑क्षी॒महि॒ युज्ये॑भि॒र्नु दे॒वैः
verses.transliteration: raré havyám matíbhir yajñíyānāṃ  nákṣat kā́mam mártyānām ásinvan  dhā́tā rayím avidasyáṃ sadāsā́ṃ  sakṣīmáhi yújyebhir nú devaíḥ

translation.text: Even as the holy wish, the gift is offered: may he, unsated, come when men desire him. Give never-failing ever-conquering riches: with Gods for our allies may we be victors.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू रोद॑सी अ॒भिष्टु॑ते॒ वसि॑ष्ठैर्ऋ॒तावा॑नो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निः यच्छ॑न्तु च॒न्द्रा उ॑प॒मं नो॑ अ॒र्कं यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: nū́ ródasī abhíṣṭute vásiṣṭhair  r̥tā́vāno váruṇo mitró agníḥ  yáchantu candrā́ upamáṃ no arkáṃ  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Now have both worlds been praised by the Vasishṭhas; and holy Mitra, Varuṇa, and Agni. May they, bright Deities, make our song supremest. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओ श्रु॒ष्टिर्वि॑द॒थ्या॒३॒॑ समे॑तु॒ प्रति॒ स्तोमं॑ दधीमहि तु॒राणा॑म् यद॒द्य दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता सु॒वाति॒ स्यामा॑स्य र॒त्निनो॑ विभा॒गे
verses.transliteration: ó śruṣṭír vidathyā̀ sám etu  práti stómaṃ dadhīmahi turā́ṇām  yád adyá deváḥ savitā́ suvā́ti  syā́māsya ratníno vibhāgé

translation.text: BE gathered all the audience of the synod: let us begin their praise whose course is rapid. Whate'er God Savitar this day produces, may we be where the Wealthy One distributes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्रस्तन्नो॒ वरु॑णो॒ रोद॑सी च॒ द्युभ॑क्त॒मिन्द्रो॑ अर्य॒मा द॑दातु दिदे॑ष्टु दे॒व्यदि॑ती॒ रेक्णो॑ वा॒युश्च॒ यन्नि॑यु॒वैते॒ भग॑श्च
verses.transliteration: mitrás tán no váruṇo ródasī ca  dyúbhaktam índro aryamā́ dadātu  dídeṣṭu devy áditī rékṇo  vāyúś ca yán niyuvaíte bhágaś ca

translation.text: This, dealt from heaven ' may both the Worlds vouchsafe us, and Varuṇa, Indra, Aryaman, and Mitra. May Goddess Aditi assign us riches, Vâyu and Bhaga make them ours for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सेदु॒ग्रो अ॑स्तु मरुतः॒ स शु॒ष्मी यं मर्त्यं॑ पृषदश्वा॒ अवा॑थ उ॒तेम॒ग्निः सर॑स्वती जु॒नन्ति॒ न तस्य॑ रा॒यः प॑र्ये॒तास्ति॑
verses.transliteration: séd ugró astu marutaḥ sá śuṣmī́  yám mártyam pr̥ṣadaśvā ávātha  utém agníḥ sárasvatī junánti  ná tásya rāyáḥ paryetā́sti

translation.text: Strong be the man and full of power, O Maruts, whom ye, borne on by spotted coursers, favour. Him, too, Sarasvatî and Agni further, and there is none to rob him of his riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं हि ने॒ता वरु॑ण ऋ॒तस्य॑ मि॒त्रो राजा॑नो अर्य॒मापो॒ धुः सु॒हवा॑ दे॒व्यदि॑तिरन॒र्वा ते नो॒ अंहो॒ अति॑ पर्ष॒न्नरि॑ष्टान्
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ hí netā́ váruṇa r̥tásya  mitró rā́jāno aryamā́po dhúḥ  suhávā devy áditir anarvā́  té no áṃho áti parṣann áriṣṭān

translation.text: This Varuṇa is guide of Law, he, Mitra, and Aryaman, the Kings, our work have finished. Divine and foeless Aditi quickly listens. May these deliver us unharmed from trouble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य दे॒वस्य॑ मी॒ळ्हुषो॑ व॒या विष्णो॑रे॒षस्य॑ प्रभृ॒थे ह॒विर्भिः॑ वि॒दे हि रु॒द्रो रु॒द्रियं॑ महि॒त्वं या॑सि॒ष्टं व॒र्तिर॑श्विना॒विरा॑वत्
verses.transliteration: asyá devásya mīḷhúṣo [']vayā́ḥ-  víṣṇor eṣásya prabhr̥thé havírbhiḥ  vidé hí rudró rudríyam mahitváṃ  yāsiṣṭáṃ vartír aśvināv írāvat

translation.text: With offerings I propitiate the branches of this swift-moving God, the bounteous Vishṇu. Hence Rudra gained his Rudra-strength: O Aṣvins, ye sought the house that hath celestial viands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मात्र॑ पूषन्नाघृण इरस्यो॒ वरू॑त्री॒ यद्रा॑ति॒षाच॑श्च॒ रास॑न् म॒यो॒भुवो॑ नो॒ अर्व॑न्तो॒ नि पा॑न्तु वृ॒ष्टिं परि॑ज्मा॒ वातो॑ ददातु
verses.transliteration: mā́tra pūṣann āghr̥ṇa irasyo  várūtrī yád rātiṣā́caś ca rā́san  mayobhúvo no árvanto ní pāntu  vr̥ṣṭím párijmā vā́to dadātu

translation.text: Be not thou angry here, O glowing Pûshan, for what Varûtrî and the Bounteous gave us. May the swift-moving Gods protect and bless us, and Vâta send us rain, wha wanders round us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू रोद॑सी अ॒भिष्टु॑ते॒ वसि॑ष्ठैर्ऋ॒तावा॑नो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निः यच्छ॑न्तु च॒न्द्रा उ॑प॒मं नो॑ अ॒र्कं यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: nū́ ródasī abhíṣṭute vásiṣṭhair  r̥tā́vāno váruṇo mitró agníḥ  yáchantu candrā́ upamáṃ no arkáṃ  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Now have both worlds been praised by the Vasishṭhas, and holy Mitra, Varuṇa, and Agni. May they, bright Deities, make our song supremest. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रा॒तर॒ग्निं प्रा॒तरिन्द्रं॑ हवामहे प्रा॒तर्मि॒त्रावरु॑णा प्रा॒तर॒श्विना॑ प्रा॒तर्भगं॑ पू॒षणं॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिं॑ प्रा॒तः सोम॑मु॒त रु॒द्रं हु॑वेम
verses.transliteration: prātár agním prātár índraṃ havāmahe  prātár mitrā́váruṇā prātár aśvínā  prātár bhágam pūṣáṇam bráhmaṇas pátim  prātáḥ sómam utá rudráṃ huvema

translation.text: AGNI at dawn, and Indra we invoke at dawn, and Varuṇa and Mitra, and the Aṣvins twain. Bhaga at dawn, Pûshan, and Brahmaṇaspati, Soma at dawn, Rudra we will invoke at dawn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रा॒त॒र्जितं॒ भग॑मु॒ग्रं हु॑वेम व॒यं पु॒त्रमदि॑ते॒र्यो वि॑ध॒र्ता आ॒ध्रश्चि॒द्यं मन्य॑मानस्तु॒रश्चि॒द्राजा॑ चि॒द्यं भगं॑ भ॒क्षीत्याह॑
verses.transliteration: prātarjítam bhágam ugráṃ huvema  vayám putrám áditer yó vidhartā́  ādhráś cid yám mányamānas turáś cid  rā́jā cid yám bhágam bhakṣī́ty ā́ha

translation.text: We will invoke strong, early-conquering Bhaga, the Son of Aditi, the great supporter: Thinking of whom, the poor, yea, even the mighty, even the King himself says, Give me Bhaga.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भग॒ प्रणे॑त॒र्भग॒ सत्य॑राधो॒ भगे॒मां धिय॒मुद॑वा॒ दद॑न्नः भग॒ प्र णो॑ जनय॒ गोभि॒रश्वै॒र्भग॒ प्र नृभि॑र्नृ॒वन्तः॑ स्याम
verses.transliteration: bhága práṇetar bhága sátyarādho  bhágemā́ṃ dhíyam úd avā dádan naḥ  bhága prá ṇo janaya góbhir áśvair  bhága prá nŕ̥bhir nr̥vántaḥ syāma

translation.text: Bhaga our guide, Bhaga whose gifts are faithful, favour this song, and give us wealth, O Bhaga. Bhaga, augment our store of kine and horses, Bhaga, may we be rich in men and heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒तेदानीं॒ भग॑वन्तः स्यामो॒त प्र॑पि॒त्व उ॒त मध्ये॒ अह्ना॑म् उ॒तोदि॑ता मघव॒न्त्सूर्य॑स्य व॒यं दे॒वानां॑ सुम॒तौ स्या॑म
verses.transliteration: utédā́nīm bhágavantaḥ syāma-  -utá prapitvá utá mádhye áhnām  utóditā maghavan sū́ryasya  vayáṃ devā́nāṃ sumataú syāma

translation.text: So may felicity be ours at present, and when the day approaches, and at noontide; And may we still, O Bounteous One, at sunset be happy in the Deities' loving-kindness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भग॑ ए॒व भग॑वाँ अस्तु देवा॒स्तेन॑ व॒यं भग॑वन्तः स्याम तं त्वा॑ भग॒ सर्व॒ इज्जो॑हवीति॒ स नो॑ भग पुरए॒ता भ॑वे॒ह
verses.transliteration: bhága evá bhágavām̐ astu devās  téna vayám bhágavantaḥ syāma  táṃ tvā bhaga sárva íj johavīti  sá no bhaga puraetā́ bhavehá

translation.text: May Bhaga verily be bliss-bestower, and through him, Gods! may happiness attend us. As such, O Bhaga, all with might invoke thee: as such be thou our Champion here, O Bhaga.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सम॑ध्व॒रायो॒षसो॑ नमन्त दधि॒क्रावे॑व॒ शुच॑ये प॒दाय॑ अ॒र्वा॒ची॒नं व॑सु॒विदं॒ भगं॑ नो॒ रथ॑मि॒वाश्वा॑ वा॒जिन॒ आ व॑हन्तु
verses.transliteration: sám adhvarā́yoṣáso namanta  dadhikrā́veva śúcaye padā́ya  arvācīnáṃ vasuvídam bhágaṃ no  rátham ivā́śvā vājína ā́ vahantu

translation.text: To this our worship may all Dawns incline them, and come to the pure place like Dadhikrâvan. As strong steeds draw a chariot may they bring us hitherward Bhaga who discovers treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वा॑वती॒र्गोम॑तीर्न उ॒षासो॑ वी॒रव॑तीः॒ सद॑मुच्छन्तु भ॒द्राः घृ॒तं दुहा॑ना वि॒श्वतः॒ प्रपी॑ता यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: áśvāvatīr gómatīr na uṣā́so  vīrávatīḥ sádam uchantu bhadrā́ḥ  ghr̥táṃ dúhānā viśvátaḥ prápītāḥ-  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: May blessed Mornings dawn on us for ever, with wealth of kine, of horses, and of heroes, Streaming with all abundance, pouring fatness. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ब्र॒ह्माणो॒ अङ्गि॑रसो नक्षन्त॒ प्र क्र॑न्द॒नुर्न॑भ॒न्य॑स्य वेतु प्र धे॒नव॑ उद॒प्रुतो॑ नवन्त यु॒ज्याता॒मद्री॑ अध्व॒रस्य॒ पेशः॑
verses.transliteration: prá brahmā́ṇo áṅgiraso nakṣanta  prá krandanúr nabhanyàsya vetu  prá dhenáva udaprúto navanta  yujyā́tām ádrī adhvarásya péśaḥ

translation.text: LET Brahmans and Angirases come forward, and let the roar of cloudy heaven surround us. Loud low the Milch-kine swimming in the waters: set be the stones that grace our holy service.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒गस्ते॑ अग्ने॒ सन॑वित्तो॒ अध्वा॑ यु॒क्ष्वा सु॒ते ह॒रितो॑ रो॒हित॑श्च ये वा॒ सद्म॑न्नरु॒षा वी॑र॒वाहो॑ हु॒वे दे॒वानां॒ जनि॑मानि स॒त्तः
verses.transliteration: sugás te agne sánavitto ádhvā  yukṣvā́ suté haríto rohítaś ca  yé vā sádmann aruṣā́ vīravā́ho  huvé devā́nāṃ jánimāni sattáḥ

translation.text: Fair, Agni, is thy long-known path to travel: yoke for the juice tfiy bay, thy ruddy horses, Or red steeds, Hero-bearing, for the chamber. Seated, I call the Deities' generations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समु॑ वो य॒ज्ञं म॑हय॒न्नमो॑भिः॒ प्र होता॑ म॒न्द्रो रि॑रिच उपा॒के यज॑स्व॒ सु पु॑र्वणीक दे॒वाना य॒ज्ञिया॑म॒रम॑तिं ववृत्याः
verses.transliteration: sám u vo yajñám mahayan námobhiḥ  prá hótā mandró ririca upāké  yájasva sú purvaṇīka devā́n  ā́ yajñíyām arámatiṃ vavr̥tyāḥ

translation.text: They glorify your sacrifice with worship, yet the glad Priest near them is left unequalled. Bring the Gods hither, thou of many aspects: turn hitherward Aramati the Holy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒दा वी॒रस्य॑ रे॒वतो॑ दुरो॒णे स्यो॑न॒शीरति॑थिरा॒चिके॑तत् सुप्री॑तो अ॒ग्निः सुधि॑तो॒ दम॒ आ स वि॒शे दा॑ति॒ वार्य॒मिय॑त्यै
verses.transliteration: yadā́ vīrásya reváto duroṇé  syonaśī́r átithir ācíketat  súprīto agníḥ súdhito dáma~ā́  sá viśé dāti vā́ryam íyatyai

translation.text: What time the Guest hath made himself apparent, at ease reclining in the rich man's dwelling, Agni, well-pleased, well-placed within the chamber gives to a house like this wealth worth the choosing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं नो॑ अग्ने अध्व॒रं जु॑षस्व म॒रुत्स्विन्द्रे॑ य॒शसं॑ कृधी नः आ नक्ता॑ ब॒र्हिः स॑दतामु॒षासो॒शन्ता॑ मि॒त्रावरु॑णा यजे॒ह
verses.transliteration: imáṃ no agne adhvaráṃ juṣasva  marútsv índre yaśásaṃ kr̥dhī naḥ  ā́ náktā barhíḥ sadatām uṣā́sā-  -uśántā mitrā́váruṇā yajehá

translation.text: Accept this sacrifice of ours, O Agni; glorify it with Indra and the Maruts. Here on our grass let Night and Dawn be seated: bring longing Varuṇa and Mitra hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वाग्निं स॑ह॒स्यं१॒॑ वसि॑ष्ठो रा॒यस्का॑मो वि॒श्वप्स्न्य॑स्य स्तौत् इषं॑ र॒यिं प॑प्रथ॒द्वाज॑म॒स्मे यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: evā́gníṃ sahasyàṃ vásiṣṭho  rāyáskāmo viśvápsnyasya staut  íṣaṃ rayím paprathad vā́jam asmé  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Thus hath Vasishṭha praised victorious Agni, yearning for wealth that giveth all subsistence. May he bestow on us food, strength, and riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॑ य॒ज्ञेषु॑ देव॒यन्तो॑ अर्च॒न्द्यावा॒ नमो॑भिः पृथि॒वी इ॒षध्यै॑ येषां॒ ब्रह्मा॒ण्यस॑मानि॒ विप्रा॒ विष्व॑ग्वि॒यन्ति॑ व॒निनो॒ न शाखाः॑
verses.transliteration: prá vo yajñéṣu devayánto arcan  dyā́vā námobhiḥ pr̥thivī́ iṣádhyai  yéṣām bráhmāṇy ásamāni víprā  víṣvag viyánti vaníno ná śā́khāḥ

translation.text: SING out the pious at your sacrifices to move with adorations Earth and Heaven- The Holy Singers, whose unmatched devotions, like a tree's branches, part in all directions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र य॒ज्ञ ए॑तु॒ हेत्वो॒ न सप्ति॒रुद्य॑च्छध्वं॒ सम॑नसो घृ॒ताचीः॑ स्तृ॒णी॒त ब॒र्हिर॑ध्व॒राय॑ सा॒धूर्ध्वा शो॒चींषि॑ देव॒यून्य॑स्थुः
verses.transliteration: prá yajñá etu hétvo ná sáptir  úd yachadhvaṃ sámanaso ghr̥tā́cīḥ  str̥ṇītá barhír adhvarā́ya sādhú-  -ūrdhvā́ śocī́ṃṣi devayū́ny asthuḥ

translation.text: Let sacrifice proceed like some fleet courser: with one accord lift ye on high the ladles. Strew sacred grass meet for the solenm service: bright flames that love the Gods have mounted upward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ पु॒त्रासो॒ न मा॒तरं॒ विभृ॑त्राः॒ सानौ॑ दे॒वासो॑ ब॒र्हिषः॑ सदन्तु आ वि॒श्वाची॑ विद॒थ्या॑मन॒क्त्वग्ने॒ मा नो॑ दे॒वता॑ता॒ मृध॑स्कः
verses.transliteration: ā́ putrā́so ná mātáraṃ víbhr̥trāḥ  sā́nau devā́so barhíṣaḥ sadantu  ā́ viśvā́cī vidathyā̀m anaktu-  ágne mā́ no devátātā mŕ̥dhas kaḥ

translation.text: Like babes in arms reposing on their mother, let the Gods sit upon the grass's summit. Let general fire make bright the flame of worship: scorn us not, Agni, in the Gods' assembly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते सी॑षपन्त॒ जोष॒मा यज॑त्रा ऋ॒तस्य॒ धाराः॑ सु॒दुघा॒ दुहा॑नाः ज्येष्ठं॑ वो अ॒द्य मह॒ आ वसू॑ना॒मा ग॑न्तन॒ सम॑नसो॒ यति॒ ष्ठ
verses.transliteration: té sīṣapanta jóṣam ā́ yájatrāḥ-  r̥tásya dhā́rāḥ sudúghā dúhānāḥ  jyéṣṭhaṃ vo adyá máha ā́ vásūnām  ā́ gantana sámanaso yáti ṣṭhá

translation.text: Gladly the Gods have let themselves be honoured, milking the copious streams of holy Order. The highest might to-day is yours, the Vasits': come ye, as many as ye are, one-minded.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा नो॑ अग्ने वि॒क्ष्वा द॑शस्य॒ त्वया॑ व॒यं स॑हसाव॒न्नास्क्राः॑ रा॒या यु॒जा स॑ध॒मादो॒ अरि॑ष्टा यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: evā́ no agne vikṣv ā́ daśasya  tváyā vayáṃ sahasāvann ā́skrāḥ  rāyā́ yujā́ sadhamā́do áriṣṭāḥ-  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: So, Agni, send us wealth among the people: may we be closely knit to thee, O Victor, Unharmed, and rich, and taking joy together. Preserve us evermore, ye ods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒धि॒क्रां वः॑ प्रथ॒मम॒श्विनो॒षस॑म॒ग्निं समि॑द्धं॒ भग॑मू॒तये॑ हुवे इन्द्रं॒ विष्णुं॑ पू॒षणं॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पति॑मादि॒त्यान्द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॒पः स्वः॑
verses.transliteration: dadhikrā́ṃ vaḥ prathamám aśvínoṣásam  agníṃ sámiddham bhágam ūtáye huve  índraṃ víṣṇum pūṣáṇam bráhmaṇas pátim  ādityā́n dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ apáḥ svàḥ

translation.text: I CALL on Dadhikrâs, the first, to give you aid, the Aṣvins, Bhaga, Dawn, and Agni kindled well, Indra, and Vishṇu, Pûshan, Brahmaṇaspati, Âdityas, Heaven and Earth, the Waters, and the Light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒धि॒क्रामु॒ नम॑सा बो॒धय॑न्त उ॒दीरा॑णा य॒ज्ञमु॑पप्र॒यन्तः॑ इळां॑ दे॒वीं ब॒र्हिषि॑ सा॒दय॑न्तो॒ऽश्विना॒ विप्रा॑ सु॒हवा॑ हुवेम
verses.transliteration: dadhikrā́m u námasā bodháyantaḥ-  udī́rāṇā yajñám upaprayántaḥ  íḷāṃ devī́m barhíṣi sādáyanto  -aśvínā víprā suhávā huvema

translation.text: When, rising, to the sacrifice we hasten, awaking Dadhikrâs with adorations. Seating on sacred grass the Goddess Iḷâ. let us invoke the sage swift-hearing Aṣvins.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒धि॒क्रावा॑णं बुबुधा॒नो अ॒ग्निमुप॑ ब्रुव उ॒षसं॒ सूर्यं॒ गाम् ब्र॒ध्नं मँ॑श्च॒तोर्वरु॑णस्य ब॒भ्रुं ते विश्वा॒स्मद्दु॑रि॒ता या॑वयन्तु
verses.transliteration: dadhikrā́vāṇam bubudhānó agním  úpa bruva uṣásaṃ sū́ryaṃ gā́m  bradhnám mām̐ścatór váruṇasya babhrúṃ  té víśvāsmád duritā́ yāvayantu

translation.text: While I am thus arousing Dadhikrâvan I speak to Agni, Earth, and Dawn, and Sûrya, The red, the brown of Varuṇa ever mindful: may they ward off from us all grief and trouble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒धि॒क्रावा॑ प्रथ॒मो वा॒ज्यर्वाग्रे॒ रथा॑नां भवति प्रजा॒नन् सं॒वि॒दा॒न उ॒षसा॒ सूर्ये॑णादि॒त्येभि॒र्वसु॑भि॒रङ्गि॑रोभिः
verses.transliteration: dadhikrā́vā prathamó vājy árvā-  -ágre ráthānām bhavati prajānán  saṃvidāná uṣásā sū́ryeṇa-  -ādityébhir vásubhir áṅgirobhiḥ

translation.text: Foremost is Dadhikrâvan, vigorous courser; in forefront of the cars, his way he knoweth, Closely allied with Sûrya and with Morning, Âdityas, and Angirases, and Vasus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ दधि॒क्राः प॒थ्या॑मनक्त्वृ॒तस्य॒ पन्था॒मन्वे॑त॒वा उ॑ शृ॒णोतु॑ नो॒ दैव्यं॒ शर्धो॑ अ॒ग्निः शृ॒ण्वन्तु॒ विश्वे॑ महि॒षा अमू॑राः
verses.transliteration: ā́ no dadhikrā́ḥ pathyā̀m anaktu-  r̥tásya pánthām ánvetavā́ u  śr̥ṇótu no daívyaṃ śárdho agníḥ  śr̥ṇvántu víśve mahiṣā́ ámūrāḥ

translation.text: May Dadhikrâs prepare the way we travel that we may pass along the path of Order. May Agni bear us, and the Heavenly Army: hear us all Mighty Ones whom none deceiveth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ दे॒वो या॑तु सवि॒ता सु॒रत्नो॑ऽन्तरिक्ष॒प्रा वह॑मानो॒ अश्वैः॑ हस्ते॒ दधा॑नो॒ नर्या॑ पु॒रूणि॑ निवे॒शय॑ञ्च प्रसु॒वञ्च॒ भूम॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ devó yātu savitā́ surátno  -antarikṣaprā́ váhamāno áśvaiḥ  háste dádhāno náryā purū́ṇi  niveśáyañ ca prasuváñ ca bhū́ma

translation.text: MAY the God Savitar, rich in goodly treasures, filling the region, borne by steeds, come hither, In his hand holding much that makes men happy, lulling to slumber and arousing creatures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद॑स्य बा॒हू शि॑थि॒रा बृ॒हन्ता॑ हिर॒ण्यया॑ दि॒वो अन्ताँ॑ अनष्टाम् नू॒नं सो अ॑स्य महि॒मा प॑निष्ट॒ सूर॑श्चिदस्मा॒ अनु॑ दादप॒स्याम्
verses.transliteration: úd asya bāhū́ śithirā́ br̥hántā  hiraṇyáyā divó ántām̐ anaṣṭām  nūnáṃ só asya mahimā́ paniṣṭa  sū́raś cid asmā ánu dād apasyā́m

translation.text: Golden, sublime, and easy in their motion, his arms extend unto the bounds of heaven. Now shall that mightiness of his he lauded: even Sûrya yields to him in active vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स घा॑ नो दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता स॒हावा सा॑विष॒द्वसु॑पति॒र्वसू॑नि वि॒श्रय॑माणो अ॒मति॑मुरू॒चीं म॑र्त॒भोज॑न॒मध॑ रासते नः
verses.transliteration: sá ghā no deváḥ savitā́ sahā́vā-  -ā́ sāviṣad vásupatir vásūni  viśráyamāṇo amátim urūcī́m  martabhójanam ádha rāsate naḥ

translation.text: May this God Savitar, the Strong and Mighty, the Lord of precious wealth, vouchsafe us treasures. May he, advancing his far-spreading lustre, bestow on us the food that feedeth mortals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा गिरः॑ सवि॒तारं॑ सुजि॒ह्वं पू॒र्णग॑भस्तिमीळते सुपा॒णिम् चि॒त्रं वयो॑ बृ॒हद॒स्मे द॑धातु यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: imā́ gíraḥ savitā́raṃ sujihvám  pūrṇágabhastim īḷate supāṇím  citráṃ váyo br̥hád asmé dadhātu  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: These songs praise Savitar whose tongue is pleasant, praise him whose arms are full, whose hands are lovely. High vital strength, and manifold, may he grant us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा रु॒द्राय॑ स्थि॒रध॑न्वने॒ गिरः॑ क्षि॒प्रेष॑वे दे॒वाय॑ स्व॒धाव्ने॑ अषा॑ळ्हाय॒ सह॑मानाय वे॒धसे॑ ति॒ग्मायु॑धाय भरता शृ॒णोतु॑ नः
verses.transliteration: imā́ rudrā́ya sthirádhanvane gíraḥ  kṣipréṣave devā́ya svadhā́vne  -áṣāḷhāya sáhamānāya vedháse  tigmā́yudhāya bharatā śr̥ṇótu naḥ

translation.text: To Rudra bring these songs, whose bow is firm and strong, the self-dependent God with swiftlyflying shafts, The Wise, the Conqueror whom none may overcome, armed with sharp-pointed weapons: may he hear our call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि क्षये॑ण॒ क्षम्य॑स्य॒ जन्म॑नः॒ साम्रा॑ज्येन दि॒व्यस्य॒ चेत॑ति अव॒न्नव॑न्ती॒रुप॑ नो॒ दुर॑श्चरानमी॒वो रु॑द्र॒ जासु॑ नो भव
verses.transliteration: sá hí kṣáyeṇa kṣámyasya jánmanaḥ  sā́mrājyena divyásya cétati  ávann ávantīr úpa no dúraś cara-  -anamīvó rudra jā́su no bhava

translation.text: He through his lordship thinks on beings of the earth, on heavenly beings through his high imperial sway. Come willingly to our doors that gladly welcome thee, and heal all sickness, Rudra., in our families.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या ते॑ दि॒द्युदव॑सृष्टा दि॒वस्परि॑ क्ष्म॒या चर॑ति॒ परि॒ सा वृ॑णक्तु नः स॒हस्रं॑ ते स्वपिवात भेष॒जा मा न॑स्तो॒केषु॒ तन॑येषु रीरिषः
verses.transliteration: yā́ te didyúd ávasr̥ṣṭā divás pári  kṣmayā́ cárati pári sā́ vr̥ṇaktu naḥ  sahásraṃ te svapivāta bheṣajā́  mā́ nas tokéṣu tánayeṣu rīriṣaḥ

translation.text: May thy bright arrow which, shot down by thee from heaven, flieth upon the earth, pass us uninjured by. Thou, very gracious God, bast thousand medicines: inflict no evil on our sons or progeny.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॑ वधी रुद्र॒ मा परा॑ दा॒ मा ते॑ भूम॒ प्रसि॑तौ हीळि॒तस्य॑ आ नो॑ भज ब॒र्हिषि॑ जीवशं॒से यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: mā́ no vadhī rudra mā́ párā dāḥ-  mā́ te bhūma prásitau hīḷitásya  ā́ no bhaja barhíṣi jīvaśaṃsé  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Slay us not, nor abandon us, O Rudra let not thy noose, when thou art angry, seize us. Give us trimmed grass and fame among the living. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आपो॒ यं वः॑ प्रथ॒मं दे॑व॒यन्त॑ इन्द्र॒पान॑मू॒र्मिमकृ॑ण्वते॒ळः तं वो॑ व॒यं शुचि॑मरि॒प्रम॒द्य घृ॑त॒प्रुषं॒ मधु॑मन्तं वनेम
verses.transliteration: ā́po yáṃ vaḥ prathamáṃ devayántaḥ-  indrapā́nam ūrmím ákr̥ṇvateḷáḥ  táṃ vo vayáṃ śúcim ariprám adyá  ghr̥taprúṣam mádhumantaṃ vanema

translation.text: MAY we obtain this day from you, O Waters, that wave of pure refreshment, which the pious Made erst the special beverage of Indra, bright, stainless, rich in sweets and dropping fatness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमू॒र्मिमा॑पो॒ मधु॑मत्तमं वो॒ऽपां नपा॑दवत्वाशु॒हेमा॑ यस्मि॒न्निन्द्रो॒ वसु॑भिर्मा॒दया॑ते॒ तम॑श्याम देव॒यन्तो॑ वो अ॒द्य
verses.transliteration: tám ūrmím āpo mádhumattamaṃ vo  -apā́ṃ nápād avatv āśuhémā  yásminn índro vásubhir mādáyāte  tám aśyāma devayánto vo adyá

translation.text: May the Floods' Offspring, he whose course is rapid, protect that wave most rich in sweets, O Waters, That shall make Indra and the Vasus joyful. This may we gain from you to-day, we pious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तप॑वित्राः स्व॒धया॒ मद॑न्तीर्दे॒वीर्दे॒वाना॒मपि॑ यन्ति॒ पाथः॑ ता इन्द्र॑स्य॒ न मि॑नन्ति व्र॒तानि॒ सिन्धु॑भ्यो ह॒व्यं घृ॒तव॑ज्जुहोत
verses.transliteration: śatápavitrāḥ svadháyā mádantīr  devī́r devā́nām ápi yanti pā́thaḥ  tā́ índrasya ná minanti vratā́ni  síndhubhyo havyáṃ ghr̥távaj juhota

translation.text: All-purifying, joying in their nature, to paths of Gods the Goddesses move onward. They never violate the laws of Indra. Present the oil-rich offering to the Rivers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याः सूर्यो॑ र॒श्मिभि॑रात॒तान॒ याभ्य॒ इन्द्रो॒ अर॑दद्गा॒तुमू॒र्मिम् ते सि॑न्धवो॒ वरि॑वो धातना नो यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: yā́ḥ sū́ryo raśmíbhir ātatā́na  yā́bhya índro áradad gātúm ūrmím  té sindhavo várivo dhātanā no  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Whom Sûrya with his bright beams hath attracted, and Indra dug the path for them to travel, May these Streams give us ample room and freedom. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋभु॑क्षणो वाजा मा॒दय॑ध्वम॒स्मे न॑रो मघवानः सु॒तस्य॑ आ वो॒ऽर्वाचः॒ क्रत॑वो॒ न या॒तां विभ्वो॒ रथं॒ नर्यं॑ वर्तयन्तु
verses.transliteration: ŕ̥bhukṣaṇo vājā mādáyadhvam  asmé naro maghavānaḥ sutásya  ā́ vo 'rvā́caḥ krátavo ná yātā́ṃ  víbhvo ráthaṃ náryaṃ vartayantu

translation.text: YE liberal Heroes, Vâjas and R̥ibhukshans, come and delight you with our flowing Soma. May your strength, Vibhûs, as ye come to meet us, turn hitherward your car that brings men profit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒भुर्ऋ॒भुभि॑र॒भि वः॑ स्याम॒ विभ्वो॑ वि॒भुभिः॒ शव॑सा॒ शवां॑सि वाजो॑ अ॒स्माँ अ॑वतु॒ वाज॑साता॒विन्द्रे॑ण यु॒जा त॑रुषेम वृ॒त्रम्
verses.transliteration: r̥bhúr r̥bhúbhir abhí vaḥ syāma  víbhvo vibhúbhiḥ śávasā śávāṃsi  vā́jo asmā́m̐ avatu vā́jasātāv  índreṇa yujā́ taruṣema vr̥trám

translation.text: May we as R̥ibhu with your R̥ibhus conquer strength with our strength, as Vibhûs with the Vibhûs. May Vâja aid us in the fight for booty, and helped by Indra may we quell the foeman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते चि॒द्धि पू॒र्वीर॒भि सन्ति॑ शा॒सा विश्वाँ॑ अ॒र्य उ॑प॒रता॑ति वन्वन् इन्द्रो॒ विभ्वाँ॑ ऋभु॒क्षा वाजो॑ अ॒र्यः शत्रो॑र्मिथ॒त्या कृ॑णव॒न्वि नृ॒म्णम्
verses.transliteration: té cid dhí pūrvī́r abhí sánti śāsā́  víśvām̐ aryá uparátāti vanvan  índro víbhvām̐ r̥bhukṣā́ vā́jo aryáḥ  śátror mithatyā́ kr̥ṇavan ví nr̥mṇám

translation.text: For they rule many tribes with high dominion, and conquer all their foes in close encounter. May Indra, Vibhvan, Vâja, and R̥ibhukshan destroy by turns the wicked foeman's valour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू दे॑वासो॒ वरि॑वः कर्तना नो भू॒त नो॒ विश्वेऽव॑से स॒जोषाः॑ सम॒स्मे इषं॒ वस॑वो ददीरन्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: nū́ devāso várivaḥ kartanā no  bhūtá no víśvé 'vase sajóṣāḥ  sám asmé íṣaṃ vásavo dadīran  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Now, Deities, give us ample room and freedom: be all of you, one-minded, our protection. So let the Vasus grant us strength and vigour. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मु॒द्रज्ये॑ष्ठाः सलि॒लस्य॒ मध्या॑त्पुना॒ना य॒न्त्यनि॑विशमानाः इन्द्रो॒ या व॒ज्री वृ॑ष॒भो र॒राद॒ ता आपो॑ दे॒वीरि॒ह माम॑वन्तु
verses.transliteration: samudrájyeṣṭhāḥ salilásya mádhyāt  punānā́ yanty ániviśamānāḥ  índro yā́ vajrī́ vr̥ṣabhó rarā́da  tā́ ā́po devī́r ihá mā́m avantu

translation.text: FORTH from the middle of the flood the Waters-their chief the Sea-flow cleansing, never sleeping. Indra, the Bull, the Thunderer, dug their channels: here let those Waters, Goddesses, protect me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या आपो॑ दि॒व्या उ॒त वा॒ स्रव॑न्ति ख॒नित्रि॑मा उ॒त वा॒ याः स्व॑यं॒जाः स॒मु॒द्रार्था॒ याः शुच॑यः पाव॒कास्ता आपो॑ दे॒वीरि॒ह माम॑वन्तु
verses.transliteration: yā́ ā́po divyā́ utá vā srávanti  khanítrimā utá vā yā́ḥ svayaṃjā́ḥ  samudrā́rthā yā́ḥ śúcayaḥ pāvakā́s  tā́ ā́po devī́r ihá mā́m avantu

translation.text: Waters which come from heaven, or those that wander dug from the earth, or flowing free by nature, Bright, purifying, speeding to the Ocean, here let those Waters. Goddesses, protect me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यासां॒ राजा॒ वरु॑णो॒ याति॒ मध्ये॑ सत्यानृ॒ते अ॑व॒पश्य॒ञ्जना॑नाम् म॒धु॒श्चुतः॒ शुच॑यो॒ याः पा॑व॒कास्ता आपो॑ दे॒वीरि॒ह माम॑वन्तु
verses.transliteration: yā́sāṃ rā́jā váruṇo yā́ti mádhye  satyānr̥té avapáśyañ jánānām  madhuścútaḥ śúcayo yā́ḥ pāvakā́s  tā́ ā́po devī́r ihá mā́m avantu

translation.text: Those amid whom goes Varuṇa the Sovran, he who discriminates men's truth and falsehood- Distilling meath, the bright, the purifying, here let those Waters, Goddesses, protect me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यासु॒ राजा॒ वरु॑णो॒ यासु॒ सोमो॒ विश्वे॑ दे॒वा यासूर्जं॒ मद॑न्ति वै॒श्वा॒न॒रो यास्व॒ग्निः प्रवि॑ष्ट॒स्ता आपो॑ दे॒वीरि॒ह माम॑वन्तु
verses.transliteration: yā́su rā́jā váruṇo yā́su sómo  víśve devā́ yā́sū́rjam mádanti  vaiśvānaró yā́sv agníḥ práviṣṭas  tā́ ā́po devī́r ihá mā́m avantu

translation.text: They from whom Varuṇa the King, and Soma, and all the Deities drink strength and vigour, They into whom Vaiṣvânara Agni entered, here let those Waters, Goddesses, protect Me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ मां मि॑त्रावरुणे॒ह र॑क्षतं कुला॒यय॑द्वि॒श्वय॒न्मा न॒ आ ग॑न् अ॒ज॒का॒वं दु॒र्दृशी॑कं ति॒रो द॑धे॒ मा मां पद्ये॑न॒ रप॑सा विद॒त्त्सरुः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ mā́m mitrāvaruṇehá rakṣataṃ  kulāyáyad viśváyan mā́ na ā́ gan  ajakāváṃ durdŕ̥śīkaṃ tiró dadhe  mā́ mā́m pádyena rápasā vidat tsáruḥ

translation.text: O MITRA-Varuṇa, guard and protect me here: let not that come to me which nests within and swells. I drive afar the scorpion hateful to the sight: let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्वि॒जाम॒न्परु॑षि॒ वन्द॑नं॒ भुव॑दष्ठी॒वन्तौ॒ परि॑ कु॒ल्फौ च॒ देह॑त् अ॒ग्निष्टच्छोच॒न्नप॑ बाधतामि॒तो मा मां पद्ये॑न॒ रप॑सा विद॒त्त्सरुः॑
verses.transliteration: yád vijā́man páruṣi vándanam bhúvad  aṣṭhīvántau pári kulphaú ca déhat  agníṣ ṭác chócann ápa bādhatām itó  mā́ mā́m pádyena rápasā vidat tsáruḥ

translation.text: Eruption that appears upon the twofold joints, and that which overspreads the ankles and the knees, May the refulgent Agni banish far away let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यच्छ॑ल्म॒लौ भव॑ति॒ यन्न॒दीषु॒ यदोष॑धीभ्यः॒ परि॒ जाय॑ते वि॒षम् विश्वे॑ दे॒वा निरि॒तस्तत्सु॑वन्तु॒ मा मां पद्ये॑न॒ रप॑सा विद॒त्त्सरुः॑
verses.transliteration: yác chalmalaú bhávati yán nadī́ṣu  yád óṣadhībhyaḥ pári jā́yate viṣám  víśve devā́ nír itás tát suvantu  mā́ mā́m pádyena rápasā vidat tsáruḥ

translation.text: The poison that is formed upon the Ṣalmali, that which is found in streams, that which the plants produce, All this may all the Gods banish and drive away: let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याः प्र॒वतो॑ नि॒वत॑ उ॒द्वत॑ उद॒न्वती॑रनुद॒काश्च॒ याः ता अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ पय॑सा॒ पिन्व॑मानाः शि॒वा दे॒वीर॑शिप॒दा भ॑वन्तु॒ सर्वा॑ न॒द्यो॑ अशिमि॒दा भ॑वन्तु
verses.transliteration: yā́ḥ praváto niváta udvátaḥ-  udanvátīr anudakā́ś ca yā́ḥ  tā́ asmábhyam páyasā pínvamānāḥ  śivā́ devī́r aśipadā́ bhavantu  sárvā nadyò aśimidā́ bhavantu

translation.text: The steep declivities, the valleys, and the heights, the channels full of water, and the waterless- May those who swell with water, gracious Goddesses, never afflict us with the Ṣipada disease, may all the rivers keep us free from Ṣimidâ.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒दि॒त्याना॒मव॑सा॒ नूत॑नेन सक्षी॒महि॒ शर्म॑णा॒ शंत॑मेन अ॒ना॒गा॒स्त्वे अ॑दिति॒त्वे तु॒रास॑ इ॒मं य॒ज्ञं द॑धतु॒ श्रोष॑माणाः
verses.transliteration: ādityā́nām ávasā nū́tanena  sakṣīmáhi śármaṇā śáṃtamena  anāgāstvé adititvé turā́saḥ-  imáṃ yajñáṃ dadhatu śróṣamāṇāḥ

translation.text: THROUGH the Âdityas' most auspicious shelter, through their most recent succour may we conquer. May they, the Mighty, giving ear, establish this sacrifice, to make us free and sinless.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒दि॒त्यासो॒ अदि॑तिर्मादयन्तां मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा वरु॑णो॒ रजि॑ष्ठाः अ॒स्माकं॑ सन्तु॒ भुव॑नस्य गो॒पाः पिब॑न्तु॒ सोम॒मव॑से नो अ॒द्य
verses.transliteration: ādityā́so áditir mādayantām  mitró aryamā́ váruṇo rájiṣṭhāḥ  asmā́kaṃ santu bhúvanasya gopā́ḥ  píbantu sómam ávase no adyá

translation.text: Let Aditi rejoice and the Âdityas, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, most righteous. May they, the Guardians of the world, protect us, and, to show favour, drink this day our Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒दि॒त्या विश्वे॑ म॒रुत॑श्च॒ विश्वे॑ दे॒वाश्च॒ विश्व॑ ऋ॒भव॑श्च॒ विश्वे॑ इन्द्रो॑ अ॒ग्निर॒श्विना॑ तुष्टुवा॒ना यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: ādityā́ víśve marútaś ca víśve  devā́ś ca víśva r̥bhávaś ca víśve  índro agnír aśvínā tuṣṭuvānā́ḥ-  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: All Universal Deities, the Maruts, all the Âdityas, yea, and all the R̥ibhus, Indra, and Agni, and the Aṣvins, lauded. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒दि॒त्यासो॒ अदि॑तयः स्याम॒ पूर्दे॑व॒त्रा व॑सवो मर्त्य॒त्रा सने॑म मित्रावरुणा॒ सन॑न्तो॒ भवे॑म द्यावापृथिवी॒ भव॑न्तः
verses.transliteration: ādityā́so áditayaḥ syāma  pū́r devatrā́ vasavo martyatrā́  sánema mitrāvaruṇā sánanto  bhávema dyāvāpr̥thivī bhávantaḥ

translation.text: MAY we be free from every bond, Âdityas! a castle among Gods and men, ye Vasus. Winning, may we win Varuṇa and Mitra, and, being, may we be, O Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्रस्तन्नो॒ वरु॑णो मामहन्त॒ शर्म॑ तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय गो॒पाः मा वो॑ भुजेमा॒न्यजा॑त॒मेनो॒ मा तत्क॑र्म वसवो॒ यच्चय॑ध्वे
verses.transliteration: mitrás tán no váruṇo māmahanta  śárma tokā́ya tánayāya gopā́ḥ  mā́ vo bhujemānyájātam éno  mā́ tát karma vasavo yác cáyadhve

translation.text: May Varuṇa and Mitra grant this blessing, our Guardians, shelter to our seed and offspring. Let us not suffer for another's trespass. nor do the thing that ye, O Vasus, punish.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तु॒र॒ण्यवोऽङ्गि॑रसो नक्षन्त॒ रत्नं॑ दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुरि॑या॒नाः पि॒ता च॒ तन्नो॑ म॒हान्यज॑त्रो॒ विश्वे॑ दे॒वाः सम॑नसो जुषन्त
verses.transliteration: turaṇyávó 'ṅgiraso nakṣanta  rátnaṃ devásya savitúr iyānā́ḥ  pitā́ ca tán no mahā́n yájatro  víśve devā́ḥ sámanaso juṣanta

translation.text: The ever-prompt Angirases, imploring riches from Savitar the God, obtained them. So may our Father who is great and holy, and all the Gods, accordant, grant this favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र द्यावा॑ य॒ज्ञैः पृ॑थि॒वी नमो॑भिः स॒बाध॑ ईळे बृह॒ती यज॑त्रे ते चि॒द्धि पूर्वे॑ क॒वयो॑ गृ॒णन्तः॑ पु॒रो म॒ही द॑धि॒रे दे॒वपु॑त्रे
verses.transliteration: prá dyā́vā yajñaíḥ pr̥thivī́ námobhiḥ  sabā́dha īḷe br̥hatī́ yájatre  té cid dhí pū́rve kaváyo gr̥ṇántaḥ  puró mahī́ dadhiré deváputre

translation.text: AS priest with solemn rites and adorations I worship Heaven and Earth, the High and Holy. To them, great Parents of the Gods, have sages of ancient time, singing, assigned precedence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र पू॑र्व॒जे पि॒तरा॒ नव्य॑सीभिर्गी॒र्भिः कृ॑णुध्वं॒ सद॑ने ऋ॒तस्य॑ आ नो॑ द्यावापृथिवी॒ दैव्ये॑न॒ जने॑न यातं॒ महि॑ वां॒ वरू॑थम्
verses.transliteration: prá pūrvajé pitárā návyasībhir  gīrbhíḥ kr̥ṇudhvaṃ sádane r̥tásya  ā́ no dyāvāpr̥thivī daívyena  jánena yātam máhi vāṃ várūtham

translation.text: With newest hymns set in the seat of Order, those the Two Parents, born before all others, Come, Heaven and Earth, with the Celestial People, hither to us, for strong is your protection.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒तो हि वां॑ रत्न॒धेया॑नि॒ सन्ति॑ पु॒रूणि॑ द्यावापृथिवी सु॒दासे॑ अ॒स्मे ध॑त्तं॒ यदस॒दस्कृ॑धोयु यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: utó hí vāṃ ratnadhéyāni sánti  purū́ṇi dyāvāpr̥thivī sudā́se  asmé dhattaṃ yád ásad áskr̥dhoyu  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Yea, Heaven and Earth, ye hold in your possession full many a treasure for the liberal giver. Grant us that wealth which comes in free abundance. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वास्तो॑ष्पते॒ प्रति॑ जानीह्य॒स्मान्त्स्वा॑वे॒शो अ॑नमी॒वो भ॑वा नः यत्त्वेम॑हे॒ प्रति॒ तन्नो॑ जुषस्व॒ शं नो॑ भव द्वि॒पदे॒ शं चतु॑ष्पदे
verses.transliteration: vā́stoṣ pate práti jānīhy asmā́n  svāveśó anamīvó bhavā naḥ  yát tvémahe práti tán no juṣasva  śáṃ no bhava dvipáde śáṃ cátuṣpade

translation.text: ACKNOWLEDGE us, O Guardian of the Homestead: bring no disease, and give us happy entrance. Whate'er we ask of thee, be pleased to grant it, and prosper thou quadrupeds and bipeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वास्तो॑ष्पते प्र॒तर॑णो न एधि गय॒स्फानो॒ गोभि॒रश्वे॑भिरिन्दो अ॒जरा॑सस्ते स॒ख्ये स्या॑म पि॒तेव॑ पु॒त्रान्प्रति॑ नो जुषस्व
verses.transliteration: vā́stoṣ pate pratáraṇo na edhi  gayasphā́no góbhir áśvebhir indo  ajárāsas te sakhyé syāma  pitéva putrā́n práti no juṣasva

translation.text: Protector of the Home, be our promoter: increase our wealth in kine and steeds, O Indu. May we be ever-youthful in thy friendship: be pleased in us as in his sons a father.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वास्तो॑ष्पते श॒ग्मया॑ सं॒सदा॑ ते सक्षी॒महि॑ र॒ण्वया॑ गातु॒मत्या॑ पा॒हि क्षेम॑ उ॒त योगे॒ वरं॑ नो यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: vā́stoṣ pate śagmáyā saṃsádā te  sakṣīmáhi raṇváyā gātumátyā  pāhí kṣéma utá yóge váraṃ no  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Through thy dear fellowship that bringeth welfare, may we be victors, Guardian of the Dwelling! Protect our happiness in rest and labour. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒मी॒व॒हा वा॑स्तोष्पते॒ विश्वा॑ रू॒पाण्या॑वि॒शन् सखा॑ सु॒शेव॑ एधि नः
verses.transliteration: amīvahā́ vāstoṣ pate  víśvā rūpā́ṇy āviśán  sákhā suśéva edhi naḥ

translation.text: VÂSTOSHPATI, who killest all disease and wearest every form, Be an auspicious Friend to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॑र्जुन सारमेय द॒तः पि॑शङ्ग॒ यच्छ॑से वी॑व भ्राजन्त ऋ॒ष्टय॒ उप॒ स्रक्वे॑षु॒ बप्स॑तो॒ नि षु स्व॑प
verses.transliteration: yád arjuna sārameya  datáḥ piśaṅga yáchase  vī̀va bhrājanta r̥ṣṭáyaḥ-  úpa srákveṣu bápsato  ní ṣú svapa

translation.text: When, O bright Son of Saramâ, thou showest, tawny-hued! thy teeth, They gleam like lances' points within thy mouth when thou wouldst bite; go thou to steep.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्ते॒नं रा॑य सारमेय॒ तस्क॑रं वा पुनःसर स्तो॒तॄनिन्द्र॑स्य रायसि॒ किम॒स्मान्दु॑च्छुनायसे॒ नि षु स्व॑प
verses.transliteration: stenáṃ rāya sārameya  táskaraṃ vā punaḥsara  stotr̥̄́n índrasya rāyasi  kím asmā́n duchunāyase  ní ṣú svapa

translation.text: Saramâ's Son, retrace thy way: bark at the robber and the thief. At Indra's singers barkest thou? Why dust thou seek to terrify us? Go to sleep.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं सू॑क॒रस्य॑ दर्दृहि॒ तव॑ दर्दर्तु सूक॒रः स्तो॒तॄनिन्द्र॑स्य रायसि॒ किम॒स्मान्दु॑च्छुनायसे॒ नि षु स्व॑प
verses.transliteration: tváṃ sūkarásya dardr̥hi  táva dardartu sūkaráḥ  stotr̥̄́n índrasya rāyasi  kím asmā́n duchunāyase  ní ṣú svapa

translation.text: Be on thy guard against the boar, and let the boar beware of thee. At Indra's singers barkest thou? Why dost thou seek to terrify us? Go to sleep.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सस्तु॑ मा॒ता सस्तु॑ पि॒ता सस्तु॒ श्वा सस्तु॑ वि॒श्पतिः॑ स॒सन्तु॒ सर्वे॑ ज्ञा॒तयः॒ सस्त्व॒यम॒भितो॒ जनः॑
verses.transliteration: sástu mātā́ sástu pitā́  sástu śvā́ sástu viśpátiḥ  sasántu sárve jñātáyaḥ  sástv ayám abhíto jánaḥ

translation.text: Sleep mother, let the father sleep, sleep dog and master of the house. Let all the kinsmen sleep, sleep all the people who are round about.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य आस्ते॒ यश्च॒ चर॑ति॒ यश्च॒ पश्य॑ति नो॒ जनः॑ तेषां॒ सं ह॑न्मो अ॒क्षाणि॒ यथे॒दं ह॒र्म्यं तथा॑
verses.transliteration: yá ā́ste yáś ca cárati  yáś ca páśyati no jánaḥ  téṣāṃ sáṃ hanmo akṣā́ṇi  yáthedáṃ harmyáṃ táthā

translation.text: The man who sits, the man who walks, and whosoever looks on us, Of these we closely shut the eyes, even as we closely shut this house.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्र॑शृङ्गो वृष॒भो यः स॑मु॒द्रादु॒दाच॑रत् तेना॑ सह॒स्ये॑ना व॒यं नि जना॑न्त्स्वापयामसि
verses.transliteration: sahásraśr̥ṅgo vr̥ṣabhó  yáḥ samudrā́d udā́carat  ténā sahasyènā vayáṃ  ní jánān svāpayāmasi

translation.text: The Bull who hath a thousand horns, who rises up from out the sea,– By him the Strong and Mighty One we lull and make the people sleep.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रो॒ष्ठे॒श॒या व॑ह्येश॒या नारी॒र्यास्त॑ल्प॒शीव॑रीः स्त्रियो॒ याः पुण्य॑गन्धा॒स्ताः सर्वाः॑ स्वापयामसि
verses.transliteration: proṣṭheśayā́ vahyeśayā́ḥ-  nā́rīr yā́s talpaśī́varīḥ  stríyo yā́ḥ púṇyagandhās  tā́ḥ sárvāḥ svāpayāmasi

translation.text: The women sleeping in the court, lying without, or stretched on beds, The matrons with their odorous sweetsthese, one and all, we lull to sleep.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क ईं॒ व्य॑क्ता॒ नरः॒ सनी॑ळा रु॒द्रस्य॒ मर्या॒ अध॒ स्वश्वाः॑
verses.transliteration: ká īṃ vyàktā náraḥ sánīḷāḥ-  rudrásya máryā ádhā sváśvāḥ

translation.text: Wno are these radiant men in serried rank, Rudra's young heroes borne by noble steeds?

verses.sanskrit_deva: नकि॒र्ह्ये॑षां ज॒नूंषि॒ वेद॒ ते अ॒ङ्ग वि॑द्रे मि॒थो ज॒नित्र॑म्
verses.transliteration: nákir hy èṣāṃ janū́ṃṣi véda  té aṅgá vidre mithó janítram

translation.text: Verily no one knoweth whence they sprang: they, and they only, know each other's birth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि स्व॒पूभि॑र्मि॒थो व॑पन्त॒ वात॑स्वनसः श्ये॒ना अ॑स्पृध्रन्
verses.transliteration: abhí svapū́bhir mithó vapanta  vā́tasvanasaḥ śyenā́ aspr̥dhran

translation.text: They strew each other with their blasts, these Hawks: they strove together, roaring like the wind.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तानि॒ धीरो॑ नि॒ण्या चि॑केत॒ पृश्नि॒र्यदूधो॑ म॒ही ज॒भार॑
verses.transliteration: etā́ni dhī́ro niṇyā́ ciketa  pŕ̥śnir yád ū́dho mahī́ jabhā́ra

translation.text: A sage was he who knew these mysteries, what in her udder mighty Pr̥iṣni bore.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा विट् सु॒वीरा॑ म॒रुद्भि॑रस्तु स॒नात्सह॑न्ती॒ पुष्य॑न्ती नृ॒म्णम्
verses.transliteration: sā́ víṭ suvī́rā marúdbhir astu  sanā́t sáhantī púṣyantī nr̥mṇám

translation.text: Ever victorious, through the Maruts, be this band of Heroes, nursing manly strength,

verses.sanskrit_deva: यामं॒ येष्ठाः॑ शु॒भा शोभि॑ष्ठाः श्रि॒या सम्मि॑श्ला॒ ओजो॑भिरु॒ग्राः
verses.transliteration: yā́maṃ yéṣṭhāḥ śubhā́ śóbhiṣṭhāḥ  śriyā́ sámmiślā ójobhir ugrā́ḥ

translation.text: Most bright in splendour, flectest on their way, close-knit to glory, strong with varied power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒ग्रं व॒ ओजः॑ स्थि॒रा शवां॒स्यधा॑ म॒रुद्भि॑र्ग॒णस्तुवि॑ष्मान्
verses.transliteration: ugráṃ va ója sthirā́ śávāṃsi-  ádhā marúdbhir gaṇás túviṣmān

translation.text: Yea, mighty is your power and firm your strength: so, potent, with the Maruts, be the band.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒भ्रो वः॒ शुष्मः॒ क्रुध्मी॒ मनां॑सि॒ धुनि॒र्मुनि॑रिव॒ शर्ध॑स्य धृ॒ष्णोः
verses.transliteration: śubhró vaḥ śúṣmaḥ krúdhmī mánāṃsi  dhúnir múnir iva śárdhasya dhr̥ṣṇóḥ

translation.text: Bright is your spirit, wrathful are your minds: your bold troop's minstrel is like one inspired.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सने॑म्य॒स्मद्यु॒योत॑ दि॒द्युं मा वो॑ दुर्म॒तिरि॒ह प्रण॑ङ्नः
verses.transliteration: sánemy asmád yuyóta didyúm  mā́ vo durmatír ihá práṇaṅ naḥ

translation.text: Ever avert your blazing shaft from us, and let not your displeasure reach us here

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रि॒या वो॒ नाम॑ हुवे तु॒राणा॒मा यत्तृ॒पन्म॑रुतो वावशा॒नाः
verses.transliteration: priyā́ vo nā́ma huve turā́ṇām  ā́ yát tr̥pán maruto vāvaśānā́ḥ

translation.text: Your dear names, conquering Maruts, we invoke, calling aloud till we are satisfied.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वा॒यु॒धास॑ इ॒ष्मिणः॑ सुनि॒ष्का उ॒त स्व॒यं त॒न्व१॒॑ः शुम्भ॑मानाः
verses.transliteration: svāyudhā́sa iṣmíṇaḥ suniṣkā́ḥ-  utá svayáṃ tanvàḥ śúmbhamānāḥ

translation.text: Well-armed, impetuous in their haste, they deck themselves, their forms, with oblations: to you, the pure, ornaments made of gold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शुची॑ वो ह॒व्या म॑रुतः॒ शुची॑नां॒ शुचिं॑ हिनोम्यध्व॒रं शुचि॑भ्यः ऋ॒तेन॑ स॒त्यमृ॑त॒साप॑ आय॒ञ्छुचि॑जन्मानः॒ शुच॑यः पाव॒काः
verses.transliteration: śúcī vo havyā́ marutaḥ śúcīnāṃ  śúciṃ hinomy adhvaráṃ śúcibhyaḥ  r̥téna satyám r̥tasā́pa āyañ  -śúcijanmānaḥ śúcayaḥ pāvakā́ḥ

translation.text: Pure, Maruts, pure yourselves, are your oblations: to you, the pure, pure sacrifice I offer. By Law they came to truth, the Law's observers, bright by their birth, and pure, and sanctifying.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अंसे॒ष्वा म॑रुतः खा॒दयो॑ वो॒ वक्षः॑सु रु॒क्मा उ॑पशिश्रिया॒णाः वि वि॒द्युतो॒ न वृ॒ष्टिभी॑ रुचा॒ना अनु॑ स्व॒धामायु॑धै॒र्यच्छ॑मानाः
verses.transliteration: áṃseṣv ā́ marutaḥ khādáyo vo  vákṣassu rukmā́ upaśiśriyāṇā́ḥ  ví vidyúto ná vr̥ṣṭíbhī rucānā́ḥ-  ánu svadhā́m ā́yudhair yáchamānāḥ

translation.text: Your rings, O Maruts, rest upon your shoulders, and chains of gold are twined upon your bosoms. Gleaming with drops of rain, like lightning-flashes, after your wont ye whirl about your weapons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र बु॒ध्न्या॑ व ईरते॒ महां॑सि॒ प्र नामा॑नि प्रयज्यवस्तिरध्वम् स॒ह॒स्रियं॒ दम्यं॑ भा॒गमे॒तं गृ॑हमे॒धीयं॑ मरुतो जुषध्वम्
verses.transliteration: prá budhnyā̀ va īrate máhāṃsi  prá nā́māni prayajyavas tiradhvam  sahasríyaṃ dámyam bhāgám etáṃ  gr̥hamedhī́yam maruto juṣadhvam

translation.text: Wide in the depth of air spread forth your glories, far, most adorable, ye bear your titles. Maruts, accept this thousandfold allotment of household sacrifice and household treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑ स्तु॒तस्य॑ मरुतो अधी॒थेत्था विप्र॑स्य वा॒जिनो॒ हवी॑मन् म॒क्षू रा॒यः सु॒वीर्य॑स्य दात॒ नू चि॒द्यम॒न्य आ॒दभ॒दरा॑वा
verses.transliteration: yádi stutásya maruto adhīthá-  -itthā́ víprasya vājíno hávīman  makṣū́ rāyáḥ suvī́ryasya dāta  nū́ cid yám anyá ādábhad árāvā

translation.text: If, Maruts, ye regard the praise recited here at this mighty singer invocation, Vouchsafe us quickly wealth with noble heroes, wealth which no man uho hateth us may injure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अत्या॑सो॒ न ये म॒रुतः॒ स्वञ्चो॑ यक्ष॒दृशो॒ न शु॒भय॑न्त॒ मर्याः॑ ते ह॑र्म्ये॒ष्ठाः शिश॑वो॒ न शु॒भ्रा व॒त्सासो॒ न प्र॑क्री॒ळिनः॑ पयो॒धाः
verses.transliteration: átyāso ná yé marútaḥ sváñco  yakṣadŕ̥śo ná śubháyanta máryāḥ  té harmyeṣṭhā́ḥ śíśavo ná śubhrā́ḥ-  vatsā́so ná prakrīḷínaḥ payodhā́ḥ

translation.text: The Maruts, fleet as coursers, while they deck them like youths spectators of a festal meeting, Linger, like beauteous colts, about the dwelling, like frisking calves, these who pour down the water.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒श॒स्यन्तो॑ नो म॒रुतो॑ मृळन्तु वरिव॒स्यन्तो॒ रोद॑सी सु॒मेके॑ आ॒रे गो॒हा नृ॒हा व॒धो वो॑ अस्तु सु॒म्नेभि॑र॒स्मे व॑सवो नमध्वम्
verses.transliteration: daśasyánto no marúto mr̥ḷantu  varivasyánto ródasī suméke  āré gohā́ nr̥hā́ vadhó vo astu  sumnébhir asmé vasavo namadhvam

translation.text: So may the Maruts help us and be gracious, bringing free room to lovely Earth and Heaven. Far be your bolt that slayeth men and cattle. Ye Vasus, turn yourselves to us with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वो॒ होता॑ जोहवीति स॒त्तः स॒त्राचीं॑ रा॒तिं म॑रुतो गृणा॒नः य ईव॑तो वृषणो॒ अस्ति॑ गो॒पाः सो अद्व॑यावी हवते व उ॒क्थैः
verses.transliteration: ā́ vo hótā johavīti sattáḥ  satrā́cīṃ rātím maruto gr̥ṇānáḥ  yá ī́vato vr̥ṣaṇo ásti gopā́ḥ  só ádvayāvī havate va ukthaíḥ

translation.text: The priest, when seated, loudly calls you, Maruts, praising in song your universal bounty. He, Bulls! who hath so much in his possession, free from duplicity, with hymns invokes you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे तु॒रं म॒रुतो॑ रामयन्ती॒मे सहः॒ सह॑स॒ आ न॑मन्ति इ॒मे शंसं॑ वनुष्य॒तो नि पा॑न्ति गु॒रु द्वेषो॒ अर॑रुषे दधन्ति
verses.transliteration: imé turám marúto rāmayanti-  -imé sáhaḥ sáhasa ā́ namanti  imé śáṃsaṃ vanuṣyató ní pānti  gurú dvéṣo áraruṣe dadhanti

translation.text: These Maruts bring the swift man to a stand-still, and strength with mightier strength they break and humble These guard the singer from the man who hates him and lay their sore displeasure on the wicked.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे र॒ध्रं चि॑न्म॒रुतो॑ जुनन्ति॒ भृमिं॑ चि॒द्यथा॒ वस॑वो जु॒षन्त॑ अप॑ बाधध्वं वृषण॒स्तमां॑सि ध॒त्त विश्वं॒ तन॑यं तो॒कम॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: imé radhráṃ cin marúto junanti  bhŕ̥miṃ cid yáthā vásavo juṣánta  ápa bādhadhvaṃ vr̥ṣaṇas támāṃsi  dhattá víśvaṃ tánayaṃ tokám asmé

translation.text: These Maruts rouse even the poor and needy: the Vasus love him as an active champion. Drive to a distance, O ye Bulls, the darkness: give us full store of children and descendants.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा वो॑ दा॒त्रान्म॑रुतो॒ निर॑राम॒ मा प॒श्चाद्द॑घ्म रथ्यो विभा॒गे आ नः॑ स्पा॒र्हे भ॑जतना वस॒व्ये॒३॒॑ यदीं॑ सुजा॒तं वृ॑षणो वो॒ अस्ति॑
verses.transliteration: mā́ vo dātrā́n maruto nír arāma  mā́ paścā́d daghma rathyo vibhāgé  ā́ na spārhé bhajatanā vasavyè  yád īṃ sujātáṃ vr̥ṣaṇo vo ásti

translation.text: Never, O Maruts, may we lose your bounty, nor, car-borne Lords! be hitidmost when ye deal it. Give us a share in that delightful treasure, the genuine wealth that, Bulls! is your possession.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं यद्धन॑न्त म॒न्युभि॒र्जना॑सः॒ शूरा॑ य॒ह्वीष्वोष॑धीषु वि॒क्षु अध॑ स्मा नो मरुतो रुद्रियासस्त्रा॒तारो॑ भूत॒ पृत॑नास्व॒र्यः
verses.transliteration: sáṃ yád dhánanta manyúbhir jánāsaḥ  śū́rā yahvī́ṣv óṣadhīṣu vikṣú  ádha smā no maruto rudriyāsas  trātā́ro bhūta pŕ̥tanāsv aryáḥ

translation.text: What time the men in fury rush together for running streams, for pastures, and for houses. Then, O ye Maruts, ye who spring from Rudra, be our protectors in the strife with foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूरि॑ चक्र मरुतः॒ पित्र्या॑ण्यु॒क्थानि॒ या वः॑ श॒स्यन्ते॑ पु॒रा चि॑त् म॒रुद्भि॑रु॒ग्रः पृत॑नासु॒ साळ्हा॑ म॒रुद्भि॒रित्सनि॑ता॒ वाज॒मर्वा॑
verses.transliteration: bhū́ri cakra marutaḥ pítryāṇi-  ukthā́ni yā́ vaḥ śasyánte purā́ cit  marúdbhir ugráḥ pŕ̥tanāsu sā́ḷhā  marúdbhir ít sánitā vā́jam árvā

translation.text: Full many a deed ye did for our forefathers worthy of lauds which, even of old, they sang you. lle strong man, with the Maruts, wins in battle, the charger, with the Maruts, gains the booty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे वी॒रो म॑रुतः शु॒ष्म्य॑स्तु॒ जना॑नां॒ यो असु॑रो विध॒र्ता अ॒पो येन॑ सुक्षि॒तये॒ तरे॒माध॒ स्वमोको॑ अ॒भि वः॑ स्याम
verses.transliteration: asmé vīró marutaḥ śuṣmy àstu  jánānāṃ yó ásuro vidhartā́  apó yéna sukṣitáye tárema-  -ádha svám óko abhí vaḥ syāma

translation.text: Ours, O ye Maruts, be the vigorous Hero, the Lord Divine of men, the strong Sustainer, With whom to fair lands we may cross the waters, and dwell in our own home with you beside us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्न॒ इन्द्रो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निराप॒ ओष॑धीर्व॒निनो॑ जुषन्त शर्म॑न्त्स्याम म॒रुता॑मु॒पस्थे॑ यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: tán na índro váruṇo mitró agnír  ā́pa óṣadhīr vaníno juṣanta  śárman syāma marútām upásthe  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: May Indra, Mitra, Varuṇa and Agni, Waters, and Plants, and Trees accept our praises. May we find shelter in the Marut's bosom. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मध्वो॑ वो॒ नाम॒ मारु॑तं यजत्राः॒ प्र य॒ज्ञेषु॒ शव॑सा मदन्ति ये रे॒जय॑न्ति॒ रोद॑सी चिदु॒र्वी पिन्व॒न्त्युत्सं॒ यदया॑सुरु॒ग्राः
verses.transliteration: mádhvo vo nā́ma mā́rutaṃ yajatrāḥ  prá yajñéṣu śávasā madanti  yé rejáyanti ródasī cid urvī́  pínvanty útsaṃ yád áyāsur ugrā́ḥ

translation.text: YEA, through the power of your sweet juice, ye Holy! the Marut host is glad at sacrifices. They cause even spacious heaven and earth to tremble, they make the spring flow when they come, the Mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि॒चे॒तारो॒ हि म॒रुतो॑ गृ॒णन्तं॑ प्रणे॒तारो॒ यज॑मानस्य॒ मन्म॑ अ॒स्माक॑म॒द्य वि॒दथे॑षु ब॒र्हिरा वी॒तये॑ सदत पिप्रिया॒णाः
verses.transliteration: nicetā́ro hí marúto gr̥ṇántam  praṇetā́ro yájamānasya mánma  asmā́kam adyá vidátheṣu barhír  ā́ vītáye sadata pipriyāṇā́ḥ

translation.text: The Maruts watch the man who sings their praises, promoters of the thought of him who worships. Seat you on sacred grass in our assembly, this day, with friendly minds, to share the banquet.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नैताव॑द॒न्ये म॒रुतो॒ यथे॒मे भ्राज॑न्ते रु॒क्मैरायु॑धैस्त॒नूभिः॑ आ रोद॑सी विश्व॒पिशः॑ पिशा॒नाः स॑मा॒नम॒ञ्ज्य॑ञ्जते शु॒भे कम्
verses.transliteration: naítā́vad anyé marúto yáthemé  bhrā́jante rukmaír ā́yudhais tanū́bhiḥ  ā́ ródasī viśvapíśaḥ piśānā́ḥ  samānám añjy àñjate śubhé kám

translation.text: No others gleam so brightly as these Maruts with their own forms, their golden gauds, their weapons. With all adornments, decking earth and heaven, they heighten, for bright show, their common splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋध॒क्सा वो॑ मरुतो दि॒द्युद॑स्तु॒ यद्व॒ आगः॑ पुरु॒षता॒ करा॑म मा व॒स्तस्या॒मपि॑ भूमा यजत्रा अ॒स्मे वो॑ अस्तु सुम॒तिश्चनि॑ष्ठा
verses.transliteration: ŕ̥dhak sā́ vo maruto didyúd astu  yád va ā́gaḥ puruṣátā kárāma  mā́ vas tásyām ápi bhūmā yajatrāḥ-  asmé vo astu sumatíś cániṣṭhā

translation.text: Far from us be your blazing dart, O Maruts, when we, through human frailty, sin against you. Let us not he exposed to that, ye Holy! May your most loving favour still attend us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒ते चि॒दत्र॑ म॒रुतो॑ रणन्तानव॒द्यासः॒ शुच॑यः पाव॒काः प्र णो॑ऽवत सुम॒तिभि॑र्यजत्राः॒ प्र वाजे॑भिस्तिरत पु॒ष्यसे॑ नः
verses.transliteration: kr̥té cid átra marúto raṇanta-  -anavadyā́saḥ śúcayaḥ pāvakā́ḥ  prá ṇo 'vata sumatíbhir yajatrāḥ  prá vā́jebhis tirata puṣyáse naḥ

translation.text: May even what we have done delight the Maruts, the blameless Ones, the bright, the purifying. Further us, O ye Holy, with your kindness: advance us mightily that we may prosper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्तु॒तासो॑ म॒रुतो॑ व्यन्तु॒ विश्वे॑भि॒र्नाम॑भि॒र्नरो॑ ह॒वींषि॑ ददा॑त नो अ॒मृत॑स्य प्र॒जायै॑ जिगृ॒त रा॒यः सू॒नृता॑ म॒घानि॑
verses.transliteration: utá stutā́so marúto vyantu  víśvebhir nā́mabhir náro havī́ṃṣi  dádāta no amŕ̥tasya prajā́yai  jigr̥tá rāyáḥ sūnŕ̥tā maghā́ni

translation.text: And may the Maruts, praised by all their titles, Heroes, enjoy the taste of our oblations. Give us of Amrit for the sake of offspring: awake the excellent fair stores of riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ स्तु॒तासो॑ मरुतो॒ विश्व॑ ऊ॒ती अच्छा॑ सू॒रीन्त्स॒र्वता॑ता जिगात ये न॒स्त्मना॑ श॒तिनो॑ व॒र्धय॑न्ति यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: ā́ stutā́so maruto víśva ūtī́  áchā sūrī́n sarvátātā jigāta  yé nas tmánā śatíno vardháyanti  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Hither, ye Maruts, praised, with all your succours, with all felicity come to our princes, Who, of themselves, a hundredfold increase us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सा॑क॒मुक्षे॑ अर्चता ग॒णाय॒ यो दैव्य॑स्य॒ धाम्न॒स्तुवि॑ष्मान् उ॒त क्षो॑दन्ति॒ रोद॑सी महि॒त्वा नक्ष॑न्ते॒ नाकं॒ निर्ऋ॑तेरवं॒शात्
verses.transliteration: prá sākamúkṣe arcatā gaṇā́ya  yó daívyasya dhā́mnas túviṣmān  utá kṣodanti ródasī mahitvā́  nákṣante nā́kaṃ nírr̥ter avaṃśā́t

translation.text: SING to the troop that pours down rain in common, the Mighty Company of celestial nature. They make the world-halves tremble with their greatness: from depths of earth and sky they reach to heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज॒नूश्चि॑द्वो मरुतस्त्वे॒ष्ये॑ण॒ भीमा॑स॒स्तुवि॑मन्य॒वोऽया॑सः प्र ये महो॑भि॒रोज॑सो॒त सन्ति॒ विश्वो॑ वो॒ याम॑न्भयते स्व॒र्दृक्
verses.transliteration: janū́ś cid vo marutas tveṣyèṇa  bhī́māsas túvimanyavó 'yāsaḥ  prá yé máhobhir ójasotá sánti  víśvo vo yā́man bhayate svardŕ̥k

translation.text: Yea, your birth, Maruts, was with wild commotion, ye who move swiftly, fierce in wrath, terrific. Ye all-surpassing in your might and vigour, each looker on the light fears at your coming.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृ॒हद्वयो॑ म॒घव॑द्भ्यो दधात॒ जुजो॑ष॒न्निन्म॒रुतः॑ सुष्टु॒तिं नः॑ ग॒तो नाध्वा॒ वि ति॑राति ज॒न्तुं प्र णः॑ स्पा॒र्हाभि॑रू॒तिभि॑स्तिरेत
verses.transliteration: br̥hád váyo maghávadbhyo dadhāta  jújoṣann ín marútaḥ suṣṭutíṃ naḥ  gató nā́dhvā ví tirāti jantúm  prá ṇa spārhā́bhir ūtíbhis tireta

translation.text: Give ample vital power unto our princes let our fair praises gratify the Maruts. As the way travelled helpeth people onward, so further us with your delightful succours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒ष्मोतो॒ विप्रो॑ मरुतः शत॒स्वी यु॒ष्मोतो॒ अर्वा॒ सहु॑रिः सह॒स्री यु॒ष्मोतः॑ स॒म्राळु॒त ह॑न्ति वृ॒त्रं प्र तद्वो॑ अस्तु धूतयो दे॒ष्णम्
verses.transliteration: yuṣmóto vípro marutaḥ śatasvī́  yuṣmóto árvā sáhuriḥ sahasrī́  yuṣmótaḥ samrā́ḷ utá hanti vr̥trám  prá tád vo astu dhūtayo deṣṇám

translation.text: Your favoured singer counts his wealth by hundreds: the strong steed whom ye favour wins a thousand. The Sovran whom ye aid destroys the foeman. May this your gift, ye Shakers, be distinguished.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ताँ आ रु॒द्रस्य॑ मी॒ळ्हुषो॑ विवासे कु॒विन्नंस॑न्ते म॒रुतः॒ पुन॑र्नः यत्स॒स्वर्ता॑ जिहीळि॒रे यदा॒विरव॒ तदेन॑ ईमहे तु॒राणा॑म्
verses.transliteration: tā́m̐ ā́ rudrásya mīḷhúṣo vivāse  kuvín náṃsante marútaḥ púnar naḥ  yát sasvártā jihīḷiré yád āvír  áva tád éna īmahe turā́ṇām

translation.text: I call, as such, the Sons of bounteous Rudra: will not the Maruts turn again to us-ward? What secret sin or open stirs their anger, that we implore the Swift Ones to forgive us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सा वा॑चि सुष्टु॒तिर्म॒घोना॑मि॒दं सू॒क्तं म॒रुतो॑ जुषन्त आ॒राच्चि॒द्द्वेषो॑ वृषणो युयोत यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: prá sā́vāci suṣṭutír maghónām  idáṃ sūktám marúto juṣanta  ārā́c cid dvéṣo vr̥ṣaṇo yuyota  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: This eulogy of the Bounteous hath been spoken: accept, ye Maruts, this our hymn of praises. Ye Bulls, keep those who hate us at a distance. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं त्राय॑ध्व इ॒दमि॑दं॒ देवा॑सो॒ यं च॒ नय॑थ तस्मा॑ अग्ने॒ वरु॑ण॒ मित्रार्य॑म॒न्मरु॑तः॒ शर्म॑ यच्छत
verses.transliteration: yáṃ trā́yadhva idám-idaṃ  dévāso yáṃ ca náyatha  tásmā agne váruṇa mítrā́ryaman  márutaḥ śárma yachata

translation.text: WHOMSO ye rescue here and there, whomso ye guide, O Deities, To him give shelter, Agni, Mitra, Varuṇa, ye Maruts, and thou Aryaman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒ष्माकं॑ देवा॒ अव॒साह॑नि प्रि॒य ई॑जा॒नस्त॑रति॒ द्विषः॑ प्र स क्षयं॑ तिरते॒ वि म॒हीरिषो॒ यो वो॒ वरा॑य॒ दाश॑ति
verses.transliteration: yuṣmā́kaṃ devā ávasā́hani priyé-  ījānás tarati dvíṣaḥ  prá sá kṣáyaṃ tirate ví mahī́r íṣo  yó vo várāya dā́śati

translation.text: Through your kind favour, Gods, on some auspicious day, the worshipper subdues his foes. That man increases home and strengthening ample food who brings you offerings as ye list.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒हि व॑श्चर॒मं च॒न वसि॑ष्ठः परि॒मंस॑ते अ॒स्माक॑म॒द्य म॑रुतः सु॒ते सचा॒ विश्वे॑ पिबत का॒मिनः॑
verses.transliteration: nahí vaś caramáṃ caná  vásiṣṭhaḥ parimáṃsate  asmā́kam adyá marutaḥ suté sácā  víśve pibata kāmínaḥ

translation.text: Vasishṭha will not overlook the lowliest one among you all. O Maruts, of our Soma juice effused to-day drink all of you with eager haste.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒हि व॑ ऊ॒तिः पृत॑नासु॒ मर्ध॑ति॒ यस्मा॒ अरा॑ध्वं नरः अ॒भि व॒ आव॑र्त्सुम॒तिर्नवी॑यसी॒ तूयं॑ यात पिपीषवः
verses.transliteration: nahí va ūtíḥ pŕ̥tanāsu márdhati  yásmā árādhvaṃ naraḥ  abhí va ā́vart sumatír návīyasī  tū́yaṃ yāta pipīṣavaḥ

translation.text: Your succour in the battle injures not the man to whom ye, Heroes, grant your gifts. May your most recent favour turn to us again. Come quickly, ye who fain would drink.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओ षु घृ॑ष्विराधसो या॒तनान्धां॑सि पी॒तये॑ इ॒मा वो॑ ह॒व्या म॑रुतो र॒रे हि कं॒ मो ष्व१॒॑न्यत्र॑ गन्तन
verses.transliteration: ó ṣú ghr̥ṣvirādhaso  yātánā́ndhāṃsi pītáye  imā́ vo havyā́ maruto raré hí kam  mó ṣv ànyátra gantana

translation.text: Come hitherward to drink the juice, O ye whose bounties give you joy. These offerings are for you, these, Maruts, I present. Go not to any place but this.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ च॑ नो ब॒र्हिः सद॑तावि॒ता च॑ नः स्पा॒र्हाणि॒ दात॑वे॒ वसु॑ अस्रे॑धन्तो मरुतः सो॒म्ये मधौ॒ स्वाहे॒ह मा॑दयाध्वै
verses.transliteration: ā́ ca no barhíḥ sádatā vitā́ ca naḥ-  spārhā́ṇi dā́tave vásu  ásredhanto marutaḥ somyé mádhau  svā́hehá mādayādhvai

translation.text: Sit on our sacred grass, be graciously inclined to give the wealth for which we long, To take delight, ye Maruts, Friends of all, with Svâhâ, in sweet Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒स्वश्चि॒द्धि त॒न्व१॒॑ः शुम्भ॑माना॒ आ हं॒सासो॒ नील॑पृष्ठा अपप्तन् विश्वं॒ शर्धो॑ अ॒भितो॑ मा॒ नि षे॑द॒ नरो॒ न र॒ण्वाः सव॑ने॒ मद॑न्तः
verses.transliteration: sasváś cid dhí tanvàḥ śúmbhamānāḥ-  ā́ haṃsā́so nī́lapr̥ṣṭhā apaptan  víśvaṃ śárdho abhíto mā ní ṣeda  náro ná raṇvā́ḥ sávane mádantaḥ

translation.text: Decking the beauty of their forms in secret the Swans with purple backs have flown down hither. Around me all the Company hath settled, like joyous Heroes glad in our libation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो नो॑ मरुतो अ॒भि दु॑र्हृणा॒युस्ति॒रश्चि॒त्तानि॑ वसवो॒ जिघां॑सति द्रु॒हः पाशा॒न्प्रति॒ स मु॑चीष्ट॒ तपि॑ष्ठेन॒ हन्म॑ना हन्तना॒ तम्
verses.transliteration: yó no maruto abhí durhr̥ṇāyús  tiráś cittā́ni vasavo jíghāṃsati  druháḥ pā́śān práti sá mucīṣṭa  tápiṣṭhena hánmanā hantanā tám

translation.text: Maruts, the man whose wrath is hard to master, he who would slay us ere we think, O Vasus, May he be tangled in the toils of mischief; smite ye him down with your most flaming weapon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सांत॑पना इ॒दं ह॒विर्मरु॑त॒स्तज्जु॑जुष्टन यु॒ष्माको॒ती रि॑शादसः
verses.transliteration: sā́ṃtapanā idáṃ havír  márutas táj jujuṣṭana  yuṣmā́kotī́ riśādasaḥ

translation.text: O Maruts, ye consuming Gods, enjoy this offering brought for you, To help us, ye who slay the foe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गृह॑मेधास॒ आ ग॑त॒ मरु॑तो॒ माप॑ भूतन यु॒ष्माको॒ती सु॑दानवः
verses.transliteration: gŕ̥hamedhāsa ā́ gata  máruto mā́pa bhūtana  yuṣmā́kotī́ sudānavaḥ

translation.text: Sharers of household sacrifice, come, Maruts, stay not far away, That ye may help us, Bounteous Ones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒हेह॑ वः स्वतवसः॒ कव॑यः॒ सूर्य॑त्वचः य॒ज्ञं म॑रुत॒ आ वृ॑णे
verses.transliteration: ihéha vaḥ svatavasaḥ  kávayaḥ sū́ryatvacaḥ  yajñám maruta ā́ vr̥ṇe

translation.text: Here, Self-strong Maruts, yea, even here. ye Sages with your sunbright skins I dedicate your sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्र्य॑म्बकं यजामहे सु॒गन्धिं॑ पुष्टि॒वर्ध॑नम् उ॒र्वा॒रु॒कमि॑व॒ बन्ध॑नान्मृ॒त्योर्मु॑क्षीय॒ मामृता॑त्
verses.transliteration: tryàmbakaṃ yajāmahe  sugándhim puṣṭivárdhanam  urvārukám iva bándhanāt-  mr̥tyór mukṣīya mā́mŕ̥tāt

translation.text: Tryambaka we worship, sweet augmenter of prosperity. As from its stem the cucumber, so may I be released from death, not reft of immortality.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॒द्य सू॑र्य॒ ब्रवोऽना॑गा उ॒द्यन्मि॒त्राय॒ वरु॑णाय स॒त्यम् व॒यं दे॑व॒त्रादि॑ते स्याम॒ तव॑ प्रि॒यासो॑ अर्यमन्गृ॒णन्तः॑
verses.transliteration: yád adyá sūrya brávó 'nāgāḥ-  udyán mitrā́ya váruṇāya satyám  vayáṃ devatrā́dite syāma  táva priyā́so aryaman gr̥ṇántaḥ

translation.text: WHEN thou, O Sun, this day, arising sinless, shalt speak the truth to Varuṇa and Mitra, O Aditi, may all the Deities love us, and thou, O Aryaman, while we are singing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष स्य मि॑त्रावरुणा नृ॒चक्षा॑ उ॒भे उदे॑ति॒ सूर्यो॑ अ॒भि ज्मन् विश्व॑स्य स्था॒तुर्जग॑तश्च गो॒पा ऋ॒जु मर्ते॑षु वृजि॒ना च॒ पश्य॑न्
verses.transliteration: eṣá syá mitrāvaruṇā nr̥cákṣāḥ-  ubhé úd eti sū́ryo abhí jmán  víśvasya sthātúr jágataś ca gopā́ḥ-  r̥jú márteṣu vr̥jinā́ ca páśyan

translation.text: Looking on man, O Varuṇa and Mitra, this Sun ascendeth up by both the pathways, Guardian of all things fixt, of all that moveth, beholding good and evil acts of mortals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अयु॑क्त स॒प्त ह॒रितः॑ स॒धस्था॒द्या ईं॒ वह॑न्ति॒ सूर्यं॑ घृ॒ताचीः॑ धामा॑नि मित्रावरुणा यु॒वाकुः॒ सं यो यू॒थेव॒ जनि॑मानि॒ चष्टे॑
verses.transliteration: áyukta saptá harítaḥ sadhásthād  yā́ īṃ váhanti sū́ryaṃ ghr̥tā́cīḥ  dhā́māni mitrāvaruṇā yuvā́kuḥ  sáṃ yó yūthéva jánimāni cáṣṭe

translation.text: He from their home hath yoked the Seven gold Coursers who, dropping oil and fatness, carry Sûrya. Yours, Varuṇa and Mitra, he surveyeth the worlds and living creatures like a herdsman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद्वां॑ पृ॒क्षासो॒ मधु॑मन्तो अस्थु॒रा सूर्यो॑ अरुहच्छु॒क्रमर्णः॑ यस्मा॑ आदि॒त्या अध्व॑नो॒ रद॑न्ति मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा वरु॑णः स॒जोषाः॑
verses.transliteration: úd vām pr̥kṣā́so mádhumanto asthur  ā́ sū́ryo aruhac chukrám árṇaḥ-  yásmā ādityā́ ádhvano rádanti  mitró aryamā́ váruṇaḥ sajóṣāḥ

translation.text: Your coursers rich in store of sweets have mounted: to the bright ocean Sûrya hath ascended, For whom the Âdityas make his pathway ready, Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa, accordant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे चे॒तारो॒ अनृ॑तस्य॒ भूरे॑र्मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा वरु॑णो॒ हि सन्ति॑ इ॒म ऋ॒तस्य॑ वावृधुर्दुरो॒णे श॒ग्मासः॑ पु॒त्रा अदि॑ते॒रद॑ब्धाः
verses.transliteration: imé cetā́ro ánr̥tasya bhū́rer  mitró aryamā́ váruṇo hí sánti  imá r̥tásya vāvr̥dhur duroṇé  śagmā́saḥ putrā́ áditer ádabdhāḥ

translation.text: For these, even Aryaman, Varuṇa and Mitra, are the chastisers of all guile and falsehood. These, Aditi's Sons, infallible and mighty, have waxen in the home of law Eternal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो दू॒ळभा॑सोऽचे॒तसं॑ चिच्चितयन्ति॒ दक्षैः॑ अपि॒ क्रतुं॑ सु॒चेत॑सं॒ वत॑न्तस्ति॒रश्चि॒दंहः॑ सु॒पथा॑ नयन्ति
verses.transliteration: imé mitró váruṇo dūḷábhāso  -acetásaṃ cic citayanti dákṣaiḥ  ápi krátuṃ sucétasaṃ vátantas  tiráś cid áṃhaḥ supáthā nayanti

translation.text: These, Mitra, Varuṇa whom none deceiveth, with great power quicken even the fool to wisdom, And, wakening, moreover, thoughtful insight, lead it by easy paths o'er grief and trouble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे दि॒वो अनि॑मिषा पृथि॒व्याश्चि॑कि॒त्वांसो॑ अचे॒तसं॑ नयन्ति प्र॒व्रा॒जे चि॑न्न॒द्यो॑ गा॒धम॑स्ति पा॒रं नो॑ अ॒स्य वि॑ष्पि॒तस्य॑ पर्षन्
verses.transliteration: imé divó ánimiṣā pr̥thivyā́ś  cikitvā́ṃso acetásaṃ nayanti  pravrājé cin nadyò gādhám asti  pāráṃ no asyá viṣpitásya parṣan

translation.text: They ever vigilant, with eyes that close not, caring for heaven and earth, lead on the thoughtless. Even in the river's bed there is a shallow. across this broad expanse may they conduct us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्गो॒पाव॒ददि॑तिः॒ शर्म॑ भ॒द्रं मि॒त्रो यच्छ॑न्ति॒ वरु॑णः सु॒दासे॑ तस्मि॒न्ना तो॒कं तन॑यं॒ दधा॑ना॒ मा क॑र्म देव॒हेळ॑नं तुरासः
verses.transliteration: yád gopā́vad áditiḥ śárma bhadrám  mitró yáchanti váruṇaḥ sudā́se  tásminn ā́ tokáṃ tánayaṃ dádhānāḥ-  mā́ karma devahéḷanaṃ turāsaḥ

translation.text: When Aditi and Varuṇa and Mitra, like guardians, give Sudâs their friendly shelter, Granting him sons and lineal succession, let us not, bold ones! move the Gods to anger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॒ वेदिं॒ होत्रा॑भिर्यजेत॒ रिपः॒ काश्चि॑द्वरुण॒ध्रुतः॒ सः परि॒ द्वेषो॑भिरर्य॒मा वृ॑णक्तू॒रुं सु॒दासे॑ वृषणा उ लो॒कम्
verses.transliteration: áva védiṃ hótrābhir yajeta  rípaḥ kā́ś cid varuṇadhrútaḥ sáḥ  pári dvéṣobhir aryamā́ vr̥ṇaktu-  -urúṃ sudā́se vr̥ṣaṇā ulokám

translation.text: May he with ofierings purify the altar from any stains of Varuṇa's reviler. Aryaman save us us all those who hate us: give room and freedom to Sudâs, ye Mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒स्वश्चि॒द्धि समृ॑तिस्त्वे॒ष्ये॑षामपी॒च्ये॑न॒ सह॑सा॒ सह॑न्ते यु॒ष्मद्भि॒या वृ॑षणो॒ रेज॑माना॒ दक्ष॑स्य चिन्महि॒ना मृ॒ळता॑ नः
verses.transliteration: sasváś cid dhí sámr̥tis tveṣy èṣām  apīcyèna sáhasā sáhante  yuṣmád bhiyā́ vr̥ṣaṇo réjamānāḥ-  dákṣasya cin mahinā́ mr̥ḷátā naḥ

translation.text: Hid from our eyes is their resplendent meeting: by their mysterious might they hold dominion. Heroes! we cry trembling in fear before you, even in the greatness of your power have mercy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो ब्रह्म॑णे सुम॒तिमा॒यजा॑ते॒ वाज॑स्य सा॒तौ प॑र॒मस्य॑ रा॒यः सीक्ष॑न्त म॒न्युं म॒घवा॑नो अ॒र्य उ॒रु क्षया॑य चक्रिरे सु॒धातु॑
verses.transliteration: yó bráhmaṇe sumatím āyájāte  vā́jasya sātaú paramásya rāyáḥ  sī́kṣanta manyúm maghávāno aryáḥ-  urú kṣáyāya cakrire sudhā́tu

translation.text: He who wins favour for his prayer by worship, that he may gain him strength and highest riches, That good man's mind the Mighty Ones will follow: they have brought comfort to his spacious dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं दे॑व पु॒रोहि॑तिर्यु॒वभ्यां॑ य॒ज्ञेषु॑ मित्रावरुणावकारि विश्वा॑नि दु॒र्गा पि॑पृतं ति॒रो नो॑ यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: iyáṃ deva puróhitir yuvábhyāṃ  yajñéṣu mitrāvaruṇāv akāri  víśvāni durgā́ pipr̥taṃ tiró no  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: This priestly task, Gods! Varuṇa and Mitra! hath been performed for you at sacrifices. Convey us safely over every peril. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद्वां॒ चक्षु॑र्वरुण सु॒प्रती॑कं दे॒वयो॑रेति॒ सूर्य॑स्तत॒न्वान् अ॒भि यो विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि॒ चष्टे॒ स म॒न्युं मर्त्ये॒ष्वा चि॑केत
verses.transliteration: úd vāṃ cákṣur varuṇa suprátīkaṃ  deváyor eti sū́ryas tatanvā́n  abhí yó víśvā bhúvanāni cáṣṭe  sá manyúm mártyeṣv ā́ ciketa

translation.text: O Varuṇa and Mitra, Sûrya spreading the beauteous light of you Twain Gods ariseth. He who beholdeth all existing creatures observeth well the zeal that is in mortals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वां॒ स मि॑त्रावरुणावृ॒तावा॒ विप्रो॒ मन्मा॑नि दीर्घ॒श्रुदि॑यर्ति यस्य॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि सुक्रतू॒ अवा॑थ॒ आ यत्क्रत्वा॒ न श॒रदः॑ पृ॒णैथे॑
verses.transliteration: prá vāṃ sá mitrāvaruṇāv r̥tā́vā  vípro mánmāni dīrghaśrúd iyarti  yásya bráhmāṇi sukratū ávāthaḥ-  ā́ yát krátvā ná śarádaḥ pr̥ṇaíthe

translation.text: The holy sage, renowned afar, directeth his hymns to you, O Varuṇa and Mitra,– He whose devotions, sapient Gods, ye favour so that ye fill, as 'twere, with power his autumns.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रोरोर्मि॑त्रावरुणा पृथि॒व्याः प्र दि॒व ऋ॒ष्वाद्बृ॑ह॒तः सु॑दानू स्पशो॑ दधाथे॒ ओष॑धीषु वि॒क्ष्वृध॑ग्य॒तो अनि॑मिषं॒ रक्ष॑माणा
verses.transliteration: prórór mitrāvaruṇā pr̥thivyā́ḥ  prá divá r̥ṣvā́d br̥hatáḥ sudānū  spáśo dadhāthe óṣadhīṣu vikṣú-  ŕ̥dhag yató ánimiṣaṃ rákṣamāṇā

translation.text: From the wide earth, O Varuṇa and Mitra from the great lofty heaven, ye, Bounteous Givers, – Have in the fields and houses set your warder-, who visit every spot and watch unceasing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शंसा॑ मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ धाम॒ शुष्मो॒ रोद॑सी बद्बधे महि॒त्वा अय॒न्मासा॒ अय॑ज्वनाम॒वीराः॒ प्र य॒ज्ञम॑न्मा वृ॒जनं॑ तिराते
verses.transliteration: śáṃsā mitrásya váruṇasya dhā́ma  śúṣmo ródasī badbadhe mahitvā́  áyan mā́sā áyajvanām avī́rāḥ  prá yajñámanmā vr̥jánaṃ tirāte

translation.text: I praise the strength of Varuṇa and Mitra that strength, by mightiness, keeps both worlds asunder. Heroless pass the months of the ungodly he who loves sacrifice makes his home enduring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अमू॑रा॒ विश्वा॑ वृषणावि॒मा वां॒ न यासु॑ चि॒त्रं ददृ॑शे॒ न य॒क्षम् द्रुहः॑ सचन्ते॒ अनृ॑ता॒ जना॑नां॒ न वां॑ नि॒ण्यान्य॒चिते॑ अभूवन्
verses.transliteration: ámūrā víśvā vr̥ṣaṇāv imā́ vāṃ  ná yā́su citráṃ dádr̥śe ná yakṣám  drúhaḥ sacante ánr̥tā jánānāṃ  ná vāṃ niṇyā́ny acíte abhūvan

translation.text: Steers, all infallible are these your people in whom no wondrous thing is seen, no worship. Guile follows close the men who are untruthful: no secrets may be hidden from your knowledge.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समु॑ वां य॒ज्ञं म॑हयं॒ नमो॑भिर्हु॒वे वां॑ मित्रावरुणा स॒बाधः॑ प्र वां॒ मन्मा॑न्यृ॒चसे॒ नवा॑नि कृ॒तानि॒ ब्रह्म॑ जुजुषन्नि॒मानि॑
verses.transliteration: sám u vāṃ yajñám mahayaṃ námobhir  huvé vām mitrāvaruṇā sabā́dhaḥ  prá vām mánmāny r̥cáse návāni  kr̥tā́ni bráhma jujuṣann imā́ni
