translation.text: I will exalt your sacrifice with homage: as priest, I, Mitra-Varuṇa, invoke you. May these new hymns and prayers that I have fashioned delight you to the profit of the singer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं दे॑व पु॒रोहि॑तिर्यु॒वभ्यां॑ य॒ज्ञेषु॑ मित्रावरुणावकारि विश्वा॑नि दु॒र्गा पि॑पृतं ति॒रो नो॑ यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: iyáṃ deva puróhitir yuvábhyāṃ  yajñéṣu mitrāvaruṇāv akāri  víśvāni durgā́ pipr̥taṃ tiró no  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: This priestly task, Gods! Varuṇa and Mitra! hath been performed for you at sacrifices. Convey us safely over every peril. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्सूर्यो॑ बृ॒हद॒र्चींष्य॑श्रेत्पु॒रु विश्वा॒ जनि॑म॒ मानु॑षाणाम् स॒मो दि॒वा द॑दृशे॒ रोच॑मानः॒ क्रत्वा॑ कृ॒तः सुकृ॑तः क॒र्तृभि॑र्भूत्
verses.transliteration: út sū́ryo br̥hád arcī́ṃṣy aśret  purú víśvā jánima mā́nuṣāṇām  samó divā́ dadr̥śe rócamānaḥ  krátvā kr̥táḥ súkr̥taḥ kartŕ̥bhir bhūt

translation.text: Sûrya hath sent aloft his beams of splendour o'er all the tribes of men in countless places. Together with the heaven he shines apparent, formed by his Makers well with power and wisdom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स सू॑र्य॒ प्रति॑ पु॒रो न॒ उद्गा॑ ए॒भिः स्तोमे॑भिरेत॒शेभि॒रेवैः॑ प्र नो॑ मि॒त्राय॒ वरु॑णाय वो॒चोऽना॑गसो अर्य॒म्णे अ॒ग्नये॑ च
verses.transliteration: sá sūrya práti puró na úd gāḥ-  ebhí stómebhir etaśébhir évaiḥ  prá no mitrā́ya váruṇāya vocaḥ-  -ánāgaso aryamṇé agnáye ca

translation.text: So hast thou mounted up before us, Sûrya, through these our praises, with fleet dappled horses. Declare us free from all offence to Mitra, and Varuṇa, and Aryaman, and Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि नः॑ स॒हस्रं॑ शु॒रुधो॑ रदन्त्वृ॒तावा॑नो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निः यच्छ॑न्तु च॒न्द्रा उ॑प॒मं नो॑ अ॒र्कमा नः॒ कामं॑ पूपुरन्तु॒ स्तवा॑नाः
verses.transliteration: ví naḥ sahásraṃ śurúdho radantu-  r̥tā́vāno váruṇo mitró agníḥ  yáchantu candrā́ upamáṃ no arkáṃ  ā́ naḥ kā́mam pūpurantu stávānāḥ

translation.text: May holy Agni, Varuṇa, and Mitra send down their riches upon us in thousands. May they, the Bright Ones, make our praise-song perfect, and, when we laud them, grant us all our wishes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यावा॑भूमी अदिते॒ त्रासी॑थां नो॒ ये वां॑ ज॒ज्ञुः सु॒जनि॑मान ऋष्वे मा हेळे॑ भूम॒ वरु॑णस्य वा॒योर्मा मि॒त्रस्य॑ प्रि॒यत॑मस्य नृ॒णाम्
verses.transliteration: dyā́vābhūmī adite trā́sīthāṃ naḥ  yé vāṃ jajñúḥ sujánimāna r̥ṣve  mā́ héḷe bhūma váruṇasya vāyór  mā́ mitrásya priyátamasya nr̥ṇā́m

translation.text: O undivided Heaven and Earth, preserve us, us, Lofty Ones! your nobIy-born descendants. Let us not anger Varuṇa, nor Vâyu, nor him, the dearest Friend of mortals, Mitra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र बा॒हवा॑ सिसृतं जी॒वसे॑ न॒ आ नो॒ गव्यू॑तिमुक्षतं घृ॒तेन॑ आ नो॒ जने॑ श्रवयतं युवाना श्रु॒तं मे॑ मित्रावरुणा॒ हवे॒मा
verses.transliteration: prá bāhávā sisr̥taṃ jīváse naḥ-  ā́ no gávyūtim ukṣataṃ ghr̥téna  ā́ no jáne śravayataṃ yuvānā  śrutám me mitrāvaruṇā hávemā́-

translation.text: Stretch forth your arms and let our lives be lengthened: with fatness dew the pastures of our cattle. Ye Youthful, make us famed among the people: hear, Mitra-Varuṇa, these mine invocations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो अर्य॒मा न॒स्त्मने॑ तो॒काय॒ वरि॑वो दधन्तु सु॒गा नो॒ विश्वा॑ सु॒पथा॑नि सन्तु यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: nū́ mitró váruṇo aryamā́ nas  tmáne tokā́ya várivo dadhantu  sugā́ no víśvā supáthāni santu  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Now Mitra, Varuṇa, Aryaman vouchsafe us freedom and room, for us and for our children. May we find paths all fair and good to travel. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद्वे॑ति सु॒भगो॑ वि॒श्वच॑क्षाः॒ साधा॑रणः॒ सूर्यो॒ मानु॑षाणाम् चक्षु॑र्मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्य दे॒वश्चर्मे॑व॒ यः स॒मवि॑व्य॒क्तमां॑सि
verses.transliteration: úd v eti subhágo viśvácakṣāḥ  sā́dhāraṇaḥ sū́ryo mā́nuṣāṇām  cákṣur mitrásya váruṇasya deváś  cármeva yáḥ samávivyak támāṃsi

translation.text: COMMON to all mankind, auspicious Sûrya, he who beholdeth all, is mounting upward; The God, the eye of Varuṇa and Mitra, who rolled up darkness like a piece of leather.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद्वे॑ति प्रसवी॒ता जना॑नां म॒हान्के॒तुर॑र्ण॒वः सूर्य॑स्य स॒मा॒नं च॒क्रं प॑र्या॒विवृ॑त्स॒न्यदे॑त॒शो वह॑ति धू॒र्षु यु॒क्तः
verses.transliteration: úd v eti prasavītā́ jánānām  mahā́n ketúr arṇaváḥ sū́ryasya  samānáṃ cakrám paryāvívr̥tsan  yád etaśó váhati dhūrṣú yuktáḥ

translation.text: Sûrya's great ensign, restless as the billow, that urgeth men to action, is advancing: Onward he still would roll the wheel well-rounded, which Etaṣa, harnessed to the car-pole, moveth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒भ्राज॑मान उ॒षसा॑मु॒पस्था॑द्रे॒भैरुदे॑त्यनुम॒द्यमा॑नः ए॒ष मे॑ दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता च॑च्छन्द॒ यः स॑मा॒नं न प्र॑मि॒नाति॒ धाम॑
verses.transliteration: vibhrā́jamāna uṣásām upásthād  rebhaír úd ety anumadyámānaḥ  eṣá me deváḥ savitā́ cachanda  yáḥ samānáṃ ná praminā́ti dhā́ma

translation.text: Refulgent from the bosom of the Mornings, he in Whom singers take delight ascendeth. This Savitar, God, is my chief joy and pleasure, who breaketh not the universal statute.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वो रु॒क्म उ॑रु॒चक्षा॒ उदे॑ति दू॒रेअ॑र्थस्त॒रणि॒र्भ्राज॑मानः नू॒नं जनाः॒ सूर्ये॑ण॒ प्रसू॑ता॒ अय॒न्नर्था॑नि कृ॒णव॒न्नपां॑सि
verses.transliteration: divó rukmá urucákṣā úd eti  dūréarthas taráṇir bhrā́jamānaḥ  nūnáṃ jánāḥ sū́ryeṇa prásūtāḥ-  áyann árthāni kr̥ṇávann ápāṃsi

translation.text: Golden, far-seeing, from the heaven he riseth: far is his goal, he hasteth on resplendent. Men, verily, inspirited by Sûrya speed to their aims and do the work assigned them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्रा॑ च॒क्रुर॒मृता॑ गा॒तुम॑स्मै श्ये॒नो न दीय॒न्नन्वे॑ति॒ पाथः॑ प्रति॑ वां॒ सूर॒ उदि॑ते विधेम॒ नमो॑भिर्मित्रावरुणो॒त ह॒व्यैः
verses.transliteration: yátrā cakrúr amŕ̥tā gātúm asmai  śyenó ná dī́yann ánv eti pā́thaḥ  práti vāṃ sū́ra údite vidhema  námobhir mitrāvaruṇotá havyaíḥ

translation.text: Where the irrunortals have prepared his pathway he flieth through the region like a falcon. With homage and oblations will we serve you, O Mitra-Varuṇa, when the Sun hath risen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो अर्य॒मा न॒स्त्मने॑ तो॒काय॒ वरि॑वो दधन्तु सु॒गा नो॒ विश्वा॑ सु॒पथा॑नि सन्तु यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: nū́ mitró váruṇo aryamā́ nas  tmáne tokā́ya várivo dadhantu  sugā́ no víśvā supáthāni santu  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Now Mitra, Varuṇa, Aryaman vouchsafe us freedom and room, for us and for our children. May we find paths all fair and good to travel. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वि क्षय॑न्ता॒ रज॑सः पृथि॒व्यां प्र वां॑ घृ॒तस्य॑ नि॒र्णिजो॑ ददीरन् ह॒व्यं नो॑ मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा सुजा॑तो॒ राजा॑ सुक्ष॒त्रो वरु॑णो जुषन्त
verses.transliteration: diví kṣáyantā rájasaḥ pr̥thivyā́m  prá vāṃ ghr̥tásya nirṇíjo dadīran  havyáṃ no mitró aryamā́ sújāto  rā́jā sukṣatró váruṇo juṣanta

translation.text: YE Twain who rule, in heaven and earth, the region, clothed be your clouds in robes of oil and fatness. May the imperial Varuṇa, and Mitra, and high-born Aryaman accept our presents.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ रा॑जाना मह ऋतस्य गोपा॒ सिन्धु॑पती क्षत्रिया यातम॒र्वाक् इळां॑ नो मित्रावरुणो॒त वृ॒ष्टिमव॑ दि॒व इ॑न्वतं जीरदानू
verses.transliteration: ā́ rājānā maha r̥tasya gopā  síndhupatī kṣatriyā yātam arvā́k  íḷāṃ no mitrāvaruṇotá vr̥ṣṭím  áva divá invataṃ jīradānū

translation.text: Kings, guards of rrtighty everlasting Order, come hitherward, ye Princes, Lords of Rivers. Send us from heaven, O Varuṇa and Mitra, rain and sweet food, ye who pour down your bounties.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्रस्तन्नो॒ वरु॑णो दे॒वो अ॒र्यः प्र साधि॑ष्ठेभिः प॒थिभि॑र्नयन्तु ब्रव॒द्यथा॑ न॒ आद॒रिः सु॒दास॑ इ॒षा म॑देम स॒ह दे॒वगो॑पाः
verses.transliteration: mitrás tán no váruṇo devó aryáḥ  prá sā́dhiṣṭhebhiḥ pathíbhir nayantu  brávad yáthā na ā́d aríḥ sudā́se-  iṣā́ madema sahá devágopāḥ

translation.text: May the dear God, and Varuṇa and Mitra conduct us by the most effective pathways, That foes may say unto Sudâs our chieftain, May, we, too, joy in food with Gods to guard us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वां॒ गर्तं॒ मन॑सा॒ तक्ष॑दे॒तमू॒र्ध्वां धी॒तिं कृ॒णव॑द्धा॒रय॑च्च उ॒क्षेथां॑ मित्रावरुणा घृ॒तेन॒ ता रा॑जाना सुक्षि॒तीस्त॑र्पयेथाम्
verses.transliteration: yó vāṃ gártam mánasā tákṣad etám  ūrdhvā́ṃ dhītíṃ kr̥ṇávad dhāráyac ca  ukṣéthām mitrāvaruṇā ghr̥téna  tā́ rājānā sukṣitī́s tarpayethām

translation.text: Him who hath wrought for you this car in spirit, who makes the song rise upward and sustains it, Bedew with fatness, Varuṇa nd Mitra ye Kings, make glad the pleasant dwelling-places.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष स्तोमो॑ वरुण मित्र॒ तुभ्यं॒ सोमः॑ शु॒क्रो न वा॒यवे॑ऽयामि अ॒वि॒ष्टं धियो॑ जिगृ॒तं पुरं॑धीर्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: eṣá stómo varuṇa mitra túbhyaṃ  sómaḥ śukró ná vāyáve 'yāmi  aviṣṭáṃ dhíyo jigr̥tám púraṃdhīr  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: To you this laud, O Varuṇa and Mitra is offered like bright Soma juice to Vâyu. Favour our songs of praise, wake thought and spirit. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ वां॒ सूर॒ उदि॑ते सू॒क्तैर्मि॒त्रं हु॑वे॒ वरु॑णं पू॒तद॑क्षम् ययो॑रसु॒र्य१॒॑मक्षि॑तं॒ ज्येष्ठं॒ विश्व॑स्य॒ याम॑न्ना॒चिता॑ जिग॒त्नु
verses.transliteration: práti vāṃ sū́ra údite sūktaír  mitráṃ huve váruṇam pūtádakṣam  yáyor asuryàm ákṣitaṃ jyéṣṭhaṃ  víśvasya yā́mann ācítā jigatnú

translation.text: WITH hymns I call you, when the Sun hath risen, Mitra, and Varuṇa whose thoughts are holy, Whose Power Divine, supreme and everlasting, comes with good heed at each man's supplication.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता हि दे॒वाना॒मसु॑रा॒ ताव॒र्या ता नः॑ क्षि॒तीः क॑रतमू॒र्जय॑न्तीः अ॒श्याम॑ मित्रावरुणा व॒यं वां॒ द्यावा॑ च॒ यत्र॑ पी॒पय॒न्नहा॑ च
verses.transliteration: tā́ hí devā́nām ásurā tā́v aryā́  tā́ naḥ kṣitī́ḥ karatam ūrjáyantīḥ  aśyā́ma mitrāvaruṇā vayáṃ vāṃ  dyā́vā ca yátra pīpáyann áhā ca

translation.text: For they are Asuras of Gods, the friendly make, both of you, our lands exceeding fruitful. May we obtain you, Varuṇa and Mitra, wherever Heaven and Earth and days may bless us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता भूरि॑पाशा॒वनृ॑तस्य॒ सेतू॑ दुर॒त्येतू॑ रि॒पवे॒ मर्त्या॑य ऋ॒तस्य॑ मित्रावरुणा प॒था वा॑म॒पो न ना॒वा दु॑रि॒ता त॑रेम
verses.transliteration: tā́ bhū́ripāśāv ánr̥tasya sétū  duratyétū ripáve mártyāya  r̥tásya mitrāvaruṇā pathā́ vām  -apó ná nāvā́ duritā́ tarema

translation.text: Bonds of the sinner, they bear many nooses: the wicked mortal hardly may escape them. Varuṇa-Mitra, may your path of Order bear us o'er trouble as a boat o'er waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ मित्रावरुणा ह॒व्यजु॑ष्टिं घृ॒तैर्गव्यू॑तिमुक्षत॒मिळा॑भिः प्रति॑ वा॒मत्र॒ वर॒मा जना॑य पृणी॒तमु॒द्नो दि॒व्यस्य॒ चारोः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ no mitrāvaruṇā havyájuṣṭiṃ  ghr̥taír gávyūtim ukṣatam íḷābhiḥ  práti vām átra váram ā́ jánāya  pr̥ṇītám udnó divyásya cā́roḥ

translation.text: Come, taste our offering, Varuṇa and Mitra: bedew our pasture wil sweet food and fatness. Pour down in plenty here upon the people the choicest of your fair celestial water.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष स्तोमो॑ वरुण मित्र॒ तुभ्यं॒ सोमः॑ शु॒क्रो न वा॒यवे॑ऽयामि अ॒वि॒ष्टं धियो॑ जिगृ॒तं पुरं॑धीर्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: eṣá stómo varuṇa mitra túbhyaṃ  sómaḥ śukró ná vāyáve 'yāmi  aviṣṭáṃ dhíyo jigr̥tám púraṃdhīr  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: To you this laud, O Varuṇa and Mitra, is offered, like bright Soma juice to Vâyu. Favour our songs of praise, wake thought and spirit. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र मि॒त्रयो॒र्वरु॑णयोः॒ स्तोमो॑ न एतु शू॒ष्यः॑ नम॑स्वान्तुविजा॒तयोः॑
verses.transliteration: prá mitráyor váruṇayo  stómo na etu śūṣyàḥ  námasvān tuvijātáyoḥ

translation.text: LET our strong hymn of praise go forth, the laud of Mitra-Varuṇa, With homage to that high-born Pair;

verses.sanskrit_deva: या धा॒रय॑न्त दे॒वाः सु॒दक्षा॒ दक्ष॑पितरा अ॒सु॒र्या॑य॒ प्रम॑हसा
verses.transliteration: yā́ dhāráyanta devā́ḥ  sudákṣā dákṣapitarā  asuryā̀ya prámahasā

translation.text: The Two exceeding wise, the Sons of Daksha, whom the gods ordained For lordship, excellently great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता नः॑ स्ति॒पा त॑नू॒पा वरु॑ण जरितॄ॒णाम् मित्र॑ सा॒धय॑तं॒ धियः॑
verses.transliteration: tā́ na stipā́ tanūpā́  váruṇa jaritr̥̄ṇā́m  mítra sādháyataṃ dhíyaḥ

translation.text: Such, Guardians of our homes and us, O Mitra-Varuṇa, fulfil The thoughts of those who sing your praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॒द्य सूर॒ उदि॒तेऽना॑गा मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा सु॒वाति॑ सवि॒ता भगः॑
verses.transliteration: yád adyá sū́ra údite-  -ánāgā mitró aryamā́  suvā́ti savitā́ bhágaḥ

translation.text: So when the Sun hath risen to-day, may sinless Mitra, Aryaman, Bhaga, and Savitar sendus forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒प्रा॒वीर॑स्तु॒ स क्षयः॒ प्र नु याम॑न्त्सुदानवः ये नो॒ अंहो॑ऽति॒पिप्र॑ति
verses.transliteration: suprāvī́r astu sá kṣáyaḥ  prá nú yā́man sudānavaḥ  yé no áṃho 'tipíprati

translation.text: May this our home be guarded well forward, ye Bounteous, on the way, Who bear us safely o'er distress.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्व॒राजो॒ अदि॑ति॒रद॑ब्धस्य व्र॒तस्य॒ ये म॒हो राजा॑न ईशते
verses.transliteration: utá svarā́jo áditir  ádabdhasya vratásya yé  mahó rā́jāna īśate

translation.text: And those Self-reigning, Aditi, whose statute is inviolate, The Kings who rule a vast domain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ वां॒ सूर॒ उदि॑ते मि॒त्रं गृ॑णीषे॒ वरु॑णम् अ॒र्य॒मणं॑ रि॒शाद॑सम्
verses.transliteration: práti vāṃ sū́ra údite  mitráṃ gr̥ṇīṣe váruṇam  aryamáṇaṃ riśā́dasam

translation.text: Soon as the Sun hath risen, to you, to Mitra-Varuṇa, I sing, And Aryaman who slays the foe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रा॒या हि॑रण्य॒या म॒तिरि॒यम॑वृ॒काय॒ शव॑से इ॒यं विप्रा॑ मे॒धसा॑तये
verses.transliteration: rāyā́ hiraṇyayā́ matír  iyám avr̥kā́ya śávase  iyáṃ víprā medhásātaye

translation.text: With wealth of gold may this my song bring unmolested power and might, And, Brahmans, gain the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते स्या॑म देव वरुण॒ ते मि॑त्र सू॒रिभिः॑ स॒ह इषं॒ स्व॑श्च धीमहि
verses.transliteration: té syāma deva varuṇa  té mitra sūríbhiḥ sahá  íṣaṃ svàś ca dhīmahi

translation.text: May we be thine, God Varuṇa, and with our princes, Mitra, thine. Food and Heaven's light will we obtain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब॒हवः॒ सूर॑चक्षसोऽग्निजि॒ह्वा ऋ॑ता॒वृधः॑ त्रीणि॒ ये ये॒मुर्वि॒दथा॑नि धी॒तिभि॒र्विश्वा॑नि॒ परि॑भूतिभिः
verses.transliteration: bahávaḥ sū́racakṣaso  -agnijihvā́ r̥tāvŕ̥dhaḥ  trī́ṇi yé yemúr vidáthāni dhītíbhir  víśvāni páribhūtibhiḥ

translation.text: Many are they who strengthen Law, Sun-eyed, with Agni for their tongue, They who direct the three great gatherings with their thoughts, yea, all things with surpassing might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि ये द॒धुः श॒रदं॒ मास॒मादह॑र्य॒ज्ञम॒क्तुं चादृच॑म् अ॒ना॒प्यं वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा क्ष॒त्रं राजा॑न आशत
verses.transliteration: ví yé dadhúḥ śarádam mā́sam ā́d áhar  yajñám aktúṃ cā́d ŕ̥cam  anāpyáṃ váruṇo mitró aryamā́  kṣatráṃ rā́jāna āśata

translation.text: They who have stablished year and month and then the day, night, sacrifice and holy verse, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, the Kings, have won dominion which none else may gain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्वो॑ अ॒द्य म॑नामहे सू॒क्तैः सूर॒ उदि॑ते यदोह॑ते॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा यू॒यमृ॒तस्य॑ रथ्यः
verses.transliteration: tád vo adyá manāmahe  sūktaíḥ sū́ra údite  yád óhate váruṇo mitró aryamā́  yūyám r̥tásya rathyaḥ

translation.text: So at the rising of the Sun we think of you with hymns to-day, Even as Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman deserve: ye are the charioteers of Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तावा॑न ऋ॒तजा॑ता ऋता॒वृधो॑ घो॒रासो॑ अनृत॒द्विषः॑ तेषां॑ वः सु॒म्ने सु॑च्छ॒र्दिष्ट॑मे नरः॒ स्याम॒ ये च॑ सू॒रयः॑
verses.transliteration: r̥tā́vāna r̥tájātā r̥tāvŕ̥dho  ghorā́so anr̥tadvíṣaḥ  téṣāṃ vaḥ sumné suchardíṣṭame naraḥ  syā́ma yé ca sūráyaḥ

translation.text: True to Law, born in Law the strengtheners of Law, terrible, haters of the false, In their felicity which gives the best defence may we men and our princes dwell.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒ त्यद्द॑र्श॒तं वपु॑र्दि॒व ए॑ति प्रतिह्व॒रे यदी॑मा॒शुर्वह॑ति दे॒व एत॑शो॒ विश्व॑स्मै॒ चक्ष॑से॒ अर॑म्
verses.transliteration: úd u tyád darśatáṃ vápur  divá eti pratihvaré  yád īm āśúr váhati devá étaśo  víśvasmai cákṣase áram

translation.text: Uprises, on the slope of heaven, that marvel that attracts die sight As swift celestial Etaṣa bears it away, prepared for every eye to see.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शी॒र्ष्णःशी॑र्ष्णो॒ जग॑तस्त॒स्थुष॒स्पतिं॑ स॒मया॒ विश्व॒मा रजः॑ स॒प्त स्वसा॑रः सुवि॒ताय॒ सूर्यं॒ वह॑न्ति ह॒रितो॒ रथे॑
verses.transliteration: śīrṣṇáḥ-śīrṣṇo jágatas tasthúṣas pátiṃ  samáyā víśvam ā́ rájaḥ  saptá svásāraḥ suvitā́ya sū́ryaṃ  váhanti haríto ráthe

translation.text: Lord of each single head, of fixt and moving things, equally through the whole expanse, The Seven sister Bays bear Sûrya on his car, to bring us wealth and happiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तच्चक्षु॑र्दे॒वहि॑तं शु॒क्रमु॒च्चर॑त् पश्ये॑म श॒रदः॑ श॒तं जीवे॑म श॒रदः॑ श॒तम्
verses.transliteration: tác cákṣur deváhitaṃ śukrám uccárat  páśyema śarádaḥ śatáṃ  jī́vema śarádaḥ śatám

translation.text: A hundred autumns may we see that bright Eye, God-ordained, arise A hundred autumns may we live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: काव्ये॑भिरदा॒भ्या या॑तं वरुण द्यु॒मत् मि॒त्रश्च॒ सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: kā́vyebhir adābhyā-  -ā́ yātaṃ varuṇa dyumát  mitráś ca sómapītaye

translation.text: Infallible through your wisdom, come hither, resplendent Varuṇa, And Mitra, to the Soma draught.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वो धाम॑भिर्वरुण मि॒त्रश्चा या॑तम॒द्रुहा॑ पिब॑तं॒ सोम॑मातु॒जी
verses.transliteration: divó dhā́mabhir varuṇa  mitráś cā́ yātam adrúhā  píbataṃ sómam ātujī́

translation.text: Come as the laws of Heaven ordain, Varuṇa, Mitra, void of guile: Press near and drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ या॑तं मित्रावरुणा जुषा॒णावाहु॑तिं नरा पा॒तं सोम॑मृतावृधा
verses.transliteration: ā́ yātam mitrāvaruṇā  juṣāṇā́v ā́hutiṃ narā  pātáṃ sómam r̥tāvr̥dhā

translation.text: Come, Mitra, Varuṇa, accept, Heroes, our sacrificial gift: Drink Soma, ye who strengthen Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ वां॒ रथं॑ नृपती ज॒रध्यै॑ ह॒विष्म॑ता॒ मन॑सा य॒ज्ञिये॑न यो वां॑ दू॒तो न धि॑ष्ण्या॒वजी॑ग॒रच्छा॑ सू॒नुर्न पि॒तरा॑ विवक्मि
verses.transliteration: práti vāṃ ráthaṃ nr̥patī jarádhyai  havíṣmatā mánasā yajñíyena  yó vāṃ dūtó ná dhiṣṇyāv ájīgar  áchā sūnúr ná pitárā vivakmi

translation.text: I WITH a holy heart that brings oblation will sing forth praise to meet your car, ye Princes, Which, Much-desired! hath wakened as your envoy. I call you hither as a son his parents.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अशो॑च्य॒ग्निः स॑मिधा॒नो अ॒स्मे उपो॑ अदृश्र॒न्तम॑सश्चि॒दन्ताः॑ अचे॑ति के॒तुरु॒षसः॑ पु॒रस्ता॑च्छ्रि॒ये दि॒वो दु॑हि॒तुर्जाय॑मानः
verses.transliteration: áśocy agníḥ samidhānó asmé  úpo adr̥śran támasaś cid ántāḥ  áceti ketúr uṣásaḥ purástāc  -śriyé divó duhitúr jā́yamānaḥ

translation.text: Brightly hath Agni shone by us enkindled: the limits even of darkness were apparent. Eastward is seen the Banner of the Morning, the Banner born to give Heaven's Daughter glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि वां॑ नू॒नम॑श्विना॒ सुहो॑ता॒ स्तोमैः॑ सिषक्ति नासत्या विव॒क्वान् पू॒र्वीभि॑र्यातं प॒थ्या॑भिर॒र्वाक्स्व॒र्विदा॒ वसु॑मता॒ रथे॑न
verses.transliteration: abhí vāṃ nūnám aśvinā súhotā  stómaiḥ siṣakti nāsatyā vivakvā́n  pūrvī́bhir yātam pathyā̀bhir arvā́k  svarvídā vásumatā ráthena

translation.text: With hymns the deft priest is about you, Aṣvins, the eloquent priest attends you now, Nâsatyas. Come by the paths that ye are wont to travel, on car that finds the light, laden with treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒वोर्वां॑ नू॒नम॑श्विना यु॒वाकु॑र्हु॒वे यद्वां॑ सु॒ते मा॑ध्वी वसू॒युः आ वां॑ वहन्तु॒ स्थवि॑रासो॒ अश्वाः॒ पिबा॑थो अ॒स्मे सुषु॑ता॒ मधू॑नि
verses.transliteration: avór vāṃ nūnám aśvinā yuvā́kur  huvé yád vāṃ suté mādhvī vasūyúḥ  ā́ vāṃ vahantu sthávirāso áśvāḥ  píbātho asmé súṣutā mádhūni

translation.text: When, suppliant for your help, Lovers of Sweetness! I seeking wealth call you to our libation, Hitherward let your vigorous horses bear you: drink ye with us the well-pressed Soma juices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्राची॑मु देवाश्विना॒ धियं॒ मेऽमृ॑ध्रां सा॒तये॑ कृतं वसू॒युम् विश्वा॑ अविष्टं॒ वाज॒ आ पुरं॑धी॒स्ता नः॑ शक्तं शचीपती॒ शची॑भिः
verses.transliteration: prā́cīm u devāśvinā dhíyam me-  -ámr̥dhrāṃ sātáye kr̥taṃ vasūyúm  víśvā aviṣṭaṃ vā́ja ā́ púraṃdhīs  tā́ naḥ śaktaṃ śacīpatī śácībhiḥ

translation.text: Bring forward, Aṣvins, Gods, to its fulfilment my never-wearied prayer that asks for riches. Vouchsafe us all high spirit in the combat, and with your powers, O Lords of Power, assist us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒वि॒ष्टं धी॒ष्व॑श्विना न आ॒सु प्र॒जाव॒द्रेतो॒ अह्र॑यं नो अस्तु आ वां॑ तो॒के तन॑ये॒ तूतु॑जानाः सु॒रत्ना॑सो दे॒ववी॑तिं गमेम
verses.transliteration: aviṣṭáṃ dhīṣv àśvinā na āsú  prajā́vad réto áhrayaṃ no astu  ā́ vāṃ toké tánaye tū́tujānāḥ  surátnāso devávītiṃ gamema

translation.text: Favour us in these prayers of ours, O Aṣvins. May we have genial vigour, ne'er to fail us. So may we, strong in children and descendants, go, wealthy, to the banquet that awaits you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष स्य वां॑ पूर्व॒गत्वे॑व॒ सख्ये॑ नि॒धिर्हि॒तो मा॑ध्वी रा॒तो अ॒स्मे अहे॑ळता॒ मन॒सा या॑तम॒र्वाग॒श्नन्ता॑ ह॒व्यं मानु॑षीषु वि॒क्षु
verses.transliteration: eṣá syá vām pūrvagátveva sákhye  nidhír hitó mādhvī rātó asmé  áheḷatā mánasā́ yātam arvā́g  aśnántā havyám mā́nuṣīṣu vikṣú

translation.text: Lovers of Sweetness, we have brought this treasure to you as 'twere an envoy sent for friendship. Come unto us with spirits free from anger, in homes of men enjoying our oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एक॑स्मि॒न्योगे॑ भुरणा समा॒ने परि॑ वां स॒प्त स्र॒वतो॒ रथो॑ गात् न वा॑यन्ति सु॒भ्वो॑ दे॒वयु॑क्ता॒ ये वां॑ धू॒र्षु त॒रण॑यो॒ वह॑न्ति
verses.transliteration: ékasmin yóge bhuraṇā samāné  pári vāṃ saptá sraváto rátho gāt  ná vāyanti subhvò deváyuktāḥ-  yé vāṃ dhūrṣú taráṇayo váhanti

translation.text: With one, the same, intention, ye swift movers, o'er the Seven Rivers hath your chariot travelled. Yoked by the Gods, your strong steeds never weary while speeding forward at the pole they bear you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स॒श्चता॑ म॒घव॑द्भ्यो॒ हि भू॒तं ये रा॒या म॑घ॒देयं॑ जु॒नन्ति॑ प्र ये बन्धुं॑ सू॒नृता॑भिस्ति॒रन्ते॒ गव्या॑ पृ॒ञ्चन्तो॒ अश्व्या॑ म॒घानि॑
verses.transliteration: asaścátā maghávadbhyo hí bhūtáṃ  yé rāyā́ maghadéyaṃ junánti  prá yé bándhuṃ sūnŕ̥tābhis tiránte  gávyā pr̥ñcánto áśvyā maghā́ni

translation.text: Exhaustless be your bounty to our princes who with their wealth incite the gift of riches, Who further friendship with their noble natures, combining wealth in kine with wealth in herses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू मे॒ हव॒मा शृ॑णुतं युवाना यासि॒ष्टं व॒र्तिर॑श्विना॒विरा॑वत् ध॒त्तं रत्ना॑नि॒ जर॑तं च सू॒रीन्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: nū́ me hávam ā́ śr̥ṇutaṃ yuvānā  yāsiṣṭáṃ vartír aśvināv írāvat  dhattáṃ rátnāni járataṃ ca sūrī́n  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Now hear, O Youthful Twain, mine invocation: come, Aṣvins, to the home where food aboundeth. Vouchsafe us wealth, do honour to our nobles. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ शु॑भ्रा यातमश्विना॒ स्वश्वा॒ गिरो॑ दस्रा जुजुषा॒णा यु॒वाकोः॑ ह॒व्यानि॑ च॒ प्रति॑भृता वी॒तं नः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ śubhrā yātam aśvinā sváśvā  gíro dasrā jujuṣāṇā́ yuvā́koḥ  havyā́ni ca prátibhr̥tā vītáṃ naḥ

translation.text: COME, radiant Aṣvins, with your noble horses: accept your servant's hymns, ye Wonder-Workers: Enjoy oblations which we bring to greet you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वा॒मन्धां॑सि॒ मद्या॑न्यस्थु॒ररं॑ गन्तं ह॒विषो॑ वी॒तये॑ मे ति॒रो अ॒र्यो हव॑नानि श्रु॒तं नः॑
verses.transliteration: prá vām ándhāṃsi mádyāny asthur  áraṃ gantaṃ havíṣo vītáye me  tiró aryó hávanāni śrutáṃ naḥ

translation.text: The gladdening juices stand prepared before you: come quickly and partake of mine oblation. Pass by the calling of our foe and bear us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वां॒ रथो॒ मनो॑जवा इयर्ति ति॒रो रजां॑स्यश्विना श॒तोतिः॑ अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ सूर्यावसू इया॒नः
verses.transliteration: prá vāṃ rátho mánojavā iyarti  tiró rájāṃsy aśvinā śatótiḥ  asmábhyaṃ sūryāvasū iyānáḥ

translation.text: Your chariot with a hundred aids, O Aṣvins, beareth you swift as thought across the regions, Speeding to us, O ye whose wealth is Sûrya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं ह॒ यद्वां॑ देव॒या उ॒ अद्रि॑रू॒र्ध्वो विव॑क्ति सोम॒सुद्यु॒वभ्या॑म् आ व॒ल्गू विप्रो॑ ववृतीत ह॒व्यैः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ ha yád vāṃ devayā́ u ádrir  ūrdhvó vívakti somasúd yuvábhyām  ā́ valgū́ vípro vavr̥tīta havyaíḥ

translation.text: What time this stone of yours, the Gods' adorer, upraised, sounds forth for you as Soma-presser, Let the priest bring you, Fair Ones, through oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चि॒त्रं ह॒ यद्वां॒ भोज॑नं॒ न्वस्ति॒ न्यत्र॑ये॒ महि॑ष्वन्तं युयोतम् यो वा॑मो॒मानं॒ दध॑ते प्रि॒यः सन्
verses.transliteration: citráṃ ha yád vām bhójanaṃ nv ásti  ny átraye máhiṣvantaṃ yuyotam  yó vām omā́naṃ dádhate priyáḥ sán

translation.text: The nourishment ye have is, truly, wondrous: ye gave thereof a quickening store to Atri, Who being dear to you, receives your favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त त्यद्वां॑ जुर॒ते अ॑श्विना भू॒च्च्यवा॑नाय प्र॒तीत्यं॑ हवि॒र्दे अधि॒ यद्वर्प॑ इ॒तऊ॑ति ध॒त्थः
verses.transliteration: utá tyád vāṃ juraté aśvinā bhūc  cyávānāya pratī́tyaṃ havirdé  ádhi yád várpa itáūti dhattháḥ

translation.text: That gift, which all may gain, ye gave Chyavâna, when he grew old, who offered you oblations, When ye bestowed on him enduring beauty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त त्यं भु॒ज्युम॑श्विना॒ सखा॑यो॒ मध्ये॑ जहुर्दु॒रेवा॑सः समु॒द्रे निरीं॑ पर्ष॒दरा॑वा॒ यो यु॒वाकुः॑
verses.transliteration: utá tyám bhujyúm aśvinā sákhāyo  mádhye jahur durévāsaḥ samudré  nír īm parṣad árāvā yó yuvā́kuḥ

translation.text: What time his wicked friends abandoned Bhujyu, O Aṣvins, in the middle of the ocean, Your horse delivered him, your faithful servant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृका॑य चि॒ज्जस॑मानाय शक्तमु॒त श्रु॑तं श॒यवे॑ हू॒यमा॑ना याव॒घ्न्यामपि॑न्वतम॒पो न स्त॒र्यं॑ चिच्छ॒क्त्य॑श्विना॒ शची॑भिः
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥kāya cij jásamānāya śaktam  utá śrutaṃ śayáve hūyámānā  yā́v aghnyā́m ápinvatam apó ná  staryàṃ cic chakty àśvinā śácībhiḥ

translation.text: Ye lent your aid to Vr̥ika when exhausted, and listened when invoked to Ṣayu's calling. Ye made the cow pour forth her milk like water, and, Aṣvins, strengthened with your strength the barren.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष स्य का॒रुर्ज॑रते सू॒क्तैरग्रे॑ बुधा॒न उ॒षसां॑ सु॒मन्मा॑ इ॒षा तं व॑र्धद॒घ्न्या पयो॑भिर्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: eṣá syá kārúr jarate sūktaír  ágre budhāná uṣásāṃ sumánmā  iṣā́ táṃ vardhad aghnyā́ páyobhir  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: With his fair hymns this singer, too, extols you, waking with glad thoughts at the break of morning. May the cow nourish him with milk to feed llim. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॒ रथो॒ रोद॑सी बद्बधा॒नो हि॑र॒ण्ययो॒ वृष॑भिर्या॒त्वश्वैः॑ घृ॒तव॑र्तनिः प॒विभी॑ रुचा॒न इ॒षां वो॒ळ्हा नृ॒पति॑र्वा॒जिनी॑वान्
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ rátho ródasī badbadhānó  hiraṇyáyo vŕ̥ṣabhir yātv áśvaiḥ  ghr̥távartaniḥ pavíbhī rucānáḥ-  iṣā́ṃ voḷhā́ nr̥pátir vājínīvān

translation.text: MAY your gold chariot, drawn by vigorous horses, come to us, blocking up the earth and heaven, Bright with its fellies while its way drops fatness, food-laden, rich in coursers, man's protector.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स प॑प्रथा॒नो अ॒भि पञ्च॒ भूमा॑ त्रिवन्धु॒रो मन॒सा या॑तु यु॒क्तः विशो॒ येन॒ गच्छ॑थो देव॒यन्तीः॒ कुत्रा॑ चि॒द्याम॑मश्विना॒ दधा॑ना
verses.transliteration: sá paprathānó abhí páñca bhū́mā  trivandhuró mánasā́ yātu yuktáḥ  víśo yéna gáchatho devayántīḥ  kútrā cid yā́mam aśvinā dádhānā

translation.text: Let it approach, yoked by thewill, three-seated, extending far and wide o'er fivefold beings, Whereon ye visit God-adoring races, bending your course whither ye will, O Aṣvins.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वश्वा॑ य॒शसा या॑तम॒र्वाग्दस्रा॑ नि॒धिं मधु॑मन्तं पिबाथः वि वां॒ रथो॑ व॒ध्वा॒३॒॑ याद॑मा॒नोऽन्ता॑न्दि॒वो बा॑धते वर्त॒निभ्या॑म्
verses.transliteration: sváśvā yaśásā́ yātam arvā́g  dásrā nidhím mádhumantam pibāthaḥ  ví vāṃ rátho vadhvā̀ yā́damānaḥ-  -ántān divó bādhate vartaníbhyām

translation.text: Renowned, with noble horses, come ye hither: drink, Wondrous Pair, the cup that holds sweet juices. Your car whereon your Spouse is wont to travel marks with its track the farthest ends of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वोः श्रियं॒ परि॒ योषा॑वृणीत॒ सूरो॑ दुहि॒ता परि॑तक्म्यायाम् यद्दे॑व॒यन्त॒मव॑थः॒ शची॑भिः॒ परि॑ घ्रं॒समो॒मना॑ वां॒ वयो॑ गात्
verses.transliteration: yuvóḥ śríyam pári yóṣāvr̥ṇīta  sū́ro duhitā́ páritakmyāyām  yád devayántam ávathaḥ śácībhiḥ  pári ghraṃsám ománā vāṃ váyo gāt

translation.text: When night was turning to the grey of morning the Maiden, Sûrya's Daughter, chose your splendour. When with your power and might ye aid the pious he comes through heat to life by your assistance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो ह॒ स्य वां॑ रथिरा॒ वस्त॑ उ॒स्रा रथो॑ युजा॒नः प॑रि॒याति॑ व॒र्तिः तेन॑ नः॒ शं योरु॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ॒ न्य॑श्विना वहतं य॒ज्ञे अ॒स्मिन्
verses.transliteration: yó ha syá vāṃ rathirā vásta usrā́ḥ-  rátho yujānáḥ pariyā́ti vartíḥ  téna naḥ śáṃ yór uṣáso vyùṣṭau  ny àśvinā vahataṃ yajñé asmín

translation.text: O Chariot-borne, this car of yours invested with rays of light comes harnessed to our dwelling. Herewith, O Aṣvins, while the dawn is breaking, to this our sacrifice bring peace and blessing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नरा॑ गौ॒रेव॑ वि॒द्युतं॑ तृषा॒णास्माक॑म॒द्य सव॒नोप॑ यातम् पु॒रु॒त्रा हि वां॑ म॒तिभि॒र्हव॑न्ते॒ मा वा॑म॒न्ये नि य॑मन्देव॒यन्तः॑
verses.transliteration: nárā gauréva vidyútaṃ tr̥ṣāṇā́-  -asmā́kam adyá sávanópa yātam  purutrā́ hí vām matíbhir hávante  mā́ vām anyé ní yaman devayántaḥ

translation.text: Like the wild cattle thirsty for the lightning, Heroes, come nigh this day to our libations. Men call on you with hymns in many places, but let not other worshippers detain you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं भु॒ज्युमव॑विद्धं समु॒द्र उदू॑हथु॒रर्ण॑सो॒ अस्रि॑धानैः प॒त॒त्रिभि॑रश्र॒मैर॑व्य॒थिभि॑र्दं॒सना॑भिरश्विना पा॒रय॑न्ता
verses.transliteration: yuvám bhujyúm ávaviddhaṃ samudré-  úd ūhathur árṇaso ásridhānaiḥ  patatríbhir aśramaír avyathíbhir  daṃsánābhir aśvinā pāráyantā

translation.text: Bhujyu, abandoned in the midst of ocean, ye raised from out the water with your horses, Uninjured, winged, flagging not, undaunted, with deeds of wonder saving him, O Aṣvins.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू मे॒ हव॒मा शृ॑णुतं युवाना यासि॒ष्टं व॒र्तिर॑श्विना॒विरा॑वत् ध॒त्तं रत्ना॑नि॒ जर॑तं च सू॒रीन्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: nū́ me hávam ā́ śr̥ṇutaṃ yuvānā  yāsiṣṭáṃ vartír aśvināv írāvat  dhattáṃ rátnāni járataṃ ca sūrī́n  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Now hear, O Youthful Twain, mine invocation: come, Aṣvins, to the home where food aboundeth. Vouchsafe us wealth, do honour to our nobles. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वि॑श्ववाराश्विना गतं नः॒ प्र तत्स्थान॑मवाचि वां पृथि॒व्याम् अश्वो॒ न वा॒जी शु॒नपृ॑ष्ठो अस्था॒दा यत्से॒दथु॑र्ध्रु॒वसे॒ न योनि॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ viśvavārāśvinā gataṃ naḥ  prá tát sthā́nam avāci vām pr̥thivyā́m  áśvo ná vājī́ śunápr̥ṣṭho asthād  ā́ yát sedáthur dhruváse ná yónim

translation.text: RICH in all blessings, Aṣvins come ye hither: this place on earth is called your own possession, Like a strong horse with a fair back it standeth, whereon, as in a lap, ye seat you firmly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सिष॑क्ति॒ सा वां॑ सुम॒तिश्चनि॒ष्ठाता॑पि घ॒र्मो मनु॑षो दुरो॒णे यो वां॑ समु॒द्रान्त्स॒रितः॒ पिप॒र्त्येत॑ग्वा चि॒न्न सु॒युजा॑ युजा॒नः
verses.transliteration: síṣakti sā́ vāṃ sumatíś cániṣṭhā-  -átāpi gharmó mánuṣo duroṇé  yó vāṃ samudrā́n sarítaḥ píparti-  étagvā cin ná suyújā yujānáḥ

translation.text: This most delightful eulogy awaits you in the man's house drink-offering hath been heated, Which bringeth you over the seas and rivers, yoking as'twere two well-matched shining horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यानि॒ स्थाना॑न्यश्विना द॒धाथे॑ दि॒वो य॒ह्वीष्वोष॑धीषु वि॒क्षु नि पर्व॑तस्य मू॒र्धनि॒ सद॒न्तेषं॒ जना॑य दा॒शुषे॒ वह॑न्ता
verses.transliteration: yā́ni sthā́nāny aśvinā dadhā́the  divó yahvī́ṣv óṣadhīṣu vikṣú  ní párvatasya mūrdháni sádantā-  -íṣaṃ jánāya dāśúṣe váhantā

translation.text: Whatever dwellings ye possess, O Aṣvins, in fields of men or in the streams of heaven, Resting upon the summit of the mountain, or bringing food to him who gives oblation,

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒नि॒ष्टं दे॑वा॒ ओष॑धीष्व॒प्सु यद्यो॒ग्या अ॒श्नवै॑थे॒ ऋषी॑णाम् पु॒रूणि॒ रत्ना॒ दध॑तौ॒ न्य१॒॑स्मे अनु॒ पूर्वा॑णि चख्यथुर्यु॒गानि॑
verses.transliteration: caniṣṭáṃ devā óṣadhīṣv apsú  yád yogyā́ aśnávaithe ŕ̥ṣīṇām  purū́ṇi rátnā dádhatau ny àsmé  ánu pū́rvāṇi cakhyathur yugā́ni

translation.text: Delight yourselves, ye Gods, in plants and waters when R̥ishis give them and ye find they suit You. Enriching us with treasures in abundance ye have looked back to former generations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒श्रु॒वांसा॑ चिदश्विना पु॒रूण्य॒भि ब्रह्मा॑णि चक्षाथे॒ ऋषी॑णाम् प्रति॒ प्र या॑तं॒ वर॒मा जना॑या॒स्मे वा॑मस्तु सुम॒तिश्चनि॑ष्ठा
verses.transliteration: śuśruvā́ṃsā cid aśvinā purū́ṇi-  abhí bráhmāṇi cakṣāthe ŕ̥ṣīṇām  práti prá yātaṃ váram ā́ jánāya-  -asmé vām astu sumatíś cániṣṭhā

translation.text: Aṣvins, though ye have heard them oft aforetime, regard the many prayers which R̥ishis offer. Come to the man even as his heart desireth: may we enjoy your most delightful favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वां॑ य॒ज्ञो ना॑सत्या ह॒विष्मा॑न्कृ॒तब्र॑ह्मा सम॒र्यो॒३॒॑ भवा॑ति उप॒ प्र या॑तं॒ वर॒मा वसि॑ष्ठमि॒मा ब्रह्मा॑ण्यृच्यन्ते यु॒वभ्या॑म्
verses.transliteration: yó vāṃ yajñó nāsatyā havíṣmān  kr̥tábrahmā samaryò bhávāti  úpa prá yātaṃ váram ā́ vásiṣṭham  imā́ bráhmāṇy r̥cyante yuvábhyām

translation.text: Come to the sacrifice offered you, Nâsatyas, with men, oblations, and prayer duly uttered. Come to Vasishṭha as his heart desireth, for unto you these holy hymns are chanted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं म॑नी॒षा इ॒यम॑श्विना॒ गीरि॒मां सु॑वृ॒क्तिं वृ॑षणा जुषेथाम् इ॒मा ब्रह्मा॑णि युव॒यून्य॑ग्मन्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: iyám manīṣā́ iyám aśvinā gī́r  imā́ṃ suvr̥ktíṃ vr̥ṣaṇā juṣethām  imā́ bráhmāṇi yuvayū́ny agman  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: This is the thought, this is the song, O Aṣvins: accept this hymn of ours, ye Steers, with favour. May these our prayers addressed to you come nigh you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप॒ स्वसु॑रु॒षसो॒ नग्जि॑हीते रि॒णक्ति॑ कृ॒ष्णीर॑रु॒षाय॒ पन्था॑म् अश्वा॑मघा॒ गोम॑घा वां हुवेम॒ दिवा॒ नक्तं॒ शरु॑म॒स्मद्यु॑योतम्
verses.transliteration: ápa svásur uṣáso nág jihīte  riṇákti kr̥ṣṇī́r aruṣā́ya pánthām  áśvāmaghā gómaghā vāṃ huvema  dívā náktaṃ śárum asmád yuyotam

translation.text: THE Night retireth from the Dawn her Sister; the Dark one yieldeth to the Red her pathway. Let us invoke you rich in steeds and cattle – by day and night keep far from us the arrow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒पाया॑तं दा॒शुषे॒ मर्त्या॑य॒ रथे॑न वा॒मम॑श्विना॒ वह॑न्ता यु॒यु॒तम॒स्मदनि॑रा॒ममी॑वां॒ दिवा॒ नक्तं॑ माध्वी॒ त्रासी॑थां नः
verses.transliteration: upā́yātaṃ dāśúṣe mártyāya  ráthena vāmám aśvinā váhantā  yuyutám asmád ánirām ámīvāṃ  dívā náktam mādhvī trā́sīthāṃ naḥ

translation.text: Bearing rich treasure in your car, O Aṣvins, come to the mortal who presents oblation. Keep at a distance penury and sickness; Lovers of Sweetness, day and night preserve us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॒ रथ॑मव॒मस्यां॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ सुम्ना॒यवो॒ वृष॑णो वर्तयन्तु स्यूम॑गभस्तिमृत॒युग्भि॒रश्वै॒राश्वि॑ना॒ वसु॑मन्तं वहेथाम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ rátham avamásyāṃ vyùṣṭau  sumnāyávo vŕ̥ṣaṇo vartayantu  syū́magabhastim r̥tayúgbhir áśvair  ā́śvinā vásumantaṃ vahethām

translation.text: May your strong horses, seeking bliss, bring hither your chariot at the earliest flush of morning. With coursers yoked by Law drive hither, Aṣvins, your car whose reins are light, laden with treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वां॒ रथो॑ नृपती॒ अस्ति॑ वो॒ळ्हा त्रि॑वन्धु॒रो वसु॑माँ उ॒स्रया॑मा आ न॑ ए॒ना ना॑स॒त्योप॑ यातम॒भि यद्वां॑ वि॒श्वप्स्न्यो॒ जिगा॑ति
verses.transliteration: yó vāṃ rátho nr̥patī ásti voḷhā́  trivandhuró vásumām̐ usráyāmā  ā́ na enā́ nāsatyópa yātam  abhí yád vāṃ viśvápsnyo jígāti

translation.text: The chariot, Princes, that conveys you, moving at daylight, triple-seated, fraught with riches, Even with this come unto us, Nâsatyas, that laden with all food it may approach us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं च्यवा॑नं ज॒रसो॑ऽमुमुक्तं॒ नि पे॒दव॑ ऊहथुरा॒शुमश्व॑म् निरंह॑स॒स्तम॑सः स्पर्त॒मत्रिं॒ नि जा॑हु॒षं शि॑थि॒रे धा॑तम॒न्तः
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ cyávānaṃ jaráso 'mumuktaṃ  ní pedáva ūhathur āśúm áśvam  nír áṃhasas támasa spartam átriṃ  ní jāhuṣáṃ śithiré dhātam antáḥ

translation.text: Ye freed Chyavâna from old age and weakness: ye brought the courser fleet of food to Pedu. Ye rescued Atri from distress and darkness, and loosed for Jâhusha the bonds that bound him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं म॑नी॒षा इ॒यम॑श्विना॒ गीरि॒मां सु॑वृ॒क्तिं वृ॑षणा जुषेथाम् इ॒मा ब्रह्मा॑णि युव॒यून्य॑ग्मन्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: iyám manīṣā́ iyám aśvinā gī́r  imā́ṃ suvr̥ktíṃ vr̥ṣaṇā juṣethām  imā́ bráhmāṇi yuvayū́ny agman  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: This is the thought, this is the song, O Aṣvins: accept this hymn of ours, ye Steers, With favour. May these our prayers addressed to you come nigh you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ गोम॑ता नासत्या॒ रथे॒नाश्वा॑वता पुरुश्च॒न्द्रेण॑ यातम् अ॒भि वां॒ विश्वा॑ नि॒युतः॑ सचन्ते स्पा॒र्हया॑ श्रि॒या त॒न्वा॑ शुभा॒ना
verses.transliteration: ā́ gómatā nāsatyā ráthena-  -śvāvatā puruścandréṇa yātam  abhí vāṃ víśvā niyútaḥ sacante  spārháyā śriyā́ tanvā̀ śubhānā́

translation.text: COME, O Nâsatyas, on your car resplendent, rich in abundant wealth of kine and horses. As harnessed steeds, all our laudations follow you whose forms shine with most delightful beauty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ दे॒वेभि॒रुप॑ यातम॒र्वाक्स॒जोष॑सा नासत्या॒ रथे॑न यु॒वोर्हि नः॑ स॒ख्या पित्र्या॑णि समा॒नो बन्धु॑रु॒त तस्य॑ वित्तम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ no devébhir úpa yātam arvā́k  sajóṣasā nāsatyā ráthena  yuvór hí naḥ sakhyā́ pítryāṇi  samānó bándhur utá tásya vittam

translation.text: Come with the Gods associate, come ye hither to us, Nâsatyas, with your car accordant. 'Twixt you and us there is ancestral friendship and common kin: remember and regard it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒ स्तोमा॑सो अ॒श्विनो॑रबुध्रञ्जा॒मि ब्रह्मा॑ण्यु॒षस॑श्च दे॒वीः आ॒विवा॑स॒न्रोद॑सी॒ धिष्ण्ये॒मे अच्छा॒ विप्रो॒ नास॑त्या विवक्ति
verses.transliteration: úd u stómāso aśvínor abudhrañ  jāmí bráhmāṇy uṣásaś ca devī́ḥ  āvívāsan ródasī dhíṣṇyemé  áchā vípro nā́satyā vivakti

translation.text: Awakened are the songs that praise the Aṣvins, the kindred prayers and the Celestial Mornings. Inviting those we long for, Earth and Heaven, the singer calleth these Nâsatyas hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि चेदु॒च्छन्त्य॑श्विना उ॒षासः॒ प्र वां॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि का॒रवो॑ भरन्ते ऊ॒र्ध्वं भा॒नुं स॑वि॒ता दे॒वो अ॑श्रेद्बृ॒हद॒ग्नयः॑ स॒मिधा॑ जरन्ते
verses.transliteration: ví céd uchánty aśvinā uṣā́saḥ  prá vām bráhmāṇi kārávo bharante  ūrdhvám bhānúṃ savitā́ devó aśred  br̥hád agnáyaḥ samídhā jarante

translation.text: What time the Dawns break forth in light, O Aṣvins, to you the poets offer their devotions. God Savitar hath sent aloft his splendour, and fires sing praises with the kindled fuel.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ प॒श्चाता॑न्नास॒त्या पु॒रस्ता॒दाश्वि॑ना यातमध॒रादुद॑क्तात् आ वि॒श्वतः॒ पाञ्च॑जन्येन रा॒या यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: ā́ paścā́tān nāsatyā́ purástād  ā́śvinā yātam adharā́d údaktāt  ā́ viśvátaḥ pā́ñcajanyena rāyā́  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Come from the west, come from the cast, Nâsatyas, come, Aṣvins, from below and from above us. Bring wealth from all sides for the Fivefold People. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अता॑रिष्म॒ तम॑सस्पा॒रम॒स्य प्रति॒ स्तोमं॑ देव॒यन्तो॒ दधा॑नाः पु॒रु॒दंसा॑ पुरु॒तमा॑ पुरा॒जाम॑र्त्या हवते अ॒श्विना॒ गीः
verses.transliteration: átāriṣma támasas pārám asyá-  práti stómaṃ devayánto dádhānāḥ  purudáṃsā purutámā purājā́-  -ámartyā havate aśvínā gī́ḥ

translation.text: WE have o'erpassed the limit of this darkness while, worshipping the Gods, we sang their praises. The song invoketh both Immortal Aṣvins far-reaching, born of old, great WonderWorkers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न्यु॑ प्रि॒यो मनु॑षः सादि॒ होता॒ नास॑त्या॒ यो यज॑ते॒ वन्द॑ते च अ॒श्नी॒तं मध्वो॑ अश्विना उपा॒क आ वां॑ वोचे वि॒दथे॑षु॒ प्रय॑स्वान्
verses.transliteration: ny ù priyó mánuṣaḥ sādi hótā  nā́satyā yó yájate vándate ca  aśnītám mádhvo aśvinā upāké-  ā́ vāṃ voce vidátheṣu práyasvān

translation.text: And, O Nâsatyas, man's dear Priest is seated, who brings to sacrifice and offers worship, Be near and taste the pleasant juice, O Aṣvins: with food, I call you to the sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अहे॑म य॒ज्ञं प॒थामु॑रा॒णा इ॒मां सु॑वृ॒क्तिं वृ॑षणा जुषेथाम् श्रु॒ष्टी॒वेव॒ प्रेषि॑तो वामबोधि॒ प्रति॒ स्तोमै॒र्जर॑माणो॒ वसि॑ष्ठः
verses.transliteration: áhema yajñám pathā́m urāṇā́ḥ-  imā́ṃ suvr̥ktíṃ vr̥ṣaṇā juṣethām  śruṣṭīvéva préṣito vām abodhi  práti stómair járamāṇo vásiṣṭhaḥ

translation.text: We choosing you, have let our worship follow its course: ye Steers, accept this hymn with favour. Obeying you as your appointed servant, Vasishṭha singing hath with lauds aroused you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॒ त्या वह्नी॑ गमतो॒ विशं॑ नो रक्षो॒हणा॒ सम्भृ॑ता वी॒ळुपा॑णी समन्धां॑स्यग्मत मत्स॒राणि॒ मा नो॑ मर्धिष्ट॒मा ग॑तं शि॒वेन॑
verses.transliteration: úpa tyā́ váhnī gamato víśaṃ no  rakṣoháṇā sámbhr̥tā vīḷúpāṇī  sám ándhāṃsy agmata matsarā́ṇi  mā́ no mardhiṣṭam ā́ gataṃ śivéna

translation.text: And these Two Priests come nigh unto our people, united, demon-slayers, mighty-handed. The juices that exhilarate are mingled. Injure us not, but come with happy fortune.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ प॒श्चाता॑न्नास॒त्या पु॒रस्ता॒दाश्वि॑ना यातमध॒रादुद॑क्तात् आ वि॒श्वतः॒ पाञ्च॑जन्येन रा॒या यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: ā́ paścā́tān nāsatyā́ purástād  ā́śvinā yātam adharā́d údaktāt  ā́ viśvátaḥ pā́ñcajanyena rāyā́  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Come from the west, come from the cast, Nâsatyas, come, Aṣvins, from below and from above us. Bring wealth from all sides for the Fivefold People. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा उ॑ वां॒ दिवि॑ष्टय उ॒स्रा ह॑वन्ते अश्विना अ॒यं वा॑म॒ह्वेऽव॑से शचीवसू॒ विशं॑विशं॒ हि गच्छ॑थः
verses.transliteration: imā́ u vāṃ díviṣṭayaḥ-  usrā́ havante aśvinā  ayáṃ vām ahvé 'vase śacīvasū  víśaṃ-viśaṃ hí gáchathaḥ

translation.text: THESE morning sacrifices call you, Aṣvins, at the break of day. For help have I invoked you rich in power and might: for, house by house ye visit all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं चि॒त्रं द॑दथु॒र्भोज॑नं नरा॒ चोदे॑थां सू॒नृता॑वते अ॒र्वाग्रथं॒ सम॑नसा॒ नि य॑च्छतं॒ पिब॑तं सो॒म्यं मधु॑
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ citráṃ dadathur bhójanaṃ narā  códethāṃ sūnŕ̥tāvate  arvā́g ráthaṃ sámanasā ní yachatam  píbataṃ somyám mádhu

translation.text: O Heroes, ye bestow wonderful nourishment. send it to him whose songs are sweet Accordant, both of you, drive your car down to us, and drink the savoury Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ या॑त॒मुप॑ भूषतं॒ मध्वः॑ पिबतमश्विना दु॒ग्धं पयो॑ वृषणा जेन्यावसू॒ मा नो॑ मर्धिष्ट॒मा ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ yātam úpa bhūṣatam  mádhvaḥ pibatam aśvinā  dugdhám páyo vr̥ṣaṇā jenyāvasū  mā́ no mardhiṣṭam ā́ gatam

translation.text: Approach ye and be near to us. drink, O ye Aṣvins, of the meath. Draw forth the milk, ye Mighty, rich in genuine wealth: injure us not, and come to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वा॑सो॒ ये वा॒मुप॑ दा॒शुषो॑ गृ॒हं यु॒वां दीय॑न्ति॒ बिभ्र॑तः म॒क्षू॒युभि॑र्नरा॒ हये॑भिरश्वि॒ना दे॑वा यातमस्म॒यू
verses.transliteration: áśvāso yé vām úpa dāśúṣo gr̥háṃ  yuvā́ṃ dī́yanti bíbhrataḥ  makṣūyúbhir narā háyebhir aśvinā-  -ā́ devā yātam asmayū́

translation.text: The horses that convey you in their rapid flight down to the worshipper's abode, With these your speedy coursers, Heroes, Aṣvins, come, ye Gods, come well-inclined to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॑ ह॒ यन्तो॑ अ॒श्विना॒ पृक्षः॑ सचन्त सू॒रयः॑ ता यं॑सतो म॒घव॑द्भ्यो ध्रु॒वं यश॑श्छ॒र्दिर॒स्मभ्यं॒ नास॑त्या
verses.transliteration: ádhā ha yánto aśvínā  pŕ̥kṣaḥ sacanta sūráyaḥ  tā́ yaṃsato maghávadbhyo dhruváṃ yáśaś  chardír asmábhyaṃ nā́satyā

translation.text: Yea, verily, our princes seek the Aṣvins in pursuit of food. These shall give lasting glory to our liberal lords, and, both Nâsatyas, shelter us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ये य॒युर॑वृ॒कासो॒ रथा॑ इव नृपा॒तारो॒ जना॑नाम् उ॒त स्वेन॒ शव॑सा शूशुवु॒र्नर॑ उ॒त क्षि॑यन्ति सुक्षि॒तिम्
verses.transliteration: prá yé yayúr avr̥kā́so ráthā iva  nr̥pātā́ro jánānām  utá svéna śávasā śūśuvur náraḥ-  utá kṣiyanti sukṣitím

translation.text: Those who have led the way, like cars, offending none, those who are guardians of the men- Also through their own might the heroes have grown strong, and dwell in safe and happy homes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्यु१॒॑षा आ॑वो दिवि॒जा ऋ॒तेना॑विष्कृण्वा॒ना म॑हि॒मान॒मागा॑त् अप॒ द्रुह॒स्तम॑ आव॒रजु॑ष्ट॒मङ्गि॑रस्तमा प॒थ्या॑ अजीगः
verses.transliteration: vy ùṣā́ āvo divijā́ r̥téna-  -āviṣkr̥ṇvānā́ mahimā́nam ā́gāt  ápa drúhas táma āvar ájuṣṭam  áṅgirastamā pathyā̀ ajīgaḥ

translation.text: BORN in the heavens the Dawn hath flushed, and showing her majesty is come as Law ordaineth. She hath uncovered fiends and hateful darkness; best of Angirases, hath waked the pathways.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हे नो॑ अ॒द्य सु॑वि॒ताय॑ बो॒ध्युषो॑ म॒हे सौभ॑गाय॒ प्र य॑न्धि चि॒त्रं र॒यिं य॒शसं॑ धेह्य॒स्मे देवि॒ मर्ते॑षु मानुषि श्रव॒स्युम्
verses.transliteration: mahé no adyá suvitā́ya bodhi-  úṣo mahé saúbhagāya prá yandhi  citráṃ rayíṃ yaśásaṃ dhehy asmé  dévi márteṣu mānuṣi śravasyúm

translation.text: Rouse us this day to high and happy fortune: to great felicity, O Dawn, promote us. Vouchsafe us manifold and splendid riches, famed among mortals, man-befriending Goddess!

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ते त्ये भा॒नवो॑ दर्श॒ताया॑श्चि॒त्रा उ॒षसो॑ अ॒मृता॑स॒ आगुः॑ ज॒नय॑न्तो॒ दैव्या॑नि व्र॒तान्या॑पृ॒णन्तो॑ अ॒न्तरि॑क्षा॒ व्य॑स्थुः
verses.transliteration: eté tyé bhānávo darśatā́yāś  citrā́ uṣáso amŕ̥tāsa ā́guḥ  janáyanto daívyāni vratā́ni-  āpr̥ṇánto antárikṣā vy àsthuḥ

translation.text: See, lovely Morning's everlasting splendours, bright with their varied colours, have approached us. Filling the region of mid-air, producing the rites of holy worship, they have mounted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒षा स्या यु॑जा॒ना प॑रा॒कात्पञ्च॑ क्षि॒तीः परि॑ स॒द्यो जि॑गाति अ॒भि॒पश्य॑न्ती व॒युना॒ जना॑नां दि॒वो दु॑हि॒ता भुव॑नस्य॒ पत्नी॑
verses.transliteration: eṣā́ syā́ yujānā́ parākā́t  páñca kṣitī́ḥ pári sadyó jigāti  abhipáśyantī vayúnā jánānāṃ  divó duhitā́ bhúvanasya pátnī

translation.text: She yokes her chariot far away, and swiftly visits the lands where the Five Tribes are settled, Looking upon the works and ways of mortals, Daughter of Heaven, the world's Imperial Lady.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒जिनी॑वती॒ सूर्य॑स्य॒ योषा॑ चि॒त्राम॑घा रा॒य ई॑शे॒ वसू॑नाम् ऋषि॑ष्टुता ज॒रय॑न्ती म॒घोन्यु॒षा उ॑च्छति॒ वह्नि॑भिर्गृणा॒ना
verses.transliteration: vājínīvatī sū́ryasya yóṣā  citrā́maghā rāyá īśe vásūnām  ŕ̥ṣiṣṭutā jaráyantī maghónī-  uṣā́ uchati váhnibhir gr̥ṇānā́

translation.text: She who is rich in spoil, the Spouse of Sûrya, wondrously opulent, rules all wealth and treasures. Consumer of our youth, the seers extol her: lauded by priests rich Dawn shines out refulgent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ द्युता॒नाम॑रु॒षासो॒ अश्वा॑श्चि॒त्रा अ॑दृश्रन्नु॒षसं॒ वह॑न्तः याति॑ शु॒भ्रा वि॑श्व॒पिशा॒ रथे॑न॒ दधा॑ति॒ रत्नं॑ विध॒ते जना॑य
verses.transliteration: práti dyutānā́m aruṣā́so áśvāś  citrā́ adr̥śrann uṣásaṃ váhantaḥ  yā́ti śubhrā́ viśvapíśā ráthena  dádhāti rátnaṃ vidhaté jánāya

translation.text: Apparent are the steeds of varied colour, the red steeds carrying resplendent Morning. On her all-lovely car she comes, the Fair One, and brings rich treasure for her faithful servant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒त्या स॒त्येभि॑र्मह॒ती म॒हद्भि॑र्दे॒वी दे॒वेभि॑र्यज॒ता यज॑त्रैः रु॒जद्दृ॒ळ्हानि॒ दद॑दु॒स्रिया॑णां॒ प्रति॒ गाव॑ उ॒षसं॑ वावशन्त
verses.transliteration: satyā́ satyébhir mahatī́ mahádbhir  devī́ devébhir yajatā́ yájatraiḥ  rujád dr̥ḷhā́ni dádad usríyāṇām  práti gā́va uṣásaṃ vāvaśanta

translation.text: True with the True and Mighty with the Mighty, with Gods a Goddess, Holy with the Holy, She brake strong fences down and gave the cattle: the kine were lowing as they greeted Morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू नो॒ गोम॑द्वी॒रव॑द्धेहि॒ रत्न॒मुषो॒ अश्वा॑वत्पुरु॒भोजो॑ अ॒स्मे मा नो॑ ब॒र्हिः पु॑रु॒षता॑ नि॒दे क॑र्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: nū́ no gómad vīrávad dhehi rátnam  úṣo áśvāvad purubhójo asmé  mā́ no barhíḥ puruṣátā nidé kar  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: O Dawn, now give us wealth in kine and heroes, and horses, fraught with manifold enjoyment. Protect our sacred grass from man's reproaches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒ ज्योति॑र॒मृतं॑ वि॒श्वज॑न्यं वि॒श्वान॑रः सवि॒ता दे॒वो अ॑श्रेत् क्रत्वा॑ दे॒वाना॑मजनिष्ट॒ चक्षु॑रा॒विर॑क॒र्भुव॑नं॒ विश्व॑मु॒षाः
verses.transliteration: úd u jyótir amŕ̥taṃ viśvájanyaṃ  viśvā́naraḥ savitā́ devó aśret  krátvā devā́nām ajaniṣṭa cákṣur  āvír akar bhúvanaṃ víśvam uṣā́ḥ

translation.text: SAVITAR God of all men hath sent upward his light, designed for all mankind, immortal. Through the Gods' power that Eye was first created. Dawn hath made all the universe apparent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र मे॒ पन्था॑ देव॒याना॑ अदृश्र॒न्नम॑र्धन्तो॒ वसु॑भि॒रिष्कृ॑तासः अभू॑दु के॒तुरु॒षसः॑ पु॒रस्ता॑त्प्रती॒च्यागा॒दधि॑ ह॒र्म्येभ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: prá me pánthā devayā́nā adr̥śrann  ámardhanto vásubhir íṣkr̥tāsaḥ  ábhūd u ketúr uṣásaḥ purástāt  pratīcy ā́gād ádhi harmyébhyaḥ

translation.text: I see the paths which Gods are wont to travel, innocuous paths made ready by the Vasus. Eastward the flag of Dawn hath been uplifted; she hath come hither o'er the tops of houses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तानीदहा॑नि बहु॒लान्या॑स॒न्या प्रा॒चीन॒मुदि॑ता॒ सूर्य॑स्य यतः॒ परि॑ जा॒र इ॑वा॒चर॒न्त्युषो॑ ददृ॒क्षे न पुन॑र्य॒तीव॑
verses.transliteration: tā́nī́d áhāni bahulā́ny āsan  yā́ prācī́nam úditā sū́ryasya  yátaḥ pári jārá ivācárantī-  úṣo dadr̥kṣé ná púnar yatī́va

translation.text: Great is, in truth, the number of the Mornings which were aforetime at the Sun's uprising. Since thou, O Dawn, hast been beheld repairing as to thy love, as one no more to leave him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त इद्दे॒वानां॑ सध॒माद॑ आसन्नृ॒तावा॑नः क॒वयः॑ पू॒र्व्यासः॑ गू॒ळ्हं ज्योतिः॑ पि॒तरो॒ अन्व॑विन्दन्त्स॒त्यम॑न्त्रा अजनयन्नु॒षास॑म्
verses.transliteration: tá íd devā́nāṃ sadhamā́da āsann  r̥tā́vānaḥ kaváyaḥ pūrvyā́saḥ  gūḷháṃ jyótiḥ pitáro ánv avindan  satyámantrā ajanayann uṣā́sam

translation.text: They were the Gods' companions at the banquet, the ancient sages true to Law Eternal. The Fathers found the light that lay in darkness, and with effectual words begat the Morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मा॒न ऊ॒र्वे अधि॒ संग॑तासः॒ सं जा॑नते॒ न य॑तन्ते मि॒थस्ते ते दे॒वानां॒ न मि॑नन्ति व्र॒तान्यम॑र्धन्तो॒ वसु॑भि॒र्याद॑मानाः
verses.transliteration: samāná ūrvé ádhi sáṃgatāsaḥ  sáṃ jānate ná yatante mithás té  té devā́nāṃ ná minanti vratā́ni-  ámardhanto vásubhir yā́damānāḥ

translation.text: Meeting together in the same enclosure, they strive not, ofone mind, one with another. They never break the Gods' eternal statutes, and injure none, in rivalry with Vasus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ त्वा॒ स्तोमै॑रीळते॒ वसि॑ष्ठा उष॒र्बुधः॑ सुभगे तुष्टु॒वांसः॑ गवां॑ ने॒त्री वाज॑पत्नी न उ॒च्छोषः॑ सुजाते प्रथ॒मा ज॑रस्व
verses.transliteration: práti tvā stómair īḷate vásiṣṭhāḥ-  uṣarbúdhaḥ subhage tuṣṭuvā́ṃsaḥ  gávāṃ netrī́ vā́japatnī na ucha-  -úṣaḥ sujāte prathamā́ jarasva

translation.text: Extolling thee, Blest Goddess, the Vasishṭhas, awake at early mom, with lauds implore thee. Leader of kine and Queen of all that strengthens, shine, come as first to us, O high-born Morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒षा ने॒त्री राध॑सः सू॒नृता॑नामु॒षा उ॒च्छन्ती॑ रिभ्यते॒ वसि॑ष्ठैः दी॒र्घ॒श्रुतं॑ र॒यिम॒स्मे दधा॑ना यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: eṣā́ netrī́ rā́dhasaḥ sūnŕ̥tānām  uṣā́ uchántī ribhyate vásiṣṭhaiḥ  dīrghaśrútaṃ rayím asmé dádhānā  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: She bringeth bounty and sweet charm of voices. The flushing Dawn is sung by the Vasishṭhas, Giving us riches famed to distant places. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उपो॑ रुरुचे युव॒तिर्न योषा॒ विश्वं॑ जी॒वं प्र॑सु॒वन्ती॑ च॒रायै॑ अभू॑द॒ग्निः स॒मिधे॒ मानु॑षाणा॒मक॒र्ज्योति॒र्बाध॑माना॒ तमां॑सि
verses.transliteration: úpo ruruce yuvatír ná yóṣā  víśvaṃ jīvám prasuvántī carā́yai  ábhūd agníḥ samídhe mā́nuṣāṇām  ákar jyótir bā́dhamānā támāṃsi

translation.text: SHE hath shone brightly like a youthful woman, stirring to motion every living creature. Agni hath come to feed on mortal? fuel. She hath made light and chased away the darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वं॑ प्रती॒ची स॒प्रथा॒ उद॑स्था॒द्रुश॒द्वासो॒ बिभ्र॑ती शु॒क्रम॑श्वैत् हिर॑ण्यवर्णा सु॒दृशी॑कसंदृ॒ग्गवां॑ मा॒ता ने॒त्र्यह्ना॑मरोचि
verses.transliteration: víśvam pratīcī́ sapráthā úd asthād  rúśad vā́so bíbhratī śukrám aśvait  híraṇyavarṇā sudŕ̥śīkasaṃdr̥g  gávām mātā́ netry áhnām aroci

translation.text: Turned to this All, far-spreading, she hath risen and shone in brightness with white robes about her. She hath beamed forth lovely with golden colours, Mother of kine, Guide of the days she bringeth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वानां॒ चक्षुः॑ सु॒भगा॒ वह॑न्ती श्वे॒तं नय॑न्ती सु॒दृशी॑क॒मश्व॑म् उ॒षा अ॑दर्शि र॒श्मिभि॒र्व्य॑क्ता चि॒त्राम॑घा॒ विश्व॒मनु॒ प्रभू॑ता
verses.transliteration: devā́nāṃ cákṣuḥ subhágā váhantī  śvetáṃ náyantī sudŕ̥śīkam áśvam  uṣā́ adarśi raśmíbhir vyàktā  citrā́maghā víśvam ánu prábhūtā

translation.text: Bearing the Gods' own Eye, auspicious Lady, leading her Courser white and fair to look on, Distinguished by her bean-is Dawn shines apparent, come forth to all the world with wondrous treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अन्ति॑वामा दू॒रे अ॒मित्र॑मुच्छो॒र्वीं गव्यू॑ति॒मभ॑यं कृधी नः या॒वय॒ द्वेष॒ आ भ॑रा॒ वसू॑नि चो॒दय॒ राधो॑ गृण॒ते म॑घोनि
verses.transliteration: ántivāmā dūré amítram ucha-  -urvī́ṃ gávyūtim ábhayaṃ kr̥dhī naḥ  yāváya dvéṣa ā́ bharā vásūni  codáya rā́dho gr̥ṇaté maghoni

translation.text: Draw nigh with wealth and dawn away the foeman: prepare for us wide pasture free from danger. Drive away those who hate us, bring us riches: pour bounty, opulent Lady, on the singer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे श्रेष्ठे॑भिर्भा॒नुभि॒र्वि भा॒ह्युषो॑ देवि प्रति॒रन्ती॑ न॒ आयुः॑ इषं॑ च नो॒ दध॑ती विश्ववारे॒ गोम॒दश्वा॑व॒द्रथ॑वच्च॒ राधः॑
verses.transliteration: asmé śréṣṭhebhir bhānúbhir ví bhāhi-  úṣo devi pratirántī na ā́yuḥ  íṣaṃ ca no dádhatī viśvavāre  gómad áśvāvad ráthavac ca rā́dhaḥ

translation.text: Send thy most excellent beams to shine and light us, giving us lengthened days, O Dawn, O Goddess, Granting us food, thou who hast all things precious, and bounty rich in chariots, kine, and horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यां त्वा॑ दिवो दुहितर्व॒र्धय॒न्त्युषः॑ सुजाते म॒तिभि॒र्वसि॑ष्ठाः सास्मासु॑ धा र॒यिमृ॒ष्वं बृ॒हन्तं॑ यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: yā́ṃ tvā divo duhitar vardháyanti-  úṣaḥ sujāte matíbhir vásiṣṭhāḥ  sā́smā́su dhā rayím r̥ṣvám br̥hántaṃ  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: O Ushas, nobly-born, Daughter of Heaven, whom the Vasishṭhas with their hymns make mighty, Bestow thou on us vast and glorious riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ के॒तवः॑ प्रथ॒मा अ॑दृश्रन्नू॒र्ध्वा अ॑स्या अ॒ञ्जयो॒ वि श्र॑यन्ते उषो॑ अ॒र्वाचा॑ बृह॒ता रथे॑न॒ ज्योति॑ष्मता वा॒मम॒स्मभ्यं॑ वक्षि
verses.transliteration: práti ketávaḥ prathamā́ adr̥śrann  ūrdhvā́ asyā añjáyo ví śrayante  úṣo arvā́cā br̥hatā́ ráthena  jyótiṣmatā vāmám asmábhyaṃ vakṣi

translation.text: WE have beheld her earliest lights approaching: her many glories part, on high, asunder. On car sublime, refulgent, wending hither, O Ushas, bring the Wealth that makes us happy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ षीम॒ग्निर्ज॑रते॒ समि॑द्धः॒ प्रति॒ विप्रा॑सो म॒तिभि॑र्गृ॒णन्तः॑ उ॒षा या॑ति॒ ज्योति॑षा॒ बाध॑माना॒ विश्वा॒ तमां॑सि दुरि॒ताप॑ दे॒वी
verses.transliteration: práti ṣīm agnír jarate sámiddhaḥ  práti víprāso matíbhir gr̥ṇántaḥ  uṣā́ yāti jyótiṣā bā́dhamānā  víśvā támāṃsi duritā́pa devī́

translation.text: The fire well-kindIed sings aloud to greet her, and with their hymns the priests are chaming welcome. Ushas approaches in her splendour, driving all evil darkness far away, the Goddess.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ता उ॒ त्याः प्रत्य॑दृश्रन्पु॒रस्ता॒ज्ज्योति॒र्यच्छ॑न्तीरु॒षसो॑ विभा॒तीः अजी॑जन॒न्त्सूर्यं॑ य॒ज्ञम॒ग्निम॑पा॒चीनं॒ तमो॑ अगा॒दजु॑ष्टम्
verses.transliteration: etā́ u tyā́ḥ práty adr̥śran purástāj  jyótir yáchantīr uṣáso vibhātī́ḥ  ájījanan sū́ryaṃ yajñám agním  apācī́naṃ támo agād ájuṣṭam

translation.text: Apparent eastward are those lights of Morning, sending out lustre, as they rise, around them. She hath brought forth Sun, sacrifice, and Agni, and far away hath fled detested darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अचे॑ति दि॒वो दु॑हि॒ता म॒घोनी॒ विश्वे॑ पश्यन्त्यु॒षसं॑ विभा॒तीम् आस्था॒द्रथं॑ स्व॒धया॑ यु॒ज्यमा॑न॒मा यमश्वा॑सः सु॒युजो॒ वह॑न्ति
verses.transliteration: áceti divó duhitā́ maghónī  víśve paśyanty uṣásaṃ vibhātī́m  ā́sthād ráthaṃ svadháyā yujyámānam  ā́ yám áśvāsaḥ suyújo váhanti

translation.text: Rich Daughter of the Sky, we all behold her, yea, all men look on Dawn as she is breaking. fler car that moves self-harnessed hath she mounted, the car drawn onward by her well-yoked horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ त्वा॒द्य सु॒मन॑सो बुधन्ता॒स्माका॑सो म॒घवा॑नो व॒यं च॑ ति॒ल्वि॒ला॒यध्व॑मुषसो विभा॒तीर्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: práti tvādyá sumánaso budhanta-  -asmā́kāso maghávāno vayáṃ ca  tilvilāyádhvam uṣaso vibhātī́r  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Inspired with loving thoughts this day to greet thee, we and our wealthy nobles have awakened. Show yourselves fruitful, Dawns, as ye are rising. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्यु१॒॑षा आ॑वः प॒थ्या॒३॒॑ जना॑नां॒ पञ्च॑ क्षि॒तीर्मानु॑षीर्बो॒धय॑न्ती सु॒सं॒दृग्भि॑रु॒क्षभि॑र्भा॒नुम॑श्रे॒द्वि सूर्यो॒ रोद॑सी॒ चक्ष॑सावः
verses.transliteration: vy ùṣā́ āvaḥ pathyā̀ jánānām  páñca kṣitī́r mā́nuṣīr bodháyantī  susaṃdŕ̥gbhir ukṣábhir bhānúm aśred  ví sū́ryo ródasī cákṣasāvaḥ

translation.text: ROUSING the lands where men's Five Tribes are settled, Dawn hath disclosed the pathways of the people. She hath sent out her sheen with beauteous oxen. The Sun with light hath opened earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्य॑ञ्जते दि॒वो अन्ते॑ष्व॒क्तून्विशो॒ न यु॒क्ता उ॒षसो॑ यतन्ते सं ते॒ गाव॒स्तम॒ आ व॑र्तयन्ति॒ ज्योति॑र्यच्छन्ति सवि॒तेव॑ बा॒हू
verses.transliteration: vy àñjate divó ánteṣv aktū́n  víśo ná yuktā́ uṣáso yatante  sáṃ te gā́vas táma ā́ vartayanti  jyótir yachanti savitéva bāhū́

translation.text: They paint their bright rays on the sky's far limits. the Dawns come on like tribes arrayed for battle. Thy cattle, closely shutting up the darkness, as Savitar spreads his arms, give forth their lustre.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अभू॑दु॒षा इन्द्र॑तमा म॒घोन्यजी॑जनत्सुवि॒ताय॒ श्रवां॑सि वि दि॒वो दे॒वी दु॑हि॒ता द॑धा॒त्यङ्गि॑रस्तमा सु॒कृते॒ वसू॑नि
verses.transliteration: ábhūd uṣā́ índratamā maghónī-  ájījanat suvitā́ya śrávāṃsi  ví divó devī́ duhitā́ dadhāti-  áṅgirastamā sukŕ̥te vásūni

translation.text: Wealthy, most like to Indra, Dawn hath risen, and brought forth lauds that shall promote our welfare. Daughter of Heaven, a Goddess, she distributes, best of Angirases, treasures to the pious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ताव॑दुषो॒ राधो॑ अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ रास्व॒ याव॑त्स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ अर॑दो गृणा॒ना यां त्वा॑ ज॒ज्ञुर्वृ॑ष॒भस्या॒ रवे॑ण॒ वि दृ॒ळ्हस्य॒ दुरो॒ अद्रे॑रौर्णोः
verses.transliteration: tā́vad uṣo rā́dho asmábhyaṃ rāsva  yā́vat stotŕ̥bhyo árado gr̥ṇānā́  yā́ṃ tvā jajñúr vr̥ṣabhásyā ráveṇa  ví dr̥ḷhásya dúro ádrer aurṇoḥ

translation.text: Bestow on us, O Dawn, that ample bounty which thou didst send to those who sang thy praises; Thou whom with bellowings of a bull they quickened: thou didst unbar the firm-set mountain's portals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वंदे॑वं॒ राध॑से चो॒दय॑न्त्यस्म॒द्र्य॑क्सू॒नृता॑ ई॒रय॑न्ती व्यु॒च्छन्ती॑ नः स॒नये॒ धियो॑ धा यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: deváṃ-devaṃ rā́dhase codáyantī-  asmadryàk sūnŕ̥tā īráyantī  vyuchántī naḥ sanáye dhíyo dhāḥ-  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Impelling every God to grant his bounty sending to us the charm of pleasant voices, Vouchsafe us thoughts, for profit, as thou breakest. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॒ स्तोमे॑भिरु॒षसं॒ वसि॑ष्ठा गी॒र्भिर्विप्रा॑सः प्रथ॒मा अ॑बुध्रन् वि॒व॒र्तय॑न्तीं॒ रज॑सी॒ सम॑न्ते आविष्कृण्व॒तीं भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑
verses.transliteration: práti stómebhir uṣásaṃ vásiṣṭhāḥ-  gīrbhír víprāsaḥ prathamā́ abudhran  vivartáyantīṃ rájasī sámante  āviṣkr̥ṇvatī́m bhúvanāni víśvā

translation.text: THE priests, Vasishṭhas, are the first awakened to welcome Ushas with their songs and praises, Who makes surrounding regions part asunder,and shows apparent all existing creatures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒षा स्या नव्य॒मायु॒र्दधा॑ना गू॒ढ्वी तमो॒ ज्योति॑षो॒षा अ॑बोधि अग्र॑ एति युव॒तिरह्र॑याणा॒ प्राचि॑कित॒त्सूर्यं॑ य॒ज्ञम॒ग्निम्
verses.transliteration: eṣā́ syā́ návyam ā́yur dádhānā  gūḍhvī́ támo jyótiṣoṣā́ abodhi  ágra eti yuvatír áhrayāṇā  prā́cikitat sū́ryaṃ yajñám agním

translation.text: Giving fresh life when she hath hid the darkness, this Dawn hath wakened there with new-born lustre. Youthful and unrestrained she cometh forward: she hath turned thoughts to Sun and fire and worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वा॑वती॒र्गोम॑तीर्न उ॒षासो॑ वी॒रव॑तीः॒ सद॑मुच्छन्तु भ॒द्राः घृ॒तं दुहा॑ना वि॒श्वतः॒ प्रपी॑ता यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: áśvāvatīr gómatīr na uṣā́so  vīrávatīḥ sádam uchantu bhadrā́ḥ  ghr̥táṃ dúhānā viśvátaḥ prápītāḥ-  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: May blessed Mornings shine on us for ever, with wealth of kine, of horses, and of heroes, Streaming with all abundance, pouring fatness. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रत्यु॑ अदर्श्याय॒त्यु१॒॑च्छन्ती॑ दुहि॒ता दि॒वः अपो॒ महि॑ व्ययति॒ चक्ष॑से॒ तमो॒ ज्योति॑ष्कृणोति सू॒नरी॑
verses.transliteration: práty u adarśy āyatī-  -uchántī duhitā́ diváḥ  ápo máhi vyayati cákṣase támo  jyótiṣ kr̥ṇoti sūnárī

translation.text: ADVANCING, sending forth her rays, the Daughter of the Sky is seen. Uncovering, that we may see, the mighty gloom, the friendly Lady makes the light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒स्रियाः॑ सृजते॒ सूर्यः॒ सचाँ॑ उ॒द्यन्नक्ष॑त्रमर्चि॒वत् तवेदु॑षो॒ व्युषि॒ सूर्य॑स्य च॒ सं भ॒क्तेन॑ गमेमहि
verses.transliteration: úd usríyāḥ sr̥jate sū́ryaḥ sácām̐  udyán nákṣatram arcivát  távéd uṣo vyúṣi sū́ryasya ca  sám bhakténa gamemahi

translation.text: The Sun ascending, the refulgent Star, pours down his beams together with the Dawn. O Dawn, at thine arising, and the Sun's, may we attain the share allotted us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ त्वा दुहितर्दिव॒ उषो॑ जी॒रा अ॑भुत्स्महि या वह॑सि पु॒रु स्पा॒र्हं व॑नन्वति॒ रत्नं॒ न दा॒शुषे॒ मयः॑
verses.transliteration: práti tvā duhitar divaḥ-  úṣo jīrā́ abhutsmahi  yā́ váhasi purú spārháṃ vananvati  rátnaṃ ná dāśúṣe máyaḥ

translation.text: Promptly we woke to welcome thee, O Ushas, Daughter of the Sky, Thee, Bounteous One, who bringest all we long to have, and to the offerer health and wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒च्छन्ती॒ या कृ॒णोषि॑ मं॒हना॑ महि प्र॒ख्यै दे॑वि॒ स्व॑र्दृ॒शे तस्या॑स्ते रत्न॒भाज॑ ईमहे व॒यं स्याम॑ मा॒तुर्न सू॒नवः॑
verses.transliteration: uchántī yā́ kr̥ṇóṣi maṃhánā mahi  prakhyaí devi svàr dr̥śé  tásyās te ratnabhā́ja īmahe vayáṃ  syā́ma mātúr ná sūnávaḥ

translation.text: Thou, dawning, workest fain to light the great world, yea, heaven, Goddess! that it may be seen. We yearn to be thine own, Dealer of Wealth: may we be to this Mother like her sons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तच्चि॒त्रं राध॒ आ भ॒रोषो॒ यद्दी॑र्घ॒श्रुत्त॑मम् यत्ते॑ दिवो दुहितर्मर्त॒भोज॑नं॒ तद्रा॑स्व भु॒नजा॑महै
verses.transliteration: tác citráṃ rā́dha ā́ bhara-  -úṣo yád dīrghaśrúttamam  yát te divo duhitar martabhójanaṃ  tád rāsva bhunájāmahai

translation.text: Bring us that wondrous bounty, Dawn, that shall be famed most far away. What, Child of Heaven, thou hast of nourishment for man, bestow thou on us to enjoy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रवः॑ सू॒रिभ्यो॑ अ॒मृतं॑ वसुत्व॒नं वाजाँ॑ अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ गोम॑तः चो॒द॒यि॒त्री म॒घोनः॑ सू॒नृता॑वत्यु॒षा उ॑च्छ॒दप॒ स्रिधः॑
verses.transliteration: śrávaḥ sūríbhyo amŕ̥taṃ vasutvanáṃ  vā́jām̐ asmábhyaṃ gómataḥ  codayitrī́ maghónaḥ sūnŕ̥tāvatī-  uṣā́ uchad ápa srídhaḥ

translation.text: Give to our princes opulence and immortal fame, and strength in herds of kine to us. May she who prompts the wealthy, Lady of sweet strains, may Ushas dawn our foes away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑वरुणा यु॒वम॑ध्व॒राय॑ नो वि॒शे जना॑य॒ महि॒ शर्म॑ यच्छतम् दी॒र्घप्र॑यज्यु॒मति॒ यो व॑नु॒ष्यति॑ व॒यं ज॑येम॒ पृत॑नासु दू॒ढ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: índrāvaruṇā yuvám adhvarā́ya no  viśé jánāya máhi śárma yachatam  dīrgháprayajyum áti yó vanuṣyáti  vayáṃ jayema pŕ̥tanāsu dūḍhyàḥ

translation.text: GRANT us your strong protection, IndraVaruṇa, our people, and our family, for sacrifice. May we subdue in fight our evil-hearted foes, him who attacks the man steadfast in lengthened rites.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒म्राळ॒न्यः स्व॒राळ॒न्य उ॑च्यते वां म॒हान्ता॒विन्द्रा॒वरु॑णा म॒हाव॑सू विश्वे॑ दे॒वासः॑ पर॒मे व्यो॑मनि॒ सं वा॒मोजो॑ वृषणा॒ सं बलं॑ दधुः
verses.transliteration: samrā́ḷ anyáḥ svarā́ḷ anyá ucyate vām  mahā́ntāv índrāváruṇā mahā́vasū  víśve devā́saḥ paramé vyòmani  sáṃ vām ójo vr̥ṣaṇā sám bálaṃ dadhuḥ

translation.text: O Indra-Varuṇa, mighty and very rich One of you is called Monarch and One Autocrat. All Gods in the most lofty region of the air have, O ye Steers, combined all power and might in you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अन्व॒पां खान्य॑तृन्त॒मोज॒सा सूर्य॑मैरयतं दि॒वि प्र॒भुम् इन्द्रा॑वरुणा॒ मदे॑ अस्य मा॒यिनोऽपि॑न्वतम॒पितः॒ पिन्व॑तं॒ धियः॑
verses.transliteration: ánv apā́ṃ khā́ny atr̥ntam ójasā-  -ā́ sū́ryam airayataṃ diví prabhúm  índrāvaruṇā máde asya māyínaḥ-  -ápinvatam apítaḥ pínvataṃ dhíyaḥ

translation.text: Ye with your strength have pierced the fountains of the floods: the Sun have ye brought forward as the Lord in heaven. Cheered by this magic draught ye, Indra-Varuṇa, made the dry places stream, made songs of praise flow forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वामिद्यु॒त्सु पृत॑नासु॒ वह्न॑यो यु॒वां क्षेम॑स्य प्रस॒वे मि॒तज्ञ॑वः ई॒शा॒ना वस्व॑ उ॒भय॑स्य का॒रव॒ इन्द्रा॑वरुणा सु॒हवा॑ हवामहे
verses.transliteration: yuvā́m íd yutsú pŕ̥tanāsu váhnayo  yuvā́ṃ kṣémasya prasavé mitájñavaḥ  īśānā́ vásva ubháyasya kārávaḥ-  índrāvaruṇā suhávā havāmahe

translation.text: In battels and in frays we ministering priests, kneeling upon our knees for furtherance of our weal, Invoke you, only you, the Lords of twofold wealth, you prompt to hear, we bards, O Indra-Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑वरुणा॒ यदि॒मानि॑ च॒क्रथु॒र्विश्वा॑ जा॒तानि॒ भुव॑नस्य म॒ज्मना॑ क्षेमे॑ण मि॒त्रो वरु॑णं दुव॒स्यति॑ म॒रुद्भि॑रु॒ग्रः शुभ॑म॒न्य ई॑यते
verses.transliteration: índrāvaruṇā yád imā́ni cakráthur  víśvā jātā́ni bhúvanasya majmánā  kṣémeṇa mitró váruṇaṃ duvasyáti  marúdbhir ugráḥ śúbham anyá īyate

translation.text: O Indra-Varuṇa, as ye created all these creatures of the world by your surpassing might, In peace and quiet Mitra waits on Varuṇa, the Other, awful, with the Maruis seeks renown.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हे शु॒ल्काय॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ नु त्वि॒ष ओजो॑ मिमाते ध्रु॒वम॑स्य॒ यत्स्वम् अजा॑मिम॒न्यः श्न॒थय॑न्त॒माति॑रद्द॒भ्रेभि॑र॒न्यः प्र वृ॑णोति॒ भूय॑सः
verses.transliteration: mahé śulkā́ya váruṇasya nú tviṣé-  ójo mimāte dhruvám asya yát svám  ájāmim anyáḥ śnatháyantam ā́tirad  dabhrébhir anyáḥ prá vr̥ṇoti bhū́yasaḥ

translation.text: That Varuṇa's high worth may shine preeminent, these Twain have measured each his proper power and might. The One subdueth the destructive enemy; the Other with a few furthereth many a man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न तमंहो॒ न दु॑रि॒तानि॒ मर्त्य॒मिन्द्रा॑वरुणा॒ न तपः॒ कुत॑श्च॒न यस्य॑ देवा॒ गच्छ॑थो वी॒थो अ॑ध्व॒रं न तं मर्त॑स्य नशते॒ परि॑ह्वृतिः
verses.transliteration: ná tám áṃho ná duritā́ni mártyam  índrāvaruṇā ná tápaḥ kútaś caná  yásya devā gáchatho vīthó adhvaráṃ  ná tám mártasya naśate párihvr̥tiḥ

translation.text: No trouble, no misfortune, Indra-Varuṇa, no woe from any side assails the mortal man Whose sacrifice, O Gods, ye visit and enjoy: ne'er doth the crafty guile of mortal injure him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्वाङ्न॑रा॒ दैव्ये॒नाव॒सा ग॑तं शृणु॒तं हवं॒ यदि॑ मे॒ जुजो॑षथः यु॒वोर्हि स॒ख्यमु॒त वा॒ यदाप्यं॑ मार्डी॒कमि॑न्द्रावरुणा॒ नि य॑च्छतम्
verses.transliteration: arvā́ṅ narā daívyenā́vasā́ gataṃ  śr̥ṇutáṃ hávaṃ yádi me jújoṣathaḥ  yuvór hí sakhyám utá vā yád ā́pyam  mārḍīkám indrāvaruṇā ní yachatam

translation.text: With your divine protection, Heroes, come to us: mine invncation hear, if ye be pleased therewith. Bestow ye upon us, O Indra-Varuṇa, your friendship and your kinship and your favouring grace.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माक॑मिन्द्रावरुणा॒ भरे॑भरे पुरोयो॒धा भ॑वतं कृष्ट्योजसा यद्वां॒ हव॑न्त उ॒भये॒ अध॑ स्पृ॒धि नर॑स्तो॒कस्य॒ तन॑यस्य सा॒तिषु॑
verses.transliteration: asmā́kam indrāvaruṇā bháre-bhare  puroyodhā́ bhavataṃ kr̥ṣṭyojasā  yád vāṃ hávanta ubháye ádha spr̥dhí  náras tokásya tánayasya sātíṣu

translation.text: In battle after battle, Indra-Varuṇa, be ye our Champions, ye who are the peoples' strength, When both opposing bands invoke you for the fight, and men that they may gain offspring and progeny.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे इन्द्रो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा द्यु॒म्नं य॑च्छन्तु॒ महि॒ शर्म॑ स॒प्रथः॑ अ॒व॒ध्रं ज्योति॒रदि॑तेर्ऋता॒वृधो॑ दे॒वस्य॒ श्लोकं॑ सवि॒तुर्म॑नामहे
verses.transliteration: asmé índro váruṇo mitró aryamā́  dyumnáṃ yachantu máhi śárma sapráthaḥ  avadhráṃ jyótir áditer r̥tāvŕ̥dho  devásya ślókaṃ savitúr manāmahe

translation.text: May Indra, Varuṇa, Mitra, and Aryaman vouchsafe us glory and great shelter spreading far. We think of the beneficent light of Aditi, and Savitar's song of praise, the God who strengthens Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वां न॑रा॒ पश्य॑मानास॒ आप्यं॑ प्रा॒चा ग॒व्यन्तः॑ पृथु॒पर्श॑वो ययुः दासा॑ च वृ॒त्रा ह॒तमार्या॑णि च सु॒दास॑मिन्द्रावरु॒णाव॑सावतम्
verses.transliteration: yuvā́ṃ narā páśyamānāsa ā́pyam  prācā́ gavyántaḥ pr̥thupárśavo yayuḥ  dā́sā ca vr̥trā́ hatám ā́ryāṇi ca  sudā́sam indrāvaruṇā́vasāvatam

translation.text: LOOKING to you and your alliance, O ye Men, armed with broad axes they went forward, fain for spoil. Ye smote and slew his Dâsa and his Aryan enemies, and helped Sudâs with favour, Indra-Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्रा॒ नरः॑ स॒मय॑न्ते कृ॒तध्व॑जो॒ यस्मि॑न्ना॒जा भव॑ति॒ किं च॒न प्रि॒यम् यत्रा॒ भय॑न्ते॒ भुव॑ना स्व॒र्दृश॒स्तत्रा॑ न इन्द्रावरु॒णाधि॑ वोचतम्
verses.transliteration: yátrā náraḥ samáyante kr̥tádhvajo  yásminn ājā́ bhávati kíṃ caná priyám  yátrā bháyante bhúvanā svardŕ̥śas  tátrā na indrāvaruṇā́dhi vocatam

translation.text: Where heroes come together with their banners raised, in the encounter where is naught for us to love, Where all things that behold the light are terrified, there did ye comfort us, O Indra-Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं भूम्या॒ अन्ता॑ ध्वसि॒रा अ॑दृक्ष॒तेन्द्रा॑वरुणा दि॒वि घोष॒ आरु॑हत् अस्थु॒र्जना॑ना॒मुप॒ मामरा॑तयो॒ऽर्वागव॑सा हवनश्रु॒ता ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: sám bhū́myā ántā dhvasirā́ adr̥kṣata-  -índrāvaruṇā diví ghóṣa ā́ruhat  ásthur jánānām úpa mā́m árātayo  -arvā́g ávasā havanaśrutā́ gatam

translation.text: The boundaries of earth were seen all dark with dust: O Indra-Varuṇa, the shout went up to heaven. The enmities of the people compassed me about. Ye heard my calling and ye came to me with help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑वरुणा व॒धना॑भिरप्र॒ति भे॒दं व॒न्वन्ता॒ प्र सु॒दास॑मावतम् ब्रह्मा॑ण्येषां शृणुतं॒ हवी॑मनि स॒त्या तृत्सू॑नामभवत्पु॒रोहि॑तिः
verses.transliteration: índrāvaruṇā vadhánābhir apratí  bhedáṃ vanvántā prá sudā́sam āvatam  bráhmāṇy eṣāṃ śr̥ṇutaṃ hávīmani  satyā́ tŕ̥tsūnām abhavat puróhitiḥ

translation.text: With your resistless weapons, Indra-Varuṇa, ye conquered Bheda and ye gave Sudâs your aid. Ye heard the prayers of these amid the cries of war: effectual was the service of the Tr̥itsus' priest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑वरुणाव॒भ्या त॑पन्ति मा॒घान्य॒र्यो व॒नुषा॒मरा॑तयः यु॒वं हि वस्व॑ उ॒भय॑स्य॒ राज॒थोऽध॑ स्मा नोऽवतं॒ पार्ये॑ दि॒वि
verses.transliteration: índrāvaruṇāv abhy ā́ tapanti mā-  -aghā́ny aryó vanúṣām árātayaḥ  yuváṃ hí vásva ubháyasya rā́jathaḥ-  -ádha smā no 'vatam pā́rye diví

translation.text: O Indra-Varuṇa, the wickedness of foes and mine assailants' hatred sorely trouble me. Ye Twain are Lords of riches both of earth and heaven: so grant to us your aid on the decisive day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वां ह॑वन्त उ॒भया॑स आ॒जिष्विन्द्रं॑ च॒ वस्वो॒ वरु॑णं च सा॒तये॑ यत्र॒ राज॑भिर्द॒शभि॒र्निबा॑धितं॒ प्र सु॒दास॒माव॑तं॒ तृत्सु॑भिः स॒ह
verses.transliteration: yuvā́ṃ havanta ubháyāsa ājíṣu-  índraṃ ca vásvo váruṇaṃ ca sātáye  yátra rā́jabhir daśábhir níbādhitam  prá sudā́sam ā́vataṃ tŕ̥tsubhiḥ sahá

translation.text: The men of both the hosts invoked you in the fight, Indra and Varuṇa, that they might win the wealth, What time ye helped Sudâs, with all the Tr̥itsu folk, when the Ten Kings had pressed him down in their attack.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दश॒ राजा॑नः॒ समि॑ता॒ अय॑ज्यवः सु॒दास॑मिन्द्रावरुणा॒ न यु॑युधुः स॒त्या नृ॒णाम॑द्म॒सदा॒मुप॑स्तुतिर्दे॒वा ए॑षामभवन्दे॒वहू॑तिषु
verses.transliteration: dáśa rā́jānaḥ sámitā áyajyavaḥ  sudā́sam indrāvaruṇā ná yuyudhuḥ  satyā́ nr̥ṇā́m admasádām úpastutir  devā́ eṣām abhavan deváhūtiṣu

translation.text: Ten Kings who worshipped not, O Indra-Varuṇa, confederate, in war prevailed not o'er Sudâs. True was the boast of heroes sitting at the feast: so at their invocations Gods were on their side.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दा॒श॒रा॒ज्ञे परि॑यत्ताय वि॒श्वतः॑ सु॒दास॑ इन्द्रावरुणावशिक्षतम् श्वि॒त्यञ्चो॒ यत्र॒ नम॑सा कप॒र्दिनो॑ धि॒या धीव॑न्तो॒ अस॑पन्त॒ तृत्स॑वः
verses.transliteration: dāśarājñé páriyattāya viśvátaḥ  sudā́sa indrāvaruṇāv aśikṣatam  śvityáñco yátra námasā kapardíno  dhiyā́ dhī́vanto ásapanta tŕ̥tsavaḥ

translation.text: O Indra-Varuṇa, ye gave Sudâs your aid when the Ten Kings in battle compassed him about, There where the white-robed Tr̥itsus with their braided hair, skilled in song worshipped you with homage and with hymn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृ॒त्राण्य॒न्यः स॑मि॒थेषु॒ जिघ्न॑ते व्र॒तान्य॒न्यो अ॒भि र॑क्षते॒ सदा॑ हवा॑महे वां वृषणा सुवृ॒क्तिभि॑र॒स्मे इ॑न्द्रावरुणा॒ शर्म॑ यच्छतम्
verses.transliteration: vr̥trā́ṇy anyáḥ samithéṣu jíghnate  vratā́ny anyó abhí rakṣate sádā  hávāmahe vāṃ vr̥ṣaṇā suvr̥ktíbhir  asmé indrāvaruṇā śárma yachatam

translation.text: One of you Twain destroys the Vr̥itras in the fight, the Other evermore maintains his holy Laws. We call on you, ye Mighty, with our hymns of praise. Vouchsafe us your protection, Indra-Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे इन्द्रो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा द्यु॒म्नं य॑च्छन्तु॒ महि॒ शर्म॑ स॒प्रथः॑ अ॒व॒ध्रं ज्योति॒रदि॑तेर्ऋता॒वृधो॑ दे॒वस्य॒ श्लोकं॑ सवि॒तुर्म॑नामहे
verses.transliteration: asmé índro váruṇo mitró aryamā́  dyumnáṃ yachantu máhi śárma sapráthaḥ  avadhráṃ jyótir áditer r̥tāvŕ̥dho  devásya ślókaṃ savitúr manāmahe

translation.text: May Indra, Varuṇa, Mitra, and Aryaman vouchsafe us glory and great shelter spreading far. We think of the beneficent light of Aditi, and Savitar's song of praise, the God who strengthens Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॑ राजानावध्व॒रे व॑वृत्यां ह॒व्येभि॑रिन्द्रावरुणा॒ नमो॑भिः प्र वां॑ घृ॒ताची॑ बा॒ह्वोर्दधा॑ना॒ परि॒ त्मना॒ विषु॑रूपा जिगाति
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ rājānāv adhvaré vavr̥tyāṃ  -havyébhir indrāvaruṇā námobhiḥ  prá vāṃ ghr̥tā́cī bāhvór dádhānā  pári tmánā víṣurūpā jigāti

translation.text: KINGS, Indra-Varuṇa, I would turn you hither to this our sacrifice with gifts and homage. Held in both arms the ladle, dropping fatness, goes of itself to you whose forms are varied.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वो रा॒ष्ट्रं बृ॒हदि॑न्वति॒ द्यौर्यौ से॒तृभि॑रर॒ज्जुभिः॑ सिनी॒थः परि॑ नो॒ हेळो॒ वरु॑णस्य वृज्या उ॒रुं न॒ इन्द्रः॑ कृणवदु लो॒कम्
verses.transliteration: yuvó rāṣṭrám br̥hád invati dyaúr  yaú setŕ̥bhir arajjúbhiḥ sinītháḥ  pári no héḷo váruṇasya vr̥jyāḥ-  urúṃ na índraḥ kr̥ṇavad ulokám

translation.text: Dyaus quickens and promotes your high dominion who bind with bonds not wrought of rope or cordage. Far from us still be Varuṇa's displeasure may Indra give us spacious room to dwell in.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒तं नो॑ य॒ज्ञं वि॒दथे॑षु॒ चारुं॑ कृ॒तं ब्रह्मा॑णि सू॒रिषु॑ प्रश॒स्ता उपो॑ र॒यिर्दे॒वजू॑तो न एतु॒ प्र णः॑ स्पा॒र्हाभि॑रू॒तिभि॑स्तिरेतम्
verses.transliteration: kr̥táṃ no yajñáṃ vidátheṣu cā́ruṃ  kr̥tám bráhmāṇi sūríṣu praśastā́  úpo rayír devájūto na etu  prá ṇa spārhā́bhir ūtíbhis tiretam

translation.text: Make ye our sacrifice fair amid the assemblies: make ye our prayers approved among our princes. May God-sent riches come for our possession: further ye us with your delightful succours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे इ॑न्द्रावरुणा वि॒श्ववा॑रं र॒यिं ध॑त्तं॒ वसु॑मन्तं पुरु॒क्षुम् प्र य आ॑दि॒त्यो अनृ॑ता मि॒नात्यमि॑ता॒ शूरो॑ दयते॒ वसू॑नि
verses.transliteration: asmé indrāvaruṇā viśvávāraṃ  rayíṃ dhattaṃ vásumantam purukṣúm  prá yá ādityó ánr̥tā minā́ti-  ámitā śū́ro dayate vásūni

translation.text: O Indra-Varuṇa, vouchsafe us riches with store of treasure, food, and every blessing; For the Âditya, banisher of falsehood, the Hero, dealeth wealth in boundless plenty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यमिन्द्रं॒ वरु॑णमष्ट मे॒ गीः प्राव॑त्तो॒के तन॑ये॒ तूतु॑जाना सु॒रत्ना॑सो दे॒ववी॑तिं गमेम यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: iyám índraṃ váruṇam aṣṭa me gī́ḥ  prā́vat toké tánaye tū́tujānā  surátnāso devávītiṃ gamema  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: May this my song reach Varuṇa and Indra, and, strongly urging, win me sons and offspring. To the Gods' banquet may we go with riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒नी॒षे वा॑मर॒क्षसं॑ मनी॒षां सोम॒मिन्द्रा॑य॒ वरु॑णाय॒ जुह्व॑त् घृ॒तप्र॑तीकामु॒षसं॒ न दे॒वीं ता नो॒ याम॑न्नुरुष्यताम॒भीके॑
verses.transliteration: punīṣé vām arakṣásam manīṣā́ṃ  sómam índrāya váruṇāya júhvat  ghr̥tápratīkām uṣásaṃ ná devī́ṃ  tā́ no yā́mann uruṣyatām abhī́ke

translation.text: FOR you I deck a harmless hymn, presenting the Soma juice to Varuṇa and Indra- A hymn that shines like heavenly Dawn with fatness. May they be near us on the march and guard us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्पर्ध॑न्ते॒ वा उ॑ देव॒हूये॒ अत्र॒ येषु॑ ध्व॒जेषु॑ दि॒द्यवः॒ पत॑न्ति यु॒वं ताँ इ॑न्द्रावरुणाव॒मित्रा॑न्ह॒तं परा॑चः॒ शर्वा॒ विषू॑चः
verses.transliteration: spárdhante vā́ u devahū́ye átra  yéṣu dhvajéṣu didyávaḥ pátanti  yuváṃ tā́m̐ indrāvaruṇāv amítrān  hatám párācaḥ śárvā víṣūcaḥ

translation.text: Here where the arrows fall amid the banners both hosts invoke the Gods in emulation. O Indra-Varuṇa, smite back those-our foemen,yea, smite them withyour shaft to every quarter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आप॑श्चि॒द्धि स्वय॑शसः॒ सदः॑सु दे॒वीरिन्द्रं॒ वरु॑णं दे॒वता॒ धुः कृ॒ष्टीर॒न्यो धा॒रय॑ति॒ प्रवि॑क्ता वृ॒त्राण्य॒न्यो अ॑प्र॒तीनि॑ हन्ति
verses.transliteration: ā́paś cid dhí sváyaśasaḥ sádassu  devī́r índraṃ váruṇaṃ devátā dhúḥ  kr̥ṣṭī́r anyó dhāráyati práviktāḥ-  vr̥trā́ṇy anyó apratī́ni hanti

translation.text: Self-lucid in their seats, e'en heavenly Waters endowed with Godhead Varuṇa and Indra. One of these holds the folk distinct and sundered, the Other smites and slays resistless foemen.
