verses.sanskrit_deva: स सु॒क्रतु॑र्ऋत॒चिद॑स्तु॒ होता॒ य आ॑दित्य॒ शव॑सा वां॒ नम॑स्वान् आ॒व॒वर्त॒दव॑से वां ह॒विष्मा॒नस॒दित्स सु॑वि॒ताय॒ प्रय॑स्वान्
verses.transliteration: sá sukrátur r̥tacíd astu hótā  yá āditya śávasā vāṃ námasvān  āvavártad ávase vāṃ havíṣmān  ásad ít sá suvitā́ya práyasvān

translation.text: Wise be the priest and skilled in Law Eternal, who with his sacred gifts and oration. Brings you to aid us with your might, Âdityas: let him have viands to promote his welfare.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यमिन्द्रं॒ वरु॑णमष्ट मे॒ गीः प्राव॑त्तो॒के तन॑ये॒ तूतु॑जाना सु॒रत्ना॑सो दे॒ववी॑तिं गमेम यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: iyám índraṃ váruṇam aṣṭa me gī́ḥ  prā́vat toké tánaye tū́tujānā  surátnāso devávītiṃ gamema  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: May this my song reach Varuṇa and Indra, and, strongly urging, win me sons and offspring. To the Gods' banquet may we go with riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धीरा॒ त्व॑स्य महि॒ना ज॒नूंषि॒ वि यस्त॒स्तम्भ॒ रोद॑सी चिदु॒र्वी प्र नाक॑मृ॒ष्वं नु॑नुदे बृ॒हन्तं॑ द्वि॒ता नक्ष॑त्रं प॒प्रथ॑च्च॒ भूम॑
verses.transliteration: dhī́rā tv àsya mahinā́ janū́ṃṣi  ví yás tastámbha ródasī cid urvī́  prá nā́kam r̥ṣváṃ nunude br̥hántaṃ  dvitā́ nákṣatram papráthac ca bhū́ma

translation.text: WISE, verily, are creatures through his greatness who stayed ever, spacious heaven and earth asunder; Who urged the high and mighty sky to motion, the Star of old, and spread the earth before him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्वया॑ त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ सं व॑दे॒ तत्क॒दा न्व१॒॑न्तर्वरु॑णे भुवानि किं मे॑ ह॒व्यमहृ॑णानो जुषेत क॒दा मृ॑ळी॒कं सु॒मना॑ अ॒भि ख्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: utá sváyā tanvā̀ sáṃ vade tát  kadā́ nv àntár váruṇe bhuvāni  kím me havyám áhr̥ṇāno juṣeta  kadā́ mr̥ḷīkáṃ sumánā abhí khyam

translation.text: With mine own heart I commune on the question how Varuṇa and I may be united. What gift of mine will he accept unangered? When may I calmly look and find him gracious?

verses.sanskrit_deva: पृ॒च्छे तदेनो॑ वरुण दि॒दृक्षूपो॑ एमि चिकि॒तुषो॑ वि॒पृच्छ॑म् स॒मा॒नमिन्मे॑ क॒वय॑श्चिदाहुर॒यं ह॒ तुभ्यं॒ वरु॑णो हृणीते
verses.transliteration: pr̥ché tád éno varuṇa didŕ̥kṣu-  -úpo emi cikitúṣo vipŕ̥cham  samānám ín me kaváyaś cid āhur  ayáṃ ha túbhyaṃ váruṇo hr̥ṇīte

translation.text: Fain to know this in in I question others: I seek the wise, O Varuṇa, and ask them. This one same answer even the sages gave me, "Surely this Varuṇa is angry with thee."

verses.sanskrit_deva: किमाग॑ आस वरुण॒ ज्येष्ठं॒ यत्स्तो॒तारं॒ जिघां॑ससि॒ सखा॑यम् प्र तन्मे॑ वोचो दूळभ स्वधा॒वोऽव॑ त्वाने॒ना नम॑सा तु॒र इ॑याम्
verses.transliteration: kím ā́ga āsa varuṇa jyéṣṭhaṃ  yát stotā́raṃ jíghāṃsasi sákhāyam  prá tán me voco dūḷabha svadhāvaḥ-  -áva tvānenā́ námasā turá iyām

translation.text: What, Varuṇa, hath been my chief transgression, ihat thou wouldst slay the friend who sings thy praises? Tell me, Unconquerable Lord, and quickly sinless will I approach thee with mine homage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑ द्रु॒ग्धानि॒ पित्र्या॑ सृजा॒ नोऽव॒ या व॒यं च॑कृ॒मा त॒नूभिः॑ अव॑ राजन्पशु॒तृपं॒ न ता॒युं सृ॒जा व॒त्सं न दाम्नो॒ वसि॑ष्ठम्
verses.transliteration: áva drugdhā́ni pítryā sr̥jā naḥ-  -áva yā́ vayáṃ cakr̥mā́ tanū́bhiḥ  áva rājan paśutŕ̥paṃ ná tāyúṃ  sr̥jā́ vatsáṃ ná dā́mno vásiṣṭham

translation.text: Free us from sins committed by our fathers, from those wherein we have ourselves offended. O King, loose, like a thief who feeds the cattle, as from the cord a calf, set free Vasishṭha.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न स स्वो दक्षो॑ वरुण॒ ध्रुतिः॒ सा सुरा॑ म॒न्युर्वि॒भीद॑को॒ अचि॑त्तिः अस्ति॒ ज्याया॒न्कनी॑यस उपा॒रे स्वप्न॑श्च॒नेदनृ॑तस्य प्रयो॒ता
verses.transliteration: ná sá svó dákṣo varuṇa dhrútiḥ sā́  súrā manyúr vibhī́dako ácittiḥ  ásti jyā́yān kánīyasa upāré  svápnaś canéd ánr̥tasya prayotā́

translation.text: Not our own will betrayed us, but seduction, thoughtlessness, Varuṇa wine, dice, or anger. The old is near to lead astray the younger: even sleep removeth not all evil-doing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अरं॑ दा॒सो न मी॒ळ्हुषे॑ कराण्य॒हं दे॒वाय॒ भूर्ण॒येऽना॑गाः अचे॑तयद॒चितो॑ दे॒वो अ॒र्यो गृत्सं॑ रा॒ये क॒वित॑रो जुनाति
verses.transliteration: áraṃ dāsó ná mīḷhúṣe karāṇi-  aháṃ devā́ya bhū́rṇayé 'nāgāḥ  ácetayad acíto devó aryó  gŕ̥tsaṃ rāyé kavítaro junāti

translation.text: Slavelike may I do service to the Bounteous, serve, free from sin, the God inclined to anger. This gentle Lord gives wisdom to the simple: the wiser God leads on the wise to riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं सु तुभ्यं॑ वरुण स्वधावो हृ॒दि स्तोम॒ उप॑श्रितश्चिदस्तु शं नः॒ क्षेमे॒ शमु॒ योगे॑ नो अस्तु यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ sú túbhyaṃ varuṇa svadhāvo  hr̥dí stóma úpaśritaś cid astu  śáṃ naḥ kṣéme śám u yóge no astu  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: O Lord, O Varuṇa, may this laudation come close to thed and lie within thy spirit. May it be well with us in rest and labour. Preserve us ever-more, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रद॑त्प॒थो वरु॑णः॒ सूर्या॑य॒ प्रार्णां॑सि समु॒द्रिया॑ न॒दीना॑म् सर्गो॒ न सृ॒ष्टो अर्व॑तीर्ऋता॒यञ्च॒कार॑ म॒हीर॒वनी॒रह॑भ्यः
verses.transliteration: rádat pathó váruṇaḥ sū́ryāya  prā́rṇāṃsi samudríyā nadī́nām  sárgo ná sr̥ṣṭó árvatīr r̥tāyáñ  cakā́ra mahī́r avánīr áhabhyaḥ

translation.text: Varuṇa cut a pathway out for Sûrya, and led the watery floods of rivers onward. The Mares, as in a race, speed on in order. He made great channels for the days to follow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒त्मा ते॒ वातो॒ रज॒ आ न॑वीनोत्प॒शुर्न भूर्णि॒र्यव॑से सस॒वान् अ॒न्तर्म॒ही बृ॑ह॒ती रोद॑सी॒मे विश्वा॑ ते॒ धाम॑ वरुण प्रि॒याणि॑
verses.transliteration: ātmā́ te vā́to rája ā́ navīnot  paśúr ná bhū́rṇir yávase sasavā́n  antár mahī́ br̥hatī́ ródasīmé  víśvā te dhā́ma varuṇa priyā́ṇi

translation.text: The wind, thy breath, hath sounded through the region like a wild beast that seeks his food in pastures. Within these two, exalted Earth and Heaven, O Varuṇa, are all the forms thou lovest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ स्पशो॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ स्मदि॑ष्टा उ॒भे प॑श्यन्ति॒ रोद॑सी सु॒मेके॑ ऋ॒तावा॑नः क॒वयो॑ य॒ज्ञधी॑राः॒ प्रचे॑तसो॒ य इ॒षय॑न्त॒ मन्म॑
verses.transliteration: pári spáśo váruṇasya smádiṣṭāḥ-  ubhé paśyanti ródasī suméke  r̥tā́vānaḥ kaváyo yajñádhīrāḥ  prácetaso yá iṣáyanta mánma

translation.text: Varuṇa's spies, sent forth upon their errand, survey the two world-halves well formed and fashioned. Wise are they, holy, skilled in sacrifices, the furtherers of the praise-songs of the prudent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒वाच॑ मे॒ वरु॑णो॒ मेधि॑राय॒ त्रिः स॒प्त नामाघ्न्या॑ बिभर्ति वि॒द्वान्प॒दस्य॒ गुह्या॒ न वो॑चद्यु॒गाय॒ विप्र॒ उप॑राय॒ शिक्ष॑न्
verses.transliteration: uvā́ca me váruṇo médhirāya  tríḥ saptá nā́mā́ghnyā bibharti  vidvā́n padásya gúhyā ná vocad  yugā́ya vípra úparāya śíkṣan

translation.text: To me who understand hath Varuṇa spoken, the names borne by the Cow are three times seven. The sapient God, knowing the place's secret, shall speak as 'twere to teach the race that cometh.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ति॒स्रो द्यावो॒ निहि॑ता अ॒न्तर॑स्मिन्ति॒स्रो भूमी॒रुप॑राः॒ षड्वि॑धानाः गृत्सो॒ राजा॒ वरु॑णश्चक्र ए॒तं दि॒वि प्रे॒ङ्खं हि॑र॒ण्ययं॑ शु॒भे कम्
verses.transliteration: tisró dyā́vo níhitā antár asmin  tisró bhū́mīr úparāḥ ṣáḍvidhānāḥ  gŕ̥tso rā́jā váruṇaś cakra etáṃ  diví preṅkháṃ hiraṇyáyaṃ śubhé kám

translation.text: On him three heavens rest and are supported, and the three earths are there in sixfold order. The wise King Varuṇa hath made in heaven that Golden Swing to cover it with glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॒ सिन्धुं॒ वरु॑णो॒ द्यौरि॑व स्थाद्द्र॒प्सो न श्वे॒तो मृ॒गस्तुवि॑ष्मान् ग॒म्भी॒रशं॑सो॒ रज॑सो वि॒मानः॑ सुपा॒रक्ष॑त्रः स॒तो अ॒स्य राजा॑
verses.transliteration: áva síndhuṃ váruṇo dyaúr iva sthād  drapsó ná śvetó mr̥gás túviṣmān  gambhīráśaṃso rájaso vimā́naḥ  supārákṣatraḥ sató asyá rā́jā

translation.text: Like Varuṇa from heaven he sinks in Sindhu, like a white-shining spark, a strong wild creature. Ruling in depths and meting out the region, great saving power hath he, this world's Controller.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो मृ॒ळया॑ति च॒क्रुषे॑ चि॒दागो॑ व॒यं स्या॑म॒ वरु॑णे॒ अना॑गाः अनु॑ व्र॒तान्यदि॑तेर्ऋ॒धन्तो॑ यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: yó mr̥ḷáyāti cakrúṣe cid ā́go  vayáṃ syāma váruṇe ánāgāḥ  ánu vratā́ny áditer r̥dhánto  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Before this Varuṇa may we be sinless him who shows mercy even to the sinner- While we are keeping Aditi's ordinances. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र शु॒न्ध्युवं॒ वरु॑णाय॒ प्रेष्ठां॑ म॒तिं व॑सिष्ठ मी॒ळ्हुषे॑ भरस्व य ई॑म॒र्वाञ्चं॒ कर॑ते॒ यज॑त्रं स॒हस्रा॑मघं॒ वृष॑णं बृ॒हन्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: prá śundhyúvaṃ váruṇāya préṣṭhām  matíṃ vasiṣṭha mīḷhúṣe bharasva  yá īm arvā́ñcaṃ kárate yájatraṃ  sahásrāmaghaṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇam br̥hántam

translation.text: PRESENT to Varuṇa thine hymn, Vasishṭha, bright, most delightful to the Bounteous Giver, Who bringeth on to us the Bull, the lofty, the Holy, laden with a thousand treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॒ न्व॑स्य सं॒दृशं॑ जग॒न्वान॒ग्नेरनी॑कं॒ वरु॑णस्य मंसि स्व१॒॑र्यदश्म॑न्नधि॒पा उ॒ अन्धो॒ऽभि मा॒ वपु॑र्दृ॒शये॑ निनीयात्
verses.transliteration: ádhā nv àsya saṃdŕ̥śaṃ jaganvā́n  agnér ánīkaṃ váruṇasya maṃsi  svàr yád áśmann adhipā́ u ándho  -abhí mā vápur dr̥śáye ninīyāt

translation.text: And now, as I am come before his presence, I take the face of Varuṇa for Agni's. So might he bring-Lord also of the darkness-the light in heaven that I may see its beauty!

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यद्रु॒हाव॒ वरु॑णश्च॒ नावं॒ प्र यत्स॑मु॒द्रमी॒रया॑व॒ मध्य॑म् अधि॒ यद॒पां स्नुभि॒श्चरा॑व॒ प्र प्रे॒ङ्ख ई॑ङ्खयावहै शु॒भे कम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ yád ruhā́va váruṇaś ca nā́vam  prá yát samudrám īráyāva mádhyam  ádhi yád apā́ṃ snúbhiś cárāva  prá preṅkhá īṅkhayāvahai śubhé kám

translation.text: When Varuṇa and I embark together and urge our boat into the midst of ocean, We, when we ride o'er ridges of the waters, will swing within that swing and there be happy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वसि॑ष्ठं ह॒ वरु॑णो ना॒व्याधा॒दृषिं॑ चकार॒ स्वपा॒ महो॑भिः स्तो॒तारं॒ विप्रः॑ सुदिन॒त्वे अह्नां॒ यान्नु द्याव॑स्त॒तन॒न्यादु॒षासः॑
verses.transliteration: vásiṣṭhaṃ ha váruṇo nāvy ā́dhād  ŕ̥ṣiṃ cakāra svápā máhobhiḥ  stotā́raṃ vípraḥ sudinatvé áhnāṃ  yā́n nú dyā́vas tatánan yā́d uṣā́saḥ

translation.text: Varuṇa placed Vasishṭha in the vessel, and deftly with his niight made him a R̥ishi. When days shone bright the Sage made him a singer, while the heavens broadened and the Dawns were lengthened.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्व१॒॑ त्यानि॑ नौ स॒ख्या ब॑भूवुः॒ सचा॑वहे॒ यद॑वृ॒कं पु॒रा चि॑त् बृ॒हन्तं॒ मानं॑ वरुण स्वधावः स॒हस्र॑द्वारं जगमा गृ॒हं ते॑
verses.transliteration: kvà tyā́ni nau sakhyā́ babhūvuḥ  sácāvahe yád avr̥kám purā́ cit  br̥hántam mā́naṃ varuṇa svadhāvaḥ  sahásradvāraṃ jagamā gr̥háṃ te

translation.text: What hath become of those our ancient friendships, when without enmity we walked together? I, Varuṇa, thou glorious Lord, have entered thy lofty home, thine house with thousand portals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य आ॒पिर्नित्यो॑ वरुण प्रि॒यः सन्त्वामागां॑सि कृ॒णव॒त्सखा॑ ते मा त॒ एन॑स्वन्तो यक्षिन्भुजेम य॒न्धि ष्मा॒ विप्रः॑ स्तुव॒ते वरू॑थम्
verses.transliteration: yá āpír nítyo varuṇa priyáḥ sán  tvā́m ā́gāṃsi kr̥ṇávat sákhā te  mā́ ta énasvanto yakṣin bhujema  yandhí ṣmā vípra stuvaté várūtham

translation.text: If he, thy true ally, hath sinned against thee, still, Varuṇa, he is the friend thou lovedst. Let us not, Living One, as sinners I know thee: give shelter, as a Sage, to him who lauds thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ध्रु॒वासु॑ त्वा॒सु क्षि॒तिषु॑ क्षि॒यन्तो॒ व्य१॒॑स्मत्पाशं॒ वरु॑णो मुमोचत् अवो॑ वन्वा॒ना अदि॑तेरु॒पस्था॑द्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: dhruvā́su tvāsú kṣitíṣu kṣiyánto  vy àsmát pā́śaṃ váruṇo mumocat  ávo vanvānā́ áditer upásthād  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: While we abide in these fixed habitations, and from the lap of Aditi win favour, May Varuṇa untie the bond that binds us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मो षु व॑रुण मृ॒न्मयं॑ गृ॒हं रा॑जन्न॒हं ग॑मम् मृ॒ळा सु॑क्षत्र मृ॒ळय॑
verses.transliteration: mó ṣú varuṇa mr̥nmáyaṃ  gr̥háṃ rājann aháṃ gamam  mr̥ḷā́ sukṣatra mr̥ḷáya

translation.text: LET me not yet, King Varuṇa, enter into the house of clay: Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदेमि॑ प्रस्फु॒रन्नि॑व॒ दृति॒र्न ध्मा॒तो अ॑द्रिवः मृ॒ळा सु॑क्षत्र मृ॒ळय॑
verses.transliteration: yád émi prasphuránn iva  dŕ̥tir ná dhmātó adrivaḥ  mr̥ḷā́ sukṣatra mr̥ḷáya

translation.text: When, Thunderer! I move along tremulous like a wind-blown skin, Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्रत्वः॑ समह दी॒नता॑ प्रती॒पं ज॑गमा शुचे मृ॒ळा सु॑क्षत्र मृ॒ळय॑
verses.transliteration: krátvaḥ samaha dīnátā  pratīpáṃ jagamā śuce  mr̥ḷā́ sukṣatra mr̥ḷáya

translation.text: O Bright and Powerful God, through want of strength I erred and went astray Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒पां मध्ये॑ तस्थि॒वांसं॒ तृष्णा॑विदज्जरि॒तार॑म् मृ॒ळा सु॑क्षत्र मृ॒ळय॑
verses.transliteration: apā́m mádhye tasthivā́ṃsaṃ  tŕ̥ṣṇāvidaj jaritā́ram  mr̥ḷā́ sukṣatra mr̥ḷáya

translation.text: Thirst found thy worshipper though he stood in the midst of water-fijods: Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्किं चे॒दं व॑रुण॒ दैव्ये॒ जने॑ऽभिद्रो॒हं म॑नु॒ष्या॒३॒॑श्चरा॑मसि अचि॑त्ती॒ यत्तव॒ धर्मा॑ युयोपि॒म मा न॒स्तस्मा॒देन॑सो देव रीरिषः
verses.transliteration: yát kíṃ cedáṃ varuṇa daívye jáne  -abhidrohám manuṣyā̀ś cárāmasi  ácittī yát táva dhármā yuyopimá  mā́ nas tásmād énaso deva rīriṣaḥ

translation.text: O Varuṇa, whatever the offence may be which we as men commit against the heavenly host, When through our want of thought we violate thy laws, punish us not, O God, for that iniquity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वी॑र॒या शुच॑यो दद्रिरे वामध्व॒र्युभि॒र्मधु॑मन्तः सु॒तासः॑ वह॑ वायो नि॒युतो॑ या॒ह्यच्छा॒ पिबा॑ सु॒तस्यान्ध॑सो॒ मदा॑य
verses.transliteration: prá vīrayā́ śúcayo dadrire vām  adhvaryúbhir mádhumantaḥ sutā́saḥ  váha vāyo niyúto yāhy áchā  píbā sutásyā́ndhaso mádāya

translation.text: To you pure juice, rich in meath, are offered by priest: through longing for the Pair of Heroes. Drive, Vâyu, bring thine harnessed horses hither: drink the pressed Soma till it make thee joyful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒शा॒नाय॒ प्रहु॑तिं॒ यस्त॒ आन॒ट् छुचिं॒ सोमं॑ शुचिपा॒स्तुभ्यं॑ वायो कृ॒णोषि॒ तं मर्त्ये॑षु प्रश॒स्तं जा॒तोजा॑तो जायते वा॒ज्य॑स्य
verses.transliteration: īśānā́ya práhutiṃ yás ta ā́naṭ  -śúciṃ sómaṃ śucipās túbhyaṃ vāyo  kr̥ṇóṣi tám mártyeṣu praśastáṃ  jātó-jāto jāyate vājy àsya

translation.text: Whoso to thee, the Mighty, brings oblation, pure Soma unto thee, pure-drinking Vâyu, That man thou makest famous among mortals: to him strong sons are born in quick succession.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रा॒ये नु यं ज॒ज्ञतू॒ रोद॑सी॒मे रा॒ये दे॒वी धि॒षणा॑ धाति दे॒वम् अध॑ वा॒युं नि॒युतः॑ सश्चत॒ स्वा उ॒त श्वे॒तं वसु॑धितिं निरे॒के
verses.transliteration: rāyé nú yáṃ jajñátū ródasīmé  rāyé devī́ dhiṣáṇā dhāti devám  ádha vāyúṃ niyútaḥ saścata svā́ḥ-  utá śvetáṃ vásudhitiṃ nireké

translation.text: The God whom both these worlds brought forth for riches, whom heavenly Dhishaṇâ for our wealth appointeth, His team of harnessed horses waits on Vâyu, and, foremost, on the radiant Treasure-bearer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒च्छन्नु॒षसः॑ सु॒दिना॑ अरि॒प्रा उ॒रु ज्योति॑र्विविदु॒र्दीध्या॑नाः गव्यं॑ चिदू॒र्वमु॒शिजो॒ वि व॑व्रु॒स्तेषा॒मनु॑ प्र॒दिवः॑ सस्रु॒रापः॑
verses.transliteration: uchánn uṣásaḥ sudínā ariprā́ḥ-  urú jyótir vividur dī́dhyānāḥ  gávyaṃ cid ūrvám uśíjo ví vavrus  téṣām ánu pradívaḥ sasrur ā́paḥ

translation.text: The spotless Dawns with fair bright days have broken; they found the spacious light when they were shining. Eagerly they disclosed the stall of cattle: floods streamed for them as in the days aforetime.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते स॒त्येन॒ मन॑सा॒ दीध्या॑नाः॒ स्वेन॑ यु॒क्तासः॒ क्रतु॑ना वहन्ति इन्द्र॑वायू वीर॒वाहं॒ रथं॑ वामीशा॒नयो॑र॒भि पृक्षः॑ सचन्ते
verses.transliteration: té satyéna mánasā dī́dhyānāḥ  svéna yuktā́saḥ krátunā vahanti  índravāyū vīravā́haṃ ráthaṃ vām  īśānáyor abhí pŕ̥kṣaḥ sacante

translation.text: These with their truthful spirit, shining brightly, move on provided with their natural insight. Viands attend the car that beareth Heroes, your car, ye Sovran Pair, Indra and Vâyu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒शा॒नासो॒ ये दध॑ते॒ स्व॑र्णो॒ गोभि॒रश्वे॑भि॒र्वसु॑भि॒र्हिर॑ण्यैः इन्द्र॑वायू सू॒रयो॒ विश्व॒मायु॒रर्व॑द्भिर्वी॒रैः पृत॑नासु सह्युः
verses.transliteration: īśānā́so yé dádhate svàr ṇo  góbhir áśvebhir vásubhir híraṇyaiḥ  índravāyū sūráyo víśvam ā́yur  árvadbhir vīraíḥ pŕ̥tanāsu sahyuḥ

translation.text: May these who give us heavenly light, these rulers, with gifts of kine and horses, gold and treasures. These princes, through full life, Indra and Vâyu! o'ercome in battle with their steeds and heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्व॑न्तो॒ न श्रव॑सो॒ भिक्ष॑माणा इन्द्रवा॒यू सु॑ष्टु॒तिभि॒र्वसि॑ष्ठाः वा॒ज॒यन्तः॒ स्वव॑से हुवेम यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: árvanto ná śrávaso bhíkṣamāṇāḥ-  indravāyū́ suṣṭutíbhir vásiṣṭhāḥ  vājayántaḥ sv ávase huvema  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Like coursers seeking fame will we Vasishṭhas, O Indra-Vâyu, with our fair laudations. Exerting all our power call you to aid us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कु॒विद॒ङ्ग नम॑सा॒ ये वृ॒धासः॑ पु॒रा दे॒वा अ॑नव॒द्यास॒ आस॑न् ते वा॒यवे॒ मन॑वे बाधि॒तायावा॑सयन्नु॒षसं॒ सूर्ये॑ण
verses.transliteration: kuvíd aṅgá námasā yé vr̥dhā́saḥ  purā́ devā́ anavadyā́sa ā́san  té vāyáve mánave bādhitā́ya-  -ávāsayann uṣásaṃ sū́ryeṇa

translation.text: WERE not in sooth, the Gods aforetime blameless, whose pleasure was increased by adoration? For Vâyu and for man in his affliction they caused the Morning to arise with Sûrya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒शन्ता॑ दू॒ता न दभा॑य गो॒पा मा॒सश्च॑ पा॒थः श॒रद॑श्च पू॒र्वीः इन्द्र॑वायू सुष्टु॒तिर्वा॑मिया॒ना मा॑र्डी॒कमी॑ट्टे सुवि॒तं च॒ नव्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: uśántā dūtā́ ná dábhāya gopā́  māsáś ca pātháḥ śarádaś ca pūrvī́ḥ  índravāyū suṣṭutír vām iyānā́  mārḍīkám īṭṭe suvitáṃ ca návyam

translation.text: Guardians infallible, eager as envoys' preserve us safe through many months and autumns. Addressed to you, our fair praise, Indra-Vâyu, implores your favour and renewed well-being.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पीवो॑अन्नाँ रयि॒वृधः॑ सुमे॒धाः श्वे॒तः सि॑षक्ति नि॒युता॑मभि॒श्रीः ते वा॒यवे॒ सम॑नसो॒ वि त॑स्थु॒र्विश्वेन्नरः॑ स्वप॒त्यानि॑ चक्रुः
verses.transliteration: pī́voannām̐ rayivŕ̥dhaḥ sumedhā́ḥ  śvetáḥ siṣakti niyútām abhiśrī́ḥ  té vāyáve sámanaso ví tasthur  víśvén náraḥ svapatyā́ni cakruḥ

translation.text: Wise, bright, arranger of his teams, he. seeketh men with rich food whose treasures are abundant. They have arranged them of one mind with Vâyu: the men have wrought all noble operations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याव॒त्तर॑स्त॒न्वो॒३॒॑ याव॒दोजो॒ याव॒न्नर॒श्चक्ष॑सा॒ दीध्या॑नाः शुचिं॒ सोमं॑ शुचिपा पातम॒स्मे इन्द्र॑वायू॒ सद॑तं ब॒र्हिरेदम्
verses.transliteration: yā́vat táras tanvò yā́vad ójo  yā́van náraś cákṣasā dī́dhyānāḥ  śúciṃ sómaṃ śucipā pātam asmé  índravāyū sádatam barhír édám

translation.text: So far as native power and strength permit you, so far as men behold whose eyes have vision, O ye pure-drinkers, drink with us pure Soma: sit on this sacred grass, Indra and Vâyu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि॒यु॒वा॒ना नि॒युतः॑ स्पा॒र्हवी॑रा॒ इन्द्र॑वायू स॒रथं॑ यातम॒र्वाक् इ॒दं हि वां॒ प्रभृ॑तं॒ मध्वो॒ अग्र॒मध॑ प्रीणा॒ना वि मु॑मुक्तम॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: niyuvānā́ niyúta spārhávīrāḥ-  índravāyū saráthaṃ yātam arvā́k  idáṃ hí vām prábhr̥tam mádhvo ágram  ádha prīṇānā́ ví mumuktam asmé

translation.text: Driving down teams that bear the lovely Heroes, hitherward, Indra-Vâyu, come together. To you this prime of savoury juice is offered: here loose your horses and be friendly-minded.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या वां॑ श॒तं नि॒युतो॒ याः स॒हस्र॒मिन्द्र॑वायू वि॒श्ववा॑राः॒ सच॑न्ते आभि॑र्यातं सुवि॒दत्रा॑भिर॒र्वाक्पा॒तं न॑रा॒ प्रति॑भृतस्य॒ मध्वः॑
verses.transliteration: yā́ vāṃ śatáṃ niyúto yā́ḥ sahásram  índravāyū viśvávārāḥ sácante  ā́bhir yātaṃ suvidátrābhir arvā́k  pātáṃ narā prátibhr̥tasya mádhvaḥ

translation.text: Your hundred and your thousand teams, O Indra and Vâyu, all-munificent, which attend you, With these most gracious-minded come ye hither, and drink, O Heroes of the meath we offer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्व॑न्तो॒ न श्रव॑सो॒ भिक्ष॑माणा इन्द्रवा॒यू सु॑ष्टु॒तिभि॒र्वसि॑ष्ठाः वा॒ज॒यन्तः॒ स्वव॑से हुवेम यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: árvanto ná śrávaso bhíkṣamāṇāḥ-  indravāyū́ suṣṭutíbhir vásiṣṭhāḥ  vājayántaḥ sv ávase huvema  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Like coursers seeking fame will we Vasishṭhas, O Indra-Vâyu, with our fair laudations, Exerting all our powe-,, call you to aid us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वा॑यो भूष शुचिपा॒ उप॑ नः स॒हस्रं॑ ते नि॒युतो॑ विश्ववार उपो॑ ते॒ अन्धो॒ मद्य॑मयामि॒ यस्य॑ देव दधि॒षे पू॑र्व॒पेय॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāyo bhūṣa śucipā úpa naḥ  sahásraṃ te niyúto viśvavāra  úpo te ándho mádyam ayāmi  yásya deva dadhiṣé pūrvapéyam

translation.text: O Vâyu, drinker of the pure, be near us: a thousand teams are thine, Allbounteous Giver. To thee the rapture-bringing juice is offered, whose first draught, God, thou takest as thy portion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सोता॑ जी॒रो अ॑ध्व॒रेष्व॑स्था॒त्सोम॒मिन्द्रा॑य वा॒यवे॒ पिब॑ध्यै प्र यद्वां॒ मध्वो॑ अग्रि॒यं भर॑न्त्यध्व॒र्यवो॑ देव॒यन्तः॒ शची॑भिः
verses.transliteration: prá sótā jīró adhvaréṣv asthāt  sómam índrāya vāyáve píbadhyai  prá yád vām mádhvo agriyám bháranti-  adhvaryávo devayántaḥ śácībhiḥ

translation.text: Prompt at the holy rites forth came the presser with Soma-draughts for Indra and for Vâyu, When ministering priests with strong devotion bring to you Twain the first taste of the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र याभि॒र्यासि॑ दा॒श्वांस॒मच्छा॑ नि॒युद्भि॑र्वायवि॒ष्टये॑ दुरो॒णे नि नो॑ र॒यिं सु॒भोज॑सं युवस्व॒ नि वी॒रं गव्य॒मश्व्यं॑ च॒ राधः॑
verses.transliteration: prá yā́bhir yā́si dāśvā́ṃsam áchā  niyúdbhir vāyav iṣṭáye duroṇé  ní no rayíṃ subhójasaṃ yuvasva  ní vīráṃ gávyam áśvyaṃ ca rā́dhaḥ

translation.text: The teams wherewith thou seekest him who offers, within his home, O Viyu, to direct him, Therewith send wealth: to us with full enjoyment, a hero son and gifts of kine and horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये वा॒यव॑ इन्द्र॒माद॑नास॒ आदे॑वासो नि॒तोश॑नासो अ॒र्यः घ्नन्तो॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सू॒रिभिः॑ ष्याम सास॒ह्वांसो॑ यु॒धा नृभि॑र॒मित्रा॑न्
verses.transliteration: yé vāyáva indramā́danāsaḥ-  ā́devāso nitóśanāso aryáḥ  ghnánto vr̥trā́ṇi sūríbhiḥ ṣyāma  sāsahvā́ṃso yudhā́ nŕ̥bhir amítrān

translation.text: Near to the Gods and making Indra joyful, devout and ofFering precious gifts to Vâyu, Allied with princes, smiting down the hostile, may we with heroes conquer foes in battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ नि॒युद्भिः॑ श॒तिनी॑भिरध्व॒रं स॑ह॒स्रिणी॑भि॒रुप॑ याहि य॒ज्ञम् वायो॑ अ॒स्मिन्त्सव॑ने मादयस्व यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: ā́ no niyúdbhiḥ śatínībhir adhvaráṃ  sahasríṇībhir úpa yāhi yajñám  vā́yo asmín sávane mādayasva  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: With thy yoked teams in hundreds and in thousands come to our sacrifice and solemn worship. Come, Vâyu, make thee glad at this libation. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शुचिं॒ नु स्तोमं॒ नव॑जातम॒द्येन्द्रा॑ग्नी वृत्रहणा जु॒षेथा॑म् उ॒भा हि वां॑ सु॒हवा॒ जोह॑वीमि॒ ता वाजं॑ स॒द्य उ॑श॒ते धेष्ठा॑
verses.transliteration: śúciṃ nú stómaṃ návajātam adyá-  -índrāgnī vr̥trahaṇā juṣéthām  ubhā́ hí vāṃ suhávā jóhavīmi  tā́ vā́jaṃ sadyá uśaté dhéṣṭhā

translation.text: SLAYERS of enemies, Indra and Agni, accept this day our new-born pure laudation. Again, again I call you prompt to listen, best to give quickly strength to him who craves it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता सा॑न॒सी श॑वसाना॒ हि भू॒तं सा॑कं॒वृधा॒ शव॑सा शूशु॒वांसा॑ क्षय॑न्तौ रा॒यो यव॑सस्य॒ भूरेः॑ पृ॒ङ्क्तं वाज॑स्य॒ स्थवि॑रस्य॒ घृष्वेः॑
verses.transliteration: tā́ sānasī́ śavasānā hí bhūtáṃ  sākaṃvŕ̥dhā śávasā śūśuvā́ṃsā  kṣáyantau rāyó yávasasya bhū́reḥ  pr̥ṅktáṃ vā́jasya sthávirasya ghŕ̥ṣveḥ

translation.text: For ye were strong to gain, exceeding mighty, growing together, waxing in your vigour. Lords of the pasture filled with ample riches, bestow upon us strength both fresh and lasting.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उपो॑ ह॒ यद्वि॒दथं॑ वा॒जिनो॒ गुर्धी॒भिर्विप्राः॒ प्रम॑तिमि॒च्छमा॑नाः अर्व॑न्तो॒ न काष्ठां॒ नक्ष॑माणा इन्द्रा॒ग्नी जोहु॑वतो॒ नर॒स्ते
verses.transliteration: úpo ha yád vidáthaṃ vājíno gúr  dhībhír víprāḥ prámatim ichámānāḥ  árvanto ná kā́ṣṭhāṃ nákṣamāṇāḥ-  indrāgnī́ jóhuvato náras té

translation.text: Yea when the strong have entered our assembly, and singers seeking with their hymns your favour, They are like steeds who come into the race-course, those men who call aloud on Indra-Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गी॒र्भिर्विप्रः॒ प्रम॑तिमि॒च्छमा॑न॒ ईट्टे॑ र॒यिं य॒शसं॑ पूर्व॒भाज॑म् इन्द्रा॑ग्नी वृत्रहणा सुवज्रा॒ प्र नो॒ नव्ये॑भिस्तिरतं दे॒ष्णैः
verses.transliteration: gīrbhír vípraḥ prámatim ichámānaḥ-  ī́ṭṭe rayíṃ yaśásam pūrvabhā́jam  índrāgnī vr̥trahaṇā suvajrā  prá no návyebhis tirataṃ deṣṇaíḥ

translation.text: The singer, seeking with his hymns your favour, begs splendid riches of their first possessor. Further us with new bounties, Indra-Agni, armed with strong thunder, slayers of the foeman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं यन्म॒ही मि॑थ॒ती स्पर्ध॑माने तनू॒रुचा॒ शूर॑साता॒ यतै॑ते अदे॑वयुं वि॒दथे॑ देव॒युभिः॑ स॒त्रा ह॑तं सोम॒सुता॒ जने॑न
verses.transliteration: sáṃ yán mahī́ mithatī́ spárdhamāne  tanūrúcā śū́rasātā yátaite  ádevayuṃ vidáthe devayúbhiḥ  satrā́ hataṃ somasútā jánena

translation.text: When two great hosts, arrayed against each other, meet clothed with brightness, in the fierce encounter Stand ye beside the godly, smite the godless; and still assist the men who press the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मामु॒ षु सोम॑सुति॒मुप॑ न॒ एन्द्रा॑ग्नी सौमन॒साय॑ यातम् नू चि॒द्धि प॑रिम॒म्नाथे॑ अ॒स्माना वां॒ शश्व॑द्भिर्ववृतीय॒ वाजैः॑
verses.transliteration: imā́m u ṣú sómasutim úpa naḥ-  éndrāgnī saumanasā́ya yātam  nū́ cid dhí parimamnā́the asmā́n  ā́ vāṃ śáśvadbhir vavr̥tīya vā́jaiḥ

translation.text: To this our Soma-pressing, Indra-Agni, come ye prepared to show your loving-kindness, For not at any time have ye despised us. So may I draw you with all strengthenings hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सो अ॑ग्न ए॒ना नम॑सा॒ समि॒द्धोऽच्छा॑ मि॒त्रं वरु॑ण॒मिन्द्रं॑ वोचेः यत्सी॒माग॑श्चकृ॒मा तत्सु मृ॑ळ॒ तद॑र्य॒मादि॑तिः शिश्रथन्तु
verses.transliteration: só agna enā́ námasā sámiddhaḥ-  -áchā mitráṃ váruṇam índraṃ voceḥ  yát sīm ā́gaś cakr̥mā́ tát sú mr̥ḷa  tád aryamā́ditiḥ śiśrathantu

translation.text: So Agni, kindled mid this adoration, invite thou Mitra, Varuṇa, and Indra. Forgive whatever sin we have committed may Aryaman and Aditi remove it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ता अ॑ग्न आशुषा॒णास॑ इ॒ष्टीर्यु॒वोः सचा॒भ्य॑श्याम॒ वाजा॑न् मेन्द्रो॑ नो॒ विष्णु॑र्म॒रुतः॒ परि॑ ख्यन्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: etā́ agna āśuṣāṇā́sa iṣṭī́r  yuvóḥ sácābhy àśyāma vā́jān  méndro no víṣṇur marútaḥ pári khyan  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: While we accelerate these our sacrifices, may we win strength from both of you, O Agni: Ne'er may the Maruts, Indra, Vishṇu slight us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं वा॑म॒स्य मन्म॑न॒ इन्द्रा॑ग्नी पू॒र्व्यस्तु॑तिः अ॒भ्राद्वृ॒ष्टिरि॑वाजनि
verses.transliteration: iyáṃ vām asyá mánmanaḥ-  índrāgnī pūrvyástutiḥ  abhrā́d vr̥ṣṭír ivājani

translation.text: As rain from out the cloud, for you, Indra and Agni, from my soul This noblest praise hath been produced.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शृ॒णु॒तं ज॑रि॒तुर्हव॒मिन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ वन॑तं॒ गिरः॑ ई॒शा॒ना पि॑प्यतं॒ धियः॑
verses.transliteration: śr̥ṇutáṃ jaritúr hávam  índrāgnī vánataṃ gíraḥ  īśānā́ pipyataṃ dhíyaḥ

translation.text: Do ye, O Indra-Agni, hear the singer's call: accept his songs. Ye Rulers, grant his heart's desire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा पा॑प॒त्वाय॑ नो न॒रेन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ माभिश॑स्तये मा नो॑ रीरधतं नि॒दे
verses.transliteration: mā́ pāpatvā́ya no narā-  -índrāgnī mā́bhíśastaye  mā́ no rīradhataṃ nidé

translation.text: Give us not up to poverty, ye Heroes, Indra-Agni, nor To slander and reproach of men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रे॑ अ॒ग्ना नमो॑ बृ॒हत्सु॑वृ॒क्तिमेर॑यामहे धि॒या धेना॑ अव॒स्यवः॑
verses.transliteration: índre agnā́ námo br̥hát  suvr̥ktím érayāmahe  dhiyā́ dhénā avasyávaḥ

translation.text: To Indra and to Agni we bring reverence, high and holy hymn, And, craving help, softwords with prayer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता हि शश्व॑न्त॒ ईळ॑त इ॒त्था विप्रा॑स ऊ॒तये॑ स॒बाधो॒ वाज॑सातये
verses.transliteration: tā́ hí śáśvanta ī́ḷate  itthā́ víprāsa ūtáye  sabā́dho vā́jasātaye

translation.text: For all these holy singers here implore these Twain to succour them, And priests that they may win them strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता वां॑ गी॒र्भिर्वि॑प॒न्यवः॒ प्रय॑स्वन्तो हवामहे मे॒धसा॑ता सनि॒ष्यवः॑
verses.transliteration: tā́ vāṃ gīrbhír vipanyávaḥ  práyasvanto havāmahe  medhásātā saniṣyávaḥ

translation.text: Eager to laudyou, we with songs invoke you, bearing sacred food, Fain for success in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ अव॒सा ग॑तम॒स्मभ्यं॑ चर्षणीसहा मा नो॑ दुः॒शंस॑ ईशत
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī ávasā́ gatam  asmábhyaṃ carṣaṇīsahā  mā́ no duḥśáṃsa īśata

translation.text: Indra and Agni, come to us with favour, ye who conquer men: Let not the wicked master us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा कस्य॑ नो॒ अर॑रुषो धू॒र्तिः प्रण॒ङ्मर्त्य॑स्य इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ शर्म॑ यच्छतम्
verses.transliteration: mā́ kásya no áraruṣo  dhūrtíḥ práṇaṅ mártyasya  índrāgnī śárma yachatam

translation.text: At no time let the injurious blow of hostile mortal fall on us: O Indra-Agni, shelter us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गोम॒द्धिर॑ण्यव॒द्वसु॒ यद्वा॒मश्वा॑व॒दीम॑हे इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ तद्व॑नेमहि
verses.transliteration: gómad dhíraṇyavad vásu  yád vām áśvāvad ī́mahe  índrāgnī tád vanemahi

translation.text: Whatever wealth we crave of you, in gold, in cattle, or in steeds, That, Indra-Agni, let us gain;

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्सोम॒ आ सु॒ते नर॑ इन्द्रा॒ग्नी अजो॑हवुः सप्ती॑वन्ता सप॒र्यवः॑
verses.transliteration: yát sóma ā́ suté náraḥ-  indrāgnī́ ájohavuḥ  sáptīvantā saparyávaḥ

translation.text: When heroes prompt in worship call Indra and Agni, Lords of steeds, Beside the Soma juice effused.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒क्थेभि॑र्वृत्र॒हन्त॑मा॒ या म॑न्दा॒ना चि॒दा गि॒रा आ॒ङ्गू॒षैरा॒विवा॑सतः
verses.transliteration: ukthébhir vr̥trahántamā  yā́ mandānā́ cid ā́ girā́  āṅgūṣaír āvívāsataḥ

translation.text: Call hither with the song and lauds those who best slay the foemen, those Who take delight in hymns of praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ताविद्दुः॒शंसं॒ मर्त्यं॒ दुर्वि॑द्वांसं रक्ष॒स्विन॑म् आ॒भो॒गं हन्म॑ना हतमुद॒धिं हन्म॑ना हतम्
verses.transliteration: tā́v íd duḥśáṃsam mártyaṃ  dúrvidvāṃsaṃ rakṣasvínam  ābhogáṃ hánmanā hatam  udadhíṃ hánmanā hatam

translation.text: Slay ye the wicked man whose thought is evil of the demon kind. Slay him who stays the waters, slay the Serpent with your deadly dart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र क्षोद॑सा॒ धाय॑सा सस्र ए॒षा सर॑स्वती ध॒रुण॒माय॑सी॒ पूः प्र॒बाब॑धाना र॒थ्ये॑व याति॒ विश्वा॑ अ॒पो म॑हि॒ना सिन्धु॑र॒न्याः
verses.transliteration: prá kṣódasā dhā́yasā sasra eṣā́  sárasvatī dharúṇam ā́yasī pū́ḥ  prabā́badhānā rathyèva yāti  víśvā apó mahinā́ síndhur anyā́ḥ

translation.text: THIS stream Sarasvatî with fostering current comes forth, our sure defence, our fort of iron. As on a car, the flood flows on, surpassing in majesty and might all other waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एका॑चेत॒त्सर॑स्वती न॒दीनां॒ शुचि॑र्य॒ती गि॒रिभ्य॒ आ स॑मु॒द्रात् रा॒यश्चेत॑न्ती॒ भुव॑नस्य॒ भूरे॑र्घृ॒तं पयो॑ दुदुहे॒ नाहु॑षाय
verses.transliteration: ékācetat sárasvatī nadī́nāṃ  śúcir yatī́ giríbhya ā́ samudrā́t  rāyáś cétantī bhúvanasya bhū́rer  ghr̥tám páyo duduhe nā́huṣāya

translation.text: Pure in her course from mountains to the ocean, alone of streams Sarasvatî hath listened. Thinking of wealth and the great world of creatures, she poured for Nahusha her milk and fatness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वा॑वृधे॒ नर्यो॒ योष॑णासु॒ वृषा॒ शिशु॑र्वृष॒भो य॒ज्ञिया॑सु स वा॒जिनं॑ म॒घव॑द्भ्यो दधाति॒ वि सा॒तये॑ त॒न्वं॑ मामृजीत
verses.transliteration: sá vāvr̥dhe náryo yóṣaṇāsu  vŕ̥ṣā śíśur vr̥ṣabhó yajñíyāsu  sá vājínam maghávadbhyo dadhāti  ví sātáye tanvàm māmr̥jīta

translation.text: Friendly to man he grew among the women, a strong young Steer amid the Holy Ladies. He gives the fleet steed to our wealthy princes, and decks their bodies for success in battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्या नः॒ सर॑स्वती जुषा॒णोप॑ श्रवत्सु॒भगा॑ य॒ज्णे अ॒स्मिन् मि॒तज्ञु॑भिर्नम॒स्यै॑रिया॒ना रा॒या यु॒जा चि॒दुत्त॑रा॒ सखि॑भ्यः
verses.transliteration: utá syā́ naḥ sárasvatī juṣāṇā́-  -úpa śravat subhágā yajñé asmín  mitájñubhir namasyaìr iyānā́  rāyā́ yujā́ cid úttarā sákhibhyaḥ

translation.text: May this Sarasvatî be pleased and listen at this our sacrifice, auspicious Lady, When we with reverence, on our knees, implore her close-knit to wealth, most kind to those she loveth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा जुह्वा॑ना यु॒ष्मदा नमो॑भिः॒ प्रति॒ स्तोमं॑ सरस्वति जुषस्व तव॒ शर्म॑न्प्रि॒यत॑मे॒ दधा॑ना॒ उप॑ स्थेयाम शर॒णं न वृ॒क्षम्
verses.transliteration: imā́ júhvānā yuṣmád ā́ námobhiḥ  práti stómaṃ sarasvati juṣasva  táva śárman priyátame dádhānāḥ-  úpa stheyāma śaraṇáṃ ná vr̥kṣám

translation.text: These offerings have ye made with adoration: say this, Sarasvatî, and accept our praises; And, placing us under thy dear protection, may we approach thee, as a tree, for shelter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यमु॑ ते सरस्वति॒ वसि॑ष्ठो॒ द्वारा॑वृ॒तस्य॑ सुभगे॒ व्या॑वः वर्ध॑ शुभ्रे स्तुव॒ते रा॑सि॒ वाजा॑न्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: ayám u te sarasvati vásiṣṭho  dvā́rāv r̥tásya subhage vy ā̀vaḥ  várdha śubhre stuvaté rāsi vā́jān  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: For thee, O Blest Sarasvatî, Vasishṭha hath here unbarred the doors d sacred Order. Wax, Bright One, and give strength to him who lauds thee. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृ॒हदु॑ गायिषे॒ वचो॑ऽसु॒र्या॑ न॒दीना॑म् सर॑स्वती॒मिन्म॑हया सुवृ॒क्तिभिः॒ स्तोमै॑र्वसिष्ठ॒ रोद॑सी
verses.transliteration: br̥hád u gāyiṣe váco  -asuryā̀ nadī́nām  sárasvatīm ín mahayā suvr̥ktíbhiḥ-  stómair vasiṣṭha ródasī

translation.text: I SING a lofty song, for she is mightiest, most divine of Streams. Sarasvatî will I exalt with hymns and lauds, and, O Vasishṭha, Heaven and Earth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भे यत्ते॑ महि॒ना शु॑भ्रे॒ अन्ध॑सी अधिक्षि॒यन्ति॑ पू॒रवः॑ सा नो॑ बोध्यवि॒त्री म॒रुत्स॑खा॒ चोद॒ राधो॑ म॒घोना॑म्
verses.transliteration: ubhé yát te mahinā́ śubhre ándhasī  adhikṣiyánti pūrávaḥ  sā́ no bodhy avitrī́ marútsakhā  códa rā́dho maghónām

translation.text: When in the fulness of their strength the Pûrus dwell, Beauteous One, on thy two grassy banks, Favour us thou who hast the Maruts for thy friends: stir up the bounty of our chiefs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भ॒द्रमिद्भ॒द्रा कृ॑णव॒त्सर॑स्व॒त्यक॑वारी चेतति वा॒जिनी॑वती गृ॒णा॒ना ज॑मदग्नि॒वत्स्तु॑वा॒ना च॑ वसिष्ठ॒वत्
verses.transliteration: bhadrám íd bhadrā́ kr̥ṇavat sárasvatī-  ákavārī cetati vājínīvatī  gr̥ṇānā́ jamadagnivát  stuvānā́ ca vasiṣṭhavát

translation.text: So may Sarasvatî auspicious send good luck; she, rich in spoil, is never niggardly in thought, When praised in jamadagni's way and lauded as Vasishṭha lauds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज॒नी॒यन्तो॒ न्वग्र॑वः पुत्री॒यन्तः॑ सु॒दान॑वः सर॑स्वन्तं हवामहे
verses.transliteration: janīyánto nv ágravaḥ  putrīyántaḥ sudā́navaḥ  sárasvantaṃ havāmahe

translation.text: We call upon Sarasvan, as unmarried men who long for wives, As liberal men who yearn for sons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये ते॑ सरस्व ऊ॒र्मयो॒ मधु॑मन्तो घृत॒श्चुतः॑ तेभि॑र्नोऽवि॒ता भ॑व
verses.transliteration: yé te sarasva ūrmáyo  mádhumanto ghr̥taścútaḥ  tébhir no 'vitā́ bhava

translation.text: Be thou our kind protector, O Sarasvan, with those waves of thine Laden with sweets and dropping oil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पी॒पि॒वांसं॒ सर॑स्वतः॒ स्तनं॒ यो वि॒श्वद॑र्शतः भ॒क्षी॒महि॑ प्र॒जामिष॑म्
verses.transliteration: pīpivā́ṃsaṃ sárasvataḥ-  stánaṃ yó viśvádarśataḥ  bhakṣīmáhi prajā́m íṣam

translation.text: May we enjoy Sarasvan's breast, all-beautiful, that swells with streams, May we gain food and progeny.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञे दि॒वो नृ॒षद॑ने पृथि॒व्या नरो॒ यत्र॑ देव॒यवो॒ मद॑न्ति इन्द्रा॑य॒ यत्र॒ सव॑नानि सु॒न्वे गम॒न्मदा॑य प्रथ॒मं वय॑श्च
verses.transliteration: yajñé divó nr̥ṣádane pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  náro yátra devayávo mádanti  índrāya yátra sávanāni sunvé  gáman mádāya prathamáṃ váyaś ca

translation.text: WHERE Heaven and Earth combine in men's assembly, and ttose who love the Gods delight in worship, Where the libations are effused for Indra, may he come first to drink and make him stronger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ दैव्या॑ वृणीम॒हेऽवां॑सि॒ बृह॒स्पति॑र्नो मह॒ आ स॑खायः यथा॒ भवे॑म मी॒ळ्हुषे॒ अना॑गा॒ यो नो॑ दा॒ता प॑रा॒वतः॑ पि॒तेव॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ daívyā vr̥ṇīmahé 'vāṃsi  bŕ̥haspátir no maha ā́ sakhāyaḥ  yáthā bhávema mīḷhúṣe ánāgāḥ-  yó no dātā́ parāvátaḥ pitéva

translation.text: We crave the heavenly grace of Gods to guard us-so may Br̥ihaspati, O friends, exalt us- That he, the Bounteous God, may find us sintess, who giveth from a distance like a father.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॒ ज्येष्ठं॒ नम॑सा ह॒विर्भिः॑ सु॒शेवं॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिं॑ गृणीषे इन्द्रं॒ श्लोको॒ महि॒ दैव्यः॑ सिषक्तु॒ यो ब्रह्म॑णो दे॒वकृ॑तस्य॒ राजा॑
verses.transliteration: tám u jyéṣṭhaṃ námasā havírbhiḥ  suśévam bráhmaṇas pátiṃ gr̥ṇīṣe  índraṃ ślóko máhi daívyaḥ siṣaktu  yó bráhmaṇo devákr̥tasya rā́jā

translation.text: That Brahmaṇaspati, most High and Gracious, I glorify with offerings and with homage. May the great song of praise divine, reach Indra who is the King of prayer the Gods' creation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स आ नो॒ योनिं॑ सदतु॒ प्रेष्ठो॒ बृह॒स्पति॑र्वि॒श्ववा॑रो॒ यो अस्ति॑ कामो॑ रा॒यः सु॒वीर्य॑स्य॒ तं दा॒त्पर्ष॑न्नो॒ अति॑ स॒श्चतो॒ अरि॑ष्टान्
verses.transliteration: sá ā́ no yóniṃ sadatu préṣṭho  bŕ̥haspátir viśvávāro yó ásti  kā́mo rāyáḥ suvī́ryasya táṃ dāt  párṣan no áti saścáto áriṣṭān

translation.text: May that Br̥ihaspati who brings all blessings, most dearly loved, be seated by our altar. Heroes and wealth we crave; may he bestow them, and bear us safe beyond the men who vex us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमा नो॑ अ॒र्कम॒मृता॑य॒ जुष्ट॑मि॒मे धा॑सुर॒मृता॑सः पुरा॒जाः शुचि॑क्रन्दं यज॒तं प॒स्त्या॑नां॒ बृह॒स्पति॑मन॒र्वाणं॑ हुवेम
verses.transliteration: tám ā́ no arkám amŕ̥tāya júṣṭam  imé dhāsur amŕ̥tāsaḥ purājā́ḥ  śúcikrandaṃ yajatám pastyā̀nām  bŕ̥haspátim anarvā́ṇaṃ huvema

translation.text: To us these Deathless Ones, erst born, have granted this laud of ours which gives the Immortal pleasure. Let us invoke Br̥ihaspati, the foeless, the clear-voiced God, the Holy One of households

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं श॒ग्मासो॑ अरु॒षासो॒ अश्वा॒ बृह॒स्पतिं॑ सह॒वाहो॑ वहन्ति सह॑श्चि॒द्यस्य॒ नील॑वत्स॒धस्थं॒ नभो॒ न रू॒पम॑रु॒षं वसा॑नाः
verses.transliteration: táṃ śagmā́so aruṣā́so áśvāḥ-  bŕ̥haspátiṃ sahavā́ho vahanti  sáhaś cid yásya nī́lavat sadhásthaṃ  nábho ná rūpám aruṣáṃ vásānāḥ

translation.text: Him, this Br̥ihaspati, his red-hued horses, drawing together, full of strength, bring hither. Robed in red colour like the cloud, they carry the Lord of Might whose friendship gives a dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि शुचिः॑ श॒तप॑त्रः॒ स शु॒न्ध्युर्हिर॑ण्यवाशीरिषि॒रः स्व॒र्षाः बृह॒स्पतिः॒ स स्वा॑वे॒श ऋ॒ष्वः पु॒रू सखि॑भ्य आसु॒तिं करि॑ष्ठः
verses.transliteration: sá hí śúciḥ śatápatraḥ sá śundhyúr  híraṇyavāśīr iṣiráḥ svarṣā́ḥ  bŕ̥haspátiḥ sá svāveśá r̥ṣváḥ  purū́ sákhibhya āsutíṃ káriṣṭhaḥ

translation.text: For he is pure, with hundred wings, refulgent, with sword of gold, impetuous, winning sunlight. Sublime Br̥ihaspati, easy of access granteth his friends most bountiful refreshment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वी दे॒वस्य॒ रोद॑सी॒ जनि॑त्री॒ बृह॒स्पतिं॑ वावृधतुर्महि॒त्वा द॒क्षाय्या॑य दक्षता सखायः॒ कर॒द्ब्रह्म॑णे सु॒तरा॑ सुगा॒धा
verses.transliteration: devī́ devásya ródasī jánitrī  bŕ̥haspátiṃ vāvr̥dhatur mahitvā́  dakṣā́yyāya dakṣatā sakhāyaḥ  kárad bráhmaṇe sutárā sugādhā́

translation.text: Both Heaven and Earth, divine, the Deity's Parents, have made Br̥ihaspati increase in grandeur. Glorify him, O friends, who merits glory: may he give prayer fair way and easy passage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं वां॑ ब्रह्मणस्पते सुवृ॒क्तिर्ब्रह्मेन्द्रा॑य व॒ज्रिणे॑ अकारि अ॒वि॒ष्टं धियो॑ जिगृ॒तं पुरं॑धीर्जज॒स्तम॒र्यो व॒नुषा॒मरा॑तीः
verses.transliteration: iyáṃ vām brahmaṇas pate suvr̥ktír  bráhméndrāya vajríṇe akāri  aviṣṭáṃ dhíyo jigr̥tám púraṃdhīr  jajastám aryó vanúṣām árātīḥ

translation.text: This, Brahmaṇaspati, is your laudation prayer hath been made to thunderwielding Indra. Favour our songs, wake up our thought and spirit: destroy the godless and our foemen's malice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॑स्पते यु॒वमिन्द्र॑श्च॒ वस्वो॑ दि॒व्यस्ये॑शाथे उ॒त पार्थि॑वस्य ध॒त्तं र॒यिं स्तु॑व॒ते की॒रये॑ चिद्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspate yuvám índraś ca vásvo  divyásyeśāthe utá pā́rthivasya  dhattáṃ rayíṃ stuvaté kīráye cid  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Ye Twain are Lords of wealth in earth and heaven, thou, O Br̥ihaspati, and thou, O Indra. Mean though he be, give wealth to him who lauds you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यवोऽरु॒णं दु॒ग्धमं॒शुं जु॒होत॑न वृष॒भाय॑ क्षिती॒नाम् गौ॒राद्वेदी॑याँ अव॒पान॒मिन्द्रो॑ वि॒श्वाहेद्या॑ति सु॒तसो॑ममि॒च्छन्
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryavo 'ruṇáṃ dugdhám aṃśúṃ  juhótana vr̥ṣabhā́ya kṣitīnā́m  gaurā́d védīyām̐ avapā́nam índro  viśvā́héd yāti sutásomam ichán

translation.text: PRIESTS, offer to the Lord of all the people the milked-out stalk of Soma, radiant-coloured. No wild-bull knows his drinking-place like Indra who ever seeks him who hath pressed the Soma,

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्द॑धि॒षे प्र॒दिवि॒ चार्वन्नं॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे पी॒तिमिद॑स्य वक्षि उ॒त हृ॒दोत मन॑सा जुषा॒ण उ॒शन्नि॑न्द्र॒ प्रस्थि॑तान्पाहि॒ सोमा॑न्
verses.transliteration: yád dadhiṣé pradívi cā́rv ánnaṃ  divé-dive pītím íd asya vakṣi  utá hr̥dótá mánasā juṣāṇáḥ-  uśánn indra prásthitān pāhi sómān

translation.text: Thou dost desire to drink, each day that passes, the pleasant food which thou hast had aforetime, O Indra, gratified in heart and spirit, drink eagerly the Soma set before thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज॒ज्ञा॒नः सोमं॒ सह॑से पपाथ॒ प्र ते॑ मा॒ता म॑हि॒मान॑मुवाच एन्द्र॑ पप्राथो॒र्व१॒॑न्तरि॑क्षं यु॒धा दे॒वेभ्यो॒ वरि॑वश्चकर्थ
verses.transliteration: jajñānáḥ sómaṃ sáhase papātha  prá te mātā́ mahimā́nam uvāca  éndra paprāthorv àntárikṣaṃ  yudhā́ devébhyo várivaś cakartha

translation.text: Thou, newly-born, for strength didst drink the Soma; the Mother told thee of thy future greatness. O Indra, thou hast filled mid-air's wide region, and given the Gods by battle room and freedom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्यो॒धया॑ मह॒तो मन्य॑माना॒न्त्साक्षा॑म॒ तान्बा॒हुभिः॒ शाश॑दानान् यद्वा॒ नृभि॒र्वृत॑ इन्द्राभि॒युध्या॒स्तं त्वया॒जिं सौ॑श्रव॒सं ज॑येम
verses.transliteration: yád yodháyā maható mányamānān  sā́kṣāma tā́n bāhúbhiḥ śā́śadānān  yád vā nŕ̥bhir vŕ̥ta indrābhiyúdhyās  táṃ tváyājíṃ sauśravasáṃ jayema

translation.text: When thou hast urged the arrocrant to combat, proud in their strength of arm, we will subdue them. Or, Indra, when thou fightest girt by heroes, we in the glorious fray with thee will conquer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रेन्द्र॑स्य वोचं प्रथ॒मा कृ॒तानि॒ प्र नूत॑ना म॒घवा॒ या च॒कार॑ य॒देददे॑वी॒रस॑हिष्ट मा॒या अथा॑भव॒त्केव॑लः॒ सोमो॑ अस्य
verses.transliteration: préndrasya vocam prathamā́ kr̥tā́ni  prá nū́tanā maghávā yā́ cakā́ra  yadéd ádevīr ásahiṣṭa māyā́ḥ-  áthābhavat kévalaḥ sómo asya

translation.text: I will declare the earliest deeds of Indra, and recent acts which Maghavan hath accomplished. When he had conquered godless wiles and magic, Soma became his own entire possession.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तवे॒दं विश्व॑म॒भितः॑ पश॒व्यं१॒॑ यत्पश्य॑सि॒ चक्ष॑सा॒ सूर्य॑स्य गवा॑मसि॒ गोप॑ति॒रेक॑ इन्द्र भक्षी॒महि॑ ते॒ प्रय॑तस्य॒ वस्वः॑
verses.transliteration: távedáṃ víśvam abhítaḥ paśavyàṃ  yát páśyasi cákṣasā sū́ryasya  gávām asi gópatir éka indra  bhakṣīmáhi te práyatasya vásvaḥ

translation.text: Thine is this world of flocks and herds around thee, which with the eye of Sûrya thou beholdest. Thou, Indra, art alone the Lord of cattle; may we enjoy the treasure which thou givest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॑स्पते यु॒वमिन्द्र॑श्च॒ वस्वो॑ दि॒व्यस्ये॑शाथे उ॒त पार्थि॑वस्य ध॒त्तं र॒यिं स्तु॑व॒ते की॒रये॑ चिद्यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspate yuvám índraś ca vásvo  divyásyeśāthe utá pā́rthivasya  dhattáṃ rayíṃ stuvaté kīráye cid  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Ye Twain are Lords of wealth in earth and heaven, thou, O Br̥ihaspati, and thou, O Indra. Mean though he be, give wealth to him who lauds you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒रो मात्र॑या त॒न्वा॑ वृधान॒ न ते॑ महि॒त्वमन्व॑श्नुवन्ति उ॒भे ते॑ विद्म॒ रज॑सी पृथि॒व्या विष्णो॑ देव॒ त्वं प॑र॒मस्य॑ वित्से
verses.transliteration: paró mā́trayā tanvā̀ vr̥dhāna  ná te mahitvám ánv aśnuvanti  ubhé te vidma rájasī pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  víṣṇo deva tvám paramásya vitse

translation.text: MEN come not nigh thy majesty who growest beyond all bound and measure with thy body. Both thy two regions of the earth, O Vishṇu, we know: thou God, knowest the highest also.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न ते॑ विष्णो॒ जाय॑मानो॒ न जा॒तो देव॑ महि॒म्नः पर॒मन्त॑माप उद॑स्तभ्ना॒ नाक॑मृ॒ष्वं बृ॒हन्तं॑ दा॒धर्थ॒ प्राचीं॑ क॒कुभं॑ पृथि॒व्याः
verses.transliteration: ná te viṣṇo jā́yamāno ná jātó  déva mahimnáḥ páram ántam āpa  úd astabhnā nā́kam r̥ṣvám br̥hántaṃ  dādhártha prā́cīṃ kakúbham pr̥thivyā́ḥ

translation.text: None who is born or being born, God Vishṇu, hath reached the utmost limit of thy grandeur. The vast high vault of heaven hast thou supported, and fixed earth's eastern pinnacle securely.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इरा॑वती धेनु॒मती॒ हि भू॒तं सू॑यव॒सिनी॒ मनु॑षे दश॒स्या व्य॑स्तभ्ना॒ रोद॑सी विष्णवे॒ते दा॒धर्थ॑ पृथि॒वीम॒भितो॑ म॒यूखैः॑
verses.transliteration: írāvatī dhenumátī hí bhūtáṃ  sūyavasínī mánuṣe daśasyā́  vy àstabhnā ródasī viṣṇav eté  dādhártha pr̥thivī́m abhíto mayū́khaiḥ

translation.text: Rich in sweet food be ye, and rich in milch-kine, with fertile pastures, fain to do men service. Both these worlds, Vishṇu, hast thou stayed asunder, and firmly fixed the earth with pegs around it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रुं य॒ज्ञाय॑ चक्रथुरु लो॒कं ज॒नय॑न्ता॒ सूर्य॑मु॒षास॑म॒ग्निम् दास॑स्य चिद्वृषशि॒प्रस्य॑ मा॒या ज॒घ्नथु॑र्नरा पृत॒नाज्ये॑षु
verses.transliteration: -urúṃ yajñā́ya cakrathur ulokám  janáyantā sū́ryam uṣā́sam agním  dā́sasya cid vr̥ṣaśiprásya māyā́ḥ-  jaghnáthur narā pr̥tanā́jyeṣu

translation.text: Ye have made spacious room for sacrificing by generating Sûrya, Dawn, and Agni. O Heroes, ye have conquered in your battles even the bull-jawed Dâsa's wiles and magic.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑विष्णू दृंहि॒ताः शम्ब॑रस्य॒ नव॒ पुरो॑ नव॒तिं च॑ श्नथिष्टम् श॒तं व॒र्चिनः॑ स॒हस्रं॑ च सा॒कं ह॒थो अ॑प्र॒त्यसु॑रस्य वी॒रान्
verses.transliteration: índrāviṣṇū dr̥ṃhitā́ḥ śámbarasya  náva púro navatíṃ ca śnathiṣṭam  śatáṃ varcínaḥ sahásraṃ ca sākáṃ  hathó apraty ásurasya vīrā́n

translation.text: Ye have destroyed, thou, Indra, and thou Vishṇu, Ṣambara's nine-and-ninety fenced castles. Ye Twain smote down a hundred times a thousand resistless heroes of the royal Varcin.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं म॑नी॒षा बृ॑ह॒ती बृ॒हन्तो॑रुक्र॒मा त॒वसा॑ व॒र्धय॑न्ती र॒रे वां॒ स्तोमं॑ वि॒दथे॑षु विष्णो॒ पिन्व॑त॒मिषो॑ वृ॒जने॑ष्विन्द्र
verses.transliteration: iyám manīṣā́ br̥hatī́ br̥hántā-  -urukramā́ tavásā vardháyantī  raré vāṃ stómaṃ vidátheṣu viṣṇo  pínvatam íṣo vr̥jáneṣv indra

translation.text: This is the lofty hymn of praise, exalting the Lords of Mighty Stride, the strong and lofty. I laud you in the solemn synods, Vishṇu: pour ye food on us in our camps, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वष॑ट् ते विष्णवा॒स आ कृ॑णोमि॒ तन्मे॑ जुषस्व शिपिविष्ट ह॒व्यम् वर्ध॑न्तु त्वा सुष्टु॒तयो॒ गिरो॑ मे यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: váṣaṭ te viṣṇav āsá ā́ kr̥ṇomi  tán me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyám  várdhantu tvā suṣṭutáyo gíro me  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: O Vishṇu, unto thee my lips cry Vashaṭ! Let this mine offering, Ṣipivishṭa, please thee. May these my songs of eulogy exalt thee. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू मर्तो॑ दयते सनि॒ष्यन्यो विष्ण॑व उरुगा॒याय॒ दाश॑त् प्र यः स॒त्राचा॒ मन॑सा॒ यजा॑त ए॒ताव॑न्तं॒ नर्य॑मा॒विवा॑सात्
verses.transliteration: nū́ márto dayate saniṣyán  yó víṣṇava urugāyā́ya dā́śat  prá yáḥ satrā́cā mánasā yájāte-  etā́vantaṃ náryam āvívāsāt

translation.text: NE'ER doth the man repent, who, seeking profit, bringeth his gift to the far-striding Vishṇu. He who adoreth him with all his spirit winneth himself so great a benefactor.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं वि॑ष्णो सुम॒तिं वि॒श्वज॑न्या॒मप्र॑युतामेवयावो म॒तिं दाः॑ पर्चो॒ यथा॑ नः सुवि॒तस्य॒ भूरे॒रश्वा॑वतः पुरुश्च॒न्द्रस्य॑ रा॒यः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ viṣṇo sumatíṃ viśvájanyām  áprayutām evayāvo matíṃ dāḥ  párco yáthā naḥ suvitásya bhū́rer  áśvāvataḥ puruścandrásya rāyáḥ

translation.text: Thou, Vishṇu, constant in thy courses, gavest good-will to all men, and a hymn that lasteth, That thou mightst move us to abundant comfort of very splendid wealth with store of horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिर्दे॒वः पृ॑थि॒वीमे॒ष ए॒तां वि च॑क्रमे श॒तर्च॑सं महि॒त्वा प्र विष्णु॑रस्तु त॒वस॒स्तवी॑यान्त्वे॒षं ह्य॑स्य॒ स्थवि॑रस्य॒ नाम॑
verses.transliteration: trír deváḥ pr̥thivī́m eṣá etā́ṃ  ví cakrame śatárcasam mahitvā́  prá víṣṇur astu tavásas távīyān  tveṣáṃ hy àsya sthávirasya nā́ma

translation.text: Three times strode forth this God in all his grandeur over this earth bright with a hundred splendours. Foremost be Vishṇu, stronger than the strongest: for glorious is his name who lives for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि च॑क्रमे पृथि॒वीमे॒ष ए॒तां क्षेत्रा॑य॒ विष्णु॒र्मनु॑षे दश॒स्यन् ध्रु॒वासो॑ अस्य की॒रयो॒ जना॑स उरुक्षि॒तिं सु॒जनि॑मा चकार
verses.transliteration: ví cakrame pr̥thivī́m eṣá etā́ṃ  kṣétrāya víṣṇur mánuṣe daśasyán  dhruvā́so asya kīráyo jánāsaḥ-  urukṣitíṃ sujánimā cakāra

translation.text: Over this earth with mighty step strode Vishṇu, ready to give it for a home to Manu. In him the humble people trust for safety: he, nobly born, hath made them spacious dwellings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र तत्ते॑ अ॒द्य शि॑पिविष्ट॒ नामा॒र्यः शं॑सामि व॒युना॑नि वि॒द्वान् तं त्वा॑ गृणामि त॒वस॒मत॑व्या॒न्क्षय॑न्तम॒स्य रज॑सः परा॒के
verses.transliteration: prá tát te adyá śipiviṣṭa nā́ma-  -aryáḥ śaṃsāmi vayúnāni vidvā́n  táṃ tvā gr̥ṇāmi tavásam átavyān  kṣáyantam asyá rájasaḥ parāké

translation.text: To-day I laud this name, O Ṣipivishṭa, I, skilled in rules, the name of thee the Noble. Yea, I the poor and weak praise thee the Mighty who dwellest in the realm beyond this region.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किमित्ते॑ विष्णो परि॒चक्ष्यं॑ भू॒त्प्र यद्व॑व॒क्षे शि॑पिवि॒ष्टो अ॑स्मि मा वर्पो॑ अ॒स्मदप॑ गूह ए॒तद्यद॒न्यरू॑पः समि॒थे ब॒भूथ॑
verses.transliteration: kím ít te viṣṇo paricákṣyam bhūt  prá yád vavakṣé śipiviṣṭó asmi  mā́ várpo asmád ápa gūha etád  yád anyárūpaḥ samithé babhū́tha

translation.text: What was there to be blamed in thee, O Vishṇu, when thou declaredst, I am Ṣipivishṭa? Hide not this form from us, nor keep it secret, since thou didst wear another shape in battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वष॑ट् ते विष्णवा॒स आ कृ॑णोमि॒ तन्मे॑ जुषस्व शिपिविष्ट ह॒व्यम् वर्ध॑न्तु त्वा सुष्टु॒तयो॒ गिरो॑ मे यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: váṣaṭ te viṣṇav āsá ā́ kr̥ṇomi  tán me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyám  várdhantu tvā suṣṭutáyo gíro me  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: O Vishṇu, unto thee my lips cry Vashaṭ! Let this mine offering, Ṣipivishṭa, please thee. May these my songs of eulogy exalt thee. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ति॒स्रो वाचः॒ प्र व॑द॒ ज्योति॑रग्रा॒ या ए॒तद्दु॒ह्रे म॑धुदो॒घमूधः॑ स व॒त्सं कृ॒ण्वन्गर्भ॒मोष॑धीनां स॒द्यो जा॒तो वृ॑ष॒भो रो॑रवीति
verses.transliteration: tisró vā́caḥ prá vada jyótiragrāḥ-  yā́ etád duhré madhudoghám ū́dhaḥ  sá vatsáṃ kr̥ṇván gárbham óṣadhīnāṃ  sadyó jātó vr̥ṣabhó roravīti

translation.text: SPEAK forth three words, the words which light precedeth, which milk this udder that produceth nectar. Quickly made manifest, the Bull hath bellowed, engendering the germ of plants, the Infant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वर्ध॑न॒ ओष॑धीनां॒ यो अ॒पां यो विश्व॑स्य॒ जग॑तो दे॒व ईशे॑ स त्रि॒धातु॑ शर॒णं शर्म॑ यंसत्त्रि॒वर्तु॒ ज्योतिः॑ स्वभि॒ष्ट्य१॒॑स्मे
verses.transliteration: yó várdhana óṣadhīnāṃ yó apā́ṃ  yó víśvasya jágato devá ī́śe  sá tridhā́tu śaraṇáṃ śárma yaṃsat  trivártu jyótiḥ svabhiṣṭy àsmé

translation.text: Giver of growth to plants, the God who ruleth over the waters and all moving creatures, Vouchsafe us triple shelter for our refuge, and threefold light to succour and befriend us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्त॒रीरु॑ त्व॒द्भव॑ति॒ सूत॑ उ त्वद्यथाव॒शं त॒न्वं॑ चक्र ए॒षः पि॒तुः पयः॒ प्रति॑ गृभ्णाति मा॒ता तेन॑ पि॒ता व॑र्धते॒ तेन॑ पु॒त्रः
verses.transliteration: starī́r u tvad bhávati sū́ta u tvad  yathāvaśáṃ tanvàṃ cakra eṣáḥ  pitúḥ páyaḥ práti gr̥bhṇāti mātā́  téna pitā́ vardhate téna putráḥ

translation.text: Now he is sterile, now begetteth offspring, even as he willeth doth he change his figure. The Father's genial flow bedews the Mother; therewith the Sire, therewith the son is nourished.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मि॒न्विश्वा॑नि॒ भुव॑नानि त॒स्थुस्ति॒स्रो द्याव॑स्त्रे॒धा स॒स्रुरापः॑ त्रयः॒ कोशा॑स उप॒सेच॑नासो॒ मध्वः॑ श्चोतन्त्य॒भितो॑ विर॒प्शम्
verses.transliteration: yásmin víśvāni bhúvanāni tasthús  tisró dyā́vas tredhā́ sasrúr ā́paḥ  tráyaḥ kóśāsa upasécanāso  mádhva ścotanty abhíto virapśám

translation.text: In him all living creatures have their being, and the three heavens with triplyflowing waters. Three reservoirs that sprinkle down their treasure shed their sweet streams around him with a murmur.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं वचः॑ प॒र्जन्या॑य स्व॒राजे॑ हृ॒दो अ॒स्त्वन्त॑रं॒ तज्जु॑जोषत् म॒यो॒भुवो॑ वृ॒ष्टयः॑ सन्त्व॒स्मे सु॑पिप्प॒ला ओष॑धीर्दे॒वगो॑पाः
verses.transliteration: idáṃ vácaḥ parjányāya svarā́je  hr̥dó astv ántaraṃ táj jujoṣat  mayobhúvo vr̥ṣṭáyaḥ santv asmé  supippalā́ óṣadhīr devágopāḥ

translation.text: May this my song to Sovran Lord Parjanya come near unto his heart and give him pleasure. May we obtain the showers that bring enjoyment, and God-protected plants with goodly fruitage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स रे॑तो॒धा वृ॑ष॒भः शश्व॑तीनां॒ तस्मि॑न्ना॒त्मा जग॑तस्त॒स्थुष॑श्च तन्म॑ ऋ॒तं पा॑तु श॒तशा॑रदाय यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: sá retodhā́ vr̥ṣabháḥ śáśvatīnām  tásminn ātmā́ jágatas tasthúṣaś ca  tán ma r̥tám pātu śatáśāradāya  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: He is the Bull of all, and their impregner lie holds the life of all things fixed and moving. May this rite save me till my hundredth autumn. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒र्जन्या॑य॒ प्र गा॑यत दि॒वस्पु॒त्राय॑ मी॒ळ्हुषे॑ स नो॒ यव॑समिच्छतु
verses.transliteration: parjányāya prá gāyata  divás putrā́ya mīḷhúṣe  sá no yávasam ichatu

translation.text: SING forth and laud Parjanya, son of Heaven, who sends the gift of rain May he provide our pasturage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो गर्भ॒मोष॑धीनां॒ गवां॑ कृ॒णोत्यर्व॑ताम् प॒र्जन्यः॑ पुरु॒षीणा॑म्
verses.transliteration: yó gárbham óṣadhīnāṃ  gávāṃ kr̥ṇóty árvatām  parjányaḥ puruṣī́ṇām

translation.text: Parjanya is the God who forms in kine, in mares, in plants of earth, And womankind, the germ of life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तस्मा॒ इदा॒स्ये॑ ह॒विर्जु॒होता॒ मधु॑मत्तमम् इळां॑ नः सं॒यतं॑ करत्
verses.transliteration: tásmā íd āsyè havír  juhótā mádhumattamam  íḷāṃ naḥ saṃyátaṃ karat

translation.text: Offer and pour into his mouth oblation rich in savoury juice: May he for ever give us food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं॒व॒त्स॒रं श॑शया॒ना ब्रा॑ह्म॒णा व्र॑तचा॒रिणः॑ वाचं॑ प॒र्जन्य॑जिन्वितां॒ प्र म॒ण्डूका॑ अवादिषुः
verses.transliteration: saṃvatsaráṃ śaśayānā́ḥ-  brāhmaṇā́ vratacāríṇaḥ  vā́cam parjányajinvitām  prá maṇḍū́kā avādiṣuḥ

translation.text: THEY who lay quiet for a year, the Brahmans who fulfil their vows, The Frogs have lifted up their voice, the voice Parjanya hath inspired.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒व्या आपो॑ अ॒भि यदे॑न॒माय॒न्दृतिं॒ न शुष्कं॑ सर॒सी शया॑नम् गवा॒मह॒ न मा॒युर्व॒त्सिनी॑नां म॒ण्डूका॑नां व॒ग्नुरत्रा॒ समे॑ति
verses.transliteration: divyā́ ā́po abhí yád enam ā́yan  dŕ̥tiṃ ná śúṣkaṃ sarasī́ śáyānam  gávām áha ná māyúr vatsínīnām  maṇḍū́kānāṃ vagnúr átrā sám eti

translation.text: What time on these, as on a dry skin lying in the pool's bed, the floods of heaven descended, The music of the Frogs comes forth in concert like the cows lowing with their calves beside them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदी॑मेनाँ उश॒तो अ॒भ्यव॑र्षीत्तृ॒ष्याव॑तः प्रा॒वृष्याग॑तायाम् अ॒ख्ख॒ली॒कृत्या॑ पि॒तरं॒ न पु॒त्रो अ॒न्यो अ॒न्यमुप॒ वद॑न्तमेति
verses.transliteration: yád īm enām̐ uśató abhy ávarṣīt  tr̥ṣyā́vataḥ prāvŕ̥ṣy ā́gatāyām  akhkhalīkŕ̥tyā pitáraṃ ná putró  anyó anyám úpa vádantam eti

translation.text: When at the coming of the Rains the water has poured upon them as they yearned and thirsted, One seeks another as he talks and greets him with cries of pleasure as a son his father.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न्यो अ॒न्यमनु॑ गृभ्णात्येनोर॒पां प्र॑स॒र्गे यदम॑न्दिषाताम् म॒ण्डूको॒ यद॒भिवृ॑ष्टः॒ कनि॑ष्क॒न्पृश्निः॑ सम्पृ॒ङ्क्ते हरि॑तेन॒ वाच॑म्
verses.transliteration: anyó anyám ánu gr̥bhṇāty enor  apā́m prasargé yád ámandiṣātām  maṇḍū́ko yád abhívr̥ṣṭaḥ kániṣkan  pŕ̥śniḥ sampr̥ṅkté háritena vā́cam

translation.text: Each of these twain receives the other kindly, while they are revelling in the flow of waters, When the Frog moistened by the rain springs forward, and Green and Spotty both combine their voices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदे॑षाम॒न्यो अ॒न्यस्य॒ वाचं॑ शा॒क्तस्ये॑व॒ वद॑ति॒ शिक्ष॑माणः सर्वं॒ तदे॑षां स॒मृधे॑व॒ पर्व॒ यत्सु॒वाचो॒ वद॑थ॒नाध्य॒प्सु
verses.transliteration: yád eṣām anyó anyásya vā́caṃ  śāktásyeva vádati śíkṣamāṇaḥ  sárvaṃ tád eṣāṃ samŕ̥dheva párva  yát suvā́co vádathanā́dhy apsú

translation.text: When one of these repeats the other's language, as he who learns the lesson of the teacher, Your every limb seems to be growing larger as ye converse with eloquence on the waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गोमा॑यु॒रेको॑ अ॒जमा॑यु॒रेकः॒ पृश्नि॒रेको॒ हरि॑त॒ एक॑ एषाम् स॒मा॒नं नाम॒ बिभ्र॑तो॒ विरू॑पाः पुरु॒त्रा वाचं॑ पिपिशु॒र्वद॑न्तः
verses.transliteration: gómāyur éko ajámāyur ékaḥ  pŕ̥śnir éko hárita éka eṣām  samānáṃ nā́ma bíbhrato vírūpāḥ  purutrā́ vā́cam pipiśur vádantaḥ

translation.text: Onc is Cow-bellow and Goat-bleat the other, one Frog is Green and one of them is Spotty. They bear one common name, and yet they vary, and, talking, modulate the voice diversely.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्रा॒ह्म॒णासो॑ अतिरा॒त्रे न सोमे॒ सरो॒ न पू॒र्णम॒भितो॒ वद॑न्तः सं॒व॒त्स॒रस्य॒ तदहः॒ परि॑ ष्ठ॒ यन्म॑ण्डूकाः प्रावृ॒षीणं॑ ब॒भूव॑
verses.transliteration: brāhmaṇā́so atirātré ná sóme  sáro ná pūrṇám abhíto vádantaḥ  saṃvatsarásya tád áhaḥ pári ṣṭha  yán maṇḍūkāḥ prāvr̥ṣī́ṇam babhū́va

translation.text: As Brahmans, sitting round the brimful vessel, talk at the Soma-rite of Atirâtra, So, Frogs, ye gather round the pool to honour this day of all the year, the first of Rain-time.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्रा॒ह्म॒णासः॑ सो॒मिनो॒ वाच॑मक्रत॒ ब्रह्म॑ कृ॒ण्वन्तः॑ परिवत्स॒रीण॑म् अ॒ध्व॒र्यवो॑ घ॒र्मिणः॑ सिष्विदा॒ना आ॒विर्भ॑वन्ति॒ गुह्या॒ न के चि॑त्
verses.transliteration: brāhmaṇā́saḥ somíno vā́cam akrata  bráhma kr̥ṇvántaḥ parivatsarī́ṇam  adhvaryávo gharmíṇaḥ siṣvidānā́ḥ-  āvír bhavanti gúhyā ná ké cit

translation.text: These Brahmans with the Soma juice, performing their year-long rite, have lifted up their voices; And these Adhvaryus, sweating with their kettles, come forth and show themselves, and none are hidden.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वहि॑तिं जुगुपुर्द्वाद॒शस्य॑ ऋ॒तुं नरो॒ न प्र मि॑नन्त्ये॒ते सं॒व॒त्स॒रे प्रा॒वृष्याग॑तायां त॒प्ता घ॒र्मा अ॑श्नुवते विस॒र्गम्
verses.transliteration: deváhitiṃ jugupur dvādaśásya  r̥túṃ náro ná prá minanty eté  saṃvatsaré prāvŕ̥ṣy ā́gatāyāṃ  taptā́ gharmā́ aśnuvate visargám

translation.text: They keep the twelve month's God-appointed order, and never do the men neglect the season. Soon as the Rain-time in the year returneth, these who were heated kettles gain their freedom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गोमा॑युरदाद॒जमा॑युरदा॒त्पृश्नि॑रदा॒द्धरि॑तो नो॒ वसू॑नि गवां॑ म॒ण्डूका॒ दद॑तः श॒तानि॑ सहस्रसा॒वे प्र ति॑रन्त॒ आयुः॑
verses.transliteration: gómāyur adād ajámāyur adāt  pŕ̥śnir adād dhárito no vásūni  gávām maṇḍū́kā dádataḥ śatā́ni  sahasrasāvé prá tiranta ā́yuḥ

translation.text: Cow-bellow and Goat-bleat have granted riches, and Green and Spotty have vouchsafed us treasure. The Frogs who give us cows in hundreds lengthen our lives in this most fertilizing season.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑सोमा॒ तप॑तं॒ रक्ष॑ उ॒ब्जतं॒ न्य॑र्पयतं वृषणा तमो॒वृधः॑ परा॑ शृणीतम॒चितो॒ न्यो॑षतं ह॒तं नु॒देथां॒ नि शि॑शीतम॒त्रिणः॑
verses.transliteration: índrāsomā tápataṃ rákṣa ubjátaṃ  ny àrpayataṃ vr̥ṣaṇā tamovŕ̥dhaḥ  párā śr̥ṇītam acíto ny òṣataṃ  hatáṃ nudéthāṃ ní śiśītam atríṇaḥ

translation.text: INDRA and Soma, burn, destroy the demon foe, send downward, O ye Bulls, those who add gloom to gloom. Annihilate the fools, slay them and burn them up: chase them away from us, pierce the voracious ones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑सोमा॒ सम॒घशं॑सम॒भ्य१॒॑घं तपु॑र्ययस्तु च॒रुर॑ग्नि॒वाँ इ॑व ब्र॒ह्म॒द्विषे॑ क्र॒व्यादे॑ घो॒रच॑क्षसे॒ द्वेषो॑ धत्तमनवा॒यं कि॑मी॒दिने॑
verses.transliteration: índrāsomā sám agháśaṃsam abhy àgháṃ  tápur yayastu carúr agnivā́m̐ iva  brahmadvíṣe kravyā́de ghorácakṣase  dvéṣo dhattam anavāyáṃ kimīdíne

translation.text: Indra and Soma, let sin round the wicked boil like as a caldron set amid the flames of fire. Against the foe of prayer, devourer of raw flesh, the vile fiend fierce of eye, keep ye perpetual hate.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑सोमा दु॒ष्कृतो॑ व॒व्रे अ॒न्तर॑नारम्भ॒णे तम॑सि॒ प्र वि॑ध्यतम् यथा॒ नातः॒ पुन॒रेक॑श्च॒नोदय॒त्तद्वा॑मस्तु॒ सह॑से मन्यु॒मच्छवः॑
verses.transliteration: índrāsomā duṣkŕ̥to vavré antár  anārambhaṇé támasi prá vidhyatam  yáthā nā́taḥ púnar ékaś canódáyat  tád vām astu sáhase manyumác chávaḥ

translation.text: Indra and Soma, plunge the wicked in the depth, yea, cast them into darkness that hath no support, So that not one of them may ever thence return: so may your wrathful might prevail and conquer them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑सोमा व॒र्तय॑तं दि॒वो व॒धं सं पृ॑थि॒व्या अ॒घशं॑साय॒ तर्ह॑णम् उत्त॑क्षतं स्व॒र्यं१॒॑ पर्व॑तेभ्यो॒ येन॒ रक्षो॑ वावृधा॒नं नि॒जूर्व॑थः
verses.transliteration: índrāsomā vartáyataṃ divó vadháṃ  sám pr̥thivyā́ agháśaṃsāya tárhaṇam  út takṣataṃ svaryàm párvatebhyo  yéna rákṣo vāvr̥dhānáṃ nijū́rvathaḥ

translation.text: Indra and Soma, hurl your deadly crushing bolt down on the wicked fiend from heaven and from the earth. Yea, forge out of the mountains your celestial dart wherewith ye burn to death the waxing demon race.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑सोमा व॒र्तय॑तं दि॒वस्पर्य॑ग्नित॒प्तेभि॑र्यु॒वमश्म॑हन्मभिः तपु॑र्वधेभिर॒जरे॑भिर॒त्रिणो॒ नि पर्शा॑ने विध्यतं॒ यन्तु॑ निस्व॒रम्
verses.transliteration: índrāsomā vartáyataṃ divás pári-  agnitaptébhir yuvám áśmahanmabhiḥ  tápurvadhebhir ajárebhir atríṇo  ní párśāne vidhyataṃ yántu nisvarám

translation.text: Indra and Soma, cast ye downward out of heaven your deadly darts of stone burning with fiery flame, Eternal, scorching darts; plunge the voracious ones within the depth, and let them sink without a sound.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑सोमा॒ परि॑ वां भूतु वि॒श्वत॑ इ॒यं म॒तिः क॒क्ष्याश्वे॑व वा॒जिना॑ यां वां॒ होत्रां॑ परिहि॒नोमि॑ मे॒धये॒मा ब्रह्मा॑णि नृ॒पती॑व जिन्वतम्
verses.transliteration: índrāsomā pári vām bhūtu viśvátaḥ-  iyám matíḥ kakṣyā́śveva vājínā  yā́ṃ vāṃ hótrām parihinómi medháyā-  -imā́ bráhmāṇi nr̥pátīva jinvatam

translation.text: Indra and Soma, let this hymn control you both, even as the girth encompasses two vigorous steeds- The song of praise which I with wisdom offer you: do ye, as Lords of men, animate these my prayers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ स्मरेथां तु॒जय॑द्भि॒रेवै॑र्ह॒तं द्रु॒हो र॒क्षसो॑ भङ्गु॒राव॑तः इन्द्रा॑सोमा दु॒ष्कृते॒ मा सु॒गं भू॒द्यो नः॑ क॒दा चि॑दभि॒दास॑ति द्रु॒हा
verses.transliteration: práti smarethāṃ tujáyadbhir évair  hatáṃ druhó rakṣáso bhaṅgurā́vataḥ  índrāsomā duṣkŕ̥te mā́ sugám bhūd  yó naḥ kadā́ cid abhidā́sati druhā́

translation.text: In your impetuous manner think ye both thereon: destroy these evil beings, slay the treacherous fiends. Indra and Soma, let the wicked have no bliss who evermore assails us with malignity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो मा॒ पाके॑न॒ मन॑सा॒ चर॑न्तमभि॒चष्टे॒ अनृ॑तेभि॒र्वचो॑भिः आप॑ इव का॒शिना॒ संगृ॑भीता॒ अस॑न्न॒स्त्वास॑त इन्द्र व॒क्ता
verses.transliteration: yó mā pā́kena mánasā cárantam  abhicáṣṭe ánr̥tebhir vácobhiḥ  ā́pa iva kāśínā sáṃgr̥bhītāḥ-  ásann astv ā́sata indra vaktā́

translation.text: Whoso accuses me with words of falsehood when I pursue my way with guileless spirit, May he, the speaker of untruth, be, Indra, like water which the hollowed hand compresses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये पा॑कशं॒सं वि॒हर॑न्त॒ एवै॒र्ये वा॑ भ॒द्रं दू॒षय॑न्ति स्व॒धाभिः॑ अह॑ये वा॒ तान्प्र॒ददा॑तु॒ सोम॒ आ वा॑ दधातु॒ निर्ऋ॑तेरु॒पस्थे॑
verses.transliteration: yé pākaśaṃsáṃ viháranta évair  yé vā bhadráṃ dūṣáyanti svadhā́bhiḥ  áhaye vā tā́n pradádātu sómaḥ-  ā́ vā dadhātu nírr̥ter upásthe

translation.text: Those who destroy, as is their wont, the simple, and with their evil natures barm the righteous, May Soma give them over to the serpent, or to the lap of Nirr̥iti consign them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो नो॒ रसं॒ दिप्स॑ति पि॒त्वो अ॑ग्ने॒ यो अश्वा॑नां॒ यो गवां॒ यस्त॒नूना॑म् रि॒पुः स्ते॒नः स्ते॑य॒कृद्द॒भ्रमे॑तु॒ नि ष ही॑यतां त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ तना॑ च
verses.transliteration: yó no rásaṃ dípsati pitvó agne  yó áśvānāṃ yó gávāṃ yás tanū́nām  ripú stená steyakŕ̥d dabhrám etu  ní ṣá hīyatāṃ tanvā̀ tánā ca

translation.text: The fiend, O Agni, who designs to injure the essence of our food, kine, steeds, or bodies, May he, the adversary, thief, and robber, sink to destruction, both himself and offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒रः सो अ॑स्तु त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ तना॑ च ति॒स्रः पृ॑थि॒वीर॒धो अ॑स्तु॒ विश्वाः॑ प्रति॑ शुष्यतु॒ यशो॑ अस्य देवा॒ यो नो॒ दिवा॒ दिप्स॑ति॒ यश्च॒ नक्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: paráḥ só astu tanvā̀ tánā ca  tisráḥ pr̥thivī́r adhó astu víśvāḥ  práti śuṣyatu yáśo asya devāḥ-  yó no dívā dípsati yáś ca náktam

translation.text: May he be swept away, himself and children: may all the three earths press him down beneath them. May his fair glory, O ye Gods, be blighted, who in the day or night would fain destroy us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒वि॒ज्ञा॒नं चि॑कि॒तुषे॒ जना॑य॒ सच्चास॑च्च॒ वच॑सी पस्पृधाते तयो॒र्यत्स॒त्यं य॑त॒रदृजी॑य॒स्तदित्सोमो॑ऽवति॒ हन्त्यास॑त्
verses.transliteration: suvijñānáṃ cikitúṣe jánāya  sác cā́sac ca vácasī paspr̥dhāte  táyor yát satyáṃ yatarád ŕ̥jīyas  tád ít sómo 'vati hánty ā́sat

translation.text: The prudent finds it easy to distinguish the true and false: their words oppose each other. Of these two that which is the true and honest, Soma protects, and brings the false to nothing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न वा उ॒ सोमो॑ वृजि॒नं हि॑नोति॒ न क्ष॒त्रियं॑ मिथु॒या धा॒रय॑न्तम् हन्ति॒ रक्षो॒ हन्त्यास॒द्वद॑न्तमु॒भाविन्द्र॑स्य॒ प्रसि॑तौ शयाते
verses.transliteration: ná vā́ u sómo vr̥jináṃ hinoti  ná kṣatríyam mithuyā́ dhāráyantam  hánti rákṣo hánty ā́sad vádantam  ubhā́v índrasya prásitau śayāte

translation.text: Never doth Soma aid and guide the wicked or him who falsely claims the Warrior's title. He slays the fiend and him who speaks untruly: both lie entangled in the noose of Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑ वा॒हमनृ॑तदेव॒ आस॒ मोघं॑ वा दे॒वाँ अ॑प्यू॒हे अ॑ग्ने किम॒स्मभ्यं॑ जातवेदो हृणीषे द्रोघ॒वाच॑स्ते निर्ऋ॒थं स॑चन्ताम्
verses.transliteration: yádi vāhám ánr̥tadeva ā́sa  móghaṃ vā devā́m̐ apyūhé agne  kím asmábhyaṃ jātavedo hr̥ṇīṣe  droghavā́cas te nirr̥tháṃ sacantām

translation.text: As if I worshipped deities of falsehood, or thought vain thoughts about the Gods, O Agni. Why art thou angry with us, Jâtavedas? Destruction fall on those who lie against thee!

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒द्या मु॑रीय॒ यदि॑ यातु॒धानो॒ अस्मि॒ यदि॒ वायु॑स्त॒तप॒ पूरु॑षस्य अधा॒ स वी॒रैर्द॒शभि॒र्वि यू॑या॒ यो मा॒ मोघं॒ यातु॑धा॒नेत्याह॑
verses.transliteration: adyā́ murīya yádi yātudhā́no ásmi  yádi vā́yus tatápa pū́ruṣasya  ádhā sá vīraír daśábhir ví yūyāḥ-  yó mā móghaṃ yā́tudhānéty ā́ha

translation.text: So may I die this day if I have harassed any man's life or if I be a demon. Yea, may he lose all his ten sons together who with false tongue hath called me Yatudhana.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो माया॑तुं॒ यातु॑धा॒नेत्याह॒ यो वा॑ र॒क्षाः शुचि॑र॒स्मीत्याह॑ इन्द्र॒स्तं ह॑न्तु मह॒ता व॒धेन॒ विश्व॑स्य ज॒न्तोर॑ध॒मस्प॑दीष्ट
verses.transliteration: yó mā́yātuṃ yā́tudhānéty ā́ha  yó vā rakṣā́ḥ śúcir asmī́ty ā́ha  índras táṃ hantu mahatā́ vadhéna  víśvasya jantór adhamás padīṣṭa

translation.text: May Indra slay him with a mi weapon, and let the vilest ofghty all creatures perish, The fiend who says that he is pure, who calls me a demon though devoid of demon nature.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र या जिगा॑ति ख॒र्गले॑व॒ नक्त॒मप॑ द्रु॒हा त॒न्वं१॒॑ गूह॑माना व॒व्राँ अ॑न॒न्ताँ अव॒ सा प॑दीष्ट॒ ग्रावा॑णो घ्नन्तु र॒क्षस॑ उप॒ब्दैः
verses.transliteration: prá yā́ jígāti khargáleva náktam  ápa druhā́ tanvàṃ gū́hamānā  vavrā́m̐ anantā́m̐ áva sā́ padīṣṭa  grā́vāṇo ghnantu rakṣása upabdaíḥ

translation.text: She too who wanders like an owl at night-time, hiding her body in her guile and malice, May she fall downward into endless caverns. May press-stones with loud ring destroy the demons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि ति॑ष्ठध्वं मरुतो वि॒क्ष्वि१॒॑च्छत॑ गृभा॒यत॑ र॒क्षसः॒ सं पि॑नष्टन वयो॒ ये भू॒त्वी प॒तय॑न्ति न॒क्तभि॒र्ये वा॒ रिपो॑ दधि॒रे दे॒वे अ॑ध्व॒रे
verses.transliteration: ví tiṣṭhadhvam maruto vikṣv ìcháta  gr̥bhāyáta rakṣásaḥ sám pinaṣṭana  váyo yé bhūtvī́ patáyanti naktábhir  yé vā rípo dadhiré devé adhvaré

translation.text: Spread out, ye Maruts, search among the people: seize ye and grind the Raksasas to pieces, Who fly abroad, transformed to birds, at night-time, or sully and pollute our holy worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र व॑र्तय दि॒वो अश्मा॑नमिन्द्र॒ सोम॑शितं मघव॒न्त्सं शि॑शाधि प्राक्ता॒दपा॑क्तादध॒रादुद॑क्ताद॒भि ज॑हि र॒क्षसः॒ पर्व॑तेन
verses.transliteration: prá vartaya divó áśmānam indra  sómaśitam maghavan sáṃ śiśādhi  prā́ktād ápāktād adharā́d údaktād  abhí jahi rakṣásaḥ párvatena

translation.text: Hurl down from heaven thy bolt of stone, O Indra: sharpen it, Maghavan, made keen by Soma. Forward, behind, and from above and under, smite down the demons with thy rocky weapon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒त उ॒ त्ये प॑तयन्ति॒ श्वया॑तव॒ इन्द्रं॑ दिप्सन्ति दि॒प्सवोऽदा॑भ्यम् शिशी॑ते श॒क्रः पिशु॑नेभ्यो व॒धं नू॒नं सृ॑जद॒शनिं॑ यातु॒मद्भ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: etá u tyé patayanti śváyātavaḥ-  índraṃ dipsanti dipsávó 'dābhyam  śíśīte śakráḥ píśunebhyo vadháṃ  nūnáṃ sr̥jad aśániṃ yātumádbhyaḥ

translation.text: They fly, the demon dogs, and, bent on mischief, fain would they harm indomitable Indra. Ṣakra makes sharp his weapon for the wicked: now, let him cast his bolt at fiendish wizards.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ यातू॒नाम॑भवत्पराश॒रो ह॑वि॒र्मथी॑नाम॒भ्या॒३॒॑विवा॑सताम् अ॒भीदु॑ श॒क्रः प॑र॒शुर्यथा॒ वनं॒ पात्रे॑व भि॒न्दन्त्स॒त ए॑ति र॒क्षसः॑
verses.transliteration: índro yātūnā́m abhavat parāśaró  havirmáthīnām abhy ā̀vívāsatām  abhī́d u śakráḥ paraśúr yáthā vánam  pā́treva bhindán satá eti rakṣásaḥ

translation.text: Indra hath ever been the fiends' destroyer who spoil oblations of the Gods' invokers: Yea, Ṣakra, like an axe that spilts the timber, attacks and smashes them like earthen vessels.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उलू॑कयातुं शुशु॒लूक॑यातुं ज॒हि श्वया॑तुमु॒त कोक॑यातुम् सु॒प॒र्णया॑तुमु॒त गृध्र॑यातुं दृ॒षदे॑व॒ प्र मृ॑ण॒ रक्ष॑ इन्द्र
verses.transliteration: úlūkayātuṃ śuśulū́kayātuṃ  jahí śváyātum utá kókayātum  suparṇáyātum utá gŕ̥dhrayātuṃ  dr̥ṣádeva prá mr̥ṇa rákṣa indra

translation.text: Destroy the fiend shaped like an owl or owlet, destroy him in the form of dog or cuckoo. Destroy him shaped as eagle or as vulture as with a stone, O Indra, crush the demon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॒ रक्षो॑ अ॒भि न॑ड्यातु॒माव॑ता॒मपो॑च्छतु मिथु॒ना या कि॑मी॒दिना॑ पृ॒थि॒वी नः॒ पार्थि॑वात्पा॒त्वंह॑सो॒ऽन्तरि॑क्षं दि॒व्यात्पा॑त्व॒स्मान्
verses.transliteration: mā́ no rákṣo abhí naḍ yātumā́vatām  ápochatu mithunā́ yā́ kimīdínā  pr̥thivī́ naḥ pā́rthivāt pātv áṃhaso  -antárikṣaṃ divyā́t pātv asmā́n

translation.text: Let not the fiend of witchcraft-workers reach us: may Dawn drive off the couples of Kimîdins. Earth keep us safe from earthly woe and trouble: from grief that comes from heaven mid-air preserve us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ ज॒हि पुमां॑सं यातु॒धान॑मु॒त स्त्रियं॑ मा॒यया॒ शाश॑दानाम् विग्री॑वासो॒ मूर॑देवा ऋदन्तु॒ मा ते दृ॑श॒न्त्सूर्य॑मु॒च्चर॑न्तम्
verses.transliteration: índra jahí púmāṃsaṃ yātudhā́nam  utá stríyam māyáyā śā́śadānām  vígrīvāso mū́radevā r̥dantu  mā́ té dr̥śan sū́ryam uccárantam

translation.text: Slay the male demon, Indra! slay the female, joying and triumphing in arts of magic. Let the fools' gods with bent necks fall and perish, and see no more the Sun when he arises.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ चक्ष्व॒ वि च॒क्ष्वेन्द्र॑श्च सोम जागृतम् रक्षो॑भ्यो व॒धम॑स्यतम॒शनिं॑ यातु॒मद्भ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: práti cakṣva ví cakṣva-  -índraś ca soma jāgr̥tam  rákṣobhyo vadhám asyatam  aśániṃ yātumádbhyaḥ

translation.text: Look each one hither, look around Indra and Soma, watch ye well. Cast forth your weapon at the fiends against the sorcerers hurt your bolt.
